author: {'steamid': '76561197973235843', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 713, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 713, 'last_played': 1687188584}
review:
Typical medroidvania and not too hard UNTIL YOU REACH THE ENDING "MASTER'S PALACE"!  It was at this point the developers decided to make the entire map instadeath,spike-covered precision timed acrobatics.  I cannot tell you how many times I thought, "this must be it, they won't add another section like this again!"  Nope.  There was another.  Got on YouTube and found out they added not one more timed-puzzle-acrobatics but FIVE MORE of these RIDICULOUS SECTIONS before the final boss (who looked pretty easy just like all the other bosses.

TLDR: If you liked/were great at old Megaman-style precision-timed acrobatics, you might be able to finish this game without having to replace your SteamDeck because you threw it into the wall.  For the other 95% of us, your game experience ends once you get to the final map.

author: {'steamid': '76561198847452178', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1055, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1055, 'last_played': 1687005486}
review:
Such massive improvements from Risky's Revenge that it feels like an entirely different game in the best ways possible. Pros:
- Movement and combat is faster without feeling slippery or overwhelming,
- New mechanics flow way better than the dance transformations.
- Better pace.
- Better writing.
- Auto-Potions and Damage Boosters are powerful but appropriately expensive.
- More, and more varied, environments.
- Better fast-travel system.
- Still has some false walls but does a MUCH better job of cluing the player in to look for them and all but ONE of them are optional.
- "A" button won't close dialogue/cancel anymore.
- And perhaps best of all, map that doesn't suck harder than an opening to the vacuum of space on a station pressurized to accommodate specimens from the goddamn Mariana Trench.

ALL gripes I have range from minor to straight-up nit-picks:
- Missed Opportunity to have Risky as a playable character skin, and no pirate bandanna visible in Pirate mode unless you're using the cannon.
- No princess skin like last time.
- The runnup for the dash move should be a BIT shorter.
- The unlockable Kick move that's required for 100% completion and certain achievements is utterly worthless despite costing the most money.
- The timing for being shot past spikes in one specific section at the end is way too small and irritating even if the health penalty is minimal.
- Can't check collectible totals on the map screen, you have to either exit out of the level ENTIRELY to the overworld in order to see them or track them by writing down your progress.
- There is no reason "beat ____ boss without taking damage" should be secret achievements. Just put a number representing when the player fights them! It's not like it's possible to sequence break accidentally.
- The squiggly fucked up fingers in some of the character portraits make them look like an A.I. drew them.
- They couldn't be bothered to fix the main menu button saying "EIT" instead of "Exit".
- You still have to wait a second for items to fully stop after being dropped from chests before they can be picked up.

Aside from that, yeah, this a HUGE improvement over its predecessor and just a straight-up good game in its own right.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043990017', 'num_games_owned': 1006, 'num_reviews': 236, 'playtime_forever': 862, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 862, 'last_played': 1686916650}
review:
[h1][b]"We Love Burning Town[/b], 
ИЛИ 
[i]как НЕ надо делать последние уровни в играх"[/i][/h1]

Кажется, в этой игре очаровательно все. Буквально с первых минут игрока кидают в бой, где играет упомянутая в заглавии - и самая известная - мелодия франшизы. Игрок наслаждается еще несколько часов после этого сочным визуалом, на фоне играют забавные композиции, на экране разворачивается ВНЕЗАПНО интересный сюжет с уймой приколов, частенько ломающих четвертую стену. Во время прохождения постоянно возникают новые необычные ситуации - то загадки, то бег с девочкой-зомби на руках, то ВОСХИТИТЕЛЬНАЯ, Я НАСТАИВАЮ НА ЭТОМ стелс-миссия с доводящей до истерического смеха концовкой... 

И при всем этом игра логично развивается и закономерно становится сложнее: в этой части наша подопечная героиня Шантэ решает помочь своему главному врагу, пиратке Риски Бутс, в борьбе со злым духом Капитана Пиратов, которому негодяйка некогда служила. Но так как эта же засранка украла способности героини в предыдущей части, Шантэ будет собирать и использовать обноски своей "союзницы" вместо танцев. Пистолет, шляпа, сабля, пушка и козырные сапоги - классический набор для косплея пирата! Причем, из-за того, что игрок не тратит время на выбор танца и превращения, а всегда имеет эти орудия под рукой, ритм игры тоже ощутимо более динамичен. Новая шмотка приводит к боссу, завязанному на механике этого предмета; следом на новый остров, где определенный процент препятствий преодолевается с помощью новых умений. Вместе с этим, возникает смысл и вернуться в старые локации для поиска секреток с помощью новообретенных сил.

На протяжении почти всего (вопросы к боссу-дракону, окей) прохождения разработчик относительно гладко ведет игрока.

А ПОТОМ НАСТУПАЕТ, МАТЬ ЕГО В ЛАМПУ, ПОСЛЕДНИЙ УРОВЕНЬ.

И честно, это единственная причина, которая почти изменила мое отношение к игре с очень положительного на резко-негативное. Абсолютно ублюдский дизайн километрового и почти часового забега. 
Блядь, просто погуглите и посмотрите на Ютубе, и только потом решайте, готовы ли вы это терпеть и купить игру или нет. Что забавно, судя по отзывам в Стиме, не я один так думаю - у многих вопросы к дизайну уровней, особенно последнего, и в целом они сводятся к простой сути: "Игра должна [i]развлекать[/i], а не [i]душить[/i]". Особенно в случае, если она же успешно справляется с первым на протяжении 80 процентов времени на "отлично".

Если бы не вот этот раздражающий последний кусок - игру можно было смело назвать отличной. Она великолепно звучит, выглядит, играется, развивается и развлекает своей историей и шутейками. И у меня тупо рука не поднимается влупить ей "красный" палец, хотя левел-дизайнер приложил для этого максимум усилий в конце игры.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968658621', 'num_games_owned': 997, 'num_reviews': 461, 'playtime_forever': 416, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 295, 'last_played': 1687221184}
review:
[i]---see where this game landed on my metroidvania tier list beneath this review!---[/i]


It's okay.  Wish I could give a neutral review.  20+ years ago if this came out on a gameboy, i probably would've enjoyed it.  

The game is kind of easy, kind of outdated, could be larger in scope.

Music is probably the best bit.  

I was hoping that it would be on the level of something like 'Monster Boy and the Cursed Kingdom' or 'Treasure Adventure Game' but its hard to find the motivation to keep playing through this one.

Kind of like Alwa's Awakening, I'm split between C and D tier for this one, negative or positive review, but i'll settle on D tier.  I just didn't have enough fun with it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066692891', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 137, 'playtime_forever': 558, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 381, 'last_played': 1686649947}
review:
[h1]Стильное разочарование[/h1]

[hr][/hr]
После отличного [b]Half-Genie Hero[/b] я решил попробовать эту часть и был разочарован. С метроидваниями знаком давно и плотно, поэтому я знаю о чём говорю. 

В общем-то говоря, это плохая игра. 

Здесь есть всё: 

— и плохой дизайн боёвки, вызывающий фрустрацию (противники расположены порою отвратительно и они тебя по-настоящему душат, плюс ко всему если ты заденешь хоть один пиксель противника в прыжке — Шанти уходит в неуправляемое пике; про бесполезный дэш на левый триггер даже говорить не буду); 

— и плохой дизайн босс-баттлов (спасибо, что не всех); 

— и плохой дизайн некоторых данжей вкупе с не особо удобной картой; 

— и плохой дизайн некоторых сегментов-загадок...

Словом, игра предлагает совершенно отличный от остальных игр серии опыт, и этот опыт попросту душный. Да, он именно [b]душный[/b]. А уж платформинг перед финальным боссом по-настоящему стал притчей во языцех: за такой дизайн и за такой скачок сложности нужно бить по рукам. Я пришёл играть не в серию i wanna be.

Да, красиво; да, неплохая музыка (хотя в HGH и RR она таки приятнее, а здесь почему-то на фоне всей духоты геймплея она начинает давить и приедаться); да, приятные старые-добрые персонажи и их юмор; да, неплохой сюжет. Но в игры надо [b]играть[/b], а играть в это попросту [b]невесело[/b]. 

Я уж не говорю о том, насколько безумно порою запрятаны тинкербаты с тёмной магией. Большая часть их, конечно, легко находится, но есть несколько совершенно ё6нутых мест, которые вы не найдёте без прохождения на утубе, а для истинной концовки тёмную магию собрать надо таки всю. Игру я, если что, прошёл на истинную концовку. [b]Pirate's Curse действительно скучная в сравнении с другими частями серии[/b], и 95% положительных отзывов — это настоящая загадка для меня.

[hr][/hr]
Бтв я поиграл и в Risky's Revenge, и после Pirate's Curse она мне показалась невероятным глотком свежего воздуха. Никакого душилова, никаких чересчур запутанных данжей, игра хорошо ко мне относится, она ко мне СПРАВЕДЛИВА. Я ценю это. Там вопросов к геймдизайну в общем и целом нет. А здесь — есть, и их множество.

Почему шикарнейший лес из Risky's Revenge на востоке карты превратился тупо в два экрана в the Pirate's Curse? Почему отказались от великолепной системы "слоёв", которая позволяла исследовать локации не только по горизонтали, но и вглубь? Почему the Pirate's Curse ощущается просто как деградация предыдущей части, а не её развитие? Почему она забывает хорошее и наращивает плохое? Эти вопросы останутся без ответа.

И всё ещё, откуда 95% положительных отзывов? Люди вообще никогда не играли в платформеры?

author: {'steamid': '76561198006935843', 'num_games_owned': 1376, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 1511, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 332, 'last_played': 1685160746}
review:
This is a proper sequel to Shantae: Risky's Revenge with everything you loved and more.
Cutesy, charming, sexy, funny and challenging time ahead.

+More resolutions
+Better volume control
+Better menus
+Better inventory
+Better maps
+Better gameplay
+Matchlock

=Amazing pixel art
=Great music
=Charming/Funny/Sexy

-No Fast Travel
-No powers
-No transformations

The game feels more like an actual metroidvania than before and is quite obviously a welcome addition to the franchise.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044809906', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 619, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 619, 'last_played': 1683003167}
review:
Fun platformer. It's the first game of Shantae that i've got my hands on, and it makes me want to pick up the rest to get more of the story. Cute, fun, entertaining. Not too short nor too long. 

Be warned though: it is NOT an easy game. It is unforgiving, though fair. The challenge is definitely there, but not impossible. You will definitely be saying "ARRGG" while playing...though it might be out of furstration. 

At the end of the day though, definitely worth to check out. 

I do suggest playing it with controller though. Most platformers work best with one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006244912', 'num_games_owned': 613, 'num_reviews': 245, 'playtime_forever': 742, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 742, 'last_played': 1682744806}
review:
[b][i]“For a genie kid you sure don’t pack much of a punch, do you?”[/i][/b]

Являясь прямым продолжением [b]Risky's Revenge[/b], игра берёт своё начало не очень то далеко после её событий. [b]Сюжет[/b] у игры, говоря коротко, не напрягающий и простой. А диалоги имеют толику забавного юмора! 
[b]Игровой процесс[/b] в общих чертах сохранил свою простоту и приятность. Главная героиня по ходу игры приобретает способности которые разительно отличаются от тех, которые были в предыдущей части. Ну а каких то радикальных в корне меняющих изменений, в сравнение с предыдущей частью, в игровом процессе нет. Так же проходим локации, ищем секретики, покупаем улучшения и предметы. При открытие новых игровых способностей возвращаемся в ранее посещенные локации и получаем доступ к ранее недоступным участкам карты. Самым же большим ([i]и не столь значительным[/i]) изменением по сравнению с предыдущей частью является структура мира игры. Теперь он не представляет собой одну единую карту, по которой можно протопать своими ножами. Вместо этого мы бороздим на корабле ([i]представляет собой быстрое путешествие, не более[/i]) между островами, на которых и происходят все события игры.
[b]Пиксельная графика и анимации[/b] игры выполнены очень качественно и радуют глаз.
[b]Музыка[/b] в игре довольно приятная! И для каждой локации она уникальна, поэтому не успевает надоесть.
На [b]Steam Deck[/b] игра играется [b]превосходно[/b]! [i]И я думаю что это не последний раз когда я буду писать такое про метроидвании/платформеры[/i]. Стандартные настройки управления на нем не вызывают дискомфорта. 
С какими либо [b]вылетами и багами[/b] по ходу игры я не столкнулся.  

[b]Отличная[/b] игра! Нисколько меня не разочаровала и оставила только положительные эмоции! Покупать и проходить ее без предварительного прохождения предыдущей части считаю в корне неправильным. Поэтому если надумаете брать её, то для начала пройдите [b]Shantae: Risky's Revenge[/b]!
[b][u]Рекомендую![/u][/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198120973819', 'num_games_owned': 365, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 596, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 596, 'last_played': 1654439001}
review:
재밌고 잘만든 게임이긴 하지만 명작인가 하기에는 어딘가 부족합니다.

그래픽 조작감 레벨디자인 다 좋지만... 뭔가 다 무난무난한 느낌..
난이도가 조금 쉽게 느껴지는 것도 아쉬운 점입니다.
2만원 정가 주고 사기에는 조금 아깝지 않나 하는 생각이 드네요.

이게 샨테 시리즈중에 가장 나은 게임으로 보이기 때문에...
아마 나머지는 굳이 하지 않을 것 같습니다.

압긍 게임인가 의구심은 있지만 비추 박을만한 구석도 없어서
저도 추천에 한표 넣겠습니다.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992438116', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 497, 'playtime_forever': 870, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 870, 'last_played': 1561218285}
review: Shantae and the Pirate's Curse est un excellent jeu. On part à l'aventure en compagnie de Shantae avec plaisir dans cet univers coloré en pixel art du plus bel effet. Les graphismes sont réussis et la musique nous entraîne avec légèreté dans cette expédition. Notre personnage gagne petit à petit en puissance au fil de la progression nous permettant d'avancer plus en avant. Les personnages sont attachants et les mécaniques de jeu sont plaisantes. Les combats de boss sont techniques et propose un bon challenge. Au final le titre devrait plaire aux amateurs du genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010335843', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 276, 'playtime_forever': 824, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 482, 'last_played': 1685573740}
review:
Very meh. First of all calling this a Metroidvania is just false advertising. This is not a Metroidvania. The levels are very clearly separated via a selection screen. Secondly the levels themselves are mostly linear, sure it's not exactly a straight line but you are almost always moving to a single destination at a given time. Yes you have to sometimes go to previously explored areas to pick up an item. But these feel more like padding out game time than a legitimate reason to backtrack. When you go to a previously-explored area, your new power doesn't open new areas really, it just introduces fetch questing--you grab some item with your new power and then go back to the new area. I mean should we call Wario Land 4 a metroidvania because the levels are nonlinear? Should we call Mega Man 1 a metroidvania because you need to use Gutsman's power in Elecman's stage? Give me a break with this shit.

Now let's talk about the level design. It sucks. Nothing feels challenging and most of the time you just tank enemy hits and move on. There's actually little reason to even engage with them, they drop gems but you don't need them after you purchase all the hair whip upgrades. And the level obstacles feel completely random, like I've seen roguelites with better procedurally-generated level design. The enemies are all super annoying. They either come at you from weird angles that makes it hard to hit them with your weapon, or they appear out of nowhere and start bouncing around in the most annoying fashion. And they all take multiple hits. It never feels fair, it just feels like the game is just testing your patience. Despite this being a pretty easy game, I found myself at low health constantly, and it felt like a combination of apathy and just knowing the enemy designs are so absurdly cheap you're better off just ignoring them. There is also usually only one way to approach combat which is whipping with your hair. It's pretty unsatisfying as there are no combos, and the other weapons you get are too weak to be integrated into your arsenal. 

The aforementioned fetch quests are really annoying and the worst part it is really hard to know where you are supposed to go sometimes. NPCs will ask for random items that you will not have a fricken clue where to start looking for them, and the answers are trivialized by just looking at a strategy guide.

It's crazy to me how much Shantae fans will gush about this supposedly being the best entry. It's not. Half Genie Hero is far better with tighter level design and frankly, after playing this and Seven Sirens, I'm convinced HGH is the only good game in the series.

author: {'steamid': '76561198978444094', 'num_games_owned': 81, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 892, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 833, 'last_played': 1694859834}
review:
Super Spiel. Die Charaktere und die Story haben sehr viel Charme und die Sprites und Artworks sind alle sehr schön. Das Gameplay ist hier meiner Meinung nach das Beste in der ganzen Shantae-Reihe (Habe das Original und Risky's Revenge noch nicht gespielt). Die Items, die man im verlauf des Spiels freischaltet, ergänzen sich gegenseitig einfach so gut. 
Die Charaktere sprühen vor Charme und der Dialog ist lustig, wenn auch manchmal ein bisschen corny. Risky ist by the way der beste Charakter :)

Das einzige was mich manchmal aufgeregt hat, waren die platforming sections auch wenn ich so was eigentlich gern mach. Die waren manhchmal ein bisschen unfair für meinen Geschmack, aber die Herausforderung hat auch ihren Reiz.

Alles in Allem definitiv eine Empfehlung.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025518269', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 687, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 687, 'last_played': 1680660976}
review:
If you're going to play any Shantae game, it should be this one. This is my fav, and I enjoyed it a lot. It has the most cohesive gameplay and world design and has some actual decent Metroidvania interconnected areas and power-up locks. If you think this game is mediocre, and I think that's an acceptable opinion, don't even bother with the others because they don't come as close.

Wayforward is god awful at PC ports. They DGAF. It's barebones, but strangely has keyboard rebinding. The game maxes out at 1080p which means your monitor will have to scale the game at higher resolutions. The game has an uncapped framerate, and any refresh rate over 60Hz will make the game run too fast to be playable. If the game's logic was tied to framerate, then the game should have been capped at 60Hz. Pathetic.

The interface is garish. It has the beautiful low res pixel art from the 3DS version, but the interface is high resolution with ugly UI, out of place fonts, and inconsistent presentation. After nearly a decade they haven't fixed the typo on the title screen which still says EIT GAME.

review:
Totally awesome game, all the way during the 10 hours I played... that was until I met Dagron. That Boss was *totally* impossible for me. I didn’t hit him even once ! And I read it’ll be harder at the end of that fight…

EDIT : I gave the game another chance today, and I followed a guide. I beat Dagron thanks to it. This time I arrived near the end of the game... but another impossible wall : the final area right before the final boss is just insane ! I give up, for good.

author: {'steamid': '76561198341007134', 'num_games_owned': 252, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1136, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1136, 'last_played': 1679790211}
review:
Just a really fun game :)

An improvement in every way from the previous entries, it's the peak of this series and just a really solid metroidvania. 
Its pace is really fast and basically perfect. The unlockable abilites are all enjoyable in use and good in making you feel stronger every time you get a new one.
The soundtrack is energetic, fun and just great. The locations are all original and well-designed.
I quite enjoy the story and the writing. I especially like the dynamic between Shantae and Risky, their relationship totally makes this game's plot for me.

In conclusion, it's a really good and solid time, it may not be a life changing experience but it's just plain fun and I'd recommend it to any fan of this genre

author: {'steamid': '76561198333916210', 'num_games_owned': 462, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 484, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 484, 'last_played': 1588380488}
review:
the best shantae. the art may have surpassed this game from half-genie hero onward, but pirate's curse beats the later games in terms of sheer gameplay. this game is so fluid and snappy to control, shantae flies across the screen like a dream. the art is still excellent despite the later games looking better, and i think this game still has the best soundtrack out of the series, contested by seven sirens. the story takes an interesting deviation as well, with shantae losing the ability to use her magic, instead forcing her to use pirate gear that she scavenges from around the map. this game is absolutely excellent, and i would recommend it to most people

also my personal ranking for the series for those curious
pirate's curse > seven sirens > risky's revenge > shantae > half-genie hero

review: There's a lot of positives about this game.  But there were a few too many instances where you get stuck and you explore every nook and cranny of the entire map for what to do next.  Sometimes you find what you need in an obscure place or you look online and you think "how was i supposed to know where to find that?".  I feel that is bad design. The game wastes more of your time than necessary. Sick of games that do that.

Shantae is Cute

author: {'steamid': '76561198160741210', 'num_games_owned': 263, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 368, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 368, 'last_played': 1676425402}
review:
The Pirate's Curse highlights the continued refinement of the Shantae series, trimming even more of the fat than previous releases and sharpening its qualities as an action-platformer. The titular character's ability acquisition creates a unique experience than whats come before by streamlining its non-linear level progression into something much more digestible and engaging, although certain annoying back-and-forth moments between levels still remain. Even still, this game demonstrates an upwards curve in quality and enjoyment for the series.

+ Speedier, more platforming-focused gameplay
+ More streamlined level design and game progression

- Back-and-forth fetch questing

author: {'steamid': '76561198828777357', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 884, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 884, 'last_played': 1667010598}
review:
Descobri esse jogo pelo fato da protagonista ter bastante fanart, então fico feliz por ter realmente amado jogar.
Em questão gráfica esse jogo é lindo pixelart e animações incríveis, além de ter desenhos muito fofos dos personagens quando tem algum diálogo. Gameplay desse jogo é de um metroidvania com vários elementos de plataforma, conforme você evolui no jogo vc libera novas mecânicas e pode voltar em cenários anteriores para pegar tudo (algo obrigatório pra zerar na verdade). Trilha sonora desse jogo é muito boa e sempre passa a vibe do ambiente em que você está. A história do jogo é bem bonitinha mas não é nada de grande destaque, agora os personagens são muito bons eu adorei quase todos, destaque pras garotas do jogo que todas são lindas e muito fofas, mesmo esse jogo não sendo o primeiro da franquia consegui me apaixonar pelos personagens com seus designs lindos pra caralho. Agora algo que pode afastar algumas pessoas é a dificuldade, esse jogo não é uma tortura igual Cuphead mas definitivamente não tem o grau de dificuldade de jogos AAA que seguram sua mãozinha e mostram exatamente o que você tem que fazer, vai ter momentos que você não vai ter ideia do que fazer e outros que vão te espancar até você aprender, principalmente o final do jogo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198097043496', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 90, 'playtime_forever': 712, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 712, 'last_played': 1674932479}
review:
Lighthearted, a little on the moderately short side (my total gameplay time was apparently just short of 10 hours according to the final screen, I guess that doesn't include time paused), and with difficulty level that ranged between easy and moderate (with the exception of one switch-based platforming room towards the end that was a real pain in the ass), so a good filler game between longer and/or more intense games imo.

As others have pointed out it's simply a solid game - no masterpiece, but a charming 7/10 or so. Not a must play, but if you like retro-style platformers with metroidvania elements you could certainly do worse. A lot of fanservice and some really juvenile humor here and there so probably not for everyone but certainly no worse than you'd see in a late 90s / early 00s cartoon. I had quite a lot of fun with the gameplay, but if you're looking for something with a lot of combat depth for example you're not gonna find it here - it's got a little more platforming depth than your average SNES / Megadrive title - particularly in the second half, but that's never the case for the combat. 

 I'd only bother if you're gonna go ahead and get the true ending though as the bad ending is a bit crap being honest, and as such you might need to check a walkthrough to find some of the harder to find cacklebats, but I'd say it's worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198107464933', 'num_games_owned': 560, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 518, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 518, 'last_played': 1674241297}
review:
I would say this game is very charming and perhaps lovable, but it's not what i would consider good. It is severely lacking guidance, leaving me confused what my objective even was at times; and much of the gameplay was very unintuitive to me, to the point where i ended up relying on trial and error more than anything else in the end.
I think the aesthetic, dialogue, story, music, and characters are all wonderful, but as a game, i just found it to be more frustrating than enjoyable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198190380543', 'num_games_owned': 613, 'num_reviews': 603, 'playtime_forever': 1157, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1157, 'last_played': 1674154126}
review:
Shantae and the Pirate’s Curse is a great metroidvania platformer, and the 3rd game in the Shantae series. It follows the story of the first 2 games, although you don’t need to play them to understand this one. It has a lot of recurrent characters, that could’ve been better introduced, but the key events are properly explained, which is the most important.
Basically, Shantae is a Half-Genie that lost her powers in the last game, so she’s practically a human now. Risky Boots, a pirate captain, is her archenemy, however a greater foe is lurking, so they must work together. That adds a great dynamic between them.
As a human, Shantae arsenal is more limited, but that doesn’t detract from the gameplay experience. It adds new, interesting tools that you gradually acquire, allowing access to new areas in previous zones, a staple of the genre. Now, this isn’t a “pure” metroidvania because there isn’t a single big map connecting everything. It has multiple standalone areas, and you can’t fast travel between save areas. But other than that, it plays like a metroidvania, with lots to explore (and re-explore).
Gameplay is simple but fluid and satisfying. It’s a mixture of platforming and combat, where you can also use items, although those are limited. My only complain is the lack of direction and tutorials, some things aren’t immediately obvious. For example, you can interact with most NPCs, but only a few have a button prompt. The bosses are nice, however using items can trivialize them. Especially because there’s an achievement for beating each one without taking damage, and those items help a lot for that.
The graphics are pixelated, but the sprites and animations look great. It’s not a worse game because of that. But the art on the character portraits is sharp and detailed, with lots of fanservice as well. But that’s part of the Shantae games. The text font on the dialogue boxes feels odd though. The music is also very good.
The game takes around 8 hours to beat, and more if you’re looking to collect everything (you’ll probably need a guide for that). After beating it, your reward is a new mode, where you start a new game with all movement upgrades unlocked. This basically allows you to beat the game much faster, because you can skip sections and backtracking is reducing. There’re even some rewards for beating the game fast, however this is a double-edged sword, because in practice you need to play this mode to beat those times. It feels like the game is telling that the new mode is for speed running. I like this mode, don’t get me wrong, but it feels disrespectful to the original mode, because there’s little incentive for speed running that one. It’s still possible to beat the times, but it’s a huge handicap if you play that way.
But all these flaws are basically nitpicks, because this is a great game in a great series. There are no bad games in the Shantae series, however Pirate’s Curse is considered one of the best ones. The game oozes with charm, it’s fun and very enjoyable. A must if you’re a fan of the genre, and an easy recommendation overall on sale. It’s an older title now, but it aged well.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994824233', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 273, 'playtime_forever': 867, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 867, 'last_played': 1673646712}
review:
Eğlenceli başlayan, ama sonlara doğru aşırı gereksiz zorluğuyla insanın sabrını sınayan bir platform oyunu. 

"Pirate's Curse", Shantae serisinin üçüncü oyunu. İlk oyunu sadece GameBoy'a çıkmıştı ve PC'de yok. İkinci oyunu "Risky's Revenge" ise Steam'den alınabiliyor. Ama oyun kötü yaşlanmış ve çağ dışı kalan haritası başta olmak üzere pek çok ufak tefek sıkıntısı var. Onu 9 saat kadar oynayıp en sonunda pes etmiştim. O yüzden bu oyun, yani "Pirate's Curse" seriye başlamak için şu an en ideal oyun. 

Maceramız ikinci oyunun bittiği yerden başlıyor. Yarı-lamba cini olan, dansöz kızımız Shantae güçlerini kaybetmiş ve gerçek bir insan olmuştur. Artık göbek atarak büyü yapamamaktadır (Ciddiyim.) Derken günün birinde kasabası Ammo Baron tarafından saldırıya uğrar ve iş bir kez daha başa düşer. Ateşli bir çatışma sonucunda Ammo Baron'u yenen kahramanımız kadim bir korsanın hayaletinin mezardan çıkmak üzere olduğunu ve tüm adalara dehşet saçmaya hazırlandığını öğrenir. Böylece eski düşmanı, kadın korsan Risky Boots'la zorunlu bir iş birliği yaparak bu azılı korsanı durdurmak için düşer yollara.

Oyun metroidvania tarzında. Yani ilk başta çok kısıtlı yeteneklere sahipsiniz ve haritaların her yerine gidemiyor, gördüğünüz her nesneyi toplayamıyorsunuz. Ne zaman yeni yetenekler, yeni araç gereçler ediniyorsunuz, o zaman yeni yeni yerlere ulaşabilmeye başlıyorsunuz.

Oyun bu sefer tek bir büyük, açık dünya yerine bir dizi adadan oluşuyor. Adaların her birinin farklı bir iklimi var. Atıyorum, biri karlarla kaplıyken, başka bir tanesi çöllerden oluşuyor. Bir tanesi tropik bir ormanken bir başkasıysa zombi istilası altında gibi gibi. Her adada bir tane de zindan, her zindanın sonunda da bir bölüm sonu canavarı var. Ek olarak, iyi sonu görmek istiyorsak bulmamız gereken 20 tane yarasa-düşman ve canımızı arttırmak için toplayabileceğimiz gizli kalpler de var. Bunların yerini keşfetmek epey dikkat gerektirebiliyor.

Oyun boyunca Risky Boots, Bolo, Rottytops ve Sky gibi önceki oyunlarda tanıştığımız karakterlerle tekrar karşılaşıyoruz. O yüzden ilk birkaç dakika boyunca bu kimdi, ben neredeyim diye küçük bir kafa karışıklığı yaşayabilirsiniz. Ama dert etmeyin. Karakterlerin derinliği olmadığı ve önceki oyunlardan neredeyse hiç bahsedilmediği için onları sadece ismen şöyle bir tanımanız bile yetiyor. 

Shantae'nin en güzel yanı esprili anlatımı, piksel grafikleri ve komik karakterleri hiç şüphesiz. Oyuna başlar başlamaz sizi içine çekmeyi ve kendini sevdirmeyi başarıyor. Shantae'yi yönetip sağda solda gizli sırları bulmak, yeni yetenekler kazanmak ve bölüm sonu canavarlarıyla kapışmak da keyifli.

Ama ciddi sıkıntıları da yok değil. Bir kere "fast travel" özelliğini kaldırmışlar. O yüzden aynı yerlerden durmadan, tekrar tekrar, tekrar tekrar geçmek bir yerden sonra çok sıkıyor. Düşmanlar her zamanki gibi durmadan, yeniden ortaya çıkıyor. Kaç kere öldürürseniz öldürün o ekrana geri döndüğünüzde bütün düşmanlar yine aynı yerde duruyor. 

Bu ikisini bir yere kadar affedebiliyorum. Ama asıl canımı sıkan son iki bölümün aşırı gereksiz zorluğu oldu benim için. Tek dokunuşta öldüren kazıklar... Aynı anda hem son sürat koşup hem zıplayıp hem de havada süzülmenizi talep eden upuzun koridorlar... Ucuz ölümler... Sırf siz uçurumdan falan düşün diye yerleştirilmiş ucuz düşmanlar... 

Hele son bölüm yok mu o son bölüm? Upuzun, tuzaklarla dolu, ölüp ölüp dirileceğiniz ama araya bilerek, kasıtlı olarak bir tanecik bile kayıt noktası koymadıkları için bir kez girdiniz mi bir daha çıkamadığınız o kule? Özellikle bu kısımlarda tek dokunuşta öldüren o kazıklardan bir sürü var. Öfkelenip kapatırsanız oyun kayıt almıyor ve hepsini baştan yapmak zorunda kalıyorsunuz.

Çok çok çok mu zor? Hayır, ama aynı yerde 10 defa ölüp, aynı bölümü 40 kere geçmeye çalışmak çok can sıkıyor. En azından benim için öyle oldu. 

Başarımlar açısından da uğraştırıcı bir oyun Shantae. Hepsini tek seferde toplayamıyorsunuz. En az 2-3 kez bitirmeniz lazım oyunu. Bunlardan bazıları canını hiç arttırma, boss savaşlarında hiç hasar alma gibi şeyler. Bir tanesi oyunu 3,5 saatte tamamlamanızı istiyor. Başka bir tanesiyse oyundaki her şeyi bulup, bütün boss'ları hiç yara almadan geçip, oyunu yine 3 saatte bitirmenizi talep ediyor. Uğraşılacak şeyler değiller yani...

Yine de karakterleri, mizahi unsurları, karakter tasarımları ve ilk bölümleriyle severek oynadığım bir oyun oldu. Sonlara doğru sabrımı yitirdim, hepsi bu. Herkes için aynı şey geçerli olacak değil elbette.

Artılar:
+ Grafikler
+ Mizahi hikâye
+ İlginç karakterler

Eksiler:
- Hızlı seyahat yok
- Aynı yerlerden tekrar tekrar geçmek
- Düşmanlar durmadan bir daha çıkıyor
- Son bölümler gereksiz zor

Shantae serisine giriş yapmak isterseniz buradan başlayabilirsiniz. 6/10

[b][u]Bu oyunu sevdiyseniz şunları da deneyebilirsiniz[/u][/b]: Dust: An Elysian Tale, Guacamelee!, Kunai

I don't think it's a very good Metroidvania, but its platforming is solid, the item progression is solid, the setpieces are solid, the art is solid, everything is just solid.  My biggest gripe is that the game runs too fast on high refresh rate displays without tweaking, but other than that I recommend this game.

review:
its fine... seriously overrated, honestly there are a million better metroidvanias, this one has no teleporter rooms, so backtracking is very annoying until you unlock the good traversal skills near the end of the game

the maps are super bland and seriously overuse the "long corridor with enemies" design trope, the combat is very mediocre and yet most enemies take several hits to bring down, most have very simplistic behavior too

the game is competently made, i just dont find anything that makes it a "must play", and since reviews on steam are either thumbs up or thumbs down, i guess i give this the most unenthusiastic thumbs up ever

author: {'steamid': '76561198244767998', 'num_games_owned': 411, 'num_reviews': 355, 'playtime_forever': 844, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 679, 'last_played': 1710511189}
review:
[h1]Почувствуй себя пиратом. Хоть где-то.[/h1]

Хорошая игра.
Качественно нарисованные персонажи, что в пикселях, что в плане вставок в диалоге (и они как по мне даже лучше чем в [b]Half-Genie Hero[/b], а ведь она следующая в серии).

Музыка шикарная, геймплей хорош (в следующей игре серии его можно купить, взяв DLC, так, чисто как факт вам), сюжет более менее.
Как всегда вот эта метроидванская хрень - приди сюда когда найдёшь это или то, и достанешь условного осьминога-сердце.

Проходиться довольно быстро, а после первого прохождения открывается режим пирата в котором открыты все предметы для уничтожения блоков и перемещения (сабля, ботинки, пистолет, пушка, шляпа) - этот режим в основном для спидранов.

review: Замечательная метроидвания с роскошной пиксельной графикой, приятной музыкой и будоражащими изображениями героинь в диалогах Σ>―(〃°ω°〃)♡→ Игра умеренно сложная, проходится достаточно легко, но с интересом. Не считая последнего уровня и босса, вот там жопа вспотеет как надо. У игры абсолютно нет недостатков, кроме отсутствия русского языка. author: {'steamid': '76561198146150437', 'num_games_owned': 461, 'num_reviews': 207, 'playtime_forever': 102, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 102, 'last_played': 1671971980}
review: Expected more from this given the positive reviews. Not really a metroidvania even, more a really linear Zelda-like with some ability progression (which can be fun). The biggest issue for me is that enemies are completely unconcerned with your attacks, your attacks don't stun or cause enemies to do anything, they'll attack as normal through your attacks, this is especially aggravated with some enemy placement where you can't really dodge said attacks. Now if the same applied to you it would be odd but still acceptable, but it isn't. Moreover I don't think the level design, environmental storytelling etc. is all that good. Maybe it's because I don't have a connection to the previous games in the franchise.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044667013', 'num_games_owned': 286, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 740, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 740, 'last_played': 1671862168}
review:
I decided to try out a Shantae game since the Shantae community was always hype during the Smash Ultimate days, and I'm glad I did.

The gameplay has pretty tight controls and I loved Shantae's moveset as you progress and unlock new moves.  I think it does well as a metroidvania with my only complaint being the issue of unguided backtracking. There were a couple vague moments where it didn't explain how to progress further, leading me to look up answers. The story was also a bit cheesy and filled with flat characters, but I don't think that was their focus. It's one of those games where you don't take it too seriously, you're just there to have fun. Through it all, I enjoyed Pirate's Curse and I'm excited to try the next two. (I hated risky's revenge lmao)

author: {'steamid': '76561198030784015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11207, 'playtime_forever': 545, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 545, 'last_played': 1670403211}
review:
Shantae and the Pirate's Curse is yet another of literally thousands of 2D retro pixel platformers infesting Steam and lowering the average quality of all video games everywhere.  Of course, this is a console port, and not a good one, the port was very poorly done and a bit of an afterthought.

This is an older platformer, around 10 years old, and has an anime pirate girl theme.  Gameplay consists of very generic platforming and thumping enemies with your hair (?).  Yeah me neither.  It's a metroidvania, which means a lot of backtracking and "exploration", but the game does quite poorly at this, and it's difficult to get into the game because of the plethora of technical deficiencies.

From a technical perspective, the game doesn't meet basic minimum requirements that most PC gamers expect as standard.

A choice was made to use obsolete, decades old retro pixel "art" as a substitute for contemporary PC graphics.  It's unclear if this is due to lack of budget or talent, regardless, the overall visual quality of the game is extremely low as a result.

While there are options to change the resolution for the game, all this does is scale up the simplistic low quality art assets used to make the game, which makes little or no difference to the graphics quality.  Without any other substantial graphics tweaks, it's not possible for gamers to improve the mediocre 2D visuals.

The developers didn't design the game for modern gaming PCs, as such the game resolution caps out at 1080p, a very low resolution that became mainstream back in 2006 and became obsolete when 4K entered the mainstream in 2014.  The game simply won't look right on modern gaming displays due to this failure on the part of the developers.

Because this is a console game, it carries a number of deliberate design deficiencies.  Compromises were made to cater to the inferior console gaming appliances that the game was designed for.  These are unfortunate compromises and limitations that PC gamers shouldn't be forced to accept, but it's evident that PC was a second thought for the console-centric developers.  The game is deficient as a result of these choices, and would have been so much better without the handicaps that designing games for consoles forces upon a game.  Once more, console peasants have made gaming worse for everyone.

These technical defects push this game below acceptable standards for any modern PC game.

You're forced to sign a highly questionable yet legally unenforceable End User License Agreement.  Developers must learn they are here to serve gamers, not control them.  I had my cat walk over the keyboard while the EULA was displaying, which fixed that problem for me.

Shantae and the Pirate's Curse has the completely pants on head insane price of $20 USD(!!!!!), for which you could easily get any number of older AAA games, let alone the sheer number of free games available on Steam.  Given the defects and quality issues with the game, coupled with the unrealistic price, this is impossible to recommend.  Much newer, far better platformers like Hollow Knight are cheaper than this!  What were they thinking?

review:
Sin duda todos los juegos que he probado de shantae hasta ahora han sido divertidos, interesantes y dificiles, y este no fue la excepcion. Me ha encantado su historia, la compleja atencion a los detalles para completar misiones, el diseño y dibujo que es hermoso... 

El juego es completamente bueno, al principio me molesto la reutilizacion de sprites del anterior juego pero fue solo durante los primeros minutos, con el tiempo notas que es un juego completamente distinto a su anterior entrega como es costumbre en la saga. 

Mecánicas nuevas, exploracion, grandes desafios e historia interesante. Calificación 9 / 10

author: {'steamid': '76561198277404733', 'num_games_owned': 185, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 593, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 423, 'last_played': 1668893197}
review:
Kind of jank, doesn't pass the wiki test (being able to beat a game without resorting to a wiki page), lacking polish in some areas, some weird design choices to say the least, however the game has the classic shantae comedy, and charm. 

I wish the game was played with the pirate costume on but it's sadly not. The story is okay, and the platforming is very very bland until you get a couple "upgrades"

I'd place this game underneath games such as hollow knight, axiom verge, but above momodora. It's a fairly decent game.

[spoiler]Risky's boots, and Risky's hat are by far the most fun upgrades in the game. The scimitar is pretty fun but it's a little too jank. And oh boy the cannon.[/spoiler]

This game has a big of metroidvania syndrome in which it becomes more fun the longer you play it. In other words, the beginning of the game is by far the weakest portion. I'm glad I stuck with it because I almost dropped it. 

Overall I'd rate it a solid 6-7/10, It's a fun buy, a good way to spend a chunk of time, maybe wait for a sale and pick it up.

review: This is the one best side scrolling platformers that I have played in a while. There is no second guessing the controls, there're simple enough. The level designs are challenging without being frustrating. Enemies and NPCs are unique to each level, making each new area a different experience. The story is easy to follow along. The quest aspect keeps the story engaging, while the puzzles keep you thinking. Shantae and the Pirate’s Curse is a solid platforming experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198344748406', 'num_games_owned': 80, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 1051, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1051, 'last_played': 1669158652}
review:
The fan-services in this game are wack lol, btw shantae tomboy is the best tomboy; according to squid baron.

To be honest, this is by far the greatest metroidvanian game i've ever played before.
The story and the plot were spot on and funny, gotta say with honesty. The characters were a chefs kiss, sounds & particle effects and the design of the level and puzzles were perfect, I absolutely love the amount of work they have put into this game, very good game.

Once I was playing this game in the half progress, I was overwhelmed with heavy enthusiasm and the wholesomeness oozing out from this game, I LOVED IT. I would 100% buy these videogame characters as plushies. So amazing! There are also some hidden & secrets which makes the game give you more to explore and discover new things from back to back, basically backtracking, which I am not quite a fond of comparing to another different game; Cry of Fear but hey, this one hits different from other games such as Cry of Fear.

a solid 100/10, would recommend to those who like metroidvania style videogames or just want to see some pair of nice booba based game. I love this game!

Thank you game, would and will definitely plan to revisit this wonderful game some day or years.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972267042', 'num_games_owned': 500, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 193, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 191, 'last_played': 1668451834}
review:
This is one of the most fluidly animated games I have played since Disney's platform games on the 16 bit consoles in the 90s. The vibrant colors, excellent music, and superb animation make this game an absolute blast to play. The storyline is fun, the gameplay is fun. The game itself.... is FUN!

The only complaint I have is: If you have your monitor set to a higher refresh rate than 60hz, this can cause the game to go a bit nuts and play much too fast. If the game is running fast for you, please set your refresh rate on your monitor to 60hz in Windows Display Settings -> Advanced Display Settings. This should solve the issue.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025016532', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 274, 'playtime_forever': 1026, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1026, 'last_played': 1661579634}
review:
I'm going to recommend this because it had good harmless platforming fun....but holy cow does it have some annoying anime style characters and dialogue so bad that to call it cringe is a disservice to all things cringe.  Seriously, I don't know who the target audience is that enjoys/appreciates this sort of thing, but they should probably not be allowed within 500 metres of a school if you know what I'm saying.

Anyway, it's a pretty straightforward platformer with combat that becomes increasingly more complex (although never TRULY complicated.....it's just that more elements are added as the game goes along, but they never become onerous to implement) and some basic back and forth puzzles to be solved like in a point and click adventure/metroidvania that will further the plot and/or expand the map.  There's also some collectibles one of which will allow you to increase your health and the other of which will allow you to access the true ending (but only if you get them all).

It's not bad by any stretch, and in fact it's quite fun and entertaining......you just have to grit your teeth and ignore any time characters and their "dialogue" are on the screen.

Recommended, though your mileage may (and probably will!) vary.

author: {'steamid': '76561198109795199', 'num_games_owned': 630, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 1220, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1220, 'last_played': 1663947914}
review:
50번째 도전과제 100%

- 샨테, 샨테: 리스키의 복수에 이어 3번째 작품인 샨테와 해적의 저주.

- 전작을 해보지 않아서 이전 내용은 자세히 알 수 없으나 스커틀 마을에서 시작하여 리스키의 함정에 걸린 샨테는 ‘해적왕’의 이야기를 알게 되고 샨테, 리스키가 같이 모험을 다니는 이야기. 스토리 자체는 흥미거리는 없으나 '이정도는 나쁘지 않게 전개 했다' 정도. 스토리의 깊이가 많이 얕으니 게임성을 위주로 평가하였다.

- 메트로베니아 형식을 취하지만 플랫포머도 같이 섞인 이중적인 작품:
능력을 얻고 새로운 지역을 갈 수 있는 건 여타 메트로베니아의 형식이지만 이전의 지역 스토리를 클리어하지 않으면 다른 지역 조차 접근할 수 없고 새로운 능력을 얻었다 하더라도 스토리 자체에 개입보다는 하트 문어, 다크 매직을 얻는 위주가 많다. [spoiler]하지만 다크 매직을 20개 전부 모아야 진 엔딩을 볼 수 있기 때문에 아예 개입이 없다고는 말할 순 없다.[/spoiler] 퍼즐도 가끔씩 존재하고 플랫포머의 컨트롤 요소가 많은 편이기 때문에 100% 메트로베니아 게임이라고는 설명할 수 없지만 두 개의 장르를 잘 조합해서 만들어진 형태라고 말할 수 있다.

- 난이도는 정말 쉬운 편. 체력 회복 아이템, 보조 공격 아이템, 공격 강화 아이템 등 몬스터가 나름 잘 뿌려주는 편이며 심지어 보석으로 살 수 있다. 이 아이템들을 언제 어디서든 사용할 수 있기에 체력이 부족하다 싶으면 바로 채울 수 있어 난이도가 많이 하락한다. 후술할 보석 노가다 방법과 어렵지 않은 보스패턴 등으로 메트로베니아에 처음 접하는 사람들도 스트레스 받지 않고 플레이 할 수 있다. 별개로 길 찾기는 어렵지 않은 편에 속하나 자주 왔다갔다 하는 경우가 잦고 텍스트를 제대로 읽지 않으면 길을 잃기 쉽기 때문에 플레이 할 때 잘 숙지해야 할 것이다.

- 난이도의 흐름은 일정하나 후반부로 갈수록 컨트롤 난이도의 비중이 높음:
흐름 상 초반에는 아무것도 없어도 몬스터가 약하기 때문에 난이도는 높지 않다. 중반으로 가면 진흙 습원 섬이 몬스터 배치가 촘촘하게 되어 있어 난이도가 조금 있지만 여기까지 도착했다면 체력과 데미지 업그레이드가 어느정도 되어있어 아이템으로 찍어 누르면 끝이기에 상관없다. 이후는 몬스터가 아닌 컨트롤 요소가 꽤나 있어 난이도가 초반보단 확실히 높다...만 하드코어한 게임보다는 확실히 난이도는 떨어지는 편.

- 국내에서 태보 때문에 잘 알려진 ‘Run Run Rottytops’와 더불어 맵 배경과 맞게 짜임새 있는 노래로 게임 내내 즐겁게 했다. 그리고 솔직히 애들 게임으로 만든 거 같은데 일러스트 수위가 조금 있는거 같다. 솔직히 밖에서 하기엔 좀 그럼ㅋㅋ 나름 롱런한 게임이기도 해서 게임 외부적인 요소는 깔끔하고 좋은 편.

- 최종적으로 정통 메트로베니아라 하기엔 무리가 있지만 잘 짜여진 맵 디자인과 플랫포머 요소를 합쳐서 재미를 높였다. 난이도도 응애 수준이기 때문에 어느정도 게임을 한 사람들이라면 정말 쉽다고 평가할 것이므로 이러한 장르를 처음 접하는 사람에게 추천한다. 가격은 플레이타임이 길지 않기 때문에 다소 높으나 15년에 나온 게임이라 할인도 큰 편으로 하는 편이고 번들로 많이 뿌리기 때문에 그때 사면 되지 않나 싶다.

- [b]여기서부턴 플레이하면서 도전과제, 스피드런에 대한 내용을 서술함. 어느정도 스포가 될 수 있음[/b]:
난이도가 높은 것만 서술하자면 보스 클리어+노 데미지와 스피드런이다. 무조건 1회차 이후에 하는 것을 추천한다. 클리어 이후 새로운 회차를 시작할 때 모든 해적 도구(피스톨, 모자, 시미터, 부츠)를 주는 ‘해적 모드’가 존재하기 때문에 난이도가 급격하게 낮아진다. 물론 공격 데미지는 처음으로 되돌아가기에 이 부분은 보석 노가다로 업그레이드 해주면 된다.
보석 노가다 하는 법(유튜브): https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6HHiNm2doFs
- 스피드런은 2개의 도전과제가 존재한다. 하나는 2시간 이내에 클리어(노말 엔딩 가능, 수집 요소 필요없음)와 4시간 이내에 100% 클리어(진 엔딩, 문어 하트, 다크 매직 모두 모으기, 샨테 능력치 모두 업그레이드)가 있다. 유튜브에는 100% 클리어를 1시간 반만에 클리어를 하는 영상이 있는 것처럼 실력이 좋은 사람들은 동시에 2개의 스피드런을 클리어 할 수 있을 것이다. 필자는 그게 안돼서 2개를 따로 했다. 게임 내에서 세이브 파일을 복사할 수 있어 최대한 100%로 클리어하다가 1시간 반정도때 복사하여 노말 엔딩을 보고 2시간 스피드런 클리어 후 4시간 100% 스피드런을 클리어 했다. 다른 게임의 스피드런에 비해서는 난이도가 낮은 편이니 부담없이 해도 괜찮을 것이다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198321834845', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1872, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1224, 'last_played': 1683071536}
review:
tan tan tan tan tanran ran tururururu rururu ruru

Primeiramente patrocinado pelo meu nebro boga e agora comprado por mim, mermao que jogo GOSTOSO, literalmente o primeiro metroidvania que eu me senti jogando metroid, divertido pa krl, os upgrades são simples mas funcionam direitinho e a trilha sonora, P0RR4 é muito boa, salve pra frostbite island.

Eu real comecei a jogar ano passado sem hype nenhum, e estou aqui agora adorando esse jogo, tenho que jogar os outros 4 agoram, mas de fato esse ja é meu favorito, isso ate pode ser um erro meu não ter começado pelo Risky Revenge, mas simplesmente diversao, ost vibrante e sprite gostosa, namoral ai mano vistam umas roupas nao aguento mais.

Os sprites são muito bem animados, designs bonitos e desafios legais, acho que eu nao tenho uma fodendo critica pra esse jogo, na real tenho sim vai se fud3 ultimo mapa mt rui aaaaaaaaaaaa, eu tmb esperava que o final boss fosse mais desafiador mas tudo bem, eu adorei esse jogo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198402073499', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 98, 'playtime_forever': 1480, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 32, 'playtime_at_review': 1448, 'last_played': 1711761213}
review: 이 게임 흑막은 시장인거 같어 초콜렛따위에 마을을 파는게 말이 되냐고 / 샨테 최신작인 일곱 사이렌까지 다 해보고 느낀 결과 샨테 시리즈 중 해적의 저주 이게 제일 재미있었던 거 같다. 춤 시스템이 없다 보니 게임의 템포?라고 해야하나 그게 빠르기도 하고 대화창에 나오는 일러스트도 수려하고 개인적으로 도트 그래픽 빠돌이인데 샨테 시리즈 중 마지막 도트 그래픽 게임이기도 하고 리스키 부츠랑 좇비비는것도 그동안 없던 전개라서 제일 재밌었던 거 같다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198801199233', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1792, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1792, 'last_played': 1689465845}
review:
Shantae and the pirate's curse es un juego que si o si vale la pena jugar.
Aunque se aleja un poco de la formula Metroidvania, aun conserva la exploración pero en menor medida y de cierta forma balanceándola con la acción, todo esto para darnos un juego que es mas lineal a comparación de las entregas anteriores, lo cual no es malo y funciona muy bien.
En cuanto a la dificultad, se podría considerar un juego con una dificultad media/baja, salvo un par de bosses y un par de niveles no requiere que tengamos 10 dedos en cada mano (? 
En el aspecto gráfico no decepciona, el pixel art del juego es simplemente hermoso, las animaciones son fluidas y tiene un gran cast de personajes muy divertidos y carismáticos asi como varias situaciones graciosas

Es un juego totalmente recomendado asi como cualquier juego de la saga de Shantae <3

author: {'steamid': '76561198027847713', 'num_games_owned': 181, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 783, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 783, 'last_played': 1661753242}
review: A really fun metroidvania-like, and perhaps this whole series is like this. It was my first one so there's a few "unimportant" story beats that I missed out on understanding the true depth. However, it's all self-contained and done very well. The art is amazing and it's just a lot of fun. It wasn't hard to beat this in under 13hrs, and I'm not a speedster, so if you can find a deal around $10-15 it's WELL worth your investment.

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198041079983', 'num_games_owned': 1590, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 607, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 607, 'last_played': 1661276077}
review: The key to a good metroidvania is to make the backtracking progressively more convenient with endgame traversal being effortless. This game nails it and is a huge step up from Risky's Revenge. Good level design, music, and comedy. Definitely worth a playthrough if you have any love for the genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061481125', 'num_games_owned': 73, 'num_reviews': 89, 'playtime_forever': 1138, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1138, 'last_played': 1661252246}
review:
La 3er juego de Shantae y seguramente el mejor.

Este fue el último de la saga que tuvo gráficos pixel art... ya que en las posteriores entregas los han cambiado a otro rollo más "dibujo animado". No están mal, pero prefiero el estilo retro de este Pirate's Curse.

Muy BONITO (con mayúsculas) además de que tiene misiones muy variadas, tan entretenido que me lo he pasado casi del tirón.

Hay unas cuantas habilidades piratas que irás consiguiendo por las diferentes islas, aunque también otras que se compran en la tienda de la ciudad con gemas, además de pasivas para fortalecer tu pelo y hacer más daño con él, etc.

Eso si, pesar de ser un metroidvania me ha parecido bastante fácil, algo extraño en su género. He matado a todos los bosses a la primera y en general no he muerto ni una vez en todo el juego.
Pero lo dicho, aunque sea sencillo está genial y para nada aburre. Juegazo!

Esta ha sido mi reseña y al que no le guste que le den. 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198866883051', 'num_games_owned': 26, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1731, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1731, 'last_played': 1649706480}
review:
Story and characters 
Shantae franchise has both fantastic characters and dialogue. While the designs are obviously suggestive they don't feel shameless or out of place like 99% of other games. The story itself is generic but the characters more than makes up for it.

Gameplay

The port from 3DS has some issues. Notably controller rebinding is lacking though I assume isn't a problem with those familiar with steam controller rebinding, but it is annoying. 3DS controls are perfect out of the box but customization would always be nice. Achievements are a nice touch that don't exist on the 3DS version but for replays after 100%ing the game I recommend going with the Citra version
The platforming is easier than I would personally have liked, although the final cannon section is one of the best platforming experiences ever and I wish the entire game was like that. platforming ROM hacks have huge potential and I'd love to see more pirate themed Shantae in the future similar to the HGH Risky Boots DLC

Music
Like other Shantae games the music is amazing. Even after finishing the game I find myself listening to the music which is very rare for me. I play most games with no music, but made an exception for the shantae series because of how good it is. 

Overall enjoyment
I wish there had been more platforming, particularly with the cannon simply because of how good it feels. I could keep playing the last section over and over for the rest of my life.
Overall it was a wholesome and fun experience and I highly recommend playing it yourself

author: {'steamid': '76561198074650032', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 2148, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2148, 'last_played': 1622407801}
review:
A 10/10 for me, one of my favorite games.

Shantae is in the same genre as games like the 2-D Metroid games, but dials up the humor to the max. You play as the belly dancing half-genie Shantae as she traverses through a lot of classic Arabian locales, such as palaces and temples. The Shantae games often have a Saturday morning cartoon vibe, with bright, colorful visuals, and characters with big personalities. Shantae, her friends, and even her enemies are all really likable and amusing. For me, the writing and humor is top notch all the way through.

The gameplay is also fantastic, with this easily being my favorite of the Shantae series so far. The other Shantae games are a bit less fluid due to using Shantae's belly dance transformations to access her powers. While thematically I miss the dance transformations, there's no denying Pirate's Curse is just so much faster paced using the pirate gear instead. Combat is simple to learn and fun, and each dungeon is distinct with entertaining mechanics and puzzles to learn. The game's entire soundtrack is also great!

The other Shantae games for me struggle to get the right game length (with Risky's Revenge over far too quick, and Seven Sirens overstaying its welcome), but Pirate's Curse gets it just right. I've played through this several times since it came out and it's always a great time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040375999', 'num_games_owned': 680, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1468, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1468, 'last_played': 1659253013}
review: No resolutions above 1080p are supported, no integer scaling support, very lackluster release. Pretty much what I expected from Wayforward on the technical side. Started playing on my 3DS instead to get proper native scaling, game itself seems alright so far. basically scratched that GBA Castlevania but I can't recommend the PC port in good conscious, if I had to guess the rest of the versions don't have integer scaling either which will result in noticeable pixel shimmer but if that doesn't bother you then get this by all means.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978387124', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 224, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 224, 'last_played': 1658965826}
review:
I started with Shantae - Half Genie Hero, and really enjoyed the world, characters, and tone of the game. It's a very casual metroidvania, which was enjoyable. 

So I figured I'd like this game. 

And to be fair, the tone, characters, and world are still a lot of fun. It's incredibly cute and silly.

But this game is SO TEDIOUS. 

So many game design choices that waste your time. 

- an escape sequence on a zombie level, that is inexplicably long
- having to fine save stations
- you don't collect many quickly in the game, so upgrading your damage takes awhile. Which isn't too bad...unless you spent all your gems on a special kick which barely does any damage. Why?
- Having to heal a quarter heart at a time in the hot springs
- fast travel within the game is behind an item (pirate flare) that you have to buy or find. Again, why?
- I finally gave up after an escape sequence on the sand level. You need to sneak past guards. If they catch you, you have to start from the beginning of this segment. THIS SEGMENT IS RIDICULOUSLY LONG. Even worse, there's a section where you need to sneak past some guards. But there's no way other than to walk right at them. So I did, hoping to hop over them. It turns out there are shadows you can hide in. WHY WOULD YOU NOT INTRODUCE THIS MECHANIC EARLIER?! Nope, instead I had to do this whole section from square one because of terrible game design. Nah, I'll just uninstall. 

The designers don't respect your time as a player. 

Buy Shantae - Half Genie Hero, cause this game is boo boo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198333825995', 'num_games_owned': 1204, 'num_reviews': 212, 'playtime_forever': 904, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 904, 'last_played': 1658341248}
review:
Se nota una mejora considerable en todos los aspectos en comparación al Risky's Revenge (el previo en cuanto a lore).

- Gameplay mas fluido.
- Mas y mejores diseños de niveles/mapas.
- La banda sonora destacando como siempre por sobre todo.

Eso si... el ultimo nivel es bastante toca huevos, y personalmente creo no le llega ni a los talones a Sunken Cavern (el ultimo de Risky's Revenge, donde íbamos como sirena disparando a todo lo que venia de frente)

review:
The best shantae game in the series! Which is funny considering in terms of her powers she's at some of her weakest storywise. Also the art style is the most fanservicey in the series if that matters to you at all. 

The only complaint I have is running the game at higher resolutions makes the sprites and much higher quality portrait art look a little jarring in comparison.

Also don't be like some of the idiots I've seen in the comments and try to run this game at higher than 60 fps. It's a sprite based  platformer, 60 is all you need

author: {'steamid': '76561198020789907', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 139, 'playtime_forever': 2281, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2281, 'last_played': 1657177901}
review:
This is the most enjoyable and best game in the series, it is the peak of the Shantae franchise in terms of experience, quality and content. Arguably, this is the only one truly worth playing while the others are more for the fans of platformer/metroidvania-lite games since they never reach comparable heights. It's not a perfect game but it's the one that did the most things right with minimal flaws so I'll expand further.

[u]Gameplay[/u]
Gone is the input delay and unresponsiveness of Risky's Revenge, this time the controls are tight and the animations are more fluid. The powers or rather tools are much more practical in combat and interesting to use than the iconic transformations seen in the other games. Instead of having a button to dance and then having to select a transformation each time which interrupted the flow now each tools has its own button which is a great move to make their usage more natural and part of the gameplay. 

[u]Level design[/u]
The world is a bunch of islands accessible by boat, each island spans a couple of interconnected levels so its genre leans more towards a metroidvania-lite than anything else. The backtracking follows the same logic, it's reasonable but compared to its peers it's more on the light side and there is a consumable to warp back to the entrance. As for the quality of the levels, the platforming is relatively easy with occasional spikes in difficulty but while they are nothing to rave about they are well-made and fun to traverse with a reasonable amount of opposition. Some of the later parts of the game tends to be a bit aggravating with its enemy selection but nothing major enough to warrant a lot of frustration. Something that does cause frustration however are the checkpoints or the lack of, most levels aren't very long but every time you fall down a pit or land on spikes you get sent right at the beginning of the level and get damaged as well. It gets worst with the introduction of sequences where you can't get damaged or caught once or you suffer the same fate of being sent to the beginning of the level. Those moments happen very rarely and aren't difficult to complete but the design choice remains questionable.

[u]Visuals & Audio[/u]
The higher resolution pixel graphics and the detailed portraits during dialog are both charming they even get better with the great music that accompanies them.

[u]Story & Characters[/u]
The story is a sequel to Risky's Revenge, it has the same lighthearted tone with a silly humour that might get a chuckle out of you. It's simple writing that can be enjoyed as a fun adventure to save the day and interact with its jolly characters. 

Overall the game is simple good fun but it comes from a middling series so don't go expecting it to compare to something like Hollow Knight or the likes in term of quality. It remains the best of what can be done with Shantae and is probably going to land as an interesting title to play for fans of the genre and curious gamers alike. I'd rate it around an 8/10, reasonable difficulty, enjoyable gameplay, good level design and great audiovisual experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053971351', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 134, 'playtime_forever': 908, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 908, 'last_played': 1657934494}

author: {'steamid': '76561198162290111', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 421, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 421, 'last_played': 1656180965}
review:
Having played every Shantae game over the years this still stands as my personal favorite entry in the series. Very solid platforming with tight combat and movement combined with charming animations and instantly memorable character designs makes this a true metroidvania classic.
Having said that this is a 1 to 1 port of the DS version of the game and so any 144hz+ monitor is going to run the game at a hamster on crack pace. An easy fix to this is to reduce the refresh rate of your monitor down to 60hz in your computers advanced display settings. Obviously this is a somewhat of a pain, but seeing as a physical DS copy of this game is currently selling for around $100 while the switch version goes for several hundred at least id say it's a decent tradeoff.

author: {'steamid': '76561199023681887', 'num_games_owned': 49, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 680, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 654, 'last_played': 1666475445}
review:
Tras los acontecimientos de Risky's Revenge y la perdida de poderes de Shantae, llega el momento de ver a la medio genio sin poderes, y varias amistades nuevas.

En el aspecto jugabilidad me parece un juego simplemente increíble, no solo por algunos cambios en los diseños de nivel, sino por los increíbles artefactos que reemplazan a los poderes de Shantae; artefactos los cuales necesitaras si o si en alguna parte del juego, cuando consigues cualquier nuevo artefacto para Shantae el juego te obliga a usarlo contra el jefe de esa misma isla ya sea porque el jefe tiene un movimiento/habilidad que solo puede ser esquivada con el artefacto en especifico o porque simplemente para acceder a alguna sala es necesario... En cuestión movilidad va frecuentemente tendrás que viajar a un punto de la isla ya sea por un artefacto o por alguna misión especifica, algo que sinceramente si no tienes un artefacto en especifico ir a ese punto de la isla sera demasiado tardado llegar, algo que me gustaría destacar es que si hay formas rápidas de desplazarse como es el backdash (misma mecanica que estaba en Risky's Revenge) solo que ahora tendrá un cooldown de entre 1 a 1.5 segundos para volverlo a usar, algo que en lugar de facilitar el movimiento lo dificulta mas, pero fuera de eso las mecánicas del juego están incluidas de una buena forma.

En el aspecto gráfico es muy parecido a su predecesor solo que en algunos aspectos Pirate's Curse esta ligeramente mas pulido, casi todas las animaciones son fluidas y ALGUNOS por no decir TODOS los diseños de personajes durante los diálogos están completamente renovados, algo que personalmente me gusto demasiado ya que con este nuevo estilo le da una vibra un poco mas caricaturesca, ya sea por sus contornos un poco mas mascados en algunas curvas, cambio de gama de color, etc. 

En el aspecto de historia se ve claramente que es la secuela de Risky's Revenge; este juego a lo que va de la saga de Shantae se podría definir como el mejor en el aspecto de historia, podrá ser muy cliché esta misma pero eso no quita que el desarrollo o diálogos de algunos personajes de verdad te hagan sentir la emoción del momento, tal como puede ser algunas escenas de Rottytops o Risky boots, el juego no presenta inconsistencias en la historia, todo va según lo que paso en Risky's Revenge, tal y como la venta de Scuttle town a Ammo baron, etc.

En diseño de niveles este nivel tampoco se queda corto, los niveles están muy bien diseñados, enemigos bien colocados, mecánicas necesarias o relacionadas a la isla, fondos pixelart simplemente hermosos, etc.... PERO hay una excepción a todo esto la cual seria la Isla Ciénaga, esta isla a pesar de tener un pixel art de fondo hermoso y colores brillantes, la posición de algunos enemigos es simplemente... INJUSTA, si es tu primera vez jugando y te topas con esta isla, sera un completo dolor de cabeza, enemigos que aparecen de la nada sin aviso o pistas de este, los enemigos hacen una excesiva cantidad de daño para la etapa del juego e incluso habrá veces en las que si no estas lo suficientemente atento tomaras daño si o si perdiendo entre 2 a 4 pedazos de corazón.

Ahora... El juego me premia por hacer x o y acción? SI, algo que es extremadamente gratificante ya que te pueden dar algún logro ya sea por querer hacer el juego mas difícil, por sacar algún final, por derrotar algún boss, etc. El juego te premia por casi cualquier acción que haces y como lo mencione es muy gratificante para el jugador ver que su esfuerzo o acción tuvo su recompensa.

¿Que mas puedo decir? Es un juego increíble, si te gustan los juegos con dificultad media tipo metroidvania, este juego es el indicado, acabado artístico increíble, diseño de nivel bastante bueno, mecánicas divertidas, etc. Si te gustan los juegos de este tipo, date el gusto y juega esta maravilla; ya que es un 10/10 en mi opinión.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998543056', 'num_games_owned': 2354, 'num_reviews': 642, 'playtime_forever': 261, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 261, 'last_played': 1655563859}
review:
[b] > Be me
> Wake up excited to play some Shantae and the Pirate's Curse
> Load up the game
> Immediately, the music starts grooving like it's Friday night at the genie club
> Start swaying in my chair like "I'm the half-genie hero of my living room"
> Game introduces Risky Boots as the villain
> She's got that pirate swagger, and I'm thinking, "I need some of that in my life"
> Defeat the first boss and get the Pirate Hat
> Now I can float like a majestic potato in the wind
> Decide to go back to some old levels with my new floaty powers
> Reach the end of an old level
> Dance to save my progress
> My cat walks by and starts doing the Shantae dance with me
> We're both booty-shaking to the rhythm
> Jump into the next level
> Find the pistol upgrade and start shooting enemies
> Can't stop giggling at the thought of a genie with a pistol
> Risky Boots appears, and we engage in witty banter
> She calls me "Hero Hair"
> I call her "Pirate Scare"
> Decide to become best frenemies
> Get more upgrades, including a scimitar that lets me break stuff
> Start slashing every pot, barrel, and crate I see
> OCD kicks in, must break all the things
> The satisfaction of smashing everything is unparalleled
> Find the mermaid transformation
> I can swim! But only in the designated areas
> Decide to explore the high seas like a true pirate
> Get a little carried away and almost drown
> Shantae's face when she starts to panic is hilarious
> Resurface and make a mental note to stick to designated swimming areas
> Progress through the game, get more upgrades, defeat more bosses
> Feel like an unstoppable half-genie pirate goddess
> The humor, the music, the characters, everything is just so charming
> Finally reach the final boss, the Pirate Master
> Engage in an epic battle with epic music
> Every hit feels like I'm smacking him with a dose of Shantae's sass
> After a few tries, I emerge victorious
> Celebratory dance with Shantae, the game, and my cat
> Overall, Shantae and the Pirate's Curse is a hilarious, charming, and booty-shaking adventure that'll have you laughing and grooving the whole way through. 10/10 would recommend to anyone in need of a dose of genie-pirate goodness. [/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198414828996', 'num_games_owned': 1444, 'num_reviews': 144, 'playtime_forever': 804, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 781, 'last_played': 1655536887}
review:
相比前作来说进步非常大，首先地图设计和玩法都大大升级，类银河城元素加强了，不像前作除了猴子变身其他基本上没啥用，这作的能力升级不管应敌还是平台跳跃都用处极大，游戏性上绝对可以放心，绝对比前作好玩得多，游戏时长也有增长，同时任务指引更清晰了，基本上一个地图一个地图清完，到小镇找人对话或者查看物品提示都知道去哪。提示一下，我也是看商店预告片才发现，Y键那个灯不只是用来吸黑暗能量的，还能用来吸钱，打碎罐子到处跑的钱就不用麻烦去捡了，这个我真的直到通关都没发现……

至于其他方面，对话立绘有所变化，变得更偏日系二次元风格，这点见仁见智了，不过游戏内还是前作类似的像素风，不过分辨率貌似有所提升，感觉人物动作更加流畅了。剧情紧随前作，Shantae失去了精灵的能力变回人类之后与海盗姐姐Risky Boots闯关×[spoiler] Risky看着你闯关√ [/spoiler] 的故事，一路上获得的能力升级也是Risky的各种海盗装备，还包括Risky的靴子也就是Risky's boots，这个双关笑死我了。3dm的汉化补丁亲测是能用的，不过汉化质量太一般了，我建议英文稍微过得去的还是看英文吧，对话不难理解，用蹩脚汉化可能失去很多原话的乐趣。游戏还设置了一如既往的福利环节，沙漠金字塔关，相信我玩到那的不会失望。

总之如果是系列粉丝肯定无脑入必玩之作，如果路人从这作入坑也是可以的，纯粹可玩性很高，如果对剧情感兴趣的也可以先从前作Risky's Revenge开始玩。不知道为啥这作看中文评测，貌似比前作少很多中国玩家，有点可惜。

author: {'steamid': '76561198366671300', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 964, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 964, 'last_played': 1655138877}
review:
There's a lot going for this game: charming animations and character designs, amusing dialogue and world, catchy music, but, above all, solid platforming gameplay.  Things start off really easy in Scuttletown, maybe even a little too easy, but from there the game keeps throwing new mechanics, new maps and new enemies at you and the difficulty rises pretty quickly.  The boss designs are frequently outstanding.  Steel Maggot and Squid Baron are my favorites.  The game almost threatens to become too hard sometimes, but then the plentiful consumable items (health potions and food, monster milk which is a must in boss battles) help to make things more manageable.  

The only demerits are for the Metroidvania structure, which I think could have been implemented a little better.  Frequently the game won't let you progress unless you give a particular item to a particular npc in a particular spot on the map.  How was I to know to visit Bolo in Scuttletown after finding a fossil?  How would I know I had to take the soul I found on Mud Bog Island to Rottytops on Spiderweb Island before going back to Sky's place in Scuttletown?  None of these adventure game style scavenger hunts are that intuitive and you'd spend a lot of time wandering around trying to figure out what to do if you don't have access to a walkthrough.  (Use a walkthrough.)

author: {'steamid': '76561197980137679', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 856, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 856, 'last_played': 1654978652}
review:
Just finished little metroidvania style game. Playful fun tone in the art department and the writing. Surprisingly responsive controls. It's not perfect though, here are a few gripes:
There is a specific, expensive, and useless "upgrade" you might be tempted to purchase. Don't bother. Stock up on bubbles and potions for the final encounter.
Some visual cues for finding the next step to take aren't readily apparent. I had to find a guide just to see what to do with a couple items. 
The game really pushes you to master the controls by the end level with a huge difficulty spike. It's a pretty brutal obstacle course with save points farther spaced than the rest of the game.
Particularly with the last level, the back tracking would have been so tedious that I chose to forego running back to the shop for supplies and instead hurled myself at the final encounter over and over with the meager healing supplies I had on hand until I succeeded. Elden Ring prepared me well. The boss ain't dark souls, but he ain't no slouch either.

author: {'steamid': '76561198411112430', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 2961, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1501, 'last_played': 1697096056}
review:
8/10，游戏印象满分，但是实际体验要打一些折扣

优点：**剧情很放得开，森林抱妹那一段虽然很折磨，但我绝对不会当作减分项
**角色的设计抓住了重点，也确实很可爱，很美漫
*其实游戏的很多设计加以开发都可以成为卖点，比如说大炮的四段跳，香缇特有的爬着跑图等等
*我喜欢冰图那几个放电和自爆机器人的设计，蝎子娘也是一个值得一提的敌人

缺点：**游戏流程而言本质act，这不光是小游戏难以避免的内容不充实的问题，如果以银河城的角度来评价地图设计很成问题，最后的陷阱房做的很不错，然而之前的地牢体验都差强人意，重复的“钥匙-新道具-新钥匙-令人印象不深的boss”环节
*成就的难度本身当然不构成优缺点，但是我想说一点，全收集速通成就要求你获得至少2000左右的钱，鉴于你不会到处乱跑，估摸着至少得在沙漠固定的刷钱点打两个999，这从游戏体验而言河里吗？
