author: {'steamid': '76561197980449859', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 279, 'playtime_forever': 745, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 737, 'last_played': 1655261249}
review:
Pirate’s Curse was my first Shantae game and I had a really good time playing. There’s a little backstory you miss out on by starting here instead of the 2002 original or Risky’s Revenge, but it doesn’t hurt the experience, and I thought it was a great starting point.

The cast is all around charming and funny, with some hilarious one liners from the heroes and villains and even a couple of surprisingly emotional moments hidden about. It was rare to have a scene go by without a smile on my face at some point.

Pirate’s Curse has excellent controls and solid level design for the most part. Initially, your move set is really basic jumping and forward attacks (with your hair no less) but as you get various abilities including downward stab, dash, floating, quadruple jump and more, Shantae becomes more and more satisfying to use. You can also upgrade your attack power and speed and buy new moves and items with currency dropped from enemies. The tight controls, enjoyable soundtrack and creative level design brings to mind classic games like DKC 2.

The difficulty is a bit uneven, with one large spike about midway through the adventure, and another much bigger spike for the final area. For the most part, it’s a fairly easy game unless you choose to forgo the extra hearts, and multitude of offensive and recovery items you have access to, but it still keeps you on your toes.

Pirate’s Curse has a good amount of backtracking, either looking for secrets as you earn new abilities which can be entertaining, or forced backtracking for story progression which was a little more irksome. I would have preferred a more stage based approach like the aforementioned DKC 2, but it still works well and if you enjoy exploration more than I do, you’re sure to love it.

It’s hard to imagine any fan of 2D sidescrollers not enjoying this game on some level. Strong recommendation.

author: {'steamid': '76561198169513578', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 801, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 801, 'last_played': 1652323748}
review:
100% on steam deck with only 1 random crash. Definitely a good game with annoying parts. More specifically there are certain levels that are trial and error in nature instead of skill based. The second level with rotty was the first annoying level. Combined with instant kill spikes and the rooms being long its irritating. Some enemy placement are also "gotcha" in nature although it's more noticeable in later episodes. These alone make me like risky revenge more as there was less of these problems 

Now there's plenty of good parts of this game. I'll be quick about it. Mechanically it's better than Risky's revenge. No transformation just Risky's items. The music is great. Art and the fan service  is S teir. Story is the right amount of not too serious but entertaining. 

Overall it's a good game and worth the time if you can get over the few, but very apparent, "gotcha" levels

author: {'steamid': '76561198284906481', 'num_games_owned': 322, 'num_reviews': 181, 'playtime_forever': 628, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 628, 'last_played': 1624640942}
review: This is one of the best games of its genre, and easily the best game in the Shantae series. Pirates curse sports one of the most enjoyable 2D platformer movesets I've ever seen, brilliant dungeon design, an amazing OST, and so much more. The levels are super fun to traverse and combined with the great moveset make this the perfect speedrun game, heavily encouraging multiple playthroughs. This is another review where I just kinda have to gush and tell you to play the game if you like having fun. The only problem is just the fact that this game is originally from the 3DS, so when getting ported, the menus ended up turning out a bit clunky, making the maps a bit annoying to access. But all things considered, this isn't really a big deal. 9/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025752401', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 335, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 335, 'last_played': 1650317875}
review:
Frustrating and unfun. Enemies seem designed simply to be inconvenient and unfair. A scorpion centaur lady thing has a big sword, right? And swings the big sword, right? So you have a move you unlock that dodges, right? Not nearly enough pixels because it LUNGES during the attack. Try jumping? Works half the time. Then you get hit a second time when you land on the enemy itself. Damaging that enemy in the first place? Randomly it seems to guard against attacks and randomly it seems open to damage. Is there a telegraph for this? NOPE. Just spam attack and run from, don't dodge, it's thankfully telegraphed attack. The more you progress the worse it gets. Enemies popping out of the ground with no tell or warning, to slap your health away until you memorize their static locations; projectile spam like it's bullet hell; instantly re-spawning enemies as soon as you are a screen away. It's a mess.

Then there are the bosses. Successfully defeating a boss is not a triumph but a relief because now you never have to do that crap again. Until the next boss. Some have decent mechanics that are ruined by attack sequences that seem intended to stun-lock the player.

Good thing there are a bunch of cheese items you can purchase from a shop or gather as random drops! Why balance the game when you can just give the players a AOE attack to automatically whittle the enemy's health down while it stun-locks you?

The annoying one-word "voice overs". The cheesy writing. The grind to upgrade your attack by a single damage point, your attack speed by an unspecified amount, so on and so forth.

I just did not enjoy this "best in the Shantae series" game.

review:
This is my favorite of the Shantae games. It's fun and fast paced, and the pirate abilites are a great addition to Shantae's moveset.

There is some occasional backtracking for story stuff that seems a little unnecessary, but it's not too bad overall.

author: {'steamid': '76561198293904693', 'num_games_owned': 68, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 3203, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1748, 'last_played': 1698785100}

author: {'steamid': '76561198068174012', 'num_games_owned': 690, 'num_reviews': 385, 'playtime_forever': 1205, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1205, 'last_played': 1648401246}
review:
Shantae and the Pirate's Curse (2015)

I only learned later that this is the third game in the series but that's fine, the story is simple enough to understand and this title stands good on it's own. You play as the half genie Shantae who sets out to fix the pirate's curse (thanks to some events from the previous game). She lost her magical powers so you have to find and rely on pirate weapons to advance in the game. This is an extremely fun platformer game, struggled a bit with some levels but just keep going, it's actually pretty easy once you get used to it. The characters are pretty neat, the music is very good and its a pretty lengthy game to play.

9/10

"I found your boots... Risky Boots"
- Shantae

author: {'steamid': '76561198377797621', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 425, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 424, 'last_played': 1694005013}
review: Holds up well for its time, and a great precursor to Half-Genie Hero. It doesn't have a lot of lore, and the story is linear.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001304794', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 425, 'playtime_forever': 353, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 353, 'last_played': 1637548362}
review: This game is fine at best, just an average 2D Platformer/Metroidvania that doesn't really do much other than what's seen many times before but it being simple can be a great positive as it's really easy,simple and fun to understand + the Pirate Themes are always a positive as Pirates are 10/10. I always felt WayForward does a fantastic job in creating iconic nicely designed characters though but outside of that i don't feel their games do anything special sadly. I'd wait for a sale to try it out though as $30 is really abit much. The music on the other hand is fantastic, upbeat and great to listen to now and then, highly recommend buying the soundtrack though.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054302464', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 1283, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 887, 'last_played': 1646923194}
review:
アラビアンな世界観を日本的な萌え要素で描いたメトロイドヴァニア。

操作に対してキビキビと反応するタイプで、
豊富なアニメーションパターンも手伝って動かしているだけで楽しいです。

探索部分やアクション部分もオーソドックスで理不尽さがなく、
プレイ中ストレスを感じることがありませんでした。
簡単でも難しくもない、とてもいい調整だと思います。

残念なのがテキスト量が多いゲームなのに日本語訳がないことで、
全く英語が読めないとストーリーや次の目的地などが分かりにくいです。
一応、重要な単語は黄色で表示されるのでそれさえ読めれば
まあプレイはできるのですが…。

author: {'steamid': '76561198027414368', 'num_games_owned': 2570, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 1056, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1056, 'last_played': 1645788775}
review:
It's time for another Shantae review. If You haven't check out my review of [url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/Argo3422/recommended/277890]Risky's Revenge[/url] (previous Shantae title)

[h1]Ret-2-Go![/h1]
The game is direct sequel to [b]Shantae: Risky's Revenge[/b] and the events in the game are continuation of what have happened in that game. Visually it's very similar and the style is left intact. We don't have continuation errors in the game, which is very often in games like that, because just a map itself must be adjusted. Instead everything - from gameplay mechanics, story and anything else relates to the events of previous game.

The game is still a platformer, though map is less open and new levels are literally unlocked with story, when You get the map. I find this system rather unpleasant. I prefer ability blockades, which were used in [b]Risky's Revenge[/b], that makes the world map look more natural and only Your abilities are stopping You from going to certain places. But not there. After beating one level, You are unlocking next one. It's not that bad, but it breaks immersion for me. Game is still very similar in gameplay mechanics, but for a reason of what have happened in previous title, Your moves are very different. It's not continuation error, quite the contrary. They literally didn't force the powers to be the same just for the sake of it. I won't say any more, because I would have to spoil why is that. Gameplay still feels very similar, even with different moves and abilities. That's really amazing how they managed to make different gameplay mechanics that feels the same as the previous. As for the collectibles, I find them more interestingly hidden.

The game still has the same vibes, even with the changes. Only the next game will have a major differences. But I will review [b]Half-Genie Hero[/b] later. To be honest, there is no much for me to say. Game has been changed, but it's still faithful in my opinion and feels the same. I can't say too much, because of spoilers. Gameplay mechanic is directly related to what happened in previous title, so it's as much as I can describe it.

Definitely worth playing!

author: {'steamid': '76561198289897427', 'num_games_owned': 624, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 11, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1682943157}
review:
En un monitor 120Hz no se puede jugar, solo si tienes uno de 60hz.

Actualizado: 
En mi reseña antigua el problema radicaba por tener una gráfica Nvidia, ahora con un monitor 144hz y una gráfica AMD no tengo el mismo problema de aceleración x100 en el juego (para que luego digan que AMD solo es mas que problemas), se queda 60hz fijos que es lo máximo que soporta el juego para ir a la velocidad normal y natural, así que si tienes una gráfica Nvidia ten en cuenta que deberás tocar configuraciones extras en el panel de Nvidia si no el juego sera injugable para ti, dicha configuración si no recuerdo mal hay que tocarlo cada vez que lo quieres jugar o si no jugaras a todos los juegos a 60hz.

En cuanto el juego en si, es muy simple hasta rozar lo arcade, lo peor del juego que usa un sistema obsoleto de guardado el cual si mueres después de haber jugado 2h (por poner un ejemplo) y no guardaste lo tendrás que hacer todo desde el inicio, entendible ya que es un juego viejo pero aun así es muy molesto, por lo demás es un juego entretenido y solo recordable a buen precio ya que es una experiencia bastante genérica y nada nuevo para un juego de este tipo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052508726', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 725, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 725, 'last_played': 1644799686}
review:
My first foray into the Shantae universe, and what an amazing mix of charm and fun as hell gameplay!  
I'm not normally a huge platformer fan, since I am bad at controlling them, but this one was relatively forgiving, as forgiving as you'd like it to be depending on how reliant on consumables you wanted to be, and also on how many collectibles you wanted to gather.

I ended up getting every collectible simple because it felt fun and accessible to do so, so I did it, and had a blast!!

I definitely need to check out the other entries as well.

Here's a series I recorded for it, if anyone is interested!
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3Z0fn0Rn2uY&list=PLbt2SVNP1wtIiT_x_ffP5ADYNjTSaBatj&index=1

author: {'steamid': '76561198354539004', 'num_games_owned': 443, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 710, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 480, 'last_played': 1643981659}
review: Mas que recomendable. Un jueguito de plataforma con la simplicidad de aquellos de consolas de 16 bits, no representa desafíos al estilo Blasphemous o Hollow knight pero cumple a la perfección con entretener/divertir. Tiene un arte picante mas al servicio de la pajereada que otra cosa y un humor tonto que no se las rebusca demasiado, sin embargo funciona. Los controles no demandan romperse los dedos y el diseño de niveles y enemigos no sobresale pero tampoco aburre. Es una buena adquisición, sobre todo en oferta.

author: {'steamid': '76561198237633540', 'num_games_owned': 301, 'num_reviews': 100, 'playtime_forever': 3182, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 733, 'last_played': 1646223501}
review:
Ігра мені сподобалась через геймплей та сюжет: 
1. Головна героїня Шанте наснився сон, що Атаман Піратів хотів воскреснути, але для цього йому потрібна темна магія, щоб він повстав з своєї могили. Тут ГГ прокидається під час атаки солдатів Збройного барона. Далі починається геймплейга частина.
2. Битва з епічними босами.
3. Пошуки предметів (як і сюжетних, так і для прокачування ГГ). Цікаві локації і ульотний саундтрек. 
Рекомендую для тих, хто любить платформери і фанатам серії гри Shantae.
8.7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198044518746', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 738, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 737, 'last_played': 1643558386}
review:
마치 옛날의 록맨이나 록맨X 시리즈를 하는 것 같이 느껴지는데, 다행히 난이도는 그보다 많이 너그러운 편입니다. 스피드런이나 다른 제약을 걸고 하는 업적들을 더 하려면 이것보다 시간이 훨씬 많이 필요할지 모르지만, 그정도를 바라지 않는 저 같은 사람에게는 좀 짧지만 그게 가볍게 할 수 있는 장점으로 느껴져서 나쁘지 않게 느껴집니다.

※ 최고 프레임 속도를 반드시 60으로 제한하지 않으면 게임 속도가 비정상적으로 빨라집니다.
NVIDIA 제어판의 3D 게임 개별 설정을 이용하면 됩니다. 저는 이걸 25%까지 진행하고 나서야 알게 되었는데, 이 설정을 안해주면 게임이 너무 빨라 정상적인 플레이가 불가능합니다. 패치를 좀 해주면 좋겠는데, 이제와서 해줄 것 같지는 않으니 꼭 설정을 바꾸고 플레이 하세요.

※ 한글 지원을 안해주는 것은 좀 아쉽지만 유저 패치를 해주신 분들이 있습니다. 물론 없다고 못할 만큼 텍스트가 많은 게임은 아니지만 그래도 훨씬 쾌적합니다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198168646633', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 612, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 604, 'last_played': 1670026999}
review: Stavo cercando da tempo di avvicinarmi a questa serie e mi son deciso ad iniziare da questo. Me lo sono mangiato in 2 giorni da quanto mi ha tenuto incollato. Non lo definirei proprio metroidvania, come molti fanno, ma é un buon platform. L'ambientazione, la pixel art e soprattutto i personaggi ed il loro umorismo sono le cose che me lo hanno fatto apprezzare come gioco. Il gameplay é basic, con alcune belle trovate, e da quel che so manca la caratteristica peculiare della serie che sono le trasformazioni, ma comunque non annoia. A me piace correre nei giochi e madonna cara che belli gli stivali, vaffanculo alle scarpe da corsa di pokémon ziobono, che qua con quelli mandi Usian Bolt all'ufficio collocamento.

review:
Mil veces mejor que su Risky's Revenge. Tiene más variedad de escenarios, multiples mazmorras, más colecionables, es menos frustante, mejor colocación de enemigos y lo mejor de todo es que remplaza la magia de anteriores juegos por los artilugios pirata y mejora muchisimo la movilidad y su uso en puzzles y combate.
En pocas palabras, este juego es un claro ejemplo de lo que es una buena sequela.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071423880', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 712, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 712, 'last_played': 1641103449}
review:
Platformers, to me, are like fighting games; There are a lot of them, each with their own unique characters, and I'm absolutely terrible at every single one of them. Shantae and the Pirate's Curse, however, is a bit of an exception.

I've dipped my toe into the Shantae series before way back when it was on the DSi, but I dropped it quickly because I was a worse platform player then than I am now (somehow). But with the recent winter sale, I decided to give it another shot, deciding to work my way up through the games available on Steam, starting with Risky's Revenge. It was fun, if a little tough due to me taking way too long to figure out the control scheme, but The Pirate's Curse, the sequel, was what really drew me in.

 (Note: I'm choosing to play these games in order, but it's not required to play the previous installments to get the full experience. It just helps catch the references that they throw in here and there).

First off, the controls just [i]feel[/i] good. I played on a controller, and everything felt like it made sense. None of the button bindings felt weird and everything responded pretty well. Yet at the same time there's easily potential to do some crazy stuff if you can get the timings down. 

The gameplay itself is standard platformer fare, the best game to compare it to probably being the Mega Man series. You use Shantae's hair to whip baddies, and over the course of the game you get new tools to help beat the baddies faster and easier. You can also buy upgrades to make said tools stronger. Baddies also have the chance to drop consumables on defeat, which can make things even easier. The combat is fun and every enemy has their weakness that you can figure out and exploit in order to make dealing with them easier. 

The story is nothing super groundbreaking, but it showcases the Shantae series' cast doing what they do best: being goofy and having silly jokes and getting into absurd situations. The story isn't the focus, but it's still a fun ride. You also get to see cute, 2D women doing cool and funny things. What's not to like?

Last but not least, the music. I love me some video game music, and the music in The Pirate's Curse is straight up on another level. Each track fits its area perfectly, they're catchy, and (in my opinion) they don't get annoying, regardless of how many times you hear it on repeat. This was easily my favorite part of the game. I've been listening to these tracks online pretty regularly now.

TL;DR In the eyes of a subpar platformer player, Shantae and The Pirate's Curse has something for all sorts of players, whether it's people looking to dip their toes into the platformer genre, seasoned veterans, casual or tryhard. I'd definitely recommend picking this game up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050988070', 'num_games_owned': 612, 'num_reviews': 192, 'playtime_forever': 674, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 674, 'last_played': 1640728993}
review:
An instant favorite. This game is the culmination of WayForward's journey with Shantae, finally figuring out what works and what doesn't. Pirate's Curse is the perfect Shantae game in every regard:
[list]
    [*]Writing: Interesting and actually HILARIOUS interactions between characters.
    [*]Gameplay: The half-genie controls like a dream, they went as far as to cast aside her defining trait of transforming into different creatures and replaced it with Risky's pirate equipment, all because of what happened at the end of Risky's Revenge [spoiler]Shantae loses her genie magic in the final battle[/spoiler]. Playing with a fully upgraded Shantae is truly a sight to behold.
    [*]Level design: I cannot stress enough how intuitive the level design in this game is. The player is always graciously guided towards the next step of the adventure and as a result, progressing and backtracking through all the levels feels AMAZING.
[*]Art direction: The best Shantae has ever looked.
    [*]Soundtrack: Completely and utterly insane, I can barely contain my body when listening to this: 
    https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fFDhn4wgwKk
[/list]
I would recommend catching up a bit on the story of the two previous games if you care about that, (or even better, playing them. A big ask I know but they're good games too I swear) if not, do yourself a big favor and get this game already!

author: {'steamid': '76561198116136593', 'num_games_owned': 488, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1039, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1039, 'last_played': 1639884649}
review:
All of the shantaes are pretty fun if you like metroidvania style gameplay, this one is personally my favorite game in the franchise at the time. This game is absolutely great but i can't imagine this bug that is still in the game should be that hard to fix and roll out an update for.
!!! BUG !!! if you play this game on a monitor with a refresh rate larger than 60 the game will run faster than it's supposed to, for me a 144 hz monitor made the game run at ~2.3x game speed which is basically unplayable, way too fast.
I found a fix for nvidia cards. right click on the desktop and go to nvidia control panel. Manage 3D settings-->Program Settings-->select shantae and the pirate's curse. scroll down and find Max Frame Rate and set it to 60. reboot game if you still have it open.

author: {'steamid': '76561198342977528', 'num_games_owned': 350, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1045, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1045, 'last_played': 1639069111}
review:
[h1]Интродуктион[/h1]
Здесь есть спойлеры, плач как от радости, так и от печали, а также восхваление пикселей.
[h1]Пиратское проклятие[/h1]
Данная игра является продолжением [b]"Мести Риски"[/b], в финале которой [spoiler]Шантайка лишается своих джинновых способностей[/spoiler], поэтому мне было очень интересно, как разработчики обыграют это в следующей части.
[h1]Особенности[/h1]
Я был очень впечатлён добавлением [b]"человеческих"[/b] приколюх, хотя правильнее будет сказать [b]"пиратских"[/b]. Разработчики предлагают закорешиться с Риски, чтобы [b]вместе[/b](угу, да) одолеть новое зло. Хотя зря я так на отчаянную пиратку, всё же, перемещение между локациями на её корабле выглядит вполне себе[spoiler](Я был очень рад компании Риски. Так же напротив тебя находится и глядит в душу разве что [b]Джорджи[/b] из Бумажек, можно конечно ещё [b]Монику[/b] из Клуба сюда приплести, но ей далеко до этого)[/spoiler]
Однако жаль, что эта [strike]фиалка в бандане[/strike] не позволила и Шантайке надеть такой головной убор. Здрасте-приплыли, это почему если [b]"Пиратское проклятие"[/b] замешано во всём, то Шантайке нельзя соответствовать атмосфере? Как по мне, так ей этот образ очень идёт. (Да, там есть свои нюансы, но это нюансы, а Риски — [b]злюка[/b])
Однако это не единственная проблема. Я был очень [b]очепялен[/b](именно так), что в этой части у нашей не-Джинни всего один вид танца, да и то с чайником в руках. Что за неуважение? Почему так решили обделить бедную [b]танцовщицу[/b]? Мало того, что силы забрали, так ещё и танцевать не дают, [strike]скоты[/strike]! Конечно, добавили новые механики, которые заменяют танцевальные превращения и всё? Я не спорю, что они хорошо справляются с функцией замены, но дайте потанцевать(((
Ещё, здесь, как и в первой части, присутствует [b]смесь[/b] графики. Тип, рисованная и пиксельная. Я не имею ничего против данных стилей по отдельности, но тут они всё же смешиваются как-то странно. [b]"Новомодные"[/b] модельки персонажей порой уж сильно выбиваются на общем фоне игры, хоть и прорисованы очень хорошо. Касательно [b]атмосферы[/b] в целом, она здесь потрясающая, музыка отличная, динамичная, очень подходит под происходящее на экране.
Отдельное спасибо многоуважаемым [b]переводчикам[/b], [strike]чортовы вы адаптаторы[/strike]... [spoiler]Меня конечно поразило удивление, "Шанте", когда находит "Рисковые сапожки.... Риски?", но ё-моё.. Оставили бы Риски Бутс, нашла бы она Бутсы Риски, всё равно можно было выкрутиться же... Ещё вот, Гнилька, Сойка. Пересмешника? Действительно, оборжаться-пересмеяться, но ладно.[/spoiler] В целом, перевод хороший, всё понятно, ясно, текст читать приятно, несмотря на [b]ентот ч'ерезмэнный рюсский[/b].
[h1]Ценок[/h1]
[b]Восхитительная[/b] игра. Проходится спокойно, за одно прохождение можно получить почти все ачивки, если постараться. Спидрунерские ачивки идут лесом, я — эстет, а не сверхразум. Однозначно рекомендую. 47 забегов с "Гнилькой" из 46.

author: {'steamid': '76561197976408337', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 347, 'playtime_forever': 639, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 639, 'last_played': 1637511896}
review:
[h1]Overall = 6/10[/h1]

A colourful and cartoony pixel art platformer with a funny sense of humour and an odd mix of art styles, but it does all look good.  The platforming is good and the challenge is a bit light initially but gets very challenging with the bosses and in the final levels.  Combat becomes a bit of a chore due to the respawning enemies, but the plentiful health items and additional skills keep it entertaining.

The simple level design and number of them makes the mandatory backtracking feel unnecessary and gets annoying as the menus are a bit clunky and the map is pretty much useless for collectible hunting.  Great soundtrack, cast of characters and the story is functional, if not remarkable.  Overall, good old fashioned platforming fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978797255', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 143, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 143, 'last_played': 1637499911}
review:
I didn't spend a lot of time with it, so I'm not gonna write a long treatise... all I'll say is that in my opinion, a Metroidvania is only as good as its map. The genre is focused on exploration and backtracking, after all, so it's vital that the map shows the doors you haven't managed to open yet, the collectibles you've seen but not managed to collect, and so on and so forth. The really good ones will show terrain-features to help you recall the lay of the land and more easily plot a reasonably safe and hassle-free journey from A to B, or let you apply stamps to the map yourself as reminders.

This game's map is made up of squares. They don't even show you where there are doors between said squares. That's strike one and two. Strike three is the 'retro' element where dying sends you all the way back to the last save-point you found, no ifs ands or buts. This can be a REALLY long way, and cost you a LOT of progress. Sure, it's not a super-hard game by any stretch of the imagination, but you don't really have a lot of health to work with at the start, and you can wind up in some seriously nasty ambushes without warning. Sooooo yeah, that's gonna be a 'nope' from me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071010322', 'num_games_owned': 445, 'num_reviews': 91, 'playtime_forever': 522, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 522, 'last_played': 1635782311}
review:
Скажу сразу, что эта игра доставила мне удовольствие, но есть одно маленькое "но": что делали тестеры, и куда смотрели разработчики во время проектирования платформенных элементов во дворце (перед "Повелителем Пиратов")?! И почему из-за этого игра резко превратилась из добротной метроидвании-платформера в какой-то шаблоноразрывательный [b][i]I wanna be a boshy[/i][/b]?!! И как надо гнуть пространство-время, чтобы уложиться в чуть ли не в наносекундный безопасный таймер для прыжков между выдвижных шипов, где прыгнешь на эту самую наносекунду раньше - убьешься об вторую пару. Позже - об первую (или наоборот, смотря как прыгать)???!! Или почти такой же прыжок, после предыдущего, где безопасный временной промежуток для прыжка между выдвижными шипами ещё меньше..?
Крайне обидно было бросать практически на самом финале, но боюсь, спустя несколько десятков неудачных попыток проскочить, у меня окончательно сдали нервы.

В общем, трижды советую взвесить все за и против перед покупкой, иначе вам придётся как и мне, проходить последний отрезок игры на ютубе :\

author: {'steamid': '76561197994925709', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 111, 'playtime_forever': 611, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 611, 'last_played': 1635639549}

This game is great.  It has good pacing in terms of acquisition of new abilities, and the artwork and characters are good.  I wish it were a bit more challenging, but overall it's a good 8-10 hours depending on how much you complete (I got all the magic but not all the squids).

I have no idea how the SJW/leftoid mobs haven't canceled this developer for how they depict women, though.  LOL

author: {'steamid': '76561198160605793', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 819, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 484, 'last_played': 1635428518}
review:
借黑暗老吴的热度宣传一下，黑暗老吴唯二好评的其中一作香缇与海盗诅咒。作为Wayforward公司的看家作品，该系列在本作发售后大概两年（存疑）系列热度突然开始变高并且顺势推出了两部续作。但可惜的是，除开重置版半精灵英雄外，最新作七塞壬的设计水平只能用悲剧形容。可能本作将会是wayforward最优秀的游戏了。
本作发售时3DS上同步进行了发售，所以人设是比较任系的，与后两作不同，有洛克人ZX的那个味道。由于主角精灵舞娘的人设所以突出一个凹凸有致，很吸睛，至今你依然能在本子网站上搜到女主角和配角的作品。
在游戏内容方面，该作是极少数学到了密特罗德高速跨图爽快跑图精髓的银河战士类而非恶魔城的游戏，地图设计简洁明了，没有故意恶心人的点，一次跑图除开少量隐藏收集基本不需要反复跑回头路，突出一个通畅。后期拿到弯刀（等同于密特罗德的凤凰之舞）之后整个游戏优秀的地图锁钥设计支持你用20秒从最左边能一口气不停地冲刺到最右边其爽快感是大部分类似游戏（包含该系列后作）所没有的。光靠语言并不能很好说明该游戏的优点。
难度方面除开丧心病狂的最后一关（中上难度，多死能过）来说是属于较为容易的，老吴也能愉快食用的游戏，本身游戏有自动回血与消耗品回血道具整个游戏挫败感不会很强烈。
可惜至今为止没有官中，突然火了（大概是迷叔直播了该游戏）之后有了汉化补丁。Steam售价68元。
想买的朋友们可以入手，最后说一句，别看只有13.4小时，实际算上盗版本人应该通关了5次，熟练工能4小时内通关。

author: {'steamid': '76561198261881798', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 370, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 370, 'last_played': 1633444658}
review:
Now this one I like

It's weird that this is my second Shantae game after playing Half Genie Ultimate Edition and it's by far the best experience.

Outside of the graphics (there's no way it can beat Half Genie's smooth anime style) everything about this game works better than its successor:

-The stages are bigger and the sense of discovery and exploration is rewarding.
-The supporting items are great. Dancing and transformations might be a staple of these games but I found the pirate items to be way better gameplay-wise and it makes back tracking actually satisfying. They might not be as iconic but they do the work.
-The dialogue and humor are excellent. Shantae is a ray of sunshine and every interaction is fun, witty, emotional or serves a purpose. The drawing of the faces and poses are very expressive and you can feel what they feel.
-There's difficulty here, and some places will even make you slow down and think about your movement, both combat-wise and platform-wise. Yes, you still become a tank in this game, but that happens very far into the game.

All in all this was a fantastic experience for me. I was about to discard Shantae altogether after the Half-Genie experience but I'm glad I give this one a try. The most recognizable feature might be the big-breasted girls but there's also some fun gameplay inside. Give it a try!

review:
给各位一个游戏帧数过快的解决方法。
我是N卡，在N卡的控制面板里，管理3d设置，程序设置，选择该游戏（可以通过运行游戏来快速查找），然后调整最大帧速率。一般来说60帧就刚好。设置完后游戏不会立刻改变帧数，需要退出重进才可以生效。

author: {'steamid': '76561198258467884', 'num_games_owned': 400, 'num_reviews': 148, 'playtime_forever': 694, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 694, 'last_played': 1632742360}
review:
Just an honestly fun metroidvania platformer. It's got a nice aesthetic and progression did not feel tedious. There's some cool secrets and exploration, while a bit light compared to similar games, is well worth doing.  The game is a blend between a nice pixelated aesthetic for the actual gameplay and digital illustrations for the dialogue, some of the illustrations are a little on the fan service side but it's mostly played for laughs, and the dialogue is pretty funny at times.

While the game is certainly not flawless, it's surprising just how good it is, I wasn't too familiar with Shantae going into it but ended up really enjoying the experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198099620752', 'num_games_owned': 384, 'num_reviews': 170, 'playtime_forever': 456, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 456, 'last_played': 1632613267}
review: It's a lot of fun with a really upbeat and catchy soundtrack. Some good humour sprinkled in as well. More difficult than I thought it would be, even rather challenging at times (like the final dungeon + boss). Backtracking for completion was a bit annoying sometimes and backtracking just to progress was also not super engaging because there weren't any short cuts that opened up for the most part. But certainly a fun time overall and a game that shines a positive light on the series overall.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015664288', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 784, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 784, 'last_played': 1626388108}
review:
Although my first Shantae game was Seven Sirens, Pirate's Curse is my favorite, which feels like the purest Shantae to me, despite Shantae having to use pirate gear in place of her magic. It obviously directly follows the events of Risky's Revenge, so you should feel encouraged to play that before this one (it feels quite similar to this one, so it's not as big of a difference as say the first Shantae to RR). 

I recommend this to anyone looking for a fun metroidvania with amusing writing, just don't expect a difficult game especially if you're coming from something like Hollow Knight.

[h2]Gameplay[/h2]
If you played Risky's Revenge, the gameplay will feel familiar but quicker, snappier; it feels good. Instead of magic, you'll be using Pirate Gear equipment, which is a bit weird considering Shantae is supposed to be magical but it works, and they feel good to use. In Risky's Revenge I felt like the boss fights dragged on too long, and I think that might be true for this game also, but not as bad. Basically make sure you keep your attack/attack speed upgraded, use items, you'll be fine. It's not the hardest game, but you can find ways of making it more challenging by not using items to heal or buff your attacks, for example. The final encounter felt a lot better designed than in RR, with multiple phases and brought about a satisfying conclusion.

As you might expect from a metroidvania, you'll have to return to earlier areas as you expand your pirate gear. Item shops sell Pirate Flares which let you get around faster which is nice.

One complaint I had was that there are some areas in the game that I found to have really obnoxious spawns for enemies, that appear right on top of you in a way that you're forced to take damage unless you know they're going to spawn there ahead of time. Often they will continue to keep spawning as you're fighting, I suppose it's designed that way so you can farm money more easily. 

[h2]Writing[/h2]
The writing is as charming and ridiculous as ever; heart-warming in parts? I especially enjoyed some events that happened on Tanline Island. Other parts of the story add a good amount of development to Shantae, her friendships, and Risky Boots, who is shown to ultimately have more depth than a simple [i]mustache-twirling villain[/i] which I always appreciate. The ending was a satisfying conclusion that of course leads into Half-Genie Hero, though be aware that there is a 'true ending' which requires you collect all of [something] before the final fight, so look that up if it interests you.

[h2]Art[/h2]
Pirate Shantae is my favorite iteration of Shantae's design, as well as the art in general. Shantae only ever wears a pirate bandana in some dialogue bits, which is kind of unfortunate as I would have expected her to look like that the whole game. The sprites seem to be the same as they were in Risky's Revenge, they look great and the animations are just as good. The character art during dialogues has been changed, and is my personal favorite style of the series.

[h2]Sound[/h2]
Jake Kaufman returns to deliver an even better soundtrack than in Risky's Revenge, and it's probably my favorite score in the series, especially this iteration of Burning Town which criminally only plays during the intro! >:(

Shantae & friends have new voice lines that play at the start of their dialogue, which is a nice addition to the series, and suits each of the characters nicely. 

[h2]Technical[/h2]
The game runs perfectly without any crashes, BUT a big issue which almost made me refund the game is the fact that the game doesn't cap the frame rate, which means that if you have a monitor that allows for over 60 FPS, the game will play at a TREMENDOUS SPEED, think of turbo mode on an emulator. To fix this, you need to put a cap on the game yourself. I use an Nvidia card, so for me that means opening up [b]Nvidia Control Panel -> Manage 3D Settings -> Program Settings tab, and put Max Frame Rate to 60.[/b] I am unfamiliar with AMD control panels, but you may be able to accomplish this with MSI RivaTuner. 

Another weird thing is that the previous game, Risky's Revenge, allowed me to set my resolution to 2560x1440, but oddly I'm only able to go as high as 1920x1080 here. Not sure it matters since it would probably be upscaled anyway? But it is [u]widescreen[/u] this time!


[h2]Positives[/h2]
+ Controls feel faster, more responsive, and more accurate than in Risky's Revenge
+ My favorite Shantae art, design, and soundtrack
+ Hilarious writing
+ New voices/voice lines for the characters
+ Widescreen!
+ Great new character art for dialogue
+ Working with Risky was fun, and the writing was pretty good for the develoment of her character
+ Further development of Rotty Tops, and her friendship with Shantae
+ Satisfying conclusion

[h2]Negatives[/h2]
- Technical problem preventing the game from running correctly if you don't cap your frame rate
- Can't customize gamepad controls
- Enemy spawns can be obnoxious

author: {'steamid': '76561198356365573', 'num_games_owned': 174, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 601, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 601, 'last_played': 1631711659}
review:
"Shantae and the Pirate's Curse" ist ein sehr gutes Jump'n'Run / Action Adventure, was mit seiner schönen Pixelgrafik, seinem Soundtrack und auch seinem Schwierigkeitsgrad begeistern kann. Die Welten, die man bereist, sind alle sehr charmant und detailliert, es gibt viel zu entdecken und sammeln (Heart Squids, Tinkerbats...) und insgesamt gibt es viel zu entdecken. Der Schwierigkeitsgrad ist knifflig, aber trotzdem immer fair ([spoiler]bis auf die Schlammpampeninsel, die ist Hardcore[/spoiler]).

Insgesamt kann ich Shantae jedem ans Herz legen, der gerne Action Adventures oder Jump'n'Runs mag. Dazu empfehle ich das Spiel auch jedem, der sich einer Herausforderung stellen möchte. Insgesamt gibt es von mir 9.5/10 Punkten !

PS : Es gibt auch noch den Piratenmodus, nochmal extra schwer ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198035100973', 'num_games_owned': 395, 'num_reviews': 766, 'playtime_forever': 452, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 151, 'last_played': 1631925874}
review:
Disclaimer: My scores/reviews are almost always based on having bought the game at close to the "lowest historical price" on steam at time of purchase.

Quick score: 4/5

Notes: The dialogue boxes and font choice are absolutely hideous. Personally not a huge fan of the inventory system, its a bit outdated by todays standards and feels rather clunky. The game is a bit lacking in direction at times in terms of where you are supposed to go or what you are supposed to do, but if you make sure to talk to everyone in town you will generally get some clues. Also not a huge fan of the map design. 

But other than all that, pretty solid game. Your base movement speed is very high, which is a huge positive and helps keep the less challenging sections still interesting. Taking a glance at the achievements for the game, the game can definitely offer a significant challenge if you go for all achievements. However, it's worth noting that the base game is probably below average in terms of difficulty.

The game art and characters are obviously appealing to coomers, which can be either a positive or negative, but the game itself is still actually decent regardless.

author: {'steamid': '76561199006446967', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1540, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1540, 'last_played': 1631557946}
review:
Luego de 26 horas de juego y de platinarlo creo ser capaz darle una reseña.
 Esta tercera entrega de Shantae te lleva a Scuttle Town. Recorrerás múltiples y variados lugares con temáticas y características identitarias. Todo esto con una jugabilidad estilo metroidvania, juntando la acción y el plataformeo con backtracking. Creo que la jugabilidad es muy buena, los controles son muy agradables, y a esto se le suma las mejoras a tu personaje, que te dan nuevas formas de encarar enemigos y nuevas opciones de movilidad por el mapa. El bactracking es interesante, te permite volver a zonas ya visitadas e intentar descubrir todos los secretos que allí se esconden.
 Tiene un sistemas de objetos que, a mí, me pareció un poco retro. Estuve llenando mis bolsillos de objetos que casi ni utilizaba, pero eso es cosa mía. Después algunas técnicas que puedes aprender son treméndamente útiles, mientras que otras la verdad es que nunca las usé. Las mejoras de las armas creo que no son muy caras y vienen bien en general. La dificultad no considero que sea un punto fuerte, ya que para el que busque una experiencia traumática en cuestión de dificultad no la va a encontrar. Yo me lo pasé sin grandes dificultades, así que es recomendable para aquellos no muy expertos de plataformers de acción.
 El diseño de cada zona considero que es muy bonito y agradable a la vista, y transmite un aire diferente a medida que progresas en la historia. Además el soundtrack que acompaña estas zonas es increíble a todos los niveles.
 Los personajes que te encuentras son muy carismáticos y alguna que otra vez me han sacado una risilla. Sus diseños y colores son agradables a la vista y fáciles de reconocer. Además la relación que tienes con Risky crea una conexión que te invita a interesarte y preocuparte por ella, y a saber más de sus vivencias.
 Es el primer juego de Shantae que juego y aún así disfrute cada segundo jugándolo. Quién pueda comprarlo o regalárselo a un amigo tiene mi recomendación, ya que totalmente vale la pena.

author: {'steamid': '76561198109270368', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 649, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 649, 'last_played': 1631278589}
review: Рекомендую заценить. Простой, но интересный сюжет, шуточки, запоминающиеся персонажи. Топовая музыка. Прикольные боссы. Я не играл в прошлые части по этому не понял некоторые отсылки, но это мелочи. Ну и визуальный стиль приятный. Из минусов могу отметить только то, что иногда приходится с самого начала по несколько раз проходить старые уровни, чтобы получить один какой-то предмет. Но это наверное из-за жанра игры. В целом отличная ненапряжная игра на несколько вечерков.

author: {'steamid': '76561198147562854', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 1560, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1646687566}
review:
El juego esta en Español tremenda sorpresa, esta mal la información de idiomas en Steam lo menciono por si alguien tiene dudas por el idioma, puede darle no mas.

 Estoy recién empezando el juego así que mas adelante volveré a por la reseña, por ahora solo diré que se ve bien, solo un detalle, el juego no da mas de 1080p por lo que si tienes una pantalla 4k ya vete haciendo a la idea.

-------------------

 Ya lo termine así que toca actualizar la reseña.. spoiler va a ser un poco larga la reseña :)

Es un juegazo totalmente recomendado, vengo de jugar los dos últimos títulos; Shantae and the seven sirens y Half-genie hero y hasta ahora de esos dos tenia a Half-gene hero como el mejor pero este titulo me hace reconsiderarlo.

 El juego es hermoso, el pixelart en momentos me recordó a Metal Slug, por supuesto no llega al nivel demencial de animación que tenían los Metal slug pero si que hay muchos momentos que te dejan pasmado con lo trabajado que están las animaciones de los Sprite.

 No planeo explicar de que va el juego pq si llegaste hasta aquí ya sabes que es un plataforma/metroidvania, solo diré que no es tan fácil como los dos títulos que nombre antes pero tampoco es un paseo, la dificultad esta super balanceada, se lo podría recomendar a casi cualquier persona, si no te gustan los metroidvania debes saber que aquí hay backtraking pero no es tanto o por lo menos ni de cerca de lo que podría ser un Hollow knight.

 La historia esta buena, es entretenida aunque aquí no hay mucha participación de los amigos de la protagonista, mas se centran en profundizarla a ella y a su enemiga, no es una historia difícil ni menos ultra rebuscada pero cumple totalmente.

 El diseño de niveles es genial, todo se siente muy bien elaborado lo que si le reclamaría es que hubieran estirado un poco mas el final pq justo en la ultima etapa el juego intenta explotar los dos últimos poderes que obtienes y resulta en un muy buen reto pero a la vez dura muy poco, te deja con ganas de mas, da la sensación de que tenían mas cosas planeadas pero al final tuvieron que recortar.

 En lo sonoro esta bien, quizás este sea su punto mas débil, los temas me gustaron pero no al nivel de Half genie hero, las músicas cumplen y hay una que otra pegadiza pero no seria un soundtrack que volvería a escuchar en mis tiempos libres.

 Otros puntos débiles seria que al igual que en otros Shantae hay poderes que no sientes la necesidad de ocuparlos, tampoco el juego te incentiva hacerlo, por ejemplo hay un ataque tipo patada que puedes comprar que al final solo es un malgasto de dinero pq mete mucho daño pero tarda un siglo en ejecutarse, no es un buen poder y no se adapta bien a ninguna situación. También hay 2 momentos del juego que pueden ser un poco frustrantes, no diré que son pero mi recomendación no desesperes al final no son tan difíciles es solo memorizar.
 
 En cuanto cual es mejor Half genie Hero o Pirate's Curse, la verdad no puedo terminar de decidirme xD ambos tienen sus pro y contras, que la gente se mate buscando el mejor a mi me gustaron ambos por igual jajaj eso si Half genie hero lo recomendaría mas para gente nueva en la saga o incluso en el genero, me parece un titulo perfecto para iniciarse.

 Mi conclusión un juego muy pero muy bueno, entretenido de principio a fin, recomendado para casi todo tipo de personas, digo casi pq depende como manejes la frustración pero yo diría que esta entre lo normal el nivel de frustración.

Le doy 9/10 un juego de esos que son obligación si te gusta el genero.

author: {'steamid': '76561198420809356', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 144, 'playtime_forever': 450, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 137, 'last_played': 1631625984}
review:
아이코노클라스트와 비슷한 도트형 메트로베니아 플랫포머.

일러스트 때문에 게임에 집중이 안 된다.

레벨 디자인이 적절하게 잘 되어 있습니다.

그러나 보스전을 제외하고는 NPC 세이브 기능만을 지원해서, 많이 진행하다 죽으면 모든 진행내역이 날아가 허무함이 좀 크네요.

맵을 탐방하는 재미도 있습니다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023821735', 'num_games_owned': 791, 'num_reviews': 90, 'playtime_forever': 656, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 656, 'last_played': 1631079445}
review:
I'm gonna keep it real with you chief, we know why we're here.
Shantae is wife material, and so are the rest of the girls sprinkled throughout the game.
The character and sprite art for them all is fantastic, and they actually have personalities now, unlike the Risky's Revenge which was a bit dry in that regard.

The game is pretty good too, I had a lot of fun for the first like 90% of it.
The final dungeon however is one of the most sadistic, frustrating, unfun experiences I've ever had in my 20+ years of gaming. It felt more like an extreme challenge mode that should have been optional, but it was entirely necessary to reach the ending of the game.
It really brought down the whole experience.
But, if you love pain and frustration like I know a lot of people do, you'll love that final stretch.
Casuals beware, you may end up having to look at the ending on YouTube.

author: {'steamid': '76561198214072404', 'num_games_owned': 712, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 308, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1648046527}
review: 속도가 지나치게 빨라서 원래 이렇게 어려운 게임인가? 아무리 생각해도 그건 아닌 것 같아서 다른사람들 플레이 영상을 봤다. 역시나 다른 사람들 영상에서는 적당한 속도로 진행된다. 알고보니 화면 주사율 144Hz를 사용할 경우 엄청나게 빨라진다고 하더라 60Hz에서는 정상적으로 동작하는 모양인데 노트북에서 60Hz로 선택할 수가 없다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198248091288', 'num_games_owned': 166, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 218, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 117, 'last_played': 1630603490}
review:
FANTASTIC game. I played it on 3DS, along with Shovel Knight and basically nothing else, and I consider just those two games worth buying a 3DS to play. Of course now I have a computer so it's kinda useless, but at the time I was in middle school and a 3DS was the only accessible way for me.

Anyways, this is the only truly great shantae game. Half-genie hero wasn't that good, 7 sirens was a little better but still unsatisfying, and after finishing 7 sirens I just came back over to the steam page for pirate's curse, to jog my memory of if it was actually as good as I remember. And yeah, immediately, it's clear. The trailer alone reminded me. SO MANY interesting powerups, individual levels that actually feel complete (while still retaining a metroidvania structure over the course of the game) as opposed to the big, sprawling map in 7 sirens... it's just so much better. Puzzles that are actually difficult, bosses that aren't just damage sponges, more and better interaction with risky boots, more interesting characters overall, GOD I need to play pirate's curse again

Worth mentioning: if you have a high refresh rate monitor, the game is locked to 60 fps, so on a 120hz display it will run at double speed. You can limit the framerate of an individual program in NVIDIA Control Panel, so do that for "ShantaeCurse.exe" and the game should run normally. This is one thing that the newer shantae games *are* a little better at - actually being functional when you start them. But that's about the only place where pirate's curse falls behind.

Oh also, squid baron is simultaneously worse and better in 7 sirens, he makes better jokes but he also kinda sucks. They do this weird gender shit I don't like, which like yes I understand this is a shantae game and the attractiveness of the female characters is at least a tertiary draw of the game. The part that bothers me is when [spoiler]shantae and sky get LITERALLY objectified, turned into blister-packaged figurines to be bought and sold by squid baron and the armor baron. Their value in this scene is purely, canonically aesthetic, and it's barely framed as a bad thing at all, more of like a "oh look at squid baron doing his weird shit again, classic squid baron" moment.[/spoiler] It made me feel pretty weird and bad, idk why wayforward thought they had to do that. I can't actually remember specifically what squid baron is like in pirate's curse but I know he's a whole lot more innocent and likable, which I consider a win.

Sorry for the squid baron tangent. Maybe I should put it in a 7 sirens review instead. Bottom line is, pirate curse good, play it if you generally like puzzle-platformers and metroidvanias

author: {'steamid': '76561197994590173', 'num_games_owned': 941, 'num_reviews': 229, 'playtime_forever': 796, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 796, 'last_played': 1628810063}
review:
It's alright, but just not that good overall. The platformer/castlevania genre had moved a lot in the recent years and by modern standards, this feels very, very dated. The combat is generally rather boring. Exploration is dull. It's mostly a linear path through lazily designed mobs. Some collectables are locked behind in areas you can't access without a new skill or item and backtracking really doesn't feel satisfying in this game. On one side this feels like an entry game for young audience, but on the other end the game can become a real jerk just to mess with you.

It's not terrible, but I think it's worth giving this one a pass.

author: {'steamid': '76561198271431143', 'num_games_owned': 600, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 503, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 503, 'last_played': 1628313879}
review:
Going into this game right after Risky's Revenge I was excited.  Risky's Revenge was great but I had a few issues with it, but most of them could be drawn to that it's a port of a DSi game.  But with this game, pretty much all of my complaints are gone.  Before I got to this game I knew it was gonna be the best one since it had the highest review score on Steam.  They're right.  This is my favorite Shantae game so far.

The cutscenes are really good with the new art, they kept the pixel art but it looks so good now since they can design it without worrying about handheld limitations, the metroidvania is better than ever and it's not super difficult to find out what you're supposed to do next.  They just fixed so many issues from the last game that just elevates this game to the top.  All of the moves you learn on the way are really fun to use.  The problem with most of the other Shantae games is that you learn genie transformations but most if not all of them are just used for certain parts in a level you need them for.  With pirate's curse you use your entire arsenal to traverse the level and you don't have to wait a few seconds to transform into what you need you just press the button and it happens.

My only real complaints is that like most Shantae games it feels really short, some of the things you're expected to know to do next is a tad obscure, and the game is overall way too easy.  Other than those 3 things this game is solid.  Definitely my favorite Shantae game (Haven't played Seven Sirens).  An easy 9/10.

TL;DR Very good with a few small issues but overall a huge improvement on the series. 9/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986552867', 'num_games_owned': 3554, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 7, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1622857048}
review:
Once upon a time game speed was tied to processor speed of the system - back then hardware was a lot slower and there wasn't much issue with that, it was easier to write without worrying about the game. Space Invaders famously had this as a perk of the game - the aliens got faster as you destroyed them because there were less left for the processor to manage, so each got a bigger chunk of that time.

This game however has that as a problem, the game is pretty much unplayable on a modern decent PC because the game hasn't been adjusted to limit the play speed, I find it runs far too fast to be really played.

author: {'steamid': '76561198864659823', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 853, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 853, 'last_played': 1628012727}

author: {'steamid': '76561198069638742', 'num_games_owned': 110, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 686, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 122, 'last_played': 1703570543}
review:
The pixel art in this game is truly inspiring, which is what initially drew me in to buy it. You can tell so much work went into the presentation. On top of that the soundtrack is amazing. As for gameplay, it's not your typical Level 1, Level 1-2, etc deal. I would say it's closer to a metroidvania in a sense, because you have multiple paths to take, and some paths require specific elements you need to retrieve before passing. It's basically one world broken up into different islands that you visit using the ship.
You use your hair whip as an attack, and can duck to whip smaller creatures/items. I found with flying enemies they can be really annoying because it's difficult to line up the whip correctly while you jump. Usually I find it easier to just wait for them to float down to my level, but sometimes there's so much going on, or you have little space, which just makes it infuriating. It made me wish I had Hollow Knight's ability to attack up and down...
Other than that, two hours in and I'm quite enjoying it. Far too many cutscenes in my opinion, but if you get a kick out of strong story-driven platformers then you'll most likely find enjoyment here.

author: {'steamid': '76561198368075321', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 669, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 669, 'last_played': 1627115419}
review:
[h1] Digital Antidepressant [/h1] 

This is an overwhelmingly cheerful and funny metroidvania that doesn't outstay its welcome and offers just the right amount of challenge.
Following on from Risky's Revenge, you play as underdressed former half-genie Shantae who has to team up with her former rival to defeat an evil reborn.
The story is flimsy, but the actual moment to moment writing is actually really funny. The whole game has the atmosphere of an amusingly horny Saturday morning cartoon. The characters are all distinct, well-designed, funny and memorable and every cutscene has some kind of joke as a reward for making progress.

The gameplay itself is solid and enjoyable. You run, jump and puzzle across the world picking up powerups and collectables. The game isn't overly long (it took me around 10 hours to 100% it), but that just means there's no filler. It's never overly frustrating, but it can still have some pretty tough sections. 

Overall, it's a fun, simple barebones platformer, elevated by its lovable characters, good writing, bright, joyful visuals and dance-worthy soundtrack. It's a real winner.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040005010', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 491, 'playtime_forever': 1655, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1356, 'last_played': 1632155378}
review:
Uno de los pocos Metroidvania que lograron engancharme.
 +Tiene jugabilidad sencilla, los controles responden bien y los hitboxes perfectos. 
 +El Pixel art esta muy bien pulido. Realmente Hermoso
 +Tiene mucha retrojugabilidad: Siempre veras en los mapas, rutas alternativas que tarde podras acceder, cuando consiguas los nuevos poderes para ello.
 +Todas las Mujeres, desde Shantae, Sky, hasta las raras, como Rottytops (que es un zombie) estan muy ricas. Buen material de fan service. Especialmente la escena donde entras al templo, y todas son confundidas con princesas. Obligandolas a usar un conjunto bien apretado.
 Pero aqui tengo mis quejas:
 -Es confuso orientarse: Muchas veces, no se deja en claro, donde hay que ir. Muchas rutas son muy secretas y al igual que con un juego clasico. Tienes que dispararle a muros, para ver si activas un secreto, o una ruta.
 Ni hablar, que varias veces tienes que volver al principio, reutilizar rutas y usar tus nuevos poderes, como el cañon y las botas, para acceder a lugares claves.

 8/10 Uno de los pocos Metroidvania que mas adoro.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016125421', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 5549, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2908, 'last_played': 1706740561}

Любителям платформеров а-ля ретро рекомендую.

author: {'steamid': '76561198122559541', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 727, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 287, 'last_played': 1626888802}
review:
Un jeu meilleur que les autres de la série, mais frustrant et flemmard

Les durées d'invincibilités sont trop courtes, le chemin à suivre n'est pas toujours indiqué alors faut s'amuser a refaire les niveaux de fond en comble pour trouver la soluce, les animations des persos est toujours outrageusement sexy à la limite du sexisme (si elle est pas déjà franchie, franchement le costume de Leia sur tous les protagonistes féminins, vous étiez obligés?) et surtout, les ennemis repop en boucle dès le moment où tu change de map complète (et parfois juste de tableau, comme si y'en avait déjà pas assez partout).
Je ne comprends pas pourquoi les gens voulaient Shantae pour Smash. Pirate's Curse est clairement bien meilleur que Half Genie-Hero (qui est horrible de flemmardise on aurait dit un jeu indé), mais il a encore ces détails très frustrants qui font que le plaisir de jeu s'écorche régulièrement.

Dommage. C'est un bon jeu sinon.

Ah oui, et c'est traduit par dessus la jambe aussi. Un grand classique de Capcom.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006087102', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 1152, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 259, 'last_played': 1628077861}

author: {'steamid': '76561198122389612', 'num_games_owned': 381, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 2903, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2903, 'last_played': 1626549350}
review:
Shantae and the Pirate's Curse

Сюжет:
С утрица, надавав люлей милитаристической свинье, Шанти встречает старую “подружку” Риски, обладательницу красивых “сапог”, вместе они отправляются на поиски пиратских артефактов, которые помешают воскрешению великого ЗЛА.

Можно сказать что есть два варианта финала, все зависит от стараний игрока.

Геймплей:
После сюжетных поворотов предыдущей части игры у Шанти отсутствует магия, мы не может превращаться в существ, не можем метать огонь и молнии, полоска манны также покинула чат, порталы больше не наша тема. НО!!! теперь мы можем пользоваться различными пиратскими девайсами:
1)пистолет=дистанционный огонь;
2)скимитар= атака сверху;
3)сапоги=пинок; 
4)шляпа=можно парить(не вэйп); 
5)пушка=прыжки 3х;
6)скимитар+сапоги+пушка+шляпа=пролетаем локации за секунду.
 Порталы нам нафиг не нужны так как из города(хаб) нас любезно довезет Риски на своей лодочке к любому из островов. Некоторые защитные/атакующие заклинания теперь и не заклинания вовсе, а расходники приобретаемые у торговца, теперь они не кушают манну, а просто действуют ограниченное время. Апгрейд девайсов осуществляется трейдером, 
колличество ХП увеличивается местной кузнечихой, кузнецихой..хм женщиной с молотом, она сплющивает принесенных ей осминожков в количестве 4х штук в одно сердце.

Графика:
Все тот же 2D, 16-bit, пиксели стали более гладенькие, во время диалогов наблюдаем великолепно нарисованных, запоминающихся героев. Мммм арты чудесные арты...

Звук:
У каждого биома свой трек, во время диалогов трек может меняться что-бы выделить эмоцию того или иного персонажа.

Встреченных багов=1
В локации с парящим островом, при проникновении в данж игра крашнулась дважды, пока комп не перезагрузил ничего не помогло, не знаю где неисправность в компе или игре.

Для тех кто убивается по достижениям в играх стима: 
1)при прохождении обычной игры: убиваем боссов без урона,  собираем всех осминожков но не апгрейдим ХП 
2)игра+: собираем кальмаров и апгрейдим ХП, собираем всю темную магию, бьем боссов без урона, проходим игру меньше чем за 2 часа. 

ВСЕ ради ДОСТИЖЕНИЙ: Шел на достижение speed runner прошел игру за 1.30, но при этом не собрал сердца и темную магию, сердца и магия нужны для достижения в условиях которого пройти игру меньше чем за 3 часа, поэтому я реабилитировался и завалив финального босса для speed runner, загрузил финальный сейв и отправился за магией и сердцами, по итогу в очередной раз завалив финального босса получил все желаемые достижения и уложился в 2.52.

От меня: считаю что это лучшая из 4х частей (в 7 сирен не играл), проходил с большим удовольствием, а получив игру+ с еще большим удовольствием. 

P.S Завалил финального босса (no damage) раза с третьего, а самый сложный босс для меня оказался Даргон...Дагрон...Дангор... кхм в общем дракон, вальнул раза с 15го, вроде бы понятный мувсет, но местами начинает троить и выдавать неадекватную хрень.

author: {'steamid': '76561198218640757', 'num_games_owned': 1679, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 896, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 896, 'last_played': 1581822707}
review:
[h1]Disclaimer: I beat this game on 3DS, so my playtime does not reflect accurately.[/h1]

Holy moly. This game has no right being as good as it is. The level design, the movement mechanics, the MUSIC. It’s all impeccable. And well worth the sale price.

 [h1]Pros[/h1]

+The level layout is carefully designed, making backtracking much less annoying.
+The music is [i]i m p e c c a b l e .[/i] Every single track is a banger.
+All the sprites are lively, and all of the character art is cute as heck.
+Having Shantae not use magic this time means her moveset is the most creative it’s ever been. Chaining combos with the Sword dash and cannonball jump is just… Satisfying.
+ Story is dumb, but very fun. Easy to enjoy!


 [h1]Cons[/h1]

-Knowing where to go next can be a tad confusing at points, but the game does it’s best to hint where you need to go.
-Getting the “Zombie Survival Guide” achievement makes me want to pull my hair out. The main segment is trial and error as it is.
-Making the ending be a downer (unless you collect all of the Tinkerbats) is a bit of a weird move. Sure, it makes the true ending much more satisfying, but risks alienating casual players.

 [h1]Overall[/h1]

This game is probably the best one in the series. It’s the complete package. Why have you still not purchased it yet??

author: {'steamid': '76561198028209763', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 112, 'playtime_forever': 2014, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1062, 'last_played': 1656696355}
review:
[h1]Sweet[/h1]

[b]Pirate's Curse[/b] was what got me interested in Metroid, and I would go on to really get into that franchise and other 'vanias. It also made me invested in trying out the other Shantae games. That alone says a lot about the game, making you interested in similar ones. 

Pirate's Curse plays well, is silly, fun, sounds great, has great pixel art, decent level design... The only major flaw I can think of is the difficulty. The game really is just [b]too[/b] easy. I can't think of many instances where I had any sort of problem. There are achievements for speedrunning and completing the game with XYZ criteria, but that's really more of a sidething. Not a main focus. 

I suppose you could consider the exploration factor the bread and butter (and it is), but I still feel like PC in particular lacks some good extra seasoning tobe considered an 'amazing game' or a  'masterpiece'. It's still a great, strong title though, and I had lots of fun with it simply because the gameplay [b]works[/b]. And that's the most important thing, since it's a quality more often than not hard to come by.

Shantae's recent games haven't exactly topped this one, and at this point I wonder if WayForward will ever have the balls and wits to do it. It's easily the best entry in the series too, so you might as well get into it here.

Recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073870341', 'num_games_owned': 417, 'num_reviews': 199, 'playtime_forever': 1260, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1260, 'last_played': 1626309480}
review:
Shatae and the Pirate's Curse is an adorable metroidvania divided in multiple islands each with a unique dungeon. The story is very cartoonish with random funny characters and cartoon logic with some fourth walls breaks. Not a bad story but is not something you will put your mind to it, the entire purpose to the game is its fantastic gameplay. Plataformers mixed with metroidvania need good control to be considered a good game, and this game sure has it. The air control is excellent, all the movement and attacks are precise and very responsive. The dungeons you explore are fairly short sadly, without much need to backtrack or re-explore a place when you get a new item that opens new movements, making it quite a straight forward plataformer. The combat is very simple but good for what it wishes to be. You get some upgrades for Shantae's weapons and more health scattered around the world, there are even a couple of maneuvers, but they are not remotely significant for the game. Similar to many plataformers and metroidvanias out there, here you need to explore to find some great, and even unfair, secrets around the islands in order to get the correct ending, with a much more interesting fight.
But what truly makes Pirate's Curse special in the Shantae' series is the art. The pixel animations are incredible. Every character movement and idle stance is so pretty and detailed, truly a marvelous effort for this kind of animation. Adding to that, the character images, in this game, for some reason, have a much better art direction than any other Shantae game, with plenty of depth, shading, and color contrast. The art plus the gameplay make Pirate's Curse to be considered the peak Shantae game.
If you like light plataformers with nice art, jokish dialog, and a sprinkle of cute girls in skimpy outfits, this is a good one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198117845364', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 104, 'playtime_forever': 2167, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2167, 'last_played': 1626155903}
review:
Hola a todos ! Vengo a dar mi opinión sobre este juego.
La saga Shantae me encanta, este no se queda atrás. Este juego es una secuela del "Shantae: Risky´s Revenge".
La banda sonora esta muy buena, la jugabilidad esta bien y los personajes también. Diría que en cuanto a historia esta muy bien, me ha gustado que cuenten mas sobre la historia de Risky (la villana del juego).
Me he pasado el juego como 5 o 6 veces para conseguir todos los logros, con respecto a los logros de speedrun el logro de pasarte el juego 100% y rápido de limite son 3 horas, y pasarte el juego rápido sin nada su limite es 2 horas.
Hay gente que se paso esos 2 logros al mismo tiempo, es super estresante hacer esos 2 juntos, son unos enfermos XD.

Yo he visto gente diciendo que el mejor Shantae era este, no entiendo porque pero creo que maso menos se porque lo dicen, según lo que jugué diría que en lo que destaca este juego es que no hay que bucear, es puro salto y sin transformación. Otra cosa que puedo decir es que este juego es muy bueno para speedrunear, una vez que conseguís las botas, el sombrero y el cañón te recorres todos los mapas super rápido. Debo decir que hay una parte del juego que se nota forzado el fanservice aunque igual lo disfrute XD.
Me parece que por todo lo anterior dicho debe ser que la gente lo considera el mejor.
En mi opinión me gusta mas el "Shantae Half Genie Hero: Ultimate Edition" por los dlc que alargan el juego todavía mas.

Yo les recomiendo este juego ! Les va a gustar ! 
Saludos !

review:
By far my favorite Shantae game.
Playing with Risky's equipment just works so much better than the transfomrations, I almost feel ashamed to admit.
If you didn't like the other Shantae games, still give this one a try. If you're not big on side-scrollers (but like scantly clad women) I'd still give this one a try.

I'm not sure I'd say this is "one of the best platformers ever", that might be too hyperbolic, but let's just say it's the best of its kind.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012675646', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 11621, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8291, 'last_played': 1621985408}
review:
Please ignore my bizarrely high hours on record, I didn't actually play 138 hrs.

This was my intro to the Shantae series, and I'm sold. Solid platforming gameplay, an array of interesting mechanics, and a cast of colourful and fun characters, not to mention beautifully done artwork on the sprites and backgrounds. Definitely has replayability in trying to 100% the game, speed running, "no-damage" or limited item/health playthroughs.

If I had one complaint, personally, sometimes the game feels a little *too* easy, the game can be very forgiving with plentiful health drops, regular save points, and obstacles/enemies don't rely on split second reaction time to avoid - it's very hard to actually die outside of boss battles. Alternatively, this is an upside, it keeps the "frustration level" low and the enjoyment high.
