author: {'steamid': '76561197972376510', 'num_games_owned': 349, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 650, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 650, 'last_played': 1585546888}
review:
Lighter fare as far as Metroidvanias are concerned - it has neither the scale and depth of Hollow Knight nor the polish of Ori, but I chuckled quite a few times throughout.  A worthwhile journey if you get a kick out of self-aware absurd humor.

One minor annoyance, if you have a nice monitor with a refresh rate above 60Hz, you will need to lower it to that or the game will run too fast.  Easiest way to adjust is to right-click your desktop and select either the NVIDIA Control Panel (if you use GeForce) or Display Settings option for Windows and change it from there.  Ignore any comments saying you need to install an overclocking tool or some other thing - you already have everything you need to adjust the refresh rate.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995487567', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 235, 'playtime_forever': 408, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 408, 'last_played': 1585159587}
review:
Shantae and the Pirate's Curse is a pretty good one of those action platformers in the vein of Castlevania and Metroid. Only a bit more linear. Based on this, you probably know if you are going to like it or not. 4/5

Pros:
 + Amazing pixel art and animation. Everything is so, uh, bouncy and vibrant.
 + Soundtrack so good that it is like playing an old Sega game at times.
 + Real good controls and fun exploration.
 + Actually funny dialogue and comic situations.
Cons:
 - Some sections lean more on the frustrating side than well-designed. I mean, the stealth section sucks as bad as you can imagine. They are however, thankfully short. 
 - The fact that you have to hop back and forth between the islands and that there is no real quick travel makes the game somewhat unnecessarily padded.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000642224', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 221, 'playtime_forever': 456, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 456, 'last_played': 1545421896}
review:
The best Shantae game in the series, in my opinion. It doesn't feel as old as Shantae GB or Risky's Revenge, doesn't bog down the player's movements with transformations, feels satisfying to upgrade the character, and plays like a dream! It (mostly) understands not to waste the player's time, it's clearly designed for speedrunning, the music is top tier, etc. I could go on, but really I just want you to play it.

9/10 Good-ass platformer and definitely the go-to for getting people into Shantae.

review:
I recently finished Shantae and the Pirate's Curse and enjoyed playing through it. The level design is fun and challenging, but the spot on controls and Shantae's abilities (which you can unlock) will help you through it. The music and sound design are awesome as well.

If you want a metroidvania style game and you want it to be on the shorter side, this is a must buy! If you can't handle massive anime cleavage, stay away.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993023804', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 524, 'playtime_forever': 270, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 270, 'last_played': 1583019839}
review:
In my ongoing and likely futile effort to write a Steam review for every game in my library (#234 out of 558)... it's time for Shantae and the Pirate's Curse.

It's kind of mind-boggling how long it took the platforming genre to hit upon the idea of, "what if Mario, but sexy?" And then Shantae happened, and yet for some reason decades later there are still more people on this planet who know Sonic the Hedgehog than Shantae the half-djinn. Shameful, that.

So what is Shantae? A scantily-clad anime girl with a surprisingly sexy sprite, and beyond the fanservice, an even more surprisingly solid action platforming game. Admittedly the platforming aspect isn't terribly strong--the focus here is much more on combat. Shantae fights primarily by whipping her long ponytail at foes. Who doesn't love that? Combat is generally engaging, offering plenty of challenge if you're trying to play well, while still being forgiving if you can't (lots of health pickups and rank-and-file enemies tend not to do much damage).

Of particular note is the phenomenally catchy soundtrack (once you hear it, you will never forgive it) and narrative. Yeah, this game has a story--and it's not half-bad, either!

It'd be easy to dismiss Shantae as a fanservice game, and admittedly that is a big element of the series, but at the same time the core gameplay is very solid and tends to offer things other platformers don't, with much higher production value and presentation than is typical for the genre, and manages to be extremely charming all at the same time. Very highly recommended.

Note: also played on Nintendo 3DS.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026325298', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 125, 'playtime_forever': 1105, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1105, 'last_played': 1497057234}
review:
[h1]Shantae and the Pirate's Curse - review[/h1]
[b]Score: 9/10[/b]
[u]Good[/u]
[list]
[*]One of the best metroidvania style games in terms of upgrades and pacing
[*]Bright colored and unique almost Nintendo like vibe which is nice to see on PC
[*]Controls are responsive so most death will be on you and not the controls
[*]Boss fights are enjoyable and playful
[*]Dialogues are funny and playful matching the feel of the game
[/list]
[u]Bad[/u]
[list]
[*]End of game difficulty spike in platforming
[*]Graphics are retro styled which some may enjoy more then others
[*]Back tracking will happen
[/list]

author: {'steamid': '76561198799705658', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2223, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2223, 'last_played': 1581978780}
review:
A fun game.  The visuals are nice and well done in their pixelated style, with gorgeous illustrations for when characters are talking.  The difficulty scales well throughout the game, allowing you to purchase more abilities as you progress.  Grinding up currency early on can make some of the areas easier for you on a first time play-through, but the game isn't the punishing so I wouldn't worry about that.

The controls and game-play is smooth, making achievement hunting throughout the game a pleasant enough experience.  This is also helped with the addition of "Pirate Mode" for a second play-through, giving you access to all the abilities at the start (you will still need to upgrade them yourself though).

Overall a fun game, worth playing if you enjoy 2D platformers with some metroidvania elements.

author: {'steamid': '76561198406158504', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 1443, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1443, 'last_played': 1562083002}
review:
На мой взгляд Shantae and the Pirate's Curse это лучшая часть серии. 

Я играл в каждую Shantae, и среди них эта особо отличается своей динамикой. Мне кажется, что замена стандартных для серии танцев трансформации на пиратские примочки позитивно сказалась на игровом процессе, особенно на пригодности игры для спидранов. Эта часть серии ближе всех подошла к основам метроидвании. В игру даже добавили специальный режим для спидранов со всеми открытыми способностями. И подземелья построены таким образом, что наличие определенных способностей могут значительно сократить необходимое для прохождения время. 

Занимательный сюжет с забавными ситуациями и огромным количеством пасхалок, как всегда прекрасная музыка, интересная механика некоторых боссов, потрясающий визуал - я не знаю как можно не любить эту игру (особенно для поклонников жанра метроидваний)..

author: {'steamid': '76561198086359905', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1180, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1028, 'last_played': 1582621737}

author: {'steamid': '76561198308050755', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1168, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1132, 'last_played': 1581552724}
review:
Shantae and the Pirate's Curse is an enjoyable fast paced platforming game. The game follows a pretty simple formula of going through dungeons to obtain a piece of pirate equipment to get through the rest of the stage. 

Some of the Pirate's equipment like the hat, boots, and cannon are a blast to use but the equipment of the gun and scimitar felt underutilized in combat. 

Then they are used against the boss. The boss battles are fun but don't have much else to them. 

There are fun collectibles as well. The player can go through each of the different islands to track down Cacklebats to get the true ending. I think the game does a good enough job to encourage the player to hunt them down and makes it a fun side quest instead of a taxing endeavor. 

The only criticism I have for this game is that I think it isn't hard enough. Instead of unlocking a game mode to use all the pirate equipment from the beginning I think it needed a hard mode instead. 

It doesn't give me much of an incentive to continue playing after I've already beaten the game. 

Shantae and the Pirate's Curse is a fun game. I'd recommend holding out for it on a Steam sale though.

author: {'steamid': '76561198087725353', 'num_games_owned': 1034, 'num_reviews': 332, 'playtime_forever': 540, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 540, 'last_played': 1579793024}
review:
Начнем с того,что в эту игру придется играть в разрешении 1600x900 в оконном режиме,тк больше игра не поддерживает.Если нажмете фулскрин и 1920х1080 или больше,то игра начнет работать на х3 скорости .Решение этой проблемы я так и не нашел на форумах,хотя она у многих.

Игра полная фигня в своем жанре.Я не понимаю откуда столько положительных отзывов на этот мусор.Геймплей отвратный,платформинг очень слабый,боевка не меняется всю игру. Где-то часу на 4ом игры вы упретесь в закрытую дверь,которую чтобы открыть надо бектречить в начальные локи и говорить с нпсом/находить айтем чтобы открыть. Хинтов где что находить и с кем говорить игра не даст.И так будет несколько раз за игру( вроде три но это не точно).
Без гайда с ютуба мало кто сам найдет что делать не потратив 2 часа на бегание по старым локам долбясь в каждый угол карты.

3/10 игра,не верьте положительным обзорам в стиме,игра очень слабая(я повелся и жалею)

Но да в игре есть сиськи. Уиии как круто сиськи.
По секрету скажу что на рул34 есть уже 3400+ картинок по этой игре ( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°)

author: {'steamid': '76561198202048054', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 642, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 642, 'last_played': 1578244162}
review:
- Feels like old-school platformer, like Castlevania or Mario.
- Sub-plots and dialogues are funny, sometimes totally hilarious.
- Characters are simple, yet memorable and pleasing to interact with. Some of them are very.... visually appealing.
- Animations, though pixelated, look great.
- The game is sorta... sexualised. It's not explicit, but continuous hints make you wonder who has a dirty mind - either you, or developers. Not complaining, just not sure if you want your children to play it.
- Gameplay is decent, some abilities are hilarious, but fun to use.
- The only problem i have is that you are often forced to revisit old locations with new powers to collect missed secrets, or simply to travel through them. These secrets are sometimes hidden not-exactly-intuitively, so collecting stuff can be frustrating. Searching for guides may be useful.
- But still, my personal feeling is that it is an awesome game, and you should try it, if you're into platformers.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015129162', 'num_games_owned': 1189, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1631, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1631, 'last_played': 1578953795}
review:
Gameplay

The game's a well-crafted Metroidvania platformer with several islands to visit, each one needing to be explored with puzzles and quests to handle before you open up a dungeon. You'll plunge into the depths of these dens of despair, whipping baddies with your hair, and walk out after trumping a boss with the item you need to unlock the next island. It's a formula that works, and the difficulty scales pretty well, starting simple and getting rougher without ever getting too obscene. Except the final part. The final section will push you to your absolute limit with extremely precise platforming and challenges - it's rough, but that isn't necessarily a bad thing, and if you don't like it it doesn't last too long before you're at the finale.

Combat is simple, yet fun. Taking down foes is often just a matter of running up and hairlashing them like mad, mashing the button until they succumb. It's satisfying, and your foes will often have tricks up their sleeves to keep you on your toes, such as making you hit them in a certain order or blocking/dodging attacks. There'll be pesky nuisances you can take out in a single blow and beefy brawlers that take quite a bit to whittle down, and you'll be able to find or buy loads of consumables to empower, transport, heal, or power you up in a variety of different ways.

As you go along, you're gonna pick up a variety of equipment, each one important in its own way. Some will open new paths, some will help you get around, and some can even be used in combat (though how useful they are is typically lacking, mostly for a little extra chip damage or picking off weak enemies from a distance). They remain useful all throughout the adventure, although a couple of them get outclassed by a REALLY good item near the end of the game. Even then, it's not a big deal, 'cause that item's a loooot of fun. You'll also be able to upgrade your hair for damage and speed, upgrade a few of your items, and learn a few techniques (although only one was really useful). There's a ton of equipment variety, and you're gonna get a lotta mileage outta most of it.

The collectibles are, for the most part, fun to hunt down. Most of them are either in obvious spots, require a bit of thought to reach, or reward you for remembering things you can't access and coming back with the proper equipment in the future. There are a few that'll have you scratching your head until you give up and check a guide, though, such as a few you'll only find by ramming completely non-important walls.

For the achievement hunters out there, get ready for a workout. If you want 100%, be prepared to play at least three times, once to enjoy the game normally and get all the general achievements, once to beat it 100% in under three hours, and once to beat it period in under two hours. You heard me right, you're gonna have to play the entire game over again super fast if you wanna achieve everything. I'm not usually a fan of timed achievements... but the game's so good, I genuinely didn't mind going again. There's a few more harder achievements: one for beating each individual boss without taking damage (you can typically save before each boss and do-over if you mess up so it's not too bad), and a lengthy minigame you're gonna have to play absolutely perfect. If you think you're up to the challenge, you'd better be ret-2-go.

Length

A full 100% run took me about 6 1/2 hours. Since I'm a masochist... read, achievement hunter... it took me two more runs and about 5-6 more hours to get absolutely everything. It fits snugly into a 'not too big, not too small' size that works well whether you play through it all at once or just jump in to complete an island or two.

Sound

Absolutely fantastic. The Shantae series has always excelled in its music, producing tunes that make the bosses bop and make your adventure feel epic. Of particular note, I loved the icy yet industrial tune of the frost island's dungeon, and the final boss theme is one of my favorite tunes of all time.

Graphics

The art style is an intentional blend of sweet and sensual, featuring a cutesy cartoon style as well as LOTS of fanservice. The game's mainly composed of well-made sprites that move and act realistically while bringing the world to life. Dialogue has 2D character portraits with a variety of poses that always fit the situation, sometimes adding a bit of humor themselves. Whether you enjoy the older pixelated games or the newer style of art, there's something for both.

Story

I'll get the one downside out of the way - if you haven't played the previous game (Risky's Revenge), you're gonna be a bit lost. I don't think you'll be completely hopeless, but there'll be some character interactions and plot points you'll have no clue about. I did play it, thankfully, but there was still a few moments I'd think 'if I hadn't played it, I'd have NO idea what they're talking about'.

With that out of the way - the story's fantastic. Silly, witty, deep, with a great incorporation of the previous game's story like I just mentioned. Genuinely funny jokes, heartfelt moments, a wall break or two, and one of the darkest antagonists in the series' history with a dungeon looking like something straight outta Lovecraft. It's a great testament to the fact that a platformer doesn't have to be just focused on collecting things and whipping bosses.

Bugs

I didn't personally encounter any, but looking around I've seen some reports of an error that makes the game run REALLY fast. Again, I can't comment, but it might be worth looking into to see if it might affect you before you buy.

Conclusion

Probably one of my favorite platformers/metroidvanias, up there with the likes of Bloodstained and Odyssey. Am I overhyping it? Probably, but while I doubt it'd win Game of the Year it's still an absolutely incredible game that I highly recommend. Well worth the price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060404733', 'num_games_owned': 253, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 375, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1643731032}
review:
These are my thoughts on a technical issue, not the game itself.
I was very excited to play this game, especially because of the awesome soundtrack and art the game has. Unfortunately the game isn't optimized for newer screens or laptops that run at 120Hz, making the game run 5x faster (not 2x, but 5x).
It's not unplayable, but it's not the intended game experience.

I'm leaving a thumbs down on this one until the issue gets fixed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198093239492', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 285, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 285, 'last_played': 1536894005}
review:
O terceiro jogo da série Shantae. Mais uma vez a corajosa e sensual Shantae, agora sem os seus poderes, têm que se unir a bela e formosa Risky para livrar Sequin Island da ira de um poderoso pirata que voltou dos mortos para se vingar. Só que Shantae conta com um grande arsenal de acessórios que pertenciam a esse pirata.
Jogasso!
Escrito em 04/01/2020.

author: {'steamid': '76561198257979613', 'num_games_owned': 250, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 1001, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1001, 'last_played': 1578108595}
review: Shantae and the Pirate's Curse is a good game, with solid controls and platforming. The pixel art is very well done, and progression of your abilities feels natural and well paced. However, there is one small issue I have with the game. It attempts to incorporate some metroidvania style mechanics with its level design, but it feels awkward without a proper map that other metroidvanias use to give the player a better sense of direction.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055542851', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 84, 'playtime_forever': 758, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 567, 'last_played': 1664842602}
review:
Very solid Metroidvania style platformer with great art and soundtrack; with a charming sense of humor to boot. Controls very tightly and responsively.

 Don't let the cute sprite graphics fool you - this game gets pretty tricky in places. I'd liken it to Castlevania or Megaman X - a methodical placement of enemies and hazards requires quick, analytical thinking to get through certain areas without chewing through your healing reserves. You can brute force places with healing and offensive items, but this gets expensive quickly. Much better to save these assets for the boss fights; some of which can be quite difficult and require a few tries.

Shantae and the Pirate's Curse has a very nice sense of rhythm overall - no area or dungeon really overstays it's welcome. While the game isn't super expansive, there is a little bit of backtracking involved with the story and light sidequesting.

I've never played any of the other Shantae games, so there were a couple of times that I felt a little lost to some of the interpesonal backstory with the secondary characters. But I still found the sense of humor and banter charming and cute overall. The narrative has a very relaxed feel to it and doesn't feel the need to take it self seriously all the time. 

I had fun with this game in the time that I spent with it and would recommend it. That said, a $20 price tag is a bit much considering all the content can be seen in a single 10 to 15 hour playthrough. Personally I'd grab it on sale if I were buying it from the storefront - but I got it from Humble Monthly and felt like it was time and money well spent. Cool game!

review: Great game

author: {'steamid': '76561198295098190', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 388, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 388, 'last_played': 1575207306}
review:
Wayforward经典招牌作品，其实系列前4作我都玩过，个人还是最喜欢这部海盗的诅咒，关卡环境较为丰富，整个流程充满趣味和意外，战斗的流畅度做得也很好，后期能力有点逆天而且非常爽，通关之后仍让人有继续体验的欲望。最主要的，女主角Shantae实在是太可爱了！！
Shantae系列一直是一种轻松幽默的风格，除了GBC上的第一部难度略高，后几部作品即使是手残，也能够玩得很爽。如果你喜欢横版动作和迷宫探索，但是又不想过于受虐，那么我强烈推荐这款游戏。

author: {'steamid': '76561198088042218', 'num_games_owned': 1202, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 518, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 470, 'last_played': 1620401933}
review: Il miglior Shantae di sempre, sebbene anche i capitoli successivi meritino. Si differenzia dagli altri per l'assenza delle trasformazioni della protagonista a causa della maledizione che la priva dei poteri di genio, ma il gameplay risulta comunque ben congegnato e costruito per colmare perfettamente questa lacuna.

author: {'steamid': '76561198172785165', 'num_games_owned': 193, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 697, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 697, 'last_played': 1503594727}
review:
俺洋文不好，剧情上没看太懂，糊里糊涂地通关了。
游戏本身素质还是很高的，卡通的美术风格整体上非常明快，音乐也很带感，操作手感流畅。boss各有特色，基本上都是需要特定打法的，还有随游戏进度开放新能力从而能回旧地图拿收藏道具的设计跟洛克人非常像。有不少收集要素和揭秘要素，而且有些东西确实挺难找的。整体上游戏难度不是很大，除了没有中文以外体验还是很好的。有一个小小的缺点，就是钱不够用。
另外，游戏里的女孩子通通都很可爱，这点也是很重要的。

author: {'steamid': '76561198025273326', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 27151, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 948, 'last_played': 1652161847}
review:
Great game, but occasionally the game will freeze when transitioning from the main map of an island to the labyrinth sub-map. Not sure how to reproduce it. When it happens, I have to forcibly quit the executable and start over from the last save point.

I would still recommend the game to others as a moderately-challenging Metroidvania.

author: {'steamid': '76561198206181145', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 754, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 290, 'last_played': 1667218706}
review: O Estúdio Weyfoward se especializou em fazer jogos ótimos e super detalhados não importa a franquia e não importa a plataforma, como por exemplo "Thor" e "Aliens Infestation" do Nintendo DS, e Shantae é a prata da casa. A heroína meio gênia e meio humana nos deu jogos adoráveis desde o GameBoy color e este jogo é um banquete para os olhos e ouvidos.

review:
難易度控えめのメトロヴァニア。ダンジョンは所々難所があるものの、ボスは回復アイテム連打で押し切れる。
一度攻略したところを再度訪れることが頻繁にあるわりに移動速度あげる装備の入手が遅めなのが難点。
移動能力に関わる装備が揃うとめっちゃスピーディーになって気持ちいい。
あと立ち絵がとてもkawaii。

author: {'steamid': '76561198139344280', 'num_games_owned': 475, 'num_reviews': 209, 'playtime_forever': 931, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 924, 'last_played': 1572023904}
review:
[h1]Verfluchte Unbeschwertheit[/h1]
Die Haupthandlung von Shantae and the Pirate's Curse klingt erstmal wenig kreativ: Ein ruchloser Pirat schickt sich an, seinem Grabe zu entsteigen, um das friedliche Sequin Land zu unterjochen. In der Haut von Shantae, einer Wächterin eben dieses Landes, müssen wir das Vorhaben stoppen. Eine Heldengeschichte in dieser Form hat man schon oft gehört und dennoch hat mich das Jump 'n' Run-Abenteuer in vielerlei Form mit seinen frischen Ansätzen und coolen Ideen überrascht. 
Storybezogen sind vor allem die Dialoge mit dem großen Cast an Charakteren hervorzuheben. Shantae ist eine äußerst warmherzige, fröhliche Person, die in den Gesprächen für eine lockere Note mit viel ungezwungenem Humor sorgt. Ein gutes Beispiel dafür ist ihr Verhältnis zur dezent fiesen Piratin Risky Boots. Die wirkt durch ihr Gebaren eher wie Shantae's Erzfeindin, doch die gutmütige Wächterin von Sequin Land möchte mit Risky dennoch unbedingt den Fluch des bösen Piraten abwenden.     
Es schadet übrigens nicht, die früheren Teile der Serie gespielt zu haben, um besonders die Nebencharaktere besser einordnen zu können. Auch Shantae's Vorgeschichte wird ein paar mal angeschnitten und lässt Nicht-Kenner etwas rätselnd zurück. Ein Muss ist das aber nicht, die gewitzten Dialoge, markanten bis skurrilen Figuren und die eher unspektakuläre Hauptstory funktionieren auch so.  

[b]Timing, Geschick und Metroidvania[/b] 
Auch spielerisch hat mich das Jump 'n' Run mit viel Abwechslung und gut funktionierenden Ideen überrascht. Wir müssen mal schleichen, mal rätseln, die Umgebungen auf versteckte Wege erkunden oder gegen knackige Bosse kämpfen. Shantae and the Pirate's Curse bedient sich dabei Metroidvania-Elementen, denn wir finden im Verlauf unserer Reise einige coole Gadgets, die uns Zugang zu Gebieten verschaffen, die vorher nicht erreichbar waren. Allzu viel Backtracking kommt dabei dank einer Teleport-Funktion zum Anfangspunkt der jeweiligen Insel zum Glück nicht auf. Ganz im Gegenteil, das Pacing habe ich als sehr angenehm wahrgenommen - nur wenn man mangels wirklicher Hilfsfunktion bei einem Rätsel feststeckt, wird's eventuell mal zäh. Generell würde ich den Schwierigkeitsgrad für geübte Spieler als hart aber nur selten überfordernd bezeichnen. Gerade die Bosse verlangen sehr schnelle Reaktionen und bis man deren Muster studiert hat, ist auch ein bisschen Trial&Error notwendig, doch durch mächtige Heiltränke und sammelbare Upgrades für Shantae's Lebensleiste kann man das Spiel dann doch meist zähmen. Nur bei den Geschicklichkeitspassagen helfen selbst Tränke nur begrenzt - durch die griffige Steuerung (klare Gamepad-Empfehlung!) und das durchdachte Level-Design waren die aber eine zwar teils ziemlich knackige aber dennoch sehr spannende und spaßige Angelegenheit.   

[b]Der Orient ruft[/b]
Wir besuchen im Laufe des etwa zwölfstündigen Abenteuers eine ganze Reihe an Inselwelten, die thematisch von der klassischen Ferieninsel bis zu einem Dorf in der Hölle reichen. Die dort heimische Flora und Fauna will uns größtenteils an den Kragen, wobei diese viele verschiedene Formen und Angriffsstrategien aufweist.
Optisch setzt das Spiel auf einen zeitlosen Pixellook, der durch teils ziemlich hübsche Hintergründe und eine stimmige Farbgebung positiv auffällt. Der ungewöhnliche, orientalisch angehauchte Stil wird auch im Soundtrack aufgegriffen, der mal ganz klassisch klingt, ein anderes Mal aber auch richtig treibend und temperamentvoll sein kann. Eine Sprachausgabe gibt es dagegen, abgesehen von Shantae's gelegentlichen Ausrufen, nicht. Dank den auch im Deutschen sehr schwungvoll geschriebenen Dialogen, die von hübschen Zeichnungen der Charaktere untermalt werden, ist das aber halb so schlimm.

[i]Fazit[/i]
[h1]Leichtherzig, charmant und abwechslungsreich! Shantae and the Pirate's Curse ist ein tolles Jump 'n' Run, das bekannte Spielelemente zu einem frischen Mix verbindet.[/h1]

[i]Wertung[/i]
[h1]80[/h1]

[i]Wenn dir mein Review gefallen hat, freue ich mich über eine Bewertung. :)[/i]

review: おすすめしない、というのはアクションゲームがかなり苦手な人視点での評価だと思ってください。総合的には良く出来てると思っています。敵の挙動なんか本当によく考えられてると思います。ただアクション苦手を覆すほどの面白さがあったかというと、そこまでではなかったということです。特に同じステージを何度も行ったり来たりさせられるのはちょっと苦痛でした。アクション好きな人にはおすすめできると思います。

author: {'steamid': '76561197986749426', 'num_games_owned': 194, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1099, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 463, 'last_played': 1701782540}
review:
Да, я решил написать обзор на игру 4 летней давности(ну на 1 халву тоже кто-то обзоры пишет) и да, я пишу обзор, пройдя игру лишь на простую концовку, без тёмной магии, но, как говорил один великий "Большой" человек-«Ладно, хуй с ним» 
Сюжет продолжается после risky's revenge, а значит больше никакой магии превращения, в руках(а точнее на голове) остались лишь волосы(которых шантейка едва не лишилась), да всякие зелья на силу, защиту и тд. Но, одно ЖИРНОЕ но, терь в место крутых превращений, у нас появились не менее крутые артефакты проклятого пирата(ну вообще их Риски спёрла, так что считайте ЕЁ артефакты) которые можно так же опробовать в длс к 1/2, под названием королева морей. В игре встретятся много интересных и даже вроде новых персонажей (на пример как моя вайфу Баракуда Джо - 10 от тебя говной воняет из 10).Уровни в игре вполне запоминающееся в меру сложные и красивые, есть конечно которые я в рот макал (да, призрачный остров, или как там тебя?),нравиться что в некоторых уровнях есть какие-никакие головоломки(каюсь, пару раз чекал прохождение, я тупой), а сколько я слышал ремиксов из run rottytops run, говоря о музыке-она здесь чума, ну оно и не мудрено форварды как ни как (ах если бы sega по мимо гуд музыки и игры так же делала), дизайн врагов и их сложность на уровне (кроме всё того же дохлого острова), ну а говоря о боссах.. Ну, они боссы, а что вы ожидали некоторые могут быть сложные, некоторые нет, тут уж у каждого своё мнение. 
Ну, в общем то можно сказать? Игра в полне себе годнота, на этом моё вдохновение кончилось, а следующий обзор будет на mighty switch force hyper drive edition (как куплю в стиме), бай

author: {'steamid': '76561198069664721', 'num_games_owned': 444, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 1086, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1086, 'last_played': 1562711154}

author: {'steamid': '76561198136938509', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 219, 'playtime_forever': 723, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 723, 'last_played': 1564180787}
review:
El mejor juego de la saga hasta el momento (siendo objetivos) Bastante completo, un excelente juego al estilo Metrodvenia. Se nota la mejora en comparación a sus 2 anteriores títulos.
Gráficamente se ve hermoso, y la música también es buena. Como siempre, no esperen gran cosa de la historia, no se toma en serio.
Pero es un juego divertido.

author: {'steamid': '76561198129961090', 'num_games_owned': 452, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 1173, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1173, 'last_played': 1558724048}
review: buen Metroidvania, divertido con una historia buena, personajes vivos y entrañables, muy buenos graficos, power ups creativos y bien utilizados, jugabilidad buena y divertida y desafiante, buena musica, rejugabilidad y mucho fan service

author: {'steamid': '76561197971361007', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 7004, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1572, 'last_played': 1603595279}
review:
I've meant to play the Shantae games for quite some time, and picked up all 3 games available on Steam on a sale... and snagged the old Gameboy Color version elsewhere. I've always been a fan of 2D, slightly-chibi platformer action games, ever since Wonder Boy in Monster World on the Sega Genesis and its Sega Master System predecessors.

There's always a bit of exploration in them, metroidvania-style need for equipment to get to some areas or secrets, grinding up gold for equipment, and cute, goofy-looking enemies. 

The Shantae games, all of them, scratch my Wonder Boy/Monster World itch *perfectly*. They're challenging, fun, inventive, funny, and a joy to play all around.

author: {'steamid': '76561198973054801', 'num_games_owned': 102, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 965, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 916, 'last_played': 1653470052}
review:
Hikayemiz bu sefer ilkine nazaran daha iyi. İlk oyundaki olayların üzerinden bi süre geçmiş ( ne kadar olduğunu bilmiyorum ama 1 hafta ya var ya yoktur ) karakterimizin yaşadığı şehre bi saldırı olmuştur o saldırıyı geri çevirdikten bi süre sonra risky ( ilk oyundaki baş düşman ) bizi tutsak alır. bir iki tartışmadan sonra bu ikisi hem risky`nin korsan eşyalarını toplamak hem dört bi taraftaki kara sihri toplamak hem de baş düşmanı durdurmak için hem risky` nin hem de shantae``nin işine yarıyacak geçici bir barış antlaşması imzalar. spoiler a girmemek için çabalıyorum yoksa daha detaylı anlatırdım. Yani senaryo ilk oyundan daha iyi ve daha farklı yerlerede gidiyor. Benim çok sıkıntı yaşadığım nokta ise ilk oyunda olduğu gibi bunda da ilerlemek için diyalogları anlamak lazım ama benim ingilizcem yetmediği için ben internetten baka baka oynadım ama yinede eğlenceli idi. Karakterler bu sefer daha ayrıntılı ve güzel hatta bazıları hikayede baya büyük bi önem arz ediyo. Karakter gelişimi yan karakterler iyi olmasada ana karakterlerde zar zor iyi seviyesine ulaşıyo. Atmosferede özellikle korsanlık teması gayet yakışmış

Mekaniklere gelirsek dürüst olucam bu mekanikler özellikle başlarda ilk oyundaki ile aynı gibi hissettiriyo ama sonlara doğru yeni özellikler yeni ekipmanlar aldıkça mekanikler daha komplike oluyor ama hala ilki ile aynı gibi bi yandan da değil gibi. Kısacası sekiro shadow die twice gibi ilk oyuna çok benzeyen ama kendi içinde elle tutulur farklılıkta bulunduran bi yapım. Senaryo gereği artık hayvanlara dönüşemiyoruz yani dans tuşu var ama dönüşme yok. Artık o dans tuşu kara sihri ve yere düşen itemleri toplamak için var. Bölüm tasarımı artık ilk oyundaki gibi bayıcı değil daha iyi ve daha zekice olmuş. Hatta bazı bölümler varki geometry dash dan çıkmış gibi. Bu sefer ilk oyunun aksine ben bütün özellikleri keşfedip bir sonrakinin ne olucanı merak ederek oynadım.

Gelelim performans kısmına. Oyun dediğim gibi bazı yerlerde ilk oyundaki aynı animasyonları kullanıyo ama bunun bi sebebi olabilir. Şimsi ilk shantae oyunu 2010 da yapılıp 2014 de steam`e çıktı ve bu oyunda 2015 de çıktı yani benim teorim yapımcılar o ilk oyundan sonra 3. oyun için çalıştı arayada böyle bi oyun skıştırdı. Müzikler bazen çok güzel olurken bazende ilgimi hiç çekmedi ama genel olarak iyi. Grafiklşerde göze çarpan birşey yok. Oyun sabit 60 fps çalıştı ama böyle bi oyunda 60 fps olsa ne olur olmasa ne olur.

Hikaye: 10/8
Karakterler: 10/7
Mekanikler: 10/9
Bölüm Tasarımı : 10/8.5
Grafikler: 10/7
Müzikler: 10/7

Sonuç olarak Shantae and the Pirates Curse ilk oyunun adımlarını takip edip üzerine yeni şeyler ekleyen güzel bir oyundur

100/87

author: {'steamid': '76561198050251188', 'num_games_owned': 387, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 203, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 203, 'last_played': 1564728159}
review: 作为平台动作游戏的体验不好，充斥着各种无聊的跑路和对话，非常影响沉浸感和节奏。关卡设计得非常乏味。

author: {'steamid': '76561198126456791', 'num_games_owned': 113, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 1158, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1158, 'last_played': 1561863768}
review:
To call Shantae and the Pirate's Curse anything short of perfection would be a disservice. Typically the Shantae games are something I'd consider one-and-done, which always saddened me on account of how much I enjoyed the remarkable sense of humor and fantastic writing they always offered. The tedium of the backtracking required for the upgrades and items always put me off and the transformation dances constantly halted the flow of gameplay.

Then Pirate's Curse changed everything.

This game fixed everything I didn't like with the Shantae games and boasted some of the best movement tech I've seen in a Metroidvania. I cannot stress enough how satisfying it is to pull off even HALF of what you can do in this game. Every upgrade you acquire can be pulled off with a single button press, save for the dash upgrade, which is still great as it seamlessly flows into your normal movement. No waiting for a belly dance, no stopping in your tracks, just instant utility. On top of that, everything you add to your arsenal is immediately useful.

The Gun can be used to activate switches and attack enemies from afar, the Pirate Hat has one of the best glide features I've seen in years and is always a joy to use, the Scimitar provides you with a downwards strike that grants you the option to pogo on top of enemies ala Scrooge McDuck and does great damage as well, the Boots let you dash with the Scimitar in front, skewering anything foolish enough to stand in your way, and the Cannon lets you jump an additional 3 times. Do I even need to explain why that last upgrade is great?

The best part by far is that all of these, save for the gun, can be chained together to create some of the most satisfying platforming I've ever experienced. Pirate's Curse didn't just give you new toys to experiment with, it gave you tools to traverse a world designed around them. I am delighted to express just how much I enjoyed Pirate's Curse. This game isn't just fun to play, it's exhilarating to watch in action.

I mentioned before that the Shantae series has brilliant writing, and this is no exception. It balances humor and tension with panache and provided multiple belly laughs along the way. It truly was the conclusion the original trilogy needed. Wayforward has designed many outstanding games, but this tops them all. You don't need to be a fan of Shantae to appreciate this game (though knowing some of what the series has to offer does help). If you're a fan of Metroidvanias, this should already be in your library. You owe it to yourself to play this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198829435197', 'num_games_owned': 201, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 766, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 655, 'last_played': 1678882223}
review:
This is my first Shantae experience (besides Risky's Revenge) and loved it, I quickly found myself not enjoying the slow pace of Risky's Revenge and found myself enjoying this way more.
Pirate's Curse has solid fast metroidvania gameplay with [strike] waifu trash [/strike] upbeat, fun characters and a great ost by Jake Kaufman that fit Pirate's Curse amazingly.

I could list all of them but here are a few good examples:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FINmfZhhSsY
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tyo8xMiD4K4
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fm4EH5FVu1o

My only complaint is that the game is a little short but the replayability is still there within pirate's mode.

Overall? Pretty solid game, good for people who want to take their first dip into the games as it is considered one of the best entries in the series.

author: {'steamid': '76561198120794188', 'num_games_owned': 185, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 543, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 532, 'last_played': 1565002378}
review:
このゲームの一番の見所は、バンダナが脱げて意外と長い髪をしだれさせたリスキーブーツの美人っぷり。
おじさんはとても嬉しくなりました。

初代ガンスターヒーローズをはじめ、往年のトレジャーを彷彿とさせる軽やかな動きとバランスの良いアクション、懐かしさを感じさせながらもステージやストーリーにマッチしたBGMなど、完成度が高いアクションゲームです。

author: {'steamid': '76561198091487897', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 759, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 759, 'last_played': 1565128587}
review:
Depois de jogar Shantae Half Genie Hero e enrolar só um pouco pra zerar Pirate's Curse, posso dizer sem dúvidas que é um excelente jogo.

Apesar de não ter uma história digna de livro ou filme, não deixa de ser uma história divertida e com personagens únicos, cada um com sua personalidade e característica que os diferenciam entre si.
A gameplay é simples porém fantástica, o jogo não é tão difícil, mas tem seus momentos de dificuldade alta, mas nada que vá te fazer jogar o controle na parede.

Em geral: Eu amei esse jogo, e agora que finalmente o zerei estou mais ansioso do que nunca para Shantae 5, só vem!

author: {'steamid': '76561197960548937', 'num_games_owned': 298, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 546, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 546, 'last_played': 1563855252}
review: It was alright until I got sick of the instant death spike jumping/floating rooms. The graphics are fine. The backgrounds are some kind of hideous pre-rendered 3D stuff but the sprites look good. The music is pretty alright. The controls feel great (on a controller). I don't have the patience to memorize spike rooms so I'll play something else.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048054884', 'num_games_owned': 200, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 1145, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1023, 'last_played': 1573684266}
review:
"Fanservice: The Game"

Seriously, this game is so sexualized it's ridiculous. Although there isn't any NSFW scene, I wouldn't reccomend playing this game on a family couch.
Other than that, Shantae and the Pirate's Curse is very good.
-The platforming isn't incredibly punishing, except at the late game, but even still it's rewarding and cool.
-The humour is great. I had many laughs and giggles while reading the dialogues, and most of jokes caught me off guard, wich made them even funnier.
-I felt frustrated with the combat many times, although by being simple and fair I felt it was mostly my fault.
-The music makes me want to dance just like Shantae. I can't stay still in my chair for long while listening to this game's soundtrack.
-The boss battles are awesome. Many turn out to be gimmick bosses, but that happens to fit so well with this game.
-All areas are unique and each come with their own upgrade, wich boosts exploration in areas you've been through already.

Overall, It's a sweet metroidvania with querky characters, upgrades and areas. I really reccomend this game. That is, if you're okay with a bit of sexual pressure every now and then.

author: {'steamid': '76561198254498211', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 979, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 442, 'last_played': 1642308012}
review: Best Shantae game that I've played. I've played every Shantae game but the most recently released one (Half Genie Hero) and I have to say that The Pirate's Curse is by far the best that I've played. The graphics look stunning, the gameplay is tighter than ever and the series as a whole is better than ever.

author: {'steamid': '76561198118440535', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 947, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 760, 'last_played': 1593270726}
review:
PROS:
+ Good graphics for a pixelart game
+ Fluid gameplay with lots of action
+ Good soundtrack
+ Cute sexy girls
+ Upbeat mood, and fun to play.
+ Some parts are challenging but nothing crazy hard if you are used to medtroidvania.


CONS:
+About 10 hours of gameplay without looking for every single cursed magic. I wish it were longer but that is not so bad.
+No voice action.
+Using itens the game is way too easy. If you like some challange I manage to recover health only in save points, used itens only in the last stage "pirate castle" . Beat last boss without itens. Not sure if I want to search for all cursed magic to face the real last boss and get true ending, I prefer more action.

OVERALL
Great game, had lots of fun and loved playing it. Recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057491843', 'num_games_owned': 946, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 1003, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1003, 'last_played': 1562878442}
review: Without a doubt one of the best metroidvania platformers I've ever played, with an amazing soundtrack and likable characters. Definitely the best in the series. 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198029634846', 'num_games_owned': 120, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 821, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 821, 'last_played': 1563028271}
review: Yet another good game in the Shantae series and for my feeling content-wise about twice as big as its prequel; Shantae: Risky's Revenge. What I really like about Shantae and the Pirate's Curse over the prequels is that it's much easier now to use the items you have in your bag (in the past it took 3 steps to finally be able to use an item, now it's down to 2). Backtracking has gotten slightly easier as well with the use of flares which takes you back to the starting points of each zone (which are directly connected to the main hub). Nonetheless, mandatory backtracking is still one of the things I've always disliked in the series, but at least they made it a bit easier. Hopefully they'll continue improving on that in Shantae's upcoming 5th game in the series. The game offers a good adventure for all types of players out there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198867062932', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2529, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 875, 'last_played': 1659974866}

author: {'steamid': '76561198148620362', 'num_games_owned': 433, 'num_reviews': 507, 'playtime_forever': 536, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 536, 'last_played': 1562673628}
review:
好了，因为要学习，这应该是今年我玩的最后几个游戏之一了。然而我觉得这段体验，真的只能说好坏参半。

《Shantae》这个系列也算是远近闻名，不管是由于游戏本身的素质，还是由于其众多的“衍生作品”（咳咳）。对于这个系列我也不怎么了解，第一代没上steam，第二代立绘画风不喜，因此就先尝试了本作，也就是第三代。

我觉得这个游戏的优点是很显著的：清新的像素画面，生动的动画（包括一些身体部位的谜 之 抖 动，嗯），BGM的质量也是上乘的。关键是令纯洁少年血 脉 喷 张的角色设计，这里特指各种妹子，包括一些怪物也是妹子，你要注意看的话，一个从地里冒出来的粘合怪，也是由一堆[strike]前凸后翘[/strike]的妹子合在一起的。真的，我都不敢在家人面前玩这游戏，担心被误解，毕竟我还没成年呢！

不过即使这款游戏在画面上让人[strike]欲火焚身[/strike]，容易把持不住，但开放的外国佬觉得既然没有（咳咳）画面，反正衣服最少也就是比基尼的水平，就给评了个12+的评级。要知道在我国特色分级中，这可是18+分级都禁止的内容（我号没了）。但是就算这么说，这也是一款正正经经的扎实游戏啊！如果你想（咳咳），有的是地方去找，反正游戏里没有这样的内容（你们干什么，不要用这种眼神看我，我什么都不知道）。

说了这么多这游戏的艺术（嗯，包括“艺术”）价值，那这游戏作为一个Metroidvania，素质又如何呢？说实在话，这部分就是让我比较失望的地方了。

首先，本作的地图结构是这样的：七座岛屿（可以通过海盗妹子的船互达），除了最后一个只是起剧情过渡作用外，其他每个岛屿都包含两个部分——野外和地牢。地牢这个词呢，游戏里用的名词是Labyrinth，迷宫的意思，这里我把它叫做地牢，是因为这种存在的形式，与其说是Metroidvania，不如说更像塞尔达。地牢也不一定是每个岛屿一个，根据剧情需要也会有其他的阶段，不过要解锁下一个岛屿，必须要打败一个特定地牢（游戏中称为Den of Evil，恶魔巢穴）内的BOSS才能继续。也就是这样的特定地牢，通常会给主角一种新的能力，并对玩家对这个能力的掌握提出考验。

地牢的设计其实没什么可喷的，每座地牢都有其独特的氛围和设计，关卡和BOSS的设计也巧妙地用到了游戏中获得的各种海盗能力，算是优秀的水平。除了最后一个地牢，平台跳跃难度突然暴增，关卡又长容错率又低，要不是我平台跳跃不弱就卡关了（苦 痛 之 路，当然肯定还是比不上真的苦痛之路的）。问题的关键就在于这个“野外”部分，下面的很多段都是用来喷它。

比起地牢中各异的设计，我真的不知道这个“野外”部分到底有什么意义。除了一个岛屿之外，所有岛屿的“野外”部分的结构就只有一种：一条从左边拖到右边的曲线。这种极端线性的地图设计如果只过一遍还好说，问题这是一款Metroidvania，要全收集的话，走回头路在所难免。而且就连主线中也有若干要求回到之前去过的岛屿的任务，而且经常是从头跑到尾，路中间的支线也少得可怜，真的不知道有什么意义。

游戏后期会得到一个长途冲刺的能力，触发方法是不断奔跑一段时间，再按攻击键，就可以以很高的速度，而且几乎无敌的状态向前不断冲，直到你松开攻击键或者撞到墙。不可否认这个东西对跑路的确起到了一点优化的作用，但此时“优秀”的关卡设计师又出来恶心你了，在地面上放几个，你在高速状态下较难反应，所以除了背板肯定会掉下去的坑，然后你就回到这一面的最开始辣！更加优秀的是，有些怪还会重新刷出来，真是宝才设计，开发组捡到鬼了。

如果真的只是地图设计不行也就算了，还有更烦人的，就是地图上面的怪。我的老天，我认为设计师完全就是上瘾了，凡是一个平台都要放个怪。你想象一下这个场面：一个基本上只能算是落脚点的狭小平台上，有一个飞速往复移动的小怪，而且这个小怪还是那种，你必须要站在这个平台上，按住下键趴下，而且朝着小怪的方向攻击若干次，才能打掉的小怪。就算你有远程武器，平台之间的高度差也被设计成，你满跳打也不是，小跳打也不是，反正就是巨难打到这个怪。如果你稍微不注意被怪碰了，主角会做出非常夸张的被击中动作，附带一个超大硬直，直接把你弹进下面的坑或者是别的怪里。更加恐怖的是，这种平台还连续放了三到五个。你就说绝不绝望？

是，我知道游戏需要难度，毕竟这个游戏只要好好玩，多买道具，本来就很难死（比如说我通关了都没死过一次），但你也不能用密度这么夸张的怪来恶心玩家啊......这样就会让玩家觉得（反正我是这么觉得），不是自己的水平拖慢了闯关的进度，而是设计师的恶意。可以说这个点是严重地损害了我的游戏体验，只有到地牢的部分才感觉稍好一些。

游戏的收集部分......我是感觉隐藏得太隐蔽了，不像一些同类游戏有非常明显的方块，甚至连“墙有裂缝”这样的不同贴图都没有，有隐藏通道的墙和地板和其他的墙和地板[b]没有一点不同[/b]。更加奇幻的是，这种墙通常还不是走进去就完事了，还要有特定的触发方式，比如说从上面下劈进去，或者从某个旮旯冲刺进去。还有个别需要你在特定的地方用冲刺技能撞墙，才能把隐藏的要素撞出来。而且这种隐藏还真的就只有“隐藏”这个难点而已了，绝大多数并不需要多进行什么解谜和战斗，难的只是找到这个地方。这我就真不知道怎么评价了。

我觉得这样的要素如果是路过某处时顺便发现的，肯定能说得上是惊喜连连，但如果你错过了，在不看攻略的情况下找这种隐藏，太痛苦了。而且我反正是没发现有什么东西，能够把隐藏的地点表示在地图上，因此在不看攻略的情况下，只能花时间去试咯。再配上上面所说的鬼才关卡设计，绝了。当然，如果你说这是老式Metroidvania特色，并说我是“被现代简单游戏惯坏的矫情玩家”，我也没fa可说，你有喷我的权利。

这游戏理论上有两个结局，全收集黑魔法（游戏中的一种收集物，共20个）能够打真结局，最终BOSS多两个阶段。说实话，游戏的难度真的不难，最起码比空洞骑士简单到不知道哪里去了，不过由于上述的一些缺陷，我最终没有想要打真结局的想法。反正这类有续作的游戏，在续作中最基础的剧情假设肯定就是，前作中拿到了最完美的结局，所以没什么意义。

唧唧歪歪地喷了这么多，然而最后我还是给了好评，因为我认为这些都是我的个人看法，总有更能接受这些不太方便的方面的玩家，对于这样的群体，我还是推荐这款拥有独特美感的游戏。

[strike]（毕竟，妹子画的还是真实好看，还有泳 装 福 利，真香）[/strike]

author: {'steamid': '76561198893702937', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 99, 'playtime_forever': 227, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1563200191}

author: {'steamid': '76561198812296087', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1053, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1053, 'last_played': 1590248996}
review:
This game was one hell of a fun time! Great graphics, wonderful music, very interesting in terms of it being a metroidvania game, plenty of fanservice, funny dialogues... it left me speechless. As soon as I got my hands on it and tried it out, I fell in love with it in a matter of hours, and went trough every archievement just to play it again and again.
Perhaps, it's not the best choice for those who are searching for more challengy metroidvania games: infact, I felt like this was kind of easy-normal most of the times. Even figuring out where to go can be relatively easy, I sometimes was even able to predict where the game wanted me to go, lol. Obviously, not saying that it being easy is a con; I actually enjoyed it the way it is, it makes you able to enjoy all of it without having that anxiety of extreme challenges and such (think of the late game of Luna Nights, for example).
So yeah, all the way recommended. Most people say this is the best one of the Shantae saga, yet, I think I'll be trying out the other ones soon, as well as looking forward the upcoming Shantae 5.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970792368', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 671, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 671, 'last_played': 1562167242}
review:
"Shantae and the Pirate's Curse" ist der dritte Teil der Reihe. Es ist ein kurzes und spaßiges "Jump n´ Run / Metroidvania" mit paar kleinen Frustmomenten bei Geschicklichkeitspassagen und Kämpfen.
Die Rätsel sind nicht zu schwer oder zu leicht.
Jeder Boss verlangt eine andere Taktik und Vorgehensweise.
Um die Geschichte und Charaktere besser zu kennen/verstehen ist es sicher nicht verkehrt die Vorgänger zu spielen. Aber einige Dinge kann man sich zusammenreimen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000807394', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 188, 'playtime_forever': 370, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 370, 'last_played': 1552805908}

author: {'steamid': '76561197992960689', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 139, 'playtime_forever': 725, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 315, 'last_played': 1565200011}
review:
A seriously fun romp of a game, much like the others in this series, but also like the others, a bit pricey.

Well-polished, but pricey.

Slick controls, colourful, silly characters, barely-serviceable plot, and interesting destinations, all dripping with a healthy dose of anime-smarm. Great soundtrack, too.

Wait for it to go on sale, but definitely grab it when it does.

Not as slick as 1/2 Genie Hero, but with more traditional gameplay. Really looking forward to Shantae 5.

author: {'steamid': '76561198303438490', 'num_games_owned': 505, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 787, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 787, 'last_played': 1561785259}
review:
De cabeza se convirtió en uno de mis metroidvanias favoritos de toda la vida.

Responsivo
Fluido
Versátil
Y Accesible

Nada de pequeños resbalones al caer donde brincas es donde vas a caer y las versatilidad de todas sus armas tanto en combate como para resolver puzzles del juego.
Simplemente Shantae And The Pirate's Curse es de los mejores juegos de plataforma que e visto en mucho tiempo y aun que no este en oferta me comprare Half-Genie Hero por que me encanto la saga tal cual y tal vez Risky's Revenge solo para hacer el juego.

author: {'steamid': '76561198143066217', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 1268, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1268, 'last_played': 1561256005}
review:
[h1] Un buen juego de la saga Shantae	[/h1]
Un buen juego en toda la regla, al principio es un poco incomodo de jugar porque me pareció que las plataformas eran demasiado pequeñas, pero no es nada de lo que no te puedas acostumbrar al pasar por unos cuantos mundos, también el juego al principio se siente un poco ortopédico, como he visto en algunos metroidvania que me ha tocado jugar, pero va mejorando según consigues parte del [i] Pirate Gear[/i]  (en especial el sombrero).

[h1] Gameplay [8/10]	[/h1]
El único problema que le veo al gameplay es la ausencia de checkpoints y guardado automático, ya que en alguna ocasión me toco repetir varios jefes accidentalmente por olvidar guardar justo al salir del mismo (ya que el juego no guarda por ti automaticamente), otro problema que he visto es que la tienda esta muy lejos de los Laberintos (en Scuttle Town), por lo que vas a necesitar cargar siempre con auto-pociones antes de entrar al jefe o evitar que te peguen, ya que en algunos laberintos no se puede regresar a la superficie o es complicado volver a la tienda, en algunos momentos esto me resultó algo un poco frustrante.
Por otra parte el gameplay es muy variado, lo cual esta bastante bien.

[h1] Controles [9/10]	[/h1]
Como ya dije al principio de la reseña, al principio los controles me resultaron un poco ortopédicos, pero según progresa el juego va a mejorando la cosa.

[h1] Historia [10/10]	[/h1]
La historia se maneja muy bien, con toques de humor, y me gusto particularmente que el juego tuviera 2 finales, los cuales son muy emotivos y te hacen sentir e,patia por los personajes.

[h1] Música [20/10]	[/h1]
La música es sin duda el apartado más fuerte del juego teniendo canciones muy memorables, que se te quedan grabadas en la mente y vas a querer escuchar más, una lastima que WayForward no haya puesto el soundtrack en Steam.

[h1] Gráficos [10/10]	[/h1]
La estética pixel mezclada con imágenes estáticas a lo visual novel le queda muy bien al juego, el fanservice esta muy bien cuidado y en ningún momento llega a ser exagerado.

[h1] En conclusión	[/h1]
Un buen juego, lo recomiendo comprar, solamente recomiendo tener cuidado de guardar constantemente, para evitar el repetir jefes como me toco a mi y cargar una buena cantidad de Auto-pociones en el inventario para evitar perder progreso y hacer la experiencia más amena.

author: {'steamid': '76561198100598153', 'num_games_owned': 316, 'num_reviews': 167, 'playtime_forever': 2778, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2281, 'last_played': 1628218470}

author: {'steamid': '76561198126207031', 'num_games_owned': 1100, 'num_reviews': 282, 'playtime_forever': 762, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 762, 'last_played': 1560397014}
review:
사이드뷰 게임을 정말 엄청 못해서
웬만하면 피하는데
이 게임은 크게 고통받는 구간 없고

author: {'steamid': '76561198087392155', 'num_games_owned': 459, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 630, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 153, 'last_played': 1560005554}
review:
Шикарное продолжение великой истории Shantae. По сравнению с Risky's Revenge - Director's Cut диалоги персонажей просто изумительны. В плане графики сильно такого ничего не изменилось, но задний фон на уровнях стал намного красивей. Ещё стоит отметить то, что некоторые фишки и враги были взяты с первой части игры Shantae (Game Boy Color), что весьма меня порадовало. Лучше сыграть на эмуляторе, чтобы понять про какие фишки я говорю.  

Вывод: цена оправдывает качество

author: {'steamid': '76561198079579272', 'num_games_owned': 786, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 921, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1576122269}
review:
I'll be honest, this game is really special to me. Not just because it was the first Shantae game I played in the series but because the time at which I first played this game. I don't really want to go to deep into the detail since it pretty personal but back at the start of 2016 I was going through some pretty depressing events involving my family and let's just say those events didn't exactly put me in a happy mood. So I had done what I had always done to cheer myself up, play video games. But I wanted to also play something new. I wanted to play a game I haven’t played yet but wanted to out of curiosity. I wanted to play a Shantae game. So I got it for my 3DS while all that personal stuff was going on and I loved it. When I played it for the first time it brought me so much joy and happiness that it managed to become one of my top 10 favourite games of all time and the only other games that managed to do that around that same time were Xenoblade Chronicles and Fire Emblem Awakening along with Shantae herself being one of my personal favourite characters in fiction.  And maybe I am bias but to me this is the best game in the series. And quiet frankly there is no other better way I can think of for celebrating the 17th anniversary of this series than talking about my favourite game in it. And yeah the anniversary does also kind of influence my decision to buy this game again... Despite already owning it on the 3DS and Switch. Hey I have Grand Theft Auto San Andreas on four different systems so this isn't the first time.

Pirates Curse follows the same progressive structer as the first two games where you travel across the game world to collect important items and powers that are needed to progress. In this game you go to different islands to clear out the dens of evil on each to put a stop to the plans of the soon to be resurrected Pirate Master who also happens to be Risky Boot's, the main villain of the series, old master but since not even she wants him back she begrudgingly needs Shantae to help her. You know story has never been the biggest part of this series but for the sake of the plot I actually like that Risky is working with Shantae especially since this game actually does flesh out Risky a little bit, mostly her connection to her old master. But if there is any character in this game that I love the most because of the development they get it's Rottytops. I can't actually say why because of spoiler reasons but on the second last island before the final one you will see why.

So if you know anything about Shantae then you know that she is a half genie that has the ability to transform by dancing. Because of story spoilers in Riskey's Revenge she no longer has those powers making her just a full human. In exchange however this game let's you use the various different pirate gear you find in the games labyrinths to progress. These involve a flintlock pistol, a hat for floating in the air, a scimitar that can be used for a downward attack while in the air, boots for running fast and a cannon that act's like an additional jump. After playing Pirates Curse I eventually got around to playing the rest of the games in the series and as much as I enjoy the transformations I just can't help but love the pirate gear more especially when the games makes you have to use several of them at once like using the boots to get some speed, then following that up with a jump and glide with the hat while also using the cannon to keep yourself airborne. Instances like this are what put it above the dances for me. I like the transformations but I love the Pirate Gear and I'm so glad that while Shantae does get her transformations back in Half Genie Hero this style of play isn't completely lost since the Pirate Queen's Quest DLC for that game lets you play as Risky Boots and lets you use her gadgets just like here. That is probably the biggest change to the gameplay though there is also stuff like how rather than finding heart containers you have to find four heart squids to bring to the squid smith in Scuttle Town to gain additional health and I'm really glad that when traveling to different islands you are actually given a representation of how many Heart Squids and Craklebats there are on the island along with the ones you have gotten. The Craklebats are Tinkerbats that have been infused with dark magic to make them look more terrifying than there normally cartoonish looking self’s and you need to find and defeat all of them if you want the true ending, yeah this game has two different endings.

Visually the game looks identical to Riskys Revenge with the sprites but there are a lot of new backgrounds, some great music and all of the character portraits being redone with a new art style which I honestly prefer over the Half Genie Hero look though that might just be my bias towards this game talking, again this is a very special to me. Though honestly even if I wasn't I would still agree that this is a great game and I guess if there is one genuine problem I do have with it is that as I said before if you want the true ending to this game you have to find all of the Craklebats which can be hidden in very obscure places. As much as people might hate me for saying this there is no shame in using a walkthrough if your struggling. Oh and also I love Shantae's little coat in this game way to much that I'm disappointed it's probably never coming back.

Though honestly compared to everything I love about this game, the characters, the gameplay and the style that is a very small thing. I have played this game so many times on every other system I own it on and it's not going to be the last. I've said it before in this review but I want to stress just how much this game really means to me and I wouldn't be a fan of this series if it wasn't for this game. And I honestly can’t think of a better game to introduce me to a series that still brings me as much joy as when I first played it. Though really, I just love how this game and this series has fun with itself. In an era where every developer is trying way to hard to make gritty realistic games that think throwing as much controversial content at you will make it the best thing ever this was a breath of fresh air. Happy 17th birthday to this series. Of course I’m not done with it yet.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010748991', 'num_games_owned': 1832, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 966, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 966, 'last_played': 1558992239}
review:
Excellent metroidvania gameplay. Amusing (& attractive) characters. Fun narrative. Fair amount of hidden collectibles. Decent world variation to shake up scenery. & some pretty dang awesome boss fights.

This game was my intro to the Shantae series & I loved it. $20 seems a tad pricey for the package. Between $10 & $15 feel more like the sweet spot for this title, but, honestly the game is badass & is worth playing. Make sure you either purchase now or wishlist it (You don't want to miss out!) For what it is, the game is basically perfect.

Word of warning: When I first booted up the game it played at a ridiculously quick framerate. There are some posts available on how to solve it. Mine fixed itself by just rebooting the game. Never had the problem again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064568395', 'num_games_owned': 9709, 'num_reviews': 968, 'playtime_forever': 813, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 813, 'last_played': 1558738279}
review:
[table]
    [tr]
        [th][h1] My Playthrough [/h1][/th]
        [th][url=https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLTZKn1hLlcQOGreg-kOZR1tkG5YcI2i1m] Youtube Playlist [/url][/th]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td][h1]The Review[/h1][/td]
        [td]Sequel to Shantae: Risky's Revenge. Shantae and the Pirate's Curse improves the metroidvania formula of the previous games. Dungeons and towns are far bigger. The story takes place after Risky's Revenge, Shantae lost her powers at the end of the previous games so now she must use pirate tools to get past obstacles. The sprites and backgrounds are more detailed. The game is not as easy or short as the previous game which is a plus. The only cons I can think of is that the game resolution is capped at 1080p and the final dungeon is way too hard. If you enjoyed Shantae: Risky's Revenge then you will really enjoy this.[/td]
    [/tr]
[/table]

author: {'steamid': '76561198042259317', 'num_games_owned': 4316, 'num_reviews': 414, 'playtime_forever': 837, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 743, 'last_played': 1553586086}
review:
[h1]Pirate's Curse is a much better Metroidvania experience than it's predecessor. While I'm now convinced that the "Simple, lame" humor and series isn't quite for me, It's a reasonably decent game with some irritating platforming segments[/h1]



[b]Pros:[/b]
- MUCH better than Risky's Revenge
- Though its hard for me to describe why, backtracking feels a bit less aimless, though little to nothing does guide you where you really need to go
- Fullscreen mode and Confirm/Cancel controls work properly compared to Risky's Revenge
=Dungeons and bosses remain the best portions of the game, though some dungeon keys or upgrades have no challenge to get them - just walk in a room and HEY THERE"S A CHEST WITH ONE OF YOUR KEYS!

[b]Cons:[/b]
- Maps don't display Heart Squids and Risky's pirate "collectibles"
-I nventory Menu doesn't title the next tab, so you have to guess/memorize which screen is map, items, and inventory
- World map shows you what collectibles are left, but once you enter a level, you can't find that information.
- Shantae is no longer magical - uses consumable Pikeballs instead of magic. Game is thus designed to have less need for said magic.
- Rather easy game but with some irritating platforming segments, especially before the last boss
- No journal system or character reminding you directly what is your next objective 
- Needlessly lewd character designs. Why I'd never consider the previous games to be "pervy" it seems too often there are moments just to show off bikini clad character art. I have zero issue with nudity or porn, but the lewd moments just felt paper thin, and there just to be there and make teens fans of the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198207868297', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 108, 'playtime_forever': 521, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 521, 'last_played': 1553154033}
review: Estilo Metroidvania clásico dividido por mapas concretos, un apartado técnico y sonoro muy bueno, aunque es un título que propone muy poco y no se toma enserio tiene bastante carisma a nivel de personajes, sistema bastante simple pero entretenido.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049728936', 'num_games_owned': 329, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 761, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 761, 'last_played': 1552447304}
review:
I really wanted to like the Shantae games, honestly I did. The graphics are fantastic, the character design is fun, the story is pretty solid, and the music isn't bad. The problem with this game is that it lacks good design. The levels are poorly laid out, with many of the secrets leading to very little reward. A lot of the challenges feel like they don't fit in the game either. Some are in there for a brief part of the game, only to never be seen again in the game, and they don't do a great job of explaining what they do.

Again, I really want to like this game, but it's just really poorly designed and a chore to play. For that reason, I cannot recommend it.

抱歉，我不理解這遊戲的好
雖然我全破過一次，但我真的無法推薦

author: {'steamid': '76561198001117740', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 1639, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1034, 'last_played': 1640414290}
review:
This is an absolutely amazing platformer in its own right and the best in the series. I thought when I first started the game that I'd really miss the transformations, but the way they engineered the game to exclude these actually made it a lot better. The game flows better and as you acquire skills, maneuverability is much better than the other games.

The controls in this game are incredibly tight and should serve as a benchmark for anyone developing a decent platformer. In the other 2 games one thing I found especially frustrating was jump not working at the very edge of platforms, but that doesn't seem to be an issue in this game and that's a big plus in my book.
The only thing I absolutely HATE about the gameplay is the knockback. It's way over the top and was much better in the other 2 games.

It's also the hardest game in the series, and while it's not a nightmare platformer like Hollow Knight, it has a good level of challenge that I feel is very well balanced and makes the game that much more enjoyable. The other 2 games, especially Half-Genie hero, got a lot easier as you progressed, whereas the challenge in this game progresses with you and remains about the same level of difficulty relative to your experience with the game.

I'm not really a fan of pixelated games either. While the graphics are better than the first and I would have been absolutely in love with the graphics in the mid 90s, I really wish devs would move on from the nostalgia of pixel graphics. With that said, it's good to see they finally moved on to HD graphics in Half-Genie Hero.
At least all the sexy girls were in full HD and the best drawn in the series IMO.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978808414', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 736, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 723, 'last_played': 1557336748}
review:
I initially bought this game due to the series' high praise, which spans all the way back to the Gameboy Color. I never had a chance to play that, and this game would become my first Shantae experience. And it does not disappoint. The story is full of silly moments, the graphics are supremely detailed and animated, and the sound - which is done by none other than Jake Kaufman - is excellent and is bound to get stuck in your head. The controls are extremely tight which is appreciated in any platformer. Everything here is very well made. 

The game is a Metroidvania at heart and, as such, will require some backtracking for the full experience. I did not mind this too much. 

But this game isn't perfect. The Mud Bog area, in particular, seemed riddled with cheap-shot enemies until you reach the dungeon area and the final stage is a brutal gauntlet (at first). These things don't bring it down much, however. 

If you are into Metroidvanias, like Axiom Verge or even Dust: An Elysian Tale, check out Shantae - you won't regret it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198108456087', 'num_games_owned': 597, 'num_reviews': 395, 'playtime_forever': 2101, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1707, 'last_played': 1558946256}
review: Третья часть веселее, легче и разнообразнее в плане геймплея. Появились элементы метроидвании. Больше раскрывается лор и персонажи. Саундтрек уступает прошлой части, многие мелодии повторяются. Враги почти те же. Графон чуть приятнее стал. Глаза теперь не болят.

review:
Okay this is an interesting glam sack of clambering pirates sexy shore game that delivers high notes and low notes!

Im going to be automatically fair!First of all the soundtrack is a killer tune beautiful listening sensation that this jake music guy
made this game playable just for the craving music that is both haunting and mystically energetic in instances!

The graphics are well-presented into charm and very cool vivid colors with lush backgrounds that be prideful to
eliminate every old school game ever made!Way forward did a good job of making all the sexual girl characters
with tasty void bodies that make even a nerdy doorless whimp have a orgasm with a dino plush toy!!!

The controls are okay and earnest foundation!

So what makes this game a not recommended score and a highly recommended ranking on some flowing parts!

The gameplay is what made me frustrated!It's not the difficulty that ramps up or u know the typical rage quit traps and puzzles that old school games formerly have!

Its just very frustrating to play!The controls are decently gifted but they're no konami or capcom control gimmicks to make this playable!

I say pick this up on sale and u may enjoy it!But for everybody making the hype train go choo-choo-choo like its a goldem gem masterpiece!I disagree!I like Wayforward from games such as Ducktales Remastered,Contra Rebirth,Castlevania Rebirth,and many others that are rare in videogame developed books of what i call a great company!

But this game never delivers what those games have!Yes it may have a sexy girl characters with a trio of nicely done art design characters!The bosses are among creative in some instances!

But when u have bad game design and just very ragged details that are copied in rehashed selected areas!
And u get a short game that is quite unfun and unfair in approval status!

Im sorry if i get hated on this review!And all the meme junkie trolls go after me like im some circuit hippie reject trying to write this applauded review!

But ive played many games!I was born in 1990 the exact year when the Super Nintendo came out!I know when a game is really creative and trying to be a yielding experience throughout or it can just stop and be like this shantae game and make me quiver into my mercilessly thoughts that i may be the only one telling the truth!!!

But whatever!I did dance to half of the soundtrack because Jake is a really great composer and he deserves more recognition for what he does!

Dont take this the wrong way...its just we all have personal judgemental opinions about some desired games that we call classics or just air dumpage in a mileway racecar track riding our skins back and forth like we are a useless track design!

But yeah hate on me!Doesnt matter?You still got 9,000 dance videos to do the whole wide world,and u get stepping!
Thanks for experience WayForward but i wont play this ever again!

So its either a middle proportion of being not recommended but also being recommended!So you decide what slaughtering path u will take!Either buy or pass ur choice love the burrito master

author: {'steamid': '76561198092164248', 'num_games_owned': 2314, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1953, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1905, 'last_played': 1526444406}
review:
Este juego es una completa obra maestra, el completar el juego ya me hecho fan de la saga y me está tentando a conseguir toda la saga completa.

La banda sonora es espectacular, el arte en pixeles muy bien logrado y fluido, la jugabilidad perfecta y aunque la historia podría mejorar no influye mucho en los otros puntos.
La dificultad es la correcta, lo tuve que re jugar varias veces para completar todos los logros y no se sintió pesado volver a recorrer todas las zonas (Más que nada porque puedes utilizar tus objetos que recoges durante el juego desde el principio y porque nunca te cansas de la música).

9/10 sin dudarlo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198170410575', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 750, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 635, 'last_played': 1562975789}
review: This is a great platformer, probaly the best of the Shantae series. The graphics are great the artworks good. If you liked Half-Genie Hero's artwork it's pretty much the exact same. The gameplay pretty simple same with the story so if you want a very story rich game then this doesn't really have that. For most of the game you'll just wip enemies with your hair, IDK how that really works but it does. You do get other items ,but except the pistol they don't really affect combat more the level design. So if you had to start out with the series I would definitly start out with this one because the simplicty is kinda of a good thing because it does all of it's ideas really well.

review:
I played the previous game, but did not finish it because while the bosses were okay, the normal levels were too easy and mostly felt like boring filler. Shantae and the Pirate's Curse does not have this problem. The level design is pretty good and can give a decent challenge at times. The various tools you find during the game also makes the game more enjoyable.
So overall an excellent upgrade over Risky's Revenge.

author: {'steamid': '76561198263316031', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 462, 'playtime_forever': 562, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 562, 'last_played': 1547550068}
review:
Nunca habia jugado un Shantae pero si sabia de ellos, y ahora me apunto esta saga para seguirla de serca , si aun tiene algo mas que dar.
Es un juego de plataformas sencillo en un principio, saltar y pegar, conforme avanzas desbloqueas mas habilidades, ninguna de ellas demasiado creativas, me da la impresion de haberlas usado en otros juegos, pero funcionan.
EL juego se divide en islas, con un par de trabas para entrar a las mazmorraz que en general son mas bien pequeñitas y no representan un gran reto, encuentras un item y vencez un boss que tampoco son muy dificiles, hasta los ultimos 3 que si te pueden dar un problema.
Pero el puntoo mas caracteristico del juego, es el diseño y personalidad de sus personajes, no entiendo como este juego estuvo en una consola de nintendo, pero no son personajes atractivos sin mas sino que tienen sus personalidades y son simpaticos, mas de lo que esperaba para un juego de plataformas.
En general me gusto, me dejo sensaciones buenas aunque es muy sencillo (no especificamente en dificultad sino en diseño).

author: {'steamid': '76561198323912696', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 824, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 744, 'last_played': 1567070086}
review: Shantae and the Pirate's Curse is actually better than the prequel because they remixed the OSTs in the last game and made it better and the dungeon items were actually great too. Most of the islands were really awesome but some were really easy and finished it really quick. One pronblem is that you can't play with a controller in this game keep that in mind. Shantae and Risky are HOT!!!! My favorite NPC is Bolo ^_^ My overall is 9.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197999489902', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 731, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 731, 'last_played': 1547417158}
review: Great old-school inspired platformer. You don't need to have played the previous game to enjoy it, but the characters make many references to Shantae: Risky's Revenge and I wish I would have played that first to fully grasp the relationships between characters.

author: {'steamid': '76561198113084737', 'num_games_owned': 288, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 1263, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1201, 'last_played': 1616132412}
review:
The game that got me into the series, and man is it good. It's your standard metroidvania, but by late game you don't need to do much retracking because you gain insane mobility that allows you to skip most levels and be invincible at the same time.

The characters are great, as throughout the game you learn more about each side and main character, and what kind of a person (zombie?) they are.

The music is also great, and I think I'm actually addicted to the Sunburn Island theme. 
Seriously.
