author: {'steamid': '76561198283702736', 'num_games_owned': 91, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 673, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 630, 'last_played': 1581776208}
review:
没想到这游戏也通关了。当初其实不是特别喜欢这个画风的。
总体难度不是特别大，[spoiler] 除了最后boss前的陷阱关，不过我用了特殊方法所以跳过了。[/spoiler]
虽然大家都说女主很社保啊但我没啥感觉。
还有3dm翻译真的不行，官方也没出过中文。要是出中文的话销量绝对多很多，毕竟游戏质量在这。
弯刀的冲刺跑非常便利，用来赶路很合适。
另外还有很多人提到了倒数第二个岛屿开始，小怪就变得恶心起来，有些地方密集伤害又高，后期赶路很容易死在那。[spoiler]明明体力都快升最大值了[/spoiler]
还有手残就嗑药，嗑药流无敌orz
听说系列其它作品是有变身功能的，这代取消了[spoiler] 即剧情中主角失去了魔法[/spoiler]，稍微有点可惜，以后看看会不会玩同系列其他作品（最好还是出中文吧）
个人感觉是剧情不是特别吸引人(毕竟垃圾3dm机翻），攻击方式也比较传统，最后解锁真结局还得搜集全黑暗魔法（那东西不看攻略绝对会漏掉）所以只能说对我而言一般般吧。
但玩起来还是挺舒服的就是了，没有太难。这说明游戏质量是不错的。
所以推荐手残入[spoiler] 因为我就是[/spoiler]
[spoiler] 没有喜欢的萌妹子社保太可惜了[/spoiler]

review:
Probably my favorite Shantae game in it's series. Instead of using magic like transforming or shoot fire etc. like in other games, you'll get to play around with pirate weapons! Story was really well written and my experience with this game was amazing! Soundtracks are great as usual!

Definitely worth the price. Get it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010715702', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 100, 'playtime_forever': 694, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 664, 'last_played': 1546241747}
review:
I played Shantae Risky's Revenge before this, and I enjoyed that game quite a bit. 

But this game is just so much better. I had a blast playing through it. Very silly platformer game. A bit like Metroidvanias with a bit of backtracking and a bit like dungeon exploring like zelda games. Overall, a solid package that I would easily recommend to anyone. 

Just small note: I had a small bug where I had to force fullscreen with ALT+Enter for some reason, otherwise the graphic settings would never work properly, not a huge deal but just in case someone else gets this problem.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000903121', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 913, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 913, 'last_played': 1546375584}
review:
As a port they made some errors.  You can't go full screen mode without it throwing in extra frames and making the game go super fast.  They forgot to enable v-sync.  I also found a few specific locations where it likes to freeze inconsistently.
As a game... it's annoying.  I played through the first one and enjoyed it.  Considered doing a re-run to try for the alternative endings, or at least ending pics.  This one on the other hand... is just annoying.  The amount of re-treading required is just tedious and the monsters feel more like irritations rather than challenges.  Didn't enjoy this one nearly as much as the first.  It's "longer" but that's just because of the repeating of the same areas.  Life is too short, play the original and call it good.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066059380', 'num_games_owned': 213, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 10, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1545452511}
review:
I wanted to play this game. I really did. Unfortunately, my computer is TOO GOOD to run it properly. The speed at which the game runs is tied to the refresh rate, so if you have an NVIDIA GPU or a 120+ Hz monitor like I do, the game runs at a ludicrously high framerate and plays much faster than it should. So fast, in fact, that it is unplayable and literally hurt my eyes. I tried multiple fixes, but to no avail. This has apparently been an issue for years now, but every time someone asks about it on a forum, the developers just post the same old copypasta telling them to contact their support.

I requested a refund and thankfully got one. Don't bother buying it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992426032', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 6, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1545438712}
review:
If you have a decent PC/Monitor you will have a hard time playing this.

The games speed is set to the refresh rate, so unless you force an fps your gameplay is 100x faster than normal.

It's been raised multiple time, in multiple forums, with the only resposne from the developers saying raise a ticket.

Don't waste your time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198434921956', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1904, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1731, 'last_played': 1585083623}
review:
Shantae and the Pirate`s Curse, yo desconocia en su totalidad dicha saga de juegos, me tope con este titulo una tarde con amigos mientras hablabamos lo genial que eran los viejos tiempos, la simpleza, la belleza, las historias con conceptos extraños. Explorando por la Steam Store, me percate de este titulo, note que en su simpleza, nos cuenta una historia sin complejidad narrativa, así fue como surgio la idea de comprarlo, explorando por las distintas islas de su respectivo mundo, encontre un equilibrio entre colores, que resulta agradable ante los ojos, una trama simple, pero que se va estructurando con el pasar del tiempo, la importancia que tienen los objetos repartidos por los mundo, volvi a ser un niño con este juego.
Lo recomiendo en un %200, mas alla de que no te tomara mas de 10 horas explorar todo, es agradable el hecho de poder explorar, reir con los pequeños transfondos. Espero que a ustedes les logre llamar la atención, según a mí parecer, merece la pena.

-Gracias por leer-

author: {'steamid': '76561198044759091', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1193, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1193, 'last_played': 1543011830}
review:
Shantae and the Pirate's Curse is a neat platformer, featuring everyone's fevorite purple haired half-genie Shantae.

+ The gameplay mechanics are quite satisfying to perform.
+ The humorous writing is certainly alive and well.
+ The soundtrack will make you want to go idle just to have it playing in the background.
+ The added challenge of getting all of the game's colletibles and 4 different rewards for various kinds of game completion are quite enticing.
+ The characteristic wayforward artstyle (Both classic 2D and pixel) and roster of cute girls are nothing but swell eye-candy! the company should rename itself Waifu-Ward given the emphasis they make in their appealing female characters.

- Can't talk too highly of the dense backtracking you'll be performing tho, as even for a metroidvania kinda game, some of the hints as to where you should be heading next are quite vague or contrived. You'll be taking quite a few trips to islands you already vissited, good thing is they don't require you to go too far into them like their respective dungeons in order to get the goodies you now have access to.
- Some platforming sections demand a certain degree of unfair logic leaping.

Overall, a really cool game well worth your time and money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198126752030', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 627, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 627, 'last_played': 1541872898}
review:
Sorprende para bien. En primer lugar parece que va a resultar ser un juego sencillo, como los de GBA o algo parecido, pero conforme vamos jugando vemos que no es de este modo, sino que tiene más profundidad de lo esperado, puede que tengamos la sensación de que es un metroidvania clásico, y tal vez sea así, pero todo lo hace tan bien que finalmente estamos ante un juego sin fisuras, que no falla, no cansa y cada vez engancha más si cabe.

Con respecto al juego en sí, saber que podemos mejorar nuestro daño, salud, obtenemos nuevos golpes, habilidades... como esperaríamos de un buen metroidvania, y tiene una historia bastante buena, aunque lo mejor de ésta es la forma en que la cuenta, con un humor muy bien metido y algunos momentos subiditos de tono ;)

La duración es de unas 10 horas para completarlo al 100%, pero si vais directamente al lío lo podéis terminar un par de horas antes. Eso sí, si queréis todos los logros multiplicad esta duración por 5 porque es un juego muy rejugable.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966511621', 'num_games_owned': 1216, 'num_reviews': 609, 'playtime_forever': 379, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 379, 'last_played': 1540782663}
review:
SatPC is a retro-style platformer. You're a lady in a bikini top who joins forces with another lady in a bikini top to fight a bad guy. The levels are colourful, the music is nice, gameplay is smooth, dialogue is fun and there's a nice variety in enemies. It also has too much backtracking, an annoying save system, a boring bossfight and some crappy level design. I quit after 45 minutes because i fell down 4-5 screens and i was too annoyed to climb back up.

All in all, SatPC is a mediocre game. If you want to play a decent Metroidvania game with boring combat, get it on sale. Otherwise, don't bother.

author: {'steamid': '76561198260531237', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 134, 'playtime_forever': 622, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 622, 'last_played': 1539327286}
review:
비교 대상이 최근작인 샨테 하프 지니 히어로 뿐인데.
하프지니 히어로와 비교하자면 좀 더 복잡하고 어려운 편이다. 
특히 키 아이템의 활용이 무척이나 짜증난다. 

게임 자체는 그렇게 도드라지지 않지만 샨테 시리즈 특유의 귀여움이 넘쳐나니 추천. 
한패도 있고 다 좋은데 시스템 이슈가 제법 있는 편이니 사전에 잘 알아보고 플레이를 하자.

author: {'steamid': '76561198094891999', 'num_games_owned': 45, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 5238, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2659, 'last_played': 1701028005}
review:
After playing this game for more than 40 hours, I think I can finally write a review on this one.
Where do I even begin?

First of all, this is a mix between a metroidvania and a platformer.
In this game, you don't transform into animals like in the other games, but you use some nice pirate gear!
You may play Risky's Revenge before this one, but it isn't necesarry at all.

I won't tell you the story here, I think it'd be best if you play the game and get to experience the story without just reading through everything.
The gameplay revolves around using your brain to think, using Shantae's hair to whip bad guys, and using pirate gear to help you in your quest and to reach new areas.

[h1][b]Pros:[/b][/h1]
[u]- Great gameplay[/u]
I like how you use your hair as a weapon, for starters. Pirate gear is great, and can be used in many ways! Screw this, I can't write all the gameplay here! Just go play it already!

[u]- Very responsive controls[/u]
They are a bit tough to get used to (because this game was originally on Nintendo 3DS), but they are responsive, and are never the ones to blame when you get hit.

[u]- MUSIC IS SO FKIN GOOD MAN (thanks to Jake Kaufman)[/u]
As someone who went into music school for 10 years, I think I have at least a little bit of credibility to talk about music, and oh man is it amazing. The tunes represent the environment perfectly, they are catchy, the selection of instruments is great, I especially like how some themes have a distinct Middle-Eastern feel to them and, oh, did I mention how all the characters dance to the rhytm of the music?

[u]- Awesome jokes (and 4th wall breaks, what even is the 4th wall anymore?)[/u]
Just look at Squid Baron. He tears down the 4th wall like paper!

[u]- Sequin land is lively and colorful, and I really like the sprites. Oh, and did i mention how gorgeous character portraits are?[/u]
I think this one speaks for itself.

[u]- Loads of various references (good luck getting all of them xD)[/u]
There's a freaking HE-MAN in there!!! Need I say more?

[u]- All the characters have a personality that is unique to them, and they really feel like they are full of life, not like your generic 'i have to kill this because of that' protagonist[/u]
Yes, Shantae does have to save the world, but it doesn't seem like it's the only thing in her head.

[u]- Cute girls! Cute monstergirls too![/u]
You might get distracted, watch out! Or, even better, watch them walking around and watch their breasts bounce up 'n' down!

[h1][b]Cons:[/b][/h1]

[u]- The game runs at light speed on 120 and 144hz monitors.[/u]
To fix this, just set your monitor's refresh rate to 60. I don't know how to do this exactly, but you can search around in steam discussions, there is a solution

[u]- umm.... idk?[/u]

[u]- batgirls are too sexy, i can't concentrate and i keep getting hit by their weapons while they just taunt me by spanking their butts[/u]

[u]- Squidsmith doesn't have a character portrait ([strike] but she does have the biggest rack hehe[/strike])[/u]

[u]- this game isn't popular enough... [/u]

No, seriously, I can't really find anything else that is bad, except maybe that some collectibles can be hidden too well and very hard to find. Then again, I needed no guides for a 100% run.

[h1]I've noticed that people who don't like this game usually say some of the things below:[/h1] (be wary, might contain some offensive language)

[u]- The last dungeon is too difficult![/u]
Look, I'm not great at platformers, but after a bit of practice it all gets much better. Patience, timing and thinking are the key to everything in that final dungeon. You will fail quite a few times, but if my 12yo bro completed it, you can too (unless you have an injury that's preventing you from playing). Trust me, you don't want to give up at the very end!

[u]- The characters are oversexualized![/u]
People get mad when beautiful girls are in a game, people get mad when not so beautiful girls are in a game... Ignore those people. They don't know what they're missing out on. And what if the characters are sexy and/or cute? I personally think this is a great thing (watch as I get attacked by feminazis or something). That's how Shantae games are, it's the WayForward style. I like cute girls. There, I said it. 

[u]- I hAte bACKtRackINg!!11![/u]
Ok, that is a valid point, but this is just personal preference. If you absolutely don't want to visit any section of the game more than once, then go play another game. A cake with walnuts isn't bad because you hate walnuts. The game isn't bad because you hate backtracking.

[u]- This game is too easy![/u]
I bet you farmed 999 gems in that area at Tan Line Temple. Great job, you achieved nothing. Or you always use certain 3 items at once, and then proceed to wreck everything. Try beating bosses with NO ITEMS. Or maybe try completing the entire game without any health upgrades! There's even an achievement for that! Set your own difficulty! If you think the game is still too easy after that, then it's all right. You might enjoy a dying simulator like Cuphead, or [strike]casul souls [/strike] Dark Souls.

[u]- THERE IS A TYPO ON THE MAIN MENU OMG[/u]
WayForward probably decided to let this typo stay there for the memes. And it's cool and good. If you don't like the game because of THIS, you are just joking lol come on I know it.



[b]Let's sum this all up and rate the game![/b]
[table]
    [tr]
        [td]Gameplay[/td]
        [td]9/10[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Music[/td]
        [td]10/10[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Art/Graphics[/td]
        [td]8/10[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Difficulty[/td]
        [td]Depends on how you play. I'd estimate it to be at 7.5/10[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Story[/td]
        [td]This isn't a story-heavy game, but it's really nice. I'd say 7/10[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Girls[/td]
        [td]11/10[/td]
    [/tr]
[/table]



I never spent this much time on a platformer in my life. And I've enjoyed EVERY SECOND of it. Looks like I'll be playing more of this! I highly recommend buying this game if you're a fan of metroidvanias or platformers, and even if you're not, I still recommend buying it. Enjoy!

author: {'steamid': '76561198135195469', 'num_games_owned': 229, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 938, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 937, 'last_played': 1540145068}

author: {'steamid': '76561198017702328', 'num_games_owned': 1246, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 758, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 758, 'last_played': 1538831318}
review:
I wasn't sure about this game initially. It starts out very easy and the anime/boobs element gave me a bad initial impression.

It turns out, however, that this is an excellent game.

The graphics are superb with well composed music and sound effects throughout the game. The dialogue and characters are unique and funny. The gameplay can be challenging and is always fun. There is a good amount of replay value in going for the speedrunning and 100% achievements. The artwork is also charming and entertaining.

There are a few minor issues with the difficulty curve where some sections are very easy which can lead into others which are very hard. The game as a standalone also leaves the player a bit out of the loop with the story and characters but ultimately this game is highly recommend if you like 'Metroidvanias'.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079561962', 'num_games_owned': 399, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 226, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 226, 'last_played': 1537752635}
review:
It may be the best Shantae has to offer, but that still isn't enough. If you want a decent platformer to pass the time with, it's that. It does have some pretty good elements and moments. But if you want a truly good and compelling game, or a metroidvania or exploration game in any respect, I can't recommend it.

I went into this expecting a metroidvania, i.e. (for me, in this case) a game where the main driving point is exploration, expanding your moveset and using that moveset to overcome ever-more complex platforming and/or combat challenges. I don't particularly care for the aesthetic elements but they're alright - the story is kinda cute, there's some waifu bait if that's your thing, the pixel art and animations are good (very generic though) and the music is ok. The platforming is smooth enough, and the combat, be it against enemies or bosses, is simple but fairly effective. This is all fine and good as elements complementary to exploration, but sadly that element is poorest of all.

The game is level-based, with distinct islands that you go to from a level select screen. Some parts of each level will be locked off until you get later powerups. There's no non-linearity, no meaningful backtracking or re-using of areas, and no exploration (there's almost always just one path to go, with that path sometimes being locked until you talk to an NPC on a different island so you have to walk there first). In fact, I'd say the metroidvania elements work against the game, as the forced backtracking fucks over the pacing and the way forward is often unintuitive on top of being a few minutes of boring traversal away. The game is also thouroughly unchallenging so far, and if you backtrack to get heart squids as fast as you can then it can be easier yet. The bosses are simplistic, the enemies even more so, and I can't even think of a part that I would define as a proper platforming challenge.

I have many nitpicks and a few more general issues (like with saving and healing), but I don't think there's much need for it. The game is boring and fails to hook me with any of its elements, and isn't good enough on a whole that I can recommend it as a well-rounded action-adventure platformer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082820352', 'num_games_owned': 1168, 'num_reviews': 122, 'playtime_forever': 2400, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2400, 'last_played': 1558818511}
review:
[h1]Сюжет.[/h1]

Сюжет игры продолжает историю прошлой части. На этот раз Шантэль объединится со своим заклятым врагом королевой пиратов Риски, чтобы остановить еще более могущественного врага. Но поиграть за пиратку не дадут. А в конце игры будут подвязки для следующей части.

Помимо старых и уже полюбившихся по прошлым играм серии персонажей мы встретим и новых, которые не менее интересны и забавны.

[h1]Куда делась моя магия?! Кому нужна магия, когда есть пиратские артефакты![/h1]

Мир изменился, магии джиннов больше нет. Из старой магии остались только сферы, которые крутятся вокруг главной героини. Теперь их надо покупать в магазине как расходуемый предмет. Появился пузырь, который будет блокировать все дальние атаки вражин, и сильный удар ногой с разворота, который не такой быстрый как у Брюса Ли.

Перевоплощение в других живых существ было заменено на сбор пиратских артефактов, после нахождения каждого из которых Шанти получает дополнительную способность (стрельба из пистолета, быстрый бег а-ля самый быстрый человек на земле и тп.).

В магазине помимо обычных зелий для восстановления здоровья появились авто-зелья, которые будут юзаться сами, когда ваши хпшки достигнут нуля. Классные бутылки так-то. Также у торговца можно будет покупать пиратские сигналки, которые смогут быстро телепортировать вас к кораблю Риски, однако их нельзя будет заюзать в любом месте; апгрейд пиратских артефактов, силы и скорости обычной атаки; а еще супер-пупер молочко, которое временно увеличит наш урон. С таким молочком каждый босс будет убиваться очень быстро.

[h1]Враги и боссы.[/h1]

В этой части мы столкнемся со старыми и новыми врагами. Боссов стало больше, а еще они стали разнообразнее. Из врагов будет падать не только голдишка, но и различная еда, которую можно будет съесть и восполнить здоровье.

[h1]Прогресс на [strike]яйцо[/strike] лицо.[/h1]

1) Игра обзавелась большим количество локаций, следовательно и ее продолжительность увеличилась. Мир игры поделен на острова, каждый из которых состоит из территории и подземелья.

2) Купить карту больше нельзя, зато можно найти карту каждого острова. Теперь она выполнена в классическом для метроидваний виде.

3) Графически игра стала выглядеть лучше. Наконец-то можно будет сделать отображение игры на полный экран без растягивания картинки.

4) Шантайка стала шутить и подкалывать других персонажей гораздо чаще.

5) Максимальное количество хп выросло с 6 до 10 сердец, так как теперь некоторые вражки могут снести вам за удар сразу несколько сердечек.

6) Не забыли и про отсылки. Чего только стоит великолепная отсылка к Хи-Мену.

[h1]Концовки и приятный бонус.[/h1]

В игре есть 2 концовки: обычная и тру энд. В тру энде у последнего босса будет несколько форм. Скажи привет jrpg!

Если пройти игру и выполнить определенные условия (пройти игру в течение 2 часов и пр.), то можно получить различные обои, которые можно поменять на стартовом экране при выборе слота для сохранения. Мелочь, а приятно. =)

[h1]Ачивки и больше челленджа.[/h1]

Эта игра, как и прошлая в этой игровой серии, не сложная, ачивок стало побольше, некоторые из них могут бросить вам вызов: это 2 спидранчика и убийство каждого босса без получения урона.

На этот раз дополнительным режимом станет Пиратский мод, в котором нам будут доступны все пиратские артефакты с  самого начала игры, но, к большому сожалению, другого костюма нам не дадут.

[h1]В поисках вещей.[/h1]

В этой части можно будет заняться собирательством:

1) темной магии, которая нужна для выхода на настоящую концовку;

2) осьминожеков, которые нужны для увеличения максимального количества здоровья.

[h1]Музончик и озвучка.[/h1]

У каждого острова и подземелья своя музыка, которая отлично в них вписывается. Озвучки в игре все еще нет, но она все еще указана на странице игры (редкая озвучка 1-2 слов от Шанти не считается полноценной озвучкой).

[b]Моя оценка[/b] этой игре [b]10[/b] пиратских проклятий из [b]10[/b] принцесс пустынного острова. Игра стала гораздо лучше по сравнению со своей предшественницей. Так держать, WayForward!

author: {'steamid': '76561198037628843', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 665, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 302, 'last_played': 1534911375}
review:
Half-genie hero를 사려다가 일부러 the pirate's curse를 먼저 구매했다.
후술하겠지만 pre-play나 streaming등으로 봤을 때 시리즈 특유의 단점들이 노골적으로 보였기 때문이다.
그럼에도 불구하고 Shantae 시리즈 자체는 충분히 추천할만한 게임이긴 하다.

시리즈 작품 전반적으로 artistic work자체는 매우 뛰어나다. 
특히나 캐릭터 디자인이 매우 뛰어나다.
주인공이 귀엽고 깜찍한 샨테다. 더 말이 필요한가?

음악부분도 엄청나다고 할 순 없지만 아라비안 분위기에 알맞는 재미있고 알맞는 음악이 조화를 이루며, sound effect나 간간히 들리는 캐릭터 보이스도 잘 어울린다.

이 게임은 다음에 해당하는 사람에게 권한다.

1. 큰 스트레스 없이 여가를 즐기듯이 여행하듯이 게임하기를 원하는 사람
2. 초창기 수퍼마리오 시리즈 수준으로 단순명료하고 크게 머리 쓰지 않는 게임을 원하는 사람
3. 깊이있는 내용이나 하드코어한 요소, 높은 난이도의 게임을 싫어하는 사람
4. 게임 캐릭터의 행위/액션 보다는 비주얼적인 요소를 즐기고 싶은 사람

게임 자체는 메트로배니아를 표방하고 있지만 사실상 메트로배니아라고 하기는 무리가 있는 게임이다. 적대 NPC들의 AI는 지극힌 단조로우며, 다른 평가자의 shantae 시리즈 평가에도 보이듯이 메트로배니아에서 요구하는 일종의 방랑과 탐험보다는 사실상 단조로운 one-way adventure에 가까운 플레이 형태를 보인다. 쉽게 말해 굉장히 단순하고 단조롭다. 실상 단순 플랫포머 게임에 매우 가깝다. 

그런 의미에서 어떤 측면으론 완성도가 높다고 볼 수는 있다. 
쉽고 아기자기하고 게임을 통해 도전보다는 쉽고 유쾌한 액션, 귀여운 캐릭터들의 재롱, 4차원의 벽을 종종 뛰어넘는 캐릭터들의 개그와 만담을 즐길 수 있는 특정 스펙트럼에 최적화된 게임이다. 그러나 이쪽으로 타겟팅된 게임이 얼마나 많은 사람들한테 어필할 수 있을지에 대해서는 의문이다. 

지금이 90년대라면 이정도로도 충분히 어필할 수 있는 게임이겠지만 비슷한 목표로 제작된 게임이나 대체제로 선택할 수 있는 게임들은 너무나도 많다. "Shantae"라는 점과 여기에 따라붙는 몇가지 개성들 + 일부 "artistic-works"를 빼고는 "게임"으로서의 개성이나 장점을 찾을 수 없다. 게임을 위해서 디자인이 있는 것보다 디자인을 위해서 게임이 있는 듯한 기묘한 느낌을 주는 게임이다.

이 게임 자체에서 더 이상의 단점이나 의미를 찾기보다는 이 시리즈가 앞으로 어떤 식으로 Shantae를 어필해나갈 것인지, 차기작들을 통해서 어떠한 게임을 구현해 보여줄 것인지가 더욱 문제일 것이다.

review:
Honestly, the game has promise, but whoever designed the difficulty curve needs to find a new job. The difficulty runs from very easy to no room for mistake in no time flat.
For most people just trying to slog through run run rottytops just isn't worth the effort. My replay of the game convinced me of how out of place and poorly designed this level is.

Unless you're looking for a lot of frustration and challenge, look elsewhere.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119649123', 'num_games_owned': 383, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1243, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 717, 'last_played': 1562543945}
review:
---{Graphics}---
☐ Masterpiece
☐ Beautiful
☑ Good
☐ Decent
☐ Will do
☐ Bad
☐ Awful

The pixel art sprite animation is beautiful and fluid. The non-pixel art character sprites for when they're talking can seem a bit strange at first, but you get used to them, and they are very well drawn. The only thing that stopped this from being one step higher was the backgrounds. They obviously haven't been redone from the 3DS version (which has a much lower res screen than most PCs) and, as they aren't pixel art and are instead pixel interpolated bitmap graphics, they look pretty terrible at 1080p.

---{Gameplay}---
☐ Try not to get addicted
☑ Very good
☐ Good
☐ Nothing special
☐ Ehh
☐ Bad
☐ Awful

It's a metroidvania. If you like those, chances are you'll like this one. Its charm and style is what sets it apart, which could turn away some metroidvania fans, but could also draw in non-fans, so it's a double-edged sword. That said, the controls are responsive, the unlockable gadgets are awesome (though it's missing the transformation dances that other Shantae games have), and the puzzles and hidden secrets are clever. 

Here's a pro tip: do not buy the unlockable abilities in the shop. The kick, the dodge, all garbage. Buy the upgrades though, like for your hair and the pistol and stuff, and BUY AUTO POTIONS AND PIRATE FLARES. ESPECIALLY PIRATE FLARES. They are so helpful. Also there's an infinite money generator in Tan-line Temple if you can find it ;)

---{Audio}---
☐ Eargasm
☑ Very good
☐ Good
☐ Decent
☐ Not too bad
☐ Bad
☐ Earrape

The music is a masterpiece. Best in the series, and this series is known for it's music. Jake Kaufman is a god in this realm, and he delivers once more. The music will be stuck in your head, and that isn't a bad thing. Better that than despacito :P
That said the voice acting is...strange. It's well done and well recorded (Christina V, this is not your fault) but the fact that most lines AREN'T voice acted is just awkward, I would have prefered no voice acting at all, so do yourselves a favor and turn it off if that bothers you. 

---{PC Requirements}---
☐ Check if you can run the calculator program
☐ Potato
☑ Minimum
☐ Decent
☐ Fast 
☐ Rich boy
☐ Needs 32 core processor/quantum cpu

I'm running this on a GTX 770 4GB so I actually have no clue, but my best guess is that I could probably run this on an Atom-powered Windows tablet and still get a playable framerate. Don't fret, those who game on toasters, this game is for you.

---{Difficulity}---
☐ Just press some buttons
☐ Easy
☐ Significant brain usage
☐ Easy to learn / Hard to master
☑ Not so easy
☐ Difficult
☐ Dark Souls

Though it might be the easiest in the series, it hasn't lost all of that old-school difficulty. It's perfect for those who like a challenge, but couldn't handle Dark Souls.

---{Story}---
☐ Epic
☐ Lovley
☑ Good
☐ Average
☐ Not great
☐ Better than nothing i suppose...
☐ Doesnt have

The story is paper-thin to put it lightly, but that's exactly what I love about it. It fits the style perfectly, and is amusing at every turn (just wait till you find the He-man references). There's even a part that almost brought me to tears (AND YES I KNOW I'M BEING A PUSSY BUT ROTTYTOPS I'M SO SORRY YOU'LL ALWAYS BE MY BFF)

---{Game Time}---
☐ Endless
☐ Very Long
☐ Long
☐ Depends on you
☑ Not too short
☐ Short
☐ Long enough for a cup of tea

Doesn't take long to 100%, but I feel it's just the right length. Any longer and it would have run out of clearly malicious things for Shantae to stare cluelessly at.

---{Price}---
☐ Buy now
☐ Consider to buy it
☐ Worth the price
☑ Wait for sale
☐ Maybe if you have some spare money left
☐ Do not buy it
☐ Do not throw money into a trash can

It's a bit much at full price considering its length and niche appeal, but buy it at $5+ off and you won't regret it.

---{Bugs}---
☐ Never had any
☐ Minor bugs
☐ Few bugs
☐ Some bugs
☑ Can get annoying
☐ Ruining the game
☐ The game itself is a bug

Occasionally it has an error at runtime that stops the game from launching. You fix it by repeatedly closing it and telling it to launch again. Not even kidding. If you get this error, just hit OK and launch the game again. I've got it as many as 5 times in a row but it launched on the 6th try. It also has graphical scaling issues if you try to run it in fullscreen (which is just borderless window) and then minimize it. Just generally try not to minimize this game, as it can also cause it to forget you were using a controller (and you WILL want a controller) and default back to its god awful KB&M configuration.

--{OVERALL}--
It's a great game and one of my all time favs. I guarantee that MOST people who play it will at the very least walk away with a pleasant experience. Or, hey, you might fall head over heels in love with it like I did. 
Do make sure to watch for the bugs, though, as they can get annoying. 
Also, make sure you have a controller (Xbox, Playstation, Steam, doesn't matter) but whatever you do, don't try to play it with your keyboard unless you're a huge masochist.

author: {'steamid': '76561198103641611', 'num_games_owned': 656, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 1060, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 946, 'last_played': 1699141482}
review:
This game is definitely in my favorites, but it is not perfect.

There is a typo on the menu.

"Exit" is missing the "x."

How the fuck do you do that?

Also, the speed the game runs at is dictated by the framerate. Make sure to enable vsync in your GPU settings, and set your refresh rate to 60hz, otherwise the game will run way too fast.

The only other issue I have is with the game's support team not responding to those two complaints. 

Oh, and Dagron is too hard for their position in the game.

But aside from those issues, this game is perfect. The writing is fun, the characters are well defined, the gameplay is rock-solid, and the level design is top tier. The animation needs a mention as well. There are SO MANY frames of animation. The devs really outdid themselves with this game. Shantae might not be able to transform this time, but the pirate gear makes her so much more manuverable comapred to the previous game that it gives you the same feeling of speed and power as the endgame of Morrowind.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076895182', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 651, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 651, 'last_played': 1531680342}
review:
I think the first time I had heard of Shantae was when I saw that one of her games could be purchased on my DSi, it looked interesting but I eventually forgot about it. Fastforward many years to this year's summer sale, several of the games I purchased couldn't run on my computer so I got refunds and had about 15 dollars to burn. I wanted to get something and I decided to grab this game as I had remembered me considering buying it all those years ago.

Anyway, the game itself. I for one had a blast playing this, the characters are cute and quirky, the enviroments neat, and gameplay is fun, and the humor/references are really over the top. Just how I like it, I got most of the obvious references including Castlevania, Megaman, Star Wars, and Masters of the Universe but I'm sure there's many more I missed. 

My biggest complaint would be the difficulty spike in the game, I got through the whole game without guides or outside help but in the final dungeon I had to look something up to make sure I was doing something right. Even then it got pretty frustrating. If I were to play through again I would probably stop once I reach the final dungeon, the final boss wasn't bad, it was the dungeon that was horrible. Apparently there's exploits to skip the entire dungeon? I think that might be my only complaint. A few other parts were kind of annoying but nothing too bad.

So yeah, while this game made me want to tear my hair out, I love it to bits. Now I need to keep my eye on the other games and wait for a sale.

review: A fine adventure to be had for all. There are flaws here and there, shallow characters and plot / worldbuilding revealed on a need-to-know basis, but that's hardly why people play platformers. I'll say that once you get the Pirate Hat (in the trailer so it isn't a spoiler) the platforming excepting specific challenge segments becomes a joke, but that aside challenging and rewarding throughout. Not to mention excellent sprite work and the bustiest designs to date (just shy of distastefulness).

author: {'steamid': '76561198291808207', 'num_games_owned': 242, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 680, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 504, 'last_played': 1531408951}
review:
如果没有Mud Bog Island和雪地狗那里死妈的伤害和敌人设计，我会给好评的。
雪地滑坡没法动弹必须撞狼，撞一次一颗心没了，呵呵。
也就女角色可以看看，但真的没意思，硬核玩家会觉得boss和跑关没意思，休闲玩家则是要频繁吃药。过于密集的怪和过高的伤害哪种玩家都不会喜欢，因为这绝对不是提高难度的正确方式。
另外作为一个动作游戏真不知道为什么要设置这么多按键，明明是模仿恶魔城的游戏，却完全没学好。踢腿（这还是个废物技能）为什么不做成↑+攻击？下落为什么不做成↓+攻击？

author: {'steamid': '76561198072737409', 'num_games_owned': 516, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 1095, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1056, 'last_played': 1561672888}
review:
[h1]Warning: This review contains spoilers. You've been warned.[/h1]

The third entry in the acclaimed Shantae series, revolving around the cute half-genie with the same name.

[b]Story:[/b]

The game takes place an unspecified amount of time after the previous game, Risky's Revenge. Shantae, [spoiler]having lost her magic powers to a magic lamp from her nemesis[/spoiler] is now trying to live with the fact that she's fully human. Suddenly, one morning, she awakens to the sound of cannon fire. As it turns out, the Ammo Baron, one of Sequin Land's four barons, has launched a military offensive against Scuttle Town, her hometown. Shantae, being the town's protector, fights back the baron and his army as well as she can. Eventually, she defeats him in a showdown.

But as it turns out, the Ammo Baron has actually bought the town legally from the mayor, and Shantae is therefore arrested on the grounds of having attacked the town's legal owner. Feeling confused by the whole situation, Shantae goes back to her home to cope with the whole thing by taking a long, warm bath...

But, she reminds herself that she doesn't own a bathtub, and as it turns out, it's a trap laid by her nemesis, Risky Boots. After some clear-up, Risky tells Shantae that her men, the Tinkerbats, have been transforming into vicious Cacklebats, which she deduces as being the result of her former mentor, the Pirate Master, slowly but surely gaining enough power to resurrect himself. Reluctantly, Shantae and Risky form a temporary alliance in order to stop his resurrection and save Sequin Land from certain doom. But, will they be able to do it in time? Play the game to find out.

To not spoil too much, the game's story is intriguing from the moment you begin the game, and only gets better the further you get in the game. It follows a red thread very well, and every character you come across ends up contributing to the plot, even if they may seem minor.

[b]Gameplay:[/b]

Shantae and the Pirate's Curse is a Metroidvania-designed game. The game is played from a 2D platformer perspective, and you control Shantae, the eponymous half-genie. There is plenty of exploration to do, but many times you often need a special item in order to access certain areas. But the game is very pleasant and helpful with the backtracking, as you're always given clues where to go when you need to return to a former place to advance the story.

What sets the game apart from other Metroidvanias is that, rather than having a big, interconnected world, Pirate's Curse instead opts for 6, smaller islands that the player will go through on their quest. This works in favor of the game as it keeps each section small enough not to be overwhelming, but still offer plenty of exploration.

Each island hides a dungeon as well, similiar to Zelda. The dungeons are generally not very long, but they offer a change of pace and at the end of each one, you fight a boss, each one requiring a different strategy to defeat.

As you play through the game, you will find 5 pirate items that belong to Risky herself. These items give Shantae new attacks and/or abilities, such as being able to run faster or jump multiple times in the air. This part in particular is where Pirate's Curse blows the other Shantae games out of the water. They instead offered animal transformations, that let Shantae transform into animals that allowed her to navigate around the world in different ways. Problem is, they required the player to physically stop moving Shantae and perform specific actions, which slowed the pace down. The pirate items on the other hand, only requires you to press a button and Shantae will immediately use them, keeping the game's pace consistant.

The difficulty of the game feels consistant and doesn't get any sudden spikes or drops. The only exception would be the very final dungeon before the final boss, which contains multiple platforming sections where you're not given a lot of room for mistakes. Apart from that though, the game never goes cheap or too easy on you.

Overall, the gameplay is very solid.

[b]Presentation:[/b]

The game uses an interesting mix of pixel-based graphics and HD art. A lot of the graphical assets in the game are re-used from the previous game, Risky's Revenge, particularily Shantae's and many of the sprites for the enemies.

Whenever major conversations occur in the game, hand drawn character portraits show up on the side of the screen, whether it'd be left or right. The portraits are very finely drawn and does a good job of representing each character and their feelings in each situation. Though you may or may not find that they clash with the pixel-based design of the rest of the game.

Every island also looks different from the last one to keep things fresh, from the middle-eastern inspired design of Scuttle Town to the cold, icy Frostbite Island. It's enough to make you want to discover each of them.

The game also features plenty of "fanservice". Shantae herself can be considered fanservice personified with her choice of clothing, and the game also has a few instances of "adult humor". The biggest contender for this is [spoiler]Tan Line Temple, where Shantae gets mistaken for a princess and put into a VERY revealing chain-mall bikini[/spoiler]. Personally, i had nothing against this and in fact found it quite amusing. That being said, if you're not very fond of innuendos or scantily clad women, this game may not be for you.

Lastly, the sound. We'll begin with the music, and it's safe to say, the Shantae series as a whole has some of the best music ever composed for games. Every track fits perfectly for each situation that they play in, and many of them also qualify as ear worms, in that they do not leave your brain after you listen to them.

Voice work, there's not a whole lot of voice acting in the game. The only character who talks is Shantae herself, voiced by Cristina Vee. However, she has no full lines of dialogue, only grunts and small lines of dialogue. If you buy this expecting a huge line of professional voice actors to suck you in with their performances, you'll be disappointed.

Overall, the game has a very nice presentation. It screams passion and feels right at home on a Nintendo console.

[b]Controls:[/b]

Control-wise, Pirate's Curse is a dream. Shantae controls very tightly, regardles if she's on the ground or in the air. She does not suffer from any momentum, instead she comes to a complete stop when you stop inputting the direction you want her to go in. This makes platforming very tight and particularily makes jumping from platform to platform easier compared to many other similiar games.

That being said, having played the game originally on the Wii U, getting used to the PC port's lack of a secondary screen to check the map on took some time getting used to. Granted, there isn't much WayForward can do about this, as attempting a similiar thing on the PC would be very difficult.

Another major issue is that controls for controllers cannot be rebound, you are stuck to a pre-defined config. It works fine, but not giving users the option is a big oversight. Keyboard controls can be reconfigured though.

[b]Conclusion:[/b]

To conclude the review, Shantae and the Pirate's Curse is amongst the best Metroidvania games of all time, and is a jolly load of fun. Colorful graphics, fun gameplay, ear wormy soundtrack and engaging story all help make this game worth playing. It screams passion to me and has showed WayForward is a very talented company. Apart from some minor nitpicks, it's worth every cent it costs.

Final Score: 9/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052772779', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 3502, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1278, 'last_played': 1530292086}
review:
Shantae and the Pirate’s Curse picks up where Risky’s Revenge left off, with Shantae still effectively human. The town is getting bulldozed by its Mayor, Ammo Baron (yes, he’s still Mayor) and you decide to stop him. Unfortunately, this is effectively rebellion, so you get a court summons. While under house arrest, you uncover a lead into the revival of the Pirate King and decide to stop it. Who cares about court summons, amirite?

I’ll say outright that Pirate’s Curse is better than Risky’s Revenge. It maintains the quirky design and pleasing aesthetic of the first game.  It decided to go full 2D this time though, so that’s an improvement in my books. The movement feels so much more fluid and the movement options unlocked throughout the game feel better. You get a glide, a dash, and an extra triple jump… which you lose… in the final boss fight… because design decisions.

What I find most amusing is that this game sorta solves the problems of Risky’s Revenge while also adopting some problems that the old problem solved. The backtracking is less insufferable. Might be level design making it a bit more enjoyable to go through them. Luckily the backtracking is mitigated in Pirate mode (unlocked after beating the game once). Honestly, what might have fixed it for me in backtracking might be the addition of a new item called “Pirate’s Flare” which is effectively an escape rope. Tired of a map’s BS? Get out of the labyrinth and flare back to base. Speaking of items, they’ve rebalanced the items to be less broken and now none of them are required to unlock certain areas. Health drops regularly (if you’re killing enemies) and you can use these drops whenever you like instead of immediately.

There are few things more frustrating than entering a screen only to get knocked back because instant dash enemy. Yet here we are. Insufferable stealth section and the climb to the final boss is a series of spike traps that exist purely to try my patience. No enemies. Just spikes. And lord save you if you game ogre there because the save point is not between spike hells but rather at the beginning and at the end. Bring all of the potions.

Let’s talk about the final boss fight. Now in Risky’s Revenge, I didn’t really dock points for the game taking away all of your transformations because they weren’t really used for combat. The time required to dance for them took away from the pacing anyway. However, in this game, most of your upgrades are movement upgrades. Which means you don’t pause to use them and you’ve been using them the entire game. And they were instrumental in spike pit hell because each puzzle room was set up to utilize a specific upgrade. So by the time you’ve gotten to the boss, you’re pretty used to using them like, all the time. You get to use them for phase 1 of the boss. Then the boss takes them away. Then you have to deal with phase 2 with limited movement. Then phase 3 which is phase 2 with some extra patterns. And phase 4 which can be cancer because it’s not the same kind of combat you had been doing all game.

Look, the final boss is a test. A test on all of the skills we’ve obtained up until now. You don’t teach us all of the math required to do the exam and then give us a stinkin’ psychology exam instead of a math exam. That’s completely unfair to the player

But when the game works, it works. Pirate Mode (again, unlocked after playing through the game one) is a great replay option if you’re into that sorta thing. The game is legitimately enjoyable and the characters are as delightful as ever. I’m going to give this game a pass, but not by much. Be prepared

author: {'steamid': '76561198326768840', 'num_games_owned': 1904, 'num_reviews': 130, 'playtime_forever': 39, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1657346807}

author: {'steamid': '76561197985638987', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 98, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1511729739}
review:
The best game in the franchise.

A speedrunner's dream, but also a great game for casual platforming fans. This title manages to have excellent level design throughout the entire journey, with fast-paced boss battles as well. There's definite replayability too, with multiple endings for  item collecting and speedrunning (similar to Metroid games) and an absurdly fun mode where you can start the game with all your unlocked powers. 

The soundtrack is excellent (Jake Kaufman does it again) and even the voice acting isn't bad either. If you're new to sidescrollers or the Shantae franchise as a whole, this is a great starting point.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054438593', 'num_games_owned': 1158, 'num_reviews': 106, 'playtime_forever': 587, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 587, 'last_played': 1530137113}
review:
Shantae revive claramente con estilo propio y en buena forma el espiritu de los juegos estilo "metroidvania" como le llaman al género hoy. 
Tiene una jugabilidad muy buena y mecanicas para nada complejas, con el clásico mapa dividido en secciones, secretos, backtracking, habilidades, dinamica del pj muy fluida, jefes de zona, variedad de enemigos, finales alternativos, hasta al utilizar la pistola parece un buen megaman. Claramente bebe de los buenos juegos clásicos de la era de los 16 bits.
Graficamente es muy vistoso, el pixel art es muy bueno al igual que el dibujo de caricatura de los personajes. 
La historia acompaña bien, tiene un humor apto para todo público. 
La curva de dificultad es correcta, es recomendable el uso de joypad.
Se echa de menos un par más de stages/islas para extender la duración. 

Recomendado para todo público y en especial a los seguidores de este género. 
Valoración personal "8/10"

author: {'steamid': '76561198311931480', 'num_games_owned': 84, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 2166, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1028, 'last_played': 1623682230}
review:
Very great game.
It somehow makes the game better by removing shantae's shapeshifting ability. Instead they put in risky's hat, pistol and scimitar to find hidden areas that were inaccesable before. The soundtrack is great and the game controls very nicely. I also like the added challenge of finding all the bats and heart squids.  However, the backtracking can be a bit tedious and is sometimes time-consuming and uses mostly trial and error. While the backtracking can be annoying, i highly recommend this game for people who like a bit of challenge but also like classic 2d platformers

author: {'steamid': '76561198333005214', 'num_games_owned': 33, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1987, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1889, 'last_played': 1542920571}
review:
Love the game, it has pretty much everything you could want in a platformer. The characters are awesome, the music is awesome, the gameplay is top notch and fun, and there's plenty of secrets to be found. The pacing is also done pretty well, and the story can be pretty funny at times. This ranks right up there as one of the best platformers I've ever played.

The only downside for me is probably the same as everyone else's. [spoiler]I despised the last dungeon, just because it goes from the awesome dungeon formula in the previous ones, to a rather unwanted "walls of death everywhere" trial-and-error endurance course. It literally went from Zelda, to Touhou.[/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198273011256', 'num_games_owned': 3040, 'num_reviews': 715, 'playtime_forever': 1212, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1145, 'last_played': 1529739950}
review:
[h1]:D[/h1]

Los juegos de Shantae siempre son consistentes en algo: su calidad.

>A grandes rasgos: Pues es la secuela del primer titulo y a la fecha su mejor jueguito(el 3 peca mucho de su duracion); los niveles estan mejor elaborados y las skills mas op, el humor queda intocable y los bosses siguen siendo de patron.

>Lo bueno:
-Pues es un titulo que brisha por lo bien que esta hecho, en cuanto pixel art animaciones, musica y detallitos.
-El ost esta decente
-El gameplay bonito 
-Cada nivel bien hecho
-Manejas a uno de los personajes mas op y lindos que los metroidvanias pueden tener.

>Lo malo:
-puede volverse demasiado facil... si mejoras todo y grindeas como loco.
-la duracion (que los juegos de chanto, nunca duran mucho) a lo mucho 5-6hrs

[h1]Resumiendo:[/h1]
Pues... los juegos de Shantae son de los titulos metroidvania mas "amigables" que puedes adquirir; por lo facil que lo puedes volver en cuanto a su gameplay, y siempre se caracterizan por la calidad artistica que le meten a los escenarios y personajes, en este caso esta entrega es la mejorcita que lleva nuestra bella genio~♥ 8/10 en cuanto a balance duracion/calidad/gameplay. 
Recomendado si buscas un titulo decente dentro del genero.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014900142', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 627, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 627, 'last_played': 1529681091}
review:
Shantae and The Pirate's Curse is an excellent platform adventure game made in the 16-bit era console style. Compared to a previous game of the series Shantae: Risky's revenge, the map desing is a more simple, but there's more maps to play. story is simple and stright forward, Puzzles are challenging, but not frustrating, couple levels just before the final boss are quite difficult.
The pixel art and music are very typical for game that tries to look like late 90's adventure platformer, and if you like that kind of style this is a game for you. It should take about 10 hours to get to the final boss and collect most of the hidden treasures so not a huge undertaking that takes weeks to complete.

author: {'steamid': '76561198202246471', 'num_games_owned': 98, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1501, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1125, 'last_played': 1653405097}
review:
[h1]LANGUES DU JEU :[/h1]
[list]
[*]Français (French)
[*]Allemand (Dutch)
[*]Anglais  (English)
[*]Espagnol (Spanish)
[/list]
[i](MAJ depuis 2015) [/i]

[h1]AVIS :[/h1]

[i]Shantae and the Pirate's Curse[/i] est un jeu de plateforme, aventure et action, haut en couleur, entrainant. 
Jeu terminé à 100%, je n'ai rien à redire de négatif.
La difficulté n'est pas trop difficile ni trop facile mais néanmoins les épreuves sont originales.

L'univers me plait beaucoup. J'avais déjà entendu parler de Shantae mais c'est avec cet opus que j'ai pu commencer à découvrir cet univers. J'en suis devenue fan. 
Je compte d'ailleurs continuer l'aventure avec les prochains opus et les précédents !

Ce jeu est un pur concentré de bien-être !

author: {'steamid': '76561198083698727', 'num_games_owned': 133, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 144, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 123, 'last_played': 1524505475}
review: Let me just clarify that I am giving the game a bad review due to personal prefrence not because I think it was a poorly made game. After playing Hollow Knight I wanted to find another metroidvania style game that I could immerse myself with. However, after playing this game for two hours I realized this was not the game for me. The gameplay and controls have nothing wrong with them, and the animation and sound track are both well done. However, the pacing of the game was two slow for me, after completing the first two area's slow and at times tedious platforming puzzles and fighting two forgetable bosses I was still not ready to give up on the game. It wasnt until it threw me into a stealth section that was confusingly difficult and required you to start from the begining everytime you were caught that I finally gave up. A well made game just not for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116482292', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 173, 'playtime_forever': 1226, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1226, 'last_played': 1592113620}
review:
【言語】英語
【難易度】普通
【実績難易度】普通
【実績コンプリート時間】20時間

海外の名作萌えアクション・Shantae シリーズの3作目です。
探索要素のある、いわゆる『メトロイドヴァニア』系アクションになります。
今作はオープンワールドではなくステージ選択型になりました。

Steamで前作 Shantae: Risky's Revenge と新作の Shantae: Half-Genie Hero が発売されています。

Shantae シリーズの中では一番バランスが取れている作品です。
難易度は少し抑えめなカジュアルアクションですが、ステージ構成やギミックが凝っていてプレイヤーを飽きさせないように、とても丁寧に作られています。
また前作に比べてキャラクターが機敏に動くようになり、動かしていて本当に楽しい。

今作のポイントは前作まであった『変身ダンス』が無くなり、アイテムを取得して主人公がパワーアップしていくタイプになりました。
これによりノンストップで直感的に操作できるようになり、全体的にストレスの少ない作りになっています。
個人的にはシリーズの中で一番好きです。

残念なのは、やはり前作に引き続き Steam 版は英語だという事。
ストーリーが理解できないと面白さも半減しますし、次に行く場所が分からなくなる人もいるでしょう。
一応こちらもコンシューマーの N3DS・Wii U・PS4 版で完全日本語化されています。

大変クオリティの高い大好きな作品なので、ぜひ遊んで欲しいですね。

author: {'steamid': '76561198301073674', 'num_games_owned': 233, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 1686, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1686, 'last_played': 1528386655}

author: {'steamid': '76561197994042980', 'num_games_owned': 837, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 789, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 789, 'last_played': 1527459572}
review:
Shantae and the Pirate's Curse it's a 2D sidescroller platformer inspired by the old Genesis and Snes era, it actually takes a lot of elements from games like Metroid and Castlevania: Symphony of the Night.
To be honest i didn't find anything wrong about this game, well the setting could have been a little more mature, after all you play as a pirate girl that looks that it came out from a 90's cartoon and when you are an adult...well...you know...
But as i mentioned i still liked everything about it, the gameplay is smooth, with abilities to unlock and the variety of the areas are also great. Where the game truly shines it's in the animation, the 2d sprites are great to look at specially the bosses and some of the backgrounds as well. The music is great and suitable for this type of game, if you like arab music with a little touch of dance then this is your lucky day!
And yes, i even liked the characters. 

Great Game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046257051', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 577, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 577, 'last_played': 1527392754}
review:
Shantae and the Pirate's Curse (S: PC) is another game in the Shantae series that follows Shantae as she teams up with Risky Boots in order to find out what is causing all of this evil dark magic to effect Risky Boot's own troops.  You travel from island to island, finding the source of evil and destroying it.  Will this truce between Shantae and Risky last?  Or is it a setup for Shantae?   That’s why you have to play to find out.

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]   Since I already went over the story with the opening part, I will skip any further discussion on the story and go into the gameplay.  You play as Shantae and start off the game with just your hair whip.  Pretty basic but you essentially whip enemies to death until you can unlock other items.  As you beat bosses, you unlock a variety of items that belonged to Risky Boots such as her pistol, hat and canon.  Each of these items allow Shantae to perform new abilities that range from shooting with a pistol, to gliding when jumping up with Risky's Pirate Hat.   There are not a whole lot of features to use but you have to learn how to combine them or how to use them in situations that can often times not be very straight forward.  Speaking of that, finding secret areas in this game are not that easy nor are they as obvious as the sequel.   Once you unlock these items, you can upgrade them, as well as her hair, through the ingame story system which is pretty balanced.   

When it comes to exploring islands, you are tasked to essentially find the boss, and defeat it.  Anything else is side quest material but getting the side items can prove to be useful if you take the time to find everything.  These items that you can search for, are squids that are used to increase your max health and Risky Boot's shipmates or rather their dark souls that have plagued them.   The difficulty for the game, is pretty average especially with the boss fights but some fights can be tricky if you cant figure out their trick and some parts that require you  to move fast can require you to replay a level over and over til you remember where ever pop up is at (I'm looking at you, bog swamp).


[h1]Art Style[/h1]   A bit on the pixel side of things but still looks good as a 2d game.  The art sprays are super cute and very large so you can enjoy all the beauty that the ladies of game have to offer.  No one can play through this game without admitting that the girls all look super cute.

[h1]Music[/h1]      The music for the game is a staple for the series since its super cute and catchy.  I personally enjoyed the songs and think that most people will agree in they are catchy.  The sound effects are a bit dated but the game itself is a bit dated too so nothing to complain there.


[h1]Final Thoughts[/h1]    S: PC is a fun 2d, platform, metrovania style game that I highly recommend to people who enjoy that style of gameplay and want something that’s decent in length but enjoyable.   There isn't much replayabiliy to the game unless you are a speedrunner since there actually is a speedrun feature intergraded into the game itself.   You can speedrun the usual Any% or the 100%, each with a special reward to give if completed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063569742', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 472, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 472, 'last_played': 1525832035}
review:
I been trying to get into Shantae games for a while since I love platformers. But Risky's Revenge really put me off of it. (Its really slow)

This however is a great game, far superior than riskys revenge.
Pros:
-Great controls.
-Catchy music.
-Somewhat interesting story and settings.
-Superb Pixel art.
-Funny dialogue.
-Interesting characters
Cons:

-Kind of short for my liking.
-DO NOT BUY THE KICK MOVE IT IS NEXT TO USELESS

I really couldnt find anything wrong worth mentioning besides that. It is really good game you should grab it if you like platformers.

author: {'steamid': '76561198264409718', 'num_games_owned': 69, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1823, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1657, 'last_played': 1607660325}
review:
通过音mad知道的这个游戏
手感比前一部作品好；
立绘和前面作品相比好很多，个人认为是至今为止立绘最好的一部；
难度还可以，对我这种手残也很友好；
人物对话很幽默，可惜一直没有完整汉化，不能完全看懂。
＊沙漠是有地方刷钱的，在那个狼城(?)里，对游戏有一定帮助。
＊齐集所有dark magic有完美结局。

后期道具基本齐全的时候跟前期完全不是一个难度，前期手残也可以用钱买道具增加容错率。
最后，这一部的收集要素不够多...

author: {'steamid': '76561198057968731', 'num_games_owned': 373, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 559, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 559, 'last_played': 1524622318}
review:
Good music, decent platforming. Short but sweet, and very easy ( minus some self-imposed achievement challenges if that's your thing). The writing is charming and the characters are all fun and easy-going, the story is easy to understand even having never played a Shantae game. The game does lean on the anime tiddies appeal a bit much at times in my opinion, nothing against anime tiddies of course. 

It's a metroidvania without the sprawling, interconnected map but with the exploration/combat upgrades and some light backtracking if you want the best ending. It has a light, happy tone, which is a nice break from the normal lonely, bleak settings of this genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016158213', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 1828, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 930, 'last_played': 1599460840}
review:
The is the best of all existing Shantae games!

Beautiful Artwork for conversations and overall presentation. I like the art style for this Shantae the best.

Characters are all loveable. Each with their own personalities; With some backstory. My fave is Rottytops.

Plot is wonderful, where in the previous game, [spoiler]you lost your powers. This mainly means that you can't dance and transform. I was so sad, not being able to enjoy Shantae's fun-loving dances.[/spoiler]

Each game continues the story or at least has call-backs to let you know how things have progressed.

The gameplay is where this game shines! Platforming is at its best. Challenging jumps and movements to reach tricky spots and secrets! So good! Because of the previous game, the gameplay is changed slighty. Collect power-ups, and other amazing items to aid you in your quest.

Controls are spot on and I never felt out of control. Being able to perform quick maneuvers and speedy reactions to things are all up to you.

I am currently playing the Gameboy Color one, (first in the series). Already, there have been many improvements in gameplay. Shantae: The Half-Genie Hero is a huge plummet in quality, The worst in the series. If I were to rank all the games:

1: Shantae and the Pirates Curse (I danced)
2: Shantae Risky's Revenge (Dances are automated with a few dance move animations 3 movements)
3: Shantae (Has the best dances because you control which ones happen 6 movements in all)
4: Shantae: The Half-Genie Hero (Has one dance animation and its pathetic)

Pick this one up. If you're into the story, then find a way to play the previous two.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057699838', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 1093, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1093, 'last_played': 1518550824}
review:
キャラのかわいらしさが最初に語られることが多いこのシリーズ。
かわいいだけじゃなくてちゃんと操作していて面白いアクションゲーム。
マゾゲー大好きって人じゃなければ、ちょうど気持ちいい位の難易度の緩いメトロイドヴァニア。
アクション苦手なら回復アイテムゴリ押しでも何とかなる。

話的にはシリースが同じってだけじゃなく、前作の続き物の話なので、できればそちらからプレイしたい。
むしろ俺が1作目からプレイしたいが1作目頑張っても手に入らないｗ
まあなんかあって今まで敵対していた相手と共闘することになったんだなって事と、今作に必要な情報は作中で出てくるので今作だけでもちゃんと楽しめるけどね。
ちゅうかsteam版は日本語ローカライズされてないから、割り切ってストーリー無視でアクションゲームとしてやっている人も多いんじゃね？

ちなみにオススメはしていますが、ちゃんと日本語ローカライズされている3DS版を購入したほうがいいｗ

author: {'steamid': '76561198006498578', 'num_games_owned': 297, 'num_reviews': 120, 'playtime_forever': 753, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 753, 'last_played': 1522960089}
review:
Je trouve à [i]Shantae and the Pirate's Curse[/i] les mêmes qualités qu'à son grand frère ([i][...] Risky's Revenge[/i]) un petit peu améliorées mais aussi les mêmes défauts malheureusement.

J'ai obtenu une fin qui n'est pas la "vraie" fin, je suppose. Le jeu me demandait clairement d'aller reparcourir le monde à la recherche de 10 "portions" de magie que je n'avais pas trouvés (sur 20 en tout !) et ça ne m'intéressait franchement pas...

À mon avis le jeu souffre vraiment de son découpage en niveaux qui rend l'agencement global du monde moins clair que dans un metroidvania classique et n'aide pas particulièrement à se remémorer où peuvent se trouver des endroits que l'on n'avait pas pu explorer auparavant.
On est parfois obligé d'aller revisiter des niveaux parcourus précédemment mais j'ai à chaque fois trouvé ça un peu forcé et par moment pas clair du tout de savoir où je devais aller. Sachant qu'il s'agit donc principalement de revisiter des niveaux en extérieurs qui sont, je trouve, une plaie à parcourir... La faute notamment à des ennemis qui surgissent sans prévenir et au dernier moment (et sur lesquels on s'empale régulièrement) et a un level design pas folichon.

Dans les points positifs tout de même, les donjons (un par île, une portion non négligeable du jeu) sont plutôt bien pensés et dans l'ensemble très agréables à visiter de même que la plupart des boss sont chouettes à combattre !

Au final je ressors de ce [i]Shantae [/i] avec un avis mi-figue mi-raisin plus ou moins similaire à ce que j'avais ressenti en terminant [i]Risky's Revenge[/i]...

Disons 12 ou 13/20.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036640855', 'num_games_owned': 595, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 1995, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1325, 'last_played': 1552349027}
review:
Wow! This was an almost perfect Metroidvania with gorgeous art (on the level of Owlboy), stupidly catchy music, hilarious writing and an entertaining, satisfying story. Movement was smooth and fun but the player combat not particularly inventive; Guacamelee! does combat much better. Also brimming with waifus, if that's your cup of tea. I think I fell in love with all the characters; you can decide if that's a good thing or not.

The only faults were a couple of crash bugs, and the GUI was noticeably not in keeping with the pixel art - the textboxes and heart symbols looked like engine defaults. I would have also appreciated more voice work for dialogue. The overall quality of the game massively outweighs that though. I got this from the Humble Overwhelmingly Positive Bundle and it definitely deserved to be there. Looking forward to playing the rest of the series.

review:
The game is fun to play, but the story and the characters are so absurd, that there is little immersion. The mechanics are generally ok, but some of the moves (of smaller significance) feel sloppy. 7/10 - get it on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198093919303', 'num_games_owned': 278, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 558, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 558, 'last_played': 1520478235}
review:
Shantae and the Pirate's Curse is, obviously, pretty similar to the other shantae games that I have played. And, like the others, it was great. It took me about 9 hours, though of course there are a bunch of collectibles that I didn't find, and a "pirate mode" that you can play though after beating it a first time.

Let's start off with sound. Shantae isn't particularly special for it's sound effects, but the music was pretty fun to listen to, and had that classic nintendo handheld "8 bit but modern" feel to it. Very enjoyable, for sure. There actually was a bit of voice acting - in the style of a character saying a single word to accompany their dialogue, which was pretty well done and executed when it was applied. Overall, the game sounded pretty good, though it certainly isn't winning any awards for it.

Next up is the art. Shantae has always had this somewhat whimsical feel to the world, with really neat and unique enemies that manage to look pretty happy and upbeat even if they happen to be a demonic sludge or an evil half-human-half-scorpion. Combine that with backgrounds that have a lot of color and depth to them and you have a really cheerful little package, which fits Shantae exceptionally well. I will say that some of the animations looked a bit strange, most notably the basic attack animation, but that might just be the designer's style. Or that Pirate's Curse is starting to show it's age. 

Moving on to the real stuff: mechanics. First of all, I just have to say that I might be a little biased since metroidvania platformers are and always will be my favorite (ori, axiom verge, and the original metroid series number in my all time favorites). But even so, pretty much everything in this game was very satisfying and fun. Most of the upgrades really hit the sweet spot of halfway between platforming aid and combat tool. The basic combat of hair whipping was satisfying. The boss fights were good puzzles but also tested your movement and combat skills. All in all, A+ to this game for mechanics. (Also, you're running around picking up Risky's pirate gear, the irony of which is pretty fantastic)

Finally, let's talk about the story. One of Shantae's strong points are the characters, with a cast of whimsical and barely child-appropriate hooligans. Not to mention Shantae herself, who somehow manages to be a complete badass and an adorable kid at the same time. The plot was a tiny bit weak - with no spoilers, it boiled down to "help risky go beat up the bad guy" with a bunch of distractions and side quests along the way. Nothing especially special there, but hey. One last thing I need to mention in this category is that the game is extremely self-aware and funny. Spoiler: [spoiler]One of my favorite parts was immediately after the Tan Line palace, where the inane denizens realize that Shantae (and risky, and sky, and rottytops) actually look nothing like their "long-lost" princess who has been gone for an hour shopping.[/spoiler]

All in all, good stuff. ABSOLUTELY worth the $20.

author: {'steamid': '76561198811542771', 'num_games_owned': 29, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 2570, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 398, 'last_played': 1706202985}

author: {'steamid': '76561198108990161', 'num_games_owned': 633, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 860, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 860, 'last_played': 1519901766}
review:
Отличный пример метроидвании. По классике - бегаешь, собираешь спеллы, у торговца покупаешь зелья. Портирование отличное - кнопки не залипают, когда надо тогда и нажимаются. Тут к Большой Н вопросы отсутствуют. Классная музыка, но расстроило отсутствие озвучки(только у ГГ озвучено оу, пыф, ай, гыр и имена пары героев) - катастрофически мало. 
Затянуло прямо на УРА - прошел нахрапом за 11 часов. Сюжет - бомба. Банальный,но все же поржал с пары моментов.
И конечно же ФАП-контент можно найти(Гусары молчать) - начало главы в пустыне прямо для тебя, мой маленький рукоблуд.
Всем советую.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994448955', 'num_games_owned': 2411, 'num_reviews': 341, 'playtime_forever': 666, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 309, 'last_played': 1520614938}
review:
Una definizione trovata per questi giochini in stile retro ma creati negli ultimi anni è sicuramente NEW RETRO, perchè richiamano il gameplay di una volta ma con stilizzature odierne. Non avevo giocato ancora ad un titolo di questa serie e devo dire che, nonostante sia un gioco dalla vena sempliciotta, risulta davvero sfizioso giocarci, chiaramente se foste abbastanza datati come me da poter apprezzare un platform decente. Sicuramente i disegni dei personaggi possono attirare anche generazioni odierne, ma vi assicuro che non è solo quello. Alcuni dialoghi sono divertenti ed il gameplay in evoluzione rendono questo titolo da me CONSIGLIATO! Tocca recuperare gli altri, a tal proposito se avete intenzione di giocarci vi suggerisco di fare il capitolo precedente a questo ovvero Risky Revenge.

voto 7

author: {'steamid': '76561198003769504', 'num_games_owned': 669, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 600, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 600, 'last_played': 1514681599}
review: After playing through both this and Risky's revenge, i'm always down for a Shatae adventure. Since Shantae no longer needs to dance to use her power ups, the overall speed is quite fast, everything flows well. The level design here is also very solid, with each area providing a unique challenge, especially the final dungeon. On top of that, the soundtrack is amazing, easily surpassing Risky's revenge. I can't wait to play Half Genie Hero!

author: {'steamid': '76561198035900013', 'num_games_owned': 355, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 232, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 232, 'last_played': 1494521478}

author: {'steamid': '76561198044457868', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1283, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 713, 'last_played': 1562969223}
review:
Je me suis fait tous les jeux de la saga Shantae (mis à part le premier sur Game Boy Color) et je dois dire que Pirate's Curse est mon préféré de loin!

C'est dommage que Risky's Revenge n'ait jamais été traduit en français, car Pirate's Curse est la suite directe de ce jeu. Par ailleurs, contrairement à ce qui est écrit dans la page Steam du jeu, Pirate's Curse est disponible en français. Je souligne également la qualité du portage PC du jeu, bien meilleure que celui de Risky's Revenge, étant donné que ces jeux-là sont originellement sur 3DS et DS, respectivement.

Suite aux évènements du précédent opus, Shantae a perdu ses pouvoirs de génie et est donc contrainte à se battre comme une humaine. Cette fois-ci, Shantae se joint à son éternelle ennemie Risky Boots afin d'empêcher l'éveil d'un mal encore plus grand: le Pirate Master. Une histoire pour le moins basique, mais qui fait très bien le job ^^
Le histoire du jeu est accompagné d'un humour bon enfant qui correspond très bien à l'esprit de la série. C'est d'ailleurs dommage que certains jeux de mots n'ont pas été préservés dans la traduction française.

Côté gameplay, Pirate's Curse s'oriente vers du Metroidvania encore plus que Risky's Revenge l'avait fait: en plus de pouvoir améliorer sa barre de vie et sa vitesse d'attaque, on peut également améliorer sa puissance d'attaque. En accord à l'histoire du jeu, Shantae ne peut plus utiliser de magie ni ses transformations. A la place, on récupèrera des objets au cours du jeu qui nous donneront de nouvelles compétences. La seule chose qui fait un peu moins Metroidvania, c'est l'exploration: Pirate's Curse n'utilise plus le système de téléporteurs de Risky's Revenge. A la place, le jeu est divisé en 9 îles auxquels on se rend grâce au navire de Risky. Cependant, il n'empêche qu'il faudra faire des allers-retours d'une île à une autre pour avancer dans le jeu, comme dans la plupart des Metroidvania.

Je trouve que la difficulté de ce jeu est bien dosée: très facile au début, puis on commence à vous mettre à l'épreuve une fois proche de la fin. D'ailleurs, la dernière section du jeu saura vraiment tester de quoi vous êtes capable en termes de plateformes! De même pour certains secrets si vous comptez finir le jeu à 100% pour avoir la vraie fin.
Les boss sont assez simples, malheureusement. Mais ils ne peuvent pas être bêtements bourrinés pour autant: il faut attendre d'avoir une ouverture (lorsque le boss n'est pas invincible) ou bien créer cet ouverture avant de pouvoir l'attaquer.

Côté graphismes, ça m'a beaucoup plu. A un certain stade du jeu, j'ai même eu la vibe Metal Slug avec ce jeu. Une bonne partie des sprites ont été repris de Risky's Revenge, mais ça ne me dérange pas: tout habitué aux Metroidvania de la série Castlevania saura que c'était quelque chose d'habituel dans ces jeux-là, alors ça ne me dérangera pas plus dans une autre série.

Côté sonore, pas grand chose à dire. Jake Kaufmann s'est surpassé une fois de plus avec l'OST de ce Pirate's Curse. Je pense même que c'est mon OST préféré de la série! J'ai également été agréablement surpris lorsque j'ai entendu des doublages pour la première fois dans la série Shantae. Les dialogues ne sont pas intégralement doublés, il n'y a que quelques répliques et onomatopées de Shantae (doublée par Cristina Vee) qui ont eu ce privilège, mais le doublage est de bonne facture et accompagne bien les dialogues. C'est dommage que la traduction française de ce jeu laisse à désirer.

Pour finir, la durée de vie. Pirate's Curse est sans aucun doute le jeu le plus long de la série. Comptez 9-10 heures pour le terminer, et environ 12 heures pour le finir à 100%. C'est assez court par rapport au Metroidvania moyen qui durera environ une bonne vingtaine d'heures, mais on est bien loin de son prédécesseur Risky's Revenge et de son successeur Half-Genie Hero qui peuvent se terminer en 5-6 heures environ.

Bref, pour conclure, Pirate's Curse est un très bon Metroidvania, j'ai vraiment adoré ce jeu! C'est dommage que Half-Genie Hero n'ait pas continué sur cette voie-là et soit revenu vers l'ancienne formule avec des niveaux à la place.
