author: {'steamid': '76561198118686066', 'num_games_owned': 65, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 1031, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1006, 'last_played': 1498902022}
review:
From my view, it has their good and bad sides. and some of them are a matter of opinion. 
It's only too bad that the game didn't fit well to my opinion. But the game is worth the try.

I'm overall neutral about this, And I'm very two-sided to give it a positive or negative response.

It's however worth pointing out the next things before you buy:

Pro's:
- Great animations, I've really enjoying them, especially Shantae herself.
- Great Soundtrack. They're really fitting to them, some of them are arabic, and sometimes it fits even Castlevania.
- Every character has pretty much their own full body render art during dialogues.
- It has their humor, mostly classic humor. 
- Fanservice. That's pretty much the game's main point. There are busty ladies with bra's and bikini's everywhere. Now combine it with the full body renders and you've an anime visual novel in a platformer game. 
However, I'm not a visual novel fan, When I'm playing a game I prefer the gameplay over the artwork, and honestly I think it would have been fine enough for me if it were just head pictures. I can't take my time to look at their bodies if they might have something important to tell. Maybe appealing for other people. just not for me.

Cons:
- The controls are ... weird, I guess you'll get used to it, but it's weird for me when everything is assigned to a different button. An example: Attack, talk and confirm has 3 seperate buttons, while it would have been more user-friendly if they mixed it into one. This also takes away a bit of the combat flow.
- Difficulity spikes, The game feels too easy at the start. but later on the game turns out to becomes harsh. (The final area is a huge twist compared to the overall game.)
- Fullscreen seems a bit buggy sometimes when using alt-f4. 
- Lack of animations, sounds a little ironic as I also said that they've great animations. But sometimes I've noticed that it looks like only halfway done. Causing a bit of a quality break. It sometimes feels like there could have been some extra animations here and there: The idle animations looks the same every time despite their artworks shows different expressions, it's a bit odd to me as the standard idle animation doesn't really fit with the situation sometimes. 
And sometimes when I expected to see an unique animated cutscene by an event, the screen goes black instead. It's a little bit easily done in that term and that's a bit disappointing. Because the animations does look good and I could have certainely see that potential.

My own opinion: 
I think this game differs too much from what I'm used to with Metroidvania's. And there have been parts that I don't find logical to happen. I do have played the game untill the end though, including the secret ending as I was pretty close to that. But in all honestly, there has been parts that rather takes me away from replaying it. The game didn't really fit my style, but that doesn't make it a bad game. It also has their good sides, as there were several music, animations, mechanics and upgrades that I've enjoyed.

Overall, I've been really trying to love the game, but it didn't really fit at my end.
The real question is where your interests are at, because for me, it's really hard to tell to which audience this game is really meant.
- If you want to play the game for the difficulity and 'Metroidvania' level design, Then I find the game is on the easy side. Despite the insane difficulity ramp at the end. It does have the Metroidvania feelings though, but I find it done rather simple.
- If you want to play the game for the art design, go ahead. The animations, music, art and most character cast design were enjoyable for me. Just be aware that you'll get a really hard time finishing it.

That's it for Pirate's Curse, It didn't fit my style, but I don't hate it, hopefully 1/2 Genie Hero gives me a better experience what Shantae is about.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044233743', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 207, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1540093253}
review:
I have initially played this game on a Nintendo 3DS screen, so a lot of my experience will be based off that and not the PC Version. However, I would state that both versions play basically the same.
Story: Shantae has been stripped bare of her magic and Scuttle Town is now under the iron treads of Ammo Baron. On the other side of the sea, a terrible evil threatens to rise back up to send Sequin Land to a lifetime of darkness and death. Only through a team-up with Shantae's archnemesis Risky Boots can they both save Sequin Land from this evil. As a game plot, it's basic and slightly cliche'd, but it's still good enough to keep on playing. 8.5/10
Controls: Unlike most other games, where you use WASD to control your character, Shantae actually uses the arrow keys and ZXCASD, which could confuse users more used to WASD. Overall, it would be preferable to use a controller, though unlike its older brother, Super Meat Boy, it's playable with just the keyboard. 8/10
Graphics: As a whole, the pixel art style cannot get any more better than this in sheer quality. And while there are some peeople who may be bothered by how anime-like Shantae and her friends appear, it's still all good and gives people some eye candy. And don't worry, He-Man is there to balance out the waifu scale. 9.5/10
Sound: Both Music and general sound effects are here. Music-wise, Jake Kaufman does amazing job as the composer. (11/10) Sound-wise, we do get to hear how Shantae and Risky sound through their occasional spoken line, though most of the sound is through fighting. The sounds do lend themselves pretty well to their designated objects, though certain sounds don't satisfy the feeling we all have. (7.5/10) Overall: 9/10
Overall and other mentions: This game is THE definitive Metroidvania platformer, where you have to collect new power-ups to go into different areas where you couldn't go before, and go out of your way to get 100% or rush the game to complete it under a designated period of time to get a payday, if you will. This game gets a 9/10, since a lot of the less good elements do get drowned out by the best of quality entertainment. To end it, this game is most certainly NOT for kids, grandma and soccer mums everywhere. Or people who get offended real easily, to be fair.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024506842', 'num_games_owned': 716, 'num_reviews': 252, 'playtime_forever': 579, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 579, 'last_played': 1463046312}
review: still the best game in the Shantae series and will probably stay that way

author: {'steamid': '76561198013869133', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 164, 'playtime_forever': 910, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 884, 'last_played': 1587875036}
review:
in my opinion, one of the best shantae games for a lot of reasons. this game differs a bit from the others as shantae has lost her "genie half" in the previous game, so ability progression is not based on dances that transform you but in pirate gear that's a bit similar to metroid abilities (if that makes sense). 

great art, writing, sprites, and music, so right on the surface this game looks and sounds great. the "dungeons" and their bosses are really well made and the island-based map system solves the previous game's (risky's revenge) issues of the confusing/hard to navigate map.

in terms of controls and fluidity of play, the pirate gear abilities mesh really well with the levels, and it keeps the simple damage/attack speed upgrades that risky's revenge had minus the weird requriement of magic jelly. though this game also draws from metroid's habit of ability-locked secrets that require backtracking (whether that's good or bad is up to you).

lastly, if you feel an indescribable need to unlock all achievements in games you buy, then be ready. amongst the hardest are doing bosses without taking damage, speedrunning, finishing a notably difficult platforming and enemy avoiding sequence without dying, and completing the game without any health upgrades (that means with *two* health!) of course, achievements are exactly that, and it's not like you're being forced to do these asininely hard tasks.

all in all, very very good game, I've bought it on several platforms (I actually think it's a bit better on the 3DS) and do not regret it. definitely a 10/10 to me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006705874', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 3762, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2595, 'last_played': 1558908390}
review:
What do you look for in a video game? A rough challenge? A great cast and story? Enjoyable gameplay with solid controls? Well with Shantae and the Pirate's Curse you'll get at least 2 out of three.

The greatest asset this game has it's it's cast and story, even if this is your first Shantae game (it was for me). The only 2 characters that were glossed over durin the game are actually new to this title: the blond-haired duo of Twitch and Vinegar (you never even get their names). The rest of the cast, from enemies to allies, all have their own quirks, personalities, and even worries, ranging from finding a husband, turning orphanages into cannons, and dealing with post-boss syndrome. You know, normal video game problems. The story follows our title character joining forces with the previous titles' main baddie, the pirate Risky Boots, to stop the return of her old master from the grave. As with any good rivalry, plenty of bickering and comraderie awaits.

Gameplay is as resposive as you'd want out of an action-platformer. Shantae can use her hair and a variety of sub-weapons to deal with foes. As she clears the game's dungeons (called Dens of Evil) she'll find Risky's missing equipment, each helping her either fight enemies or explore more areas (often both). The game really opens up once you collect all five, as 3 of them (Hat, Boots, and Cannon) can be used in conjuction to speed through areas and past enemies, and it's at this point that the level design really begins to shine as WayForward obviously designed with this in mind. In fact, the game plays equally well, albeit sufficiently different, between Normal and Pirate Modes (NG and NG+ respectfully).

The one area the game will lack during an normal playthrough is challange, as collecting all the power-ups, Heart Squids (for extra health), and healing items mean that you're never at any real risk of dying outside of a couple boss fights. You could easily by circumvent this by skipping all these things, but it'd been nice for there to simply be a mode where the difficulty is set by the game and not the player.

Overall this is easily one of the most replayable games I've played in years. Pirate Mode is such a pleasant way to play after a Normal game, and the cast and music will always bring a smile to my heart. There's a reason it's a fan-favorite in the series.

PS: If you're interested in getting into speedrunning, then this game also makes a great introductory game if you're new and has a nice Discord community as well.


Score: 9.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198211244449', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 1187, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 881, 'last_played': 1631358028}
review:
Лучшая практически во всём, Shantae and the Pirate's Curse стала для многих эталоном качества этой франшизы. По сравнению с предыдущей частью, здесь заметно улучшился пиксель-арт и дизайн самих персонажей в диалогах между собой. Сюжетно игра также стала лучше, даже не сюжетно, а в плане насыщенности повествования, события, происходящие в игре, куда интереснее, чего только стоит спасение Роттитопс. 
 Но что важно не меньше всего, это, пожалуй, кхм, Yobaный дизайн карты - Sрань господне, как же убого была сделана карта в Risky's revenge, никогда у меня не вызывало столько баттхёрта сидеть и осознавать, что я не понимаю, куда идти, никогда я ещё не бросал игру на долгое время из-за того, что карта довела меня до слёз, как маленькую ноющую девочку... В общем, в Pirate's Curse (и следующей за ней игре) такого больше не было, потому что, видимо, эту самую глобальную карту вырезали - теперь мы перемещаемся от уровня к уровню и имеем на руках стандартную для метроидваний карту, на которой и отмечаются все места определённых уровней (без сраных слоёв этажей, сyка, и тупого 2,5д). Блаженство.
В чём эта часть может уступить Half-genie, так это в музыкальном плане. Эмбиент из Полуджина прекрасен. А вот из Pirate's Curse лично мне запомнился только "Run, Rottytops, run!".
В целом игра выглядит взрослее и проработаннее что в сравнении с предыдущей частью - Risky's revenge, - что с последующей - Half-genie hero. Проблема следующих за ней частей в принципе состоит в детскости происходящего, то, как подают нам сюжет подойдёт больше для младшей аудитории, особенно Seven sirens, с которой мне ещё предстоит ознакомиться лично. Но на самом деле это лишь ощущается как-то вторично, особенно сексапильность местных героинь, ракурсы и тон картинок, получаемых за спидран игры, полный сбор предметов и т.д., а также меню ДЛС про похождения Риски говорят о том, что всё-таки игра не только для детей, и что она заинтересована в более взрослой аудитории преимущественно мужского пола. Как и Pirate's Curse - даже не как, а больше всего именно эта часть делает упор на старшие поколения нулевых годов.

review: This series does not get the recognition it deserves, the soundtrack is amazing, the graphics are stunningly beautiful, the writing is witty and gets me to chuckle all the way through, and most importantly, the gameplay and controls are responsive and tight, so the game never makes me feel like it is not my fault for getting a game over. This is the best game in the series so far in my opinion, and this series needs much more fans than it has.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057863670', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 2076, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2057, 'last_played': 1497734451}
review:
Un jeu de platforme avec tout le gout de l'époque.
Gros plus appreciable, la difficulté est bien ajustée et on prend plaisir (objectif hélas oublié de nombre de jeux de platfrome aujourd'hui). Le jeu évolue au gré des objets trouvés permettant d'accéder à des lieux précedemment innaccessibles. Enfin il y a un scénario parfois un peu enfantin mais très frais. Vraiment un jeu agréable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198091787231', 'num_games_owned': 336, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1292, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1252, 'last_played': 1554737003}
review:
My first Steam game with all achievements unlocked. 

I did not expect to like this game so much, in fact I hated it in the first 2-3 hours. Some enemies took way too long to kill, you only had 1 attack, there was alot of backtracking and it was overall a boring and frustrating start.
But once i got more upgrades and weapons, the gameplay became alot more fluid and fun. There is one item that will make you run faster than Sonic, and that alone makes the game 10x better. When you complete the game, you unlock a new mode that lets you keep all your equipment in a new game, which made this game a joy to speedrun.

Play it if you like metroidvania platformers
(or play it for the plot ( ͡º ͜ʖ ͡º))

Also, the soundtrack is catchy af.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073410753', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 735, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 735, 'last_played': 1497486546}
review:
This is a really fun platformer game.  It's a bit different in that you don't have transformations like in the previous games, but the pirate weapons more than make up for it.

It has some frustratingly challanging areas and one real pain in the neck boss that makes the final boss seem like a walk in the park, but the humor and play control is great.

I highly recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198097629172', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 152, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 152, 'last_played': 1492131101}
review: A love letter to 16- and 32-bit platformers.  I knew of these games in their various GameBoy iterations, thought they were for kids then realized through word of mouth they were actually very good.  That's definitely the case here.  The levels are well done, the gameplay and options at your disposal are easy to understand but well-defined, and the animation in this game is fantastic.  The artwork and dialgoue are a little pervy at times, but other than that if you yearn for more platformers in this age of endless open world and FPS titles, the Shantae series will scratch the itch.

review: Shantae games have a certain charm to them, from their beautiful artstyle and music to their fun playstyle. The controls feel nice amd tight when playing with either a keyboard or controller, and the progression seems to be set at a great pace, while it can be difficult at times mostly due to new enemies or hazzard placements it is really not that difficult. Though the 2D gameplay reminds me of old platformers, I would recommend this series in any order to anyone regarless of skill or age!

author: {'steamid': '76561197961768818', 'num_games_owned': 4046, 'num_reviews': 454, 'playtime_forever': 12, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1484882155}
review:
If your monitor is 144hz, this game can't be played because the physics are based on the frame-rate and the frame-rate is based on your monitor refresh-rate (with no way to change that in-game).  You literally need fps-limiting software to make the game playable.

It's been a known issue for years, and the developer has shown no indication that they intend on fixing it.

What is this, 1990?

author: {'steamid': '76561197990112360', 'num_games_owned': 1345, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 422, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 422, 'last_played': 1496436367}
review:
The art style seems rather inconsistent, with most characters and some background objects being true pixel art, while other objects are standard drawings that were obviously created at a higher resolution then simply downscaled to a lower resolution without adjusting colors or even clamping the transparency. The high res character art and the font/border of the dialog boxes clash with the game's retro pixel art theme as well.

But that is a relatively minor complaint. The gameplay is solid, characters are playful, pacing is steady and music is fantastic. Overall the game is enjoyable and a worthy purchase at $20.

author: {'steamid': '76561198164819894', 'num_games_owned': 1414, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1008, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 770, 'last_played': 1530493587}
review:
Divertido, ingenioso y retro. Shantae vuelve en una gran aventura que sacrifica ligeramente la exploracion a cambio de un mundo y personajes mas variados, interesantes y divertidos. Dificultad perfectamente ajustada, muchos secretos, gráficos y sonido geniales... no puedo dejar de recomendar este juego.
Eso si: es un poco corto. Incluso con el genial y epico verdadero ending (ademas de los logros difíciles de completar) te dejará con ganas de más. Pero siempre se puede recurrir a los otros dos juegos en steam  ¿No? ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561197976326496', 'num_games_owned': 2527, 'num_reviews': 257, 'playtime_forever': 1259, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1259, 'last_played': 1495734431}
review:
Ver.1.03にて初週100％クリアまで約9時間、ダラダラとプレイして全実績解除までは20時間程度を要しました。アクションゲームは好きな方で人並み程度の腕前として読んで頂ければ幸い。前作Risky's Revengeもプレイ済みです。

[h1]Pros:[/h1][list]
[*]レスポンスの良い操作性
[*]可愛らしいキャラクター達と明朗快活なシナリオ
[*]取り逃しが分かる収集要素の明示
[*]テンションが上がるサウンドトラック[/list]

[h1]Cons:[/h1][list]
[*]切替が面倒なインベントリとマップのUI
[*]現在の目的を見失いやすい
[*]形骸化されている一部のスキル[/list]

[h1]前作から大きく遊びやすさが向上した良質の2Dアクションゲーム[/h1]

　Wayforward開発のShantaeシリーズ3作目。持ち前の行動力と運動能力を武器に、飛んだり跳ねたりの冒険を繰り広げ、ゲーム進行に伴って能力が解放されて活動範囲が広がるタイプの2Dアクションゲーム。主人公であるShantaeはジーニーと人間を親に持つ半魔人として魔力を受け継いでいましたが、前作での成り行きにより今作では魔力を失っています。しかも今回はひょんなことから敵対していた女海賊のRiskyと手を結び、島々を渡り歩くこととなります。

　前作と比較して今作の特徴として大きく目につくところと言えば、[b]移動速度とレスポンスが向上している[/b]点です。アクション後の硬直時間が全体的に短めとなり、高速に移動できる手段が増えたことでゲーム全体のテンポが速まっています。機敏にキャラクターが動くので操作しているだけでとても楽しいです。エリア間が連なっていた前作に対して島ごとにエリア区分されており、[b]VirtことJake Kaufmanのサウンドと相まってよりエリアの特色が出ている[/b]のも特徴です。まだ行くことのできない島が最初からシルエット表示されており、収集要素も島ごとに初めから明示されているので、[b]全体のボリュームを把握しやすくなっている[/b]のも好感触。何気にABボタンの決定、キャンセルのデフォルトが変更されているのも嬉しい。

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=917802318

　解像度はフルHDに対応していないものの、ビジュアルも大きく強化されています。特にキャラクターイラストには日本人のイラストレーターKOU氏を迎え、前作のトゥーン調より取っつきやすくなったのではと思います。ドット絵は本当によく動き、アニメーションを眺めるだけでも楽しめます。[b]ランプを掲げて無駄にクネクネさせたのは絶対に私だけでは無い[/b]筈です！kawaii。

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=673418269
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=673418251

　リプレイ性もあります。周回時は最初から全能力(装備)解禁されるため、初周プレイでは行えなかった大幅なショートカットが可能でありプレイが苦になりません。飛び道具を無効化するアイテムだったり攻撃力を高めるアイテムを駆使すれば、エリアボスですらパターンの一巡内で倒すことも可能です。そのようなショートカットなりボス瞬殺の攻略方法を見つけるのも周回プレイ時の楽しみと言えます。

　そこまで大きな問題ではないのですが、私がプレイしていて気になった点についても述べて(ボヤいて)おきます。初周プレイ時などマップを見つつインベントリも使用する場合に、ページの切替が面倒臭く感じられました。ワンボタンで目的の画面を表示できたらいいのになぁ…。あと、ゲーム進行はちゃんとテキストを読んでおかないと迷いがちです。島と島の間を行き来するので、メニューのどこかに目的を常時表示してくれると嬉しいなぁ…。そして、お店で買えるスキル系。あえて使うメリットが無いのです…。マイナス点はこのくらいです。


　2015年以降になって旧作含め日本語版リリースが増えてきている経緯から、少しずつ国内での知名度も上がってきているのかも。登場するキャラクター達が明るく活き活きとしていて操作感も良好です。Steam以外のプラットフォームでは定価が4000円であることから定価であってもお買い得です！アクションゲームが好きならどうぞ～。

author: {'steamid': '76561198023324916', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 497, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 497, 'last_played': 1495562876}
review:
Overall the game has great potential with awesome retro graphics, some good humor and likeable characters. Sadly the game has some of the most frustrating jump puzzles I have seen in a long time. These puzzles at the end take way to much room compared to the overall jump and run gameplay against mobs and bosses. If you are not a fan of unforgiving jump puzzles then stay away from this game.
This is all quite sad because up till the last dungeon the game was not that hard aside from a running part in the middle of the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032429849', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 824, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 824, 'last_played': 1485468099}
review:
[i][b]Shantae and the Pirate’s Curse[/b][/i] est un jeu de plates-formes teinté de [i]metroidvania[/i] de facture très classique qui bénéficie d’une licence porteuse et d’un délicieux enrobage. Mais l’excellence de la bande-son et l’attrait visuel ne suffisent pas à compenser un [i]level design[/i] trop peu inspiré et une progression qui révèle la banalité des mécaniques. Malgré une forme d’exclusion scénaristique pour qui n’a pas fait les épisodes précédents, le titre de [b]WayForward[/b] se traverse néanmoins sans déplaisir et dans la bonne humeur. Les souvenirs à long terme, eux, s’effaceront vite, rangeant [i]The Pirate’s Curse[/i] dans la catégorie des jeux plaisants mais oubliables.

Lire la critique complète sur [url=http://kulturkonfitur.fr/shantae-and-the-pirates-curse/]Kultur & Konfitur[/url].

author: {'steamid': '76561197999853563', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1265, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1245, 'last_played': 1584151254}
review: This game had been in my backlog for a while and I wasn't sure if I would like it. I'm happy to say that after the fact it's become one of my favorite platformers. Shantae and the Pirate's Curse was clearly developed by people who really cared about the game they were making. The platforming is very rewarding and can be challenging without feeling cheap... that is, with the exception of some platforming near the end that's more of a fight with hit detection on spiked walls than it is platforming. Overall, a very solid game with tons of personality and great art and music.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064783185', 'num_games_owned': 854, 'num_reviews': 275, 'playtime_forever': 565, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 565, 'last_played': 1495023891}
review:
Tercera parte de la saga de Shantae. Esta vez nos encontramos sin poderes (final del anterior juego) y el Pirate Master regresa a la vida. Nuestro objetivo será eliminar la magia negra que asolan las ieferentes islas, ayudando a sus habitantes.
En jugabilidad, gráficos y banda sonora, es tan perfecta como las anteriores entregas, pero con los controles más refinados incluso, y en vez de danzas de animales como antes, ahora contamos con armas piratas, objetos que nos ayudarán a cruzar zonas que antes no podíamos (un metroidvania como los anteriores).
Si has jugado al menos al segundo juego, este no está recomendado, es obligatorio. 9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198054447980', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 1208, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 800, 'last_played': 1579580718}
review:
This is my first time playing a game in the Shantae series. Thankfully, you don't have to know much about it except she's a butt-whooping genie.

Pros: 
Amazing soundtrack!
Sexy characters ;3
Fun beat-em-up with cool powerups
Modern crisp anime-style graphics meets old school side-scroller

Cons: 
Steep learning curve, prepare to die a lot
Many levels feel a little too linear
Not much replay value except for speedrunning and achievment hunting

Overall, this game is an excellent modern side-scroller with a lot of color and humor, really good for brightening up your day.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045582850', 'num_games_owned': 820, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 823, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 823, 'last_played': 1494669478}
review:
I loved this game. I'm a bit on the older side and I remember when 2D platfomers were in their heyday. To me, 2D platformers are the essence of video gaming. After all, Mario saved the whole industry on his own back in the day. This game takes me back to those glorious times. There are so few games now that hold my attention for very long, but I simply could not put this game down. I even went for the 100% achievement, where usually I just want to complete the story and nothing else.

The visuals in this game are beautiful, from the sprite work to the full 2D character drawings. Environments are varied and well designed and the enemies are cute too. Wayforward has some of my favorite character design in their original IPs, and I love the designs in this game.

There are small bits of voice acting here and there, but they sound really great. The music is catchy, although occasionally repetitive, but that is to be expected in this genre of game.

Controls are tight and work well. I personally finished it using a Steam Controller and I liked it very much.

The gameplay itself is truly excellent. It is [i]slightly[/i] on the hard side but I'm pretty used to that kind of thing from my childhood. If you really want to 100% the game, it will take a bit of work and occasional frustration. I was actually slightly disappointed by the final boss. I found him surprisingly easy to beat, especially with bubble shields and auto-potions equipped. If I had known he would be so easy, I would have probably tried to beat him without any items.

Overall, this game is quite a gem and you should absolutely buy it. Wayforward is a great company that makes great games that are better than many AAA titles, but with 1/10th of the staff and budget. They deserve your love and money.

9.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198076572440', 'num_games_owned': 137, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 840, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 826, 'last_played': 1648752685}
review:
I've been playing this game for about a week.  For the most part, it's been an enjoyable ride, but the game has a fatal flaw.  That is the final dungeon.  I find myself totally unable to get past the first spike room as the switch timing and all the spikes makes it nearly impossible for all but the most skilled players to pass with any degree of success.

The massive spike in difficulty that comes with the final dungeon totally ruins my enjoyment of the game and makes me feel cheated that I ever bought it.  Due to the difficulty of the dungeon, I will likely never complete the game and it will remain unfinished.  I feel like I wasted my money with this title.

The final dungeon has a difficulty so great that it feels like it belongs in a different game.  Had I known it would be as difficult as it was, I never would've made the purchase, which is a shame since I enjoyed Half Genie Hero.

On the other hand, it does seem like Wayforward Technologies learned their lesson in this regard as the follow up title had less of a difficulty spike with its final level.  When designing games, there should be a more even increase in the level of difficulty as you progress through the game.  For the most part, this is the case with Shantae and the Pirate's Curse.  However this lesson is forgotten with the final level.  I find the level almost totally impassable, which makes me both frustrated and incredibly angry,

I would ask for a refund, but the game is functional and works on my P.C.  The fault isn't with the game not working but in the fundamentally flawed level design of the final level.  I regretfully must recommend against purchasing this game for all but the most skilled players with the best reflexes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000350256', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 846, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 751, 'last_played': 1498293898}
review:
Totally fell in love with this game.
At first I was very sceptical of the hair attack, but as you find upgrades through out the games, everything comes together nicely.
Gameplay is is great.
Level design is varied and maps are not big (quite handy when you need to come back to find secrets).
Upgrades are fun.
Character design is great and fresh.
Story... well i will leave that to you since i am not the kind of person who play games for the story. But overall it is a fine game.
Go get it!

Also, the 3DS version is quite good, it is a pixel perfect match for this kind of graphics.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995985473', 'num_games_owned': 2646, 'num_reviews': 321, 'playtime_forever': 663, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 663, 'last_played': 1493921863}
review:
This. This is the [i]Shantae[/i] I've always wanted. Every misstep from its predecessors cut clean, left only with the best parts and then some.

Fabulous art and music always. Reworked character portraits? Absolutely adorable. The controls are improved, more fluent, and the pirate gear significantly expands Shantae's toolset while never feeling tedious nor neglected as with the past game's transformation spells.

There's a challenge present in [i]The Pirate's Curse[/i] unseen prior -- a fair one with just the right amount of annoyance factor. The stages are wonderfully varied, but never too long; any larger would be to the detriment.

Then there's the story. For the first time in the series, I'm interested in Shantae and her friends. Where they're headed? I genuinely curious to see.

A masterpiece of throwback platforming; that's what [i]Shantae and the Pirate's Curse[/i] is.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975897155', 'num_games_owned': 1166, 'num_reviews': 95, 'playtime_forever': 679, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 614, 'last_played': 1555952125}
review: Shantae and the Pirate's Curse is superb. The artstyle and especially the animations are great and full of life. The port to PC is good and adds high resolution character portraits and hud. Considering this game was released on the Nintendo 3DS/Wii U originally it looks very polished. The music is amazing, gets you right into the mood for some fast paced level clearing! The platforming gameplay is fun but gets a bit repetitive after a while because you mainly attack with your hair since the other attacks don't do much damage for the most part. Lots of stuff to collect too. Highly recommended!

author: {'steamid': '76561198123537815', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 823, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 805, 'last_played': 1527443668}
review:
Zanim zacząłem grać w Shantae and the Pirate's Curse nie znałem tej serii, dlatego też nie miałem żadnych oczekiwań wobec  gry. Pomimo iż jest to port z konsoli na PC gra się przyjemnie i płynnie. Szata graficzna jest kolorowa, a jak na pikselowe obrazki - szczegółowa, animacje są płynne i dopracowane. Naprawdę niewiele można zarzucić tej grze. Jak już to być może to że muzyka po chwili może stać się monotonna.
Poziom trudności gry nie należy do bardzo wymagających a przynajmniej tak jest do momentu w którym nie próbujemy przejść gry na czas lub/i nie otrzymując żadnych obrażeń.
Ogółem, Shantae and the Pirate's Curse to bezstresowa, odprężająca platformówka która na pewno spodoba się wielbicielom klasyki.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058221635', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1095, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 599, 'last_played': 1494115933}
review: 여러면으로 전작보다 향상되었습니다. 고전적인 도트그래픽이 싫지만 않다면 충분히 시간을 투자해 해볼만한 재미있는 게임이죠.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077182863', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 209, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1506434201}
review:
NOTE: This review is from the perspective of someone who played the Wii U version, hence the low play-time

Level design, music, and controls are all excellent. Writing is good and the characters are likable as well. I miss some of the power ups and upgrades from the previous games and Half Genie Hero such as Fireball, but Risky's weapons are an acceptable replacement for Shantae's genie powers. Not a big fan of the character artwork as it seems like generic anime art in my opinion, but that's a relatively trivial complaint. It's a relatively short game, but it's very fun and it's emphasis on speedrunning gives it good replay value, especially for it's low price. Highly recommended especially for those who seek a fun adventure that they can complete within a few hours.

author: {'steamid': '76561198148030287', 'num_games_owned': 1149, 'num_reviews': 200, 'playtime_forever': 694, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 694, 'last_played': 1493142826}
review:
I am so glad that I played this game after having it sit in my library for ages.
I loved every minute of except near the end but I will come back to that later.

The game has excellent music which is catchy and elevates your mood.
The characters are memorable and enjoyable to read all their dialogue.
Gameplay is smooth and I can't remember any deaths where I said that it was the games fault.
Platforming games are normally not my thing but this one surprised me and kept me looking at my clock, planning as to when I could come back to the game.
The only downside was the final part right where the game felt the need to put all "live or die" sequences right behind each other which for me was a bit much. I felt that it would have been better if they had been spread out a bit more throughout the game.

Definitely a great game worth your time!!! ♥♥♥
Now I need more Shantae, can't wait ...

author: {'steamid': '76561198067337159', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 578, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 578, 'last_played': 1487524434}
review:
*Full disclosure* - I own this game on Nintendo 3DS and purchased a Steam key for this game through Humble for a buck. Keep that in mind while you read this review.

If you like Metroidvania-type games, you should definitely play Shantae and the Pirate's Curse (henceforth PC). While it doesn't have the slick HD graphics of Shantae: 1/2 Genie Hero, it has far more exploration and item hunting that HGH does. If go into PC understanding that this is a port of a 240p game from severely underpowered handheld hardware, you'll be just fine. Wayforward has redrawn the portrait art and menues as those would have looked horrid on any modern PC monitor.

Graphically, PC, like all Shantae games is a colorfull 3D side-scroller with lots of cute girl characters and art. Look for screen shots to get a better idea, but don't go in expecting DOAX or Senran Kagura.

Anyway, rather than a tradition Metroidvania structure where all areas are interconnected, this game has one "hub" island and another 4 (5?) islands which you travel to via a scrolling menu. I would have prefered interconnected worlds, but the menu makes sense with the game's ship/pirate theme.

Most Shantae games see the main character using her genie powers to transform into various animals which grant powers such as block crushing, wall climbing, swimming, and the like. In this game, Shantae instead gets her powere from Pirate Gear like a hat that lets you float/fly, a pistol that allows, long distance hits, etc.  Like most fans of the series, I feel like the Pirate Gear results in better, more seamless gameplay than Shante's genie transformations.

The game has a very fair difficulty. You may die here and there, but you should learn from you mistakes and be able to movbe on quickly. The exception is one sequence near the end of the game. I won't well you what it is, but you will know it when you get there.  

This isn't a long game. Most players should be able to finish in 10 hours or less at 100%.

If you like colorful, mid-difficulty exploration games with cute girls and light story, PC is probably for you. if you're looking for a Dark Souls-level challenge, a 100+ hour game, deep story, or are triggered by cute, somtimes scantily-clad anime-style girls, you might be best served to look elsewhere for you gaming needs. 

Highly recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025134353', 'num_games_owned': 201, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1204, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1105, 'last_played': 1492574041}
review:
8.5/10.

This is a very fun game, with charismatic characters, good art direction, good level design, classical gameplay with some twists that make it original, fresh and very replayable, with a consistent diffiiculty, it never feels too hard or too easy.

The pixel art, in my opinion, could be better, but that problem seems fixed in the new Half Genie-Hero game, looking to get that one anytime soon. The music is FANTASTIC, is rather simple, but it is so catchy that you will find yourself humming the song of every stage while playing it. Dialogue is kind of funny, it always end up feeling like a parody of a overly serious gritty game, which demonstrates with it's colorful scheme.

Buy this game if you enjoy 2D sidescroller metroidvania-esque games.
You know what? Buy it nonetheless, it is worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055186773', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 917, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 917, 'last_played': 1492658153}
review:
This is a fun platformer game. 
It feels like playing an updated version of the old Aladdin game that was on the Sega Genesis.

[b]Gameplay[/b]
You start in a town where you can save your game, buy items, and talk to people.
Then you choose which level you want to play.
Only one level is available initially, but more levels are unlocked as you progress.
Each level has a special item that gives your character new abilities.
The new abilities allow your character to reach places that were inaccessible before.
The game is pretty linear overall, but you will backtrack after you get new abilities to obtain powerups that were previously beyond your reach.

The game is not difficult in general but there are parts that can be challenging and frustrating.
Most of the bosses are of moderate difficulty but one or two of them are hard.

[b]Other[/b]
The characters in the game are likable and the dialogue is fun and light-hearted.
It seems like the story is a continuation of some previous games, but I'm not familiar with this saga.
The graphics and animation are good, though some of the animations are rather strange.
The character portraits are done well.
The different plot-lines you encounter in the levels are often funny but the storyline is pretty simple and straight-forward.

[b]Final Thoughts[/b]
Overall, it definitely a fun game that is worth checking out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046528648', 'num_games_owned': 2315, 'num_reviews': 161, 'playtime_forever': 1129, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1129, 'last_played': 1492609572}
review:
非常棒~
上一作的一些小缺点基本上都改掉了。
9/10
在加上性感可爱的人物，给个满分也不为过~~~

+++++许多性感可爱的妹子+漂亮的立绘
+++优秀的画面表现，怪物的种类相比前作提高不少
+++流畅的操作
++多样的玩法，不同关卡都有会一些有趣的玩法。
+++丰富的隐藏要素，除了地图上标识出来的东西，还有一个隐藏房间，一个隐藏迷宫。还有许多隐藏的瓶瓶罐罐，虽然罐子里面的钱本身没什么太大的价值，但寻找隐藏的过程本身就是一种乐趣。
+++精巧的地图设计+许多有趣的小谜题。不需要大量的反复跑动，就可以探索所有的区域。
+++适当的难度，整体难度不高，但能够让你感受到威胁和挑战性。

~经济系统比前作平衡多了，前作中期钱基本就开始大量富余了。

-火枪和踢技作为攻击效果比较差。

虽然没有中文，但有点英文基础，大致理解剧情和通关没什么问题。
即使英文较差，关键的剧情和道具在对话中都会用黄子标识出来。而且NPC比较集中，多对话就可以了。

桑塔的公主服装不能一直使用太可惜了。

author: {'steamid': '76561198263594559', 'num_games_owned': 213, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 2087, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 981, 'last_played': 1630083714}
review:
Tras las consecuencias ocurridas en Risky's Revenge, llega a nosotros Shantae & the Pirate´s Curse. Es hora de ver una medio-genio sin poderes, habilidades con armas y una amistad inesperada.

El aspecto gráfico no cambia demasiado de su predecesor hacia aquí, pero no quita el hecho que es precioso de ver a punta y espada. Y ni hablar del Soundtrack de este juego... Jake Kaufman, una vez más muestra su increíble habilidad en composición para este juego, no hay NI UNA canción que no me canse de escuchar jamás.

El gameplay se siente mucho más fluido y dinámico a comparación de la entrega pasada, lo que da puntos a favor en muchos sentidos. A excepción de ciertas mecánicas aquí y allá, pero no quitan lo disfrutable que es moverse de un sitio a otro.

La historia, como se mencionó antes, es una secuela directa a lo que fue Risky's Revenge; Ésta siendo una mejoría en muchísimos aspectos a lo que conocemos del universo de Shantae, es divertida, expande nuestra visión sobre este mundo y sus personajes, y da mayor propósito a Risky Boots, ¡Es simplemente fenomenal!

Las localizaciones, cada una siendo bastante cliché, no quita que sean cómodas de ver y explorar, los enemigos se sienten muy bien en las ubicaciones visitadas, y hay cierta atmósfera que te hace querer explorar más de estos sitios. Gran parte del Backtrack se siente un poco de extra, pero te da oportunidad de encontrar los objetos ocultos en cada zona, lo que tiene bastante sentido en cierto punto.

¿Y qué hay si te cuento que hay cierta recompensa dependiendo del cómo completes el juego? 4 variantes: Any%, 100%, Speedrun Any% y Speedrun 100% ¡Siéntete mejor contigo mismo si logras estas hazañas!

Rating: 10/10
¿Qué más puedo decir? Es el Magnum Opus de WayForward, sin duda alguna; Si eres un fan de Shantae, los Metroidvanias, o quieres insertarte en este género de videojuegos, date el gusto y juega esta maravilla de juego.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004839075', 'num_games_owned': 1986, 'num_reviews': 133, 'playtime_forever': 174, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 174, 'last_played': 1492383423}
review: Improvement over the previous installment (Risky's Revenge) in many ways (menu confirm button, pause/select buttons, enemy variety and boss design, map, not zoomed so much you can't see where you are jumping). The previous installment was alright. This is better. But same general idea.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058695291', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 120, 'playtime_forever': 983, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 983, 'last_played': 1492329121}
review:
I must say I'm a fan of the Shantae games after my brief encounter with Risky's Revenge. And by brief I mean that that game was too short. Shantae, her hair and endearing cast of characters come at you strong in this game making for a fun platforming adventure.  This time you have a new unseen but ever present foe in the Pirate King, whose presence is felt in the different locations you travel to and as a big bad baddie after revealing himself.

I would say this game features platforming at it's best with every stage being slightly more challenging than the last. Even though you don't sport magical transforming genie powers in this game you still have a number of accessories that help you along the way in the guise of Risky Boots' old pirate gear. Another big change being she's now part of your quest traveling entourage shipping you off to each new destination in Sequin Land.

The graphics, while very reminiscent of the previous game have an updated look and feel making it familiar yet fresh. The in game UI has improved so that it's less cluttered with usable items separated from the questing ones. Some of Shantae's side moves, like her backdash and recovery jump are added as purchased moves but overall felt less necessary than before. The one roundhouse kick move I all but forgot about most of the time as your primary weapons and accessories are more than adequate for dispatching foes.

The platforming though is where this game shines. There's some areas near the end where you'll have to think a lot about how you're going to traverse the area, especially the last stage on your way to defeat the Pirate King. Level design was challenging without being punishing. Bosses had patterns that were easy to figure out but also utilized any new item you picked up in the dungeons well. I would say this game was maybe twice as long as Risky's Revenge and definitely worth your time if you're into Metroidvania type games even if you're not it's just a lot of fun playing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040713594', 'num_games_owned': 908, 'num_reviews': 116, 'playtime_forever': 752, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 752, 'last_played': 1486692838}
review:
Trés trés bon, je hais la plate forme, mais j'adore les metroidvania.
Il me fait penser à Lady Sia sur GBA que je conseille fortement, j'ai eu un peu la même sentation en jouant.

Le jeu n'est ni trop dure ni trop facile à finir, hormis certains succes où il faut speedrunné le jeu. 
On avance plutot bien dans le jeu, le personnage de Shantae est plutot attachant, bestiaire varié, des "coeurs"sont cachés pour augmenter vos points de vies, un système de shop avec des upgrades et des items a utiliser pour des bonus temporaires, un peu comme dans Super Princess Peach sur DS.

Le jeu est remplie monsters girls, tout comme les personages aux cotés de Shantae, il n'y a aucun monstres ainsi qu'aucun personnages importants masculins. 

Parité/20.

author: {'steamid': '76561198115673548', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 229, 'playtime_forever': 1446, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1446, 'last_played': 1491815826}
review:
[h1]接近攻撃で戦うアドベンチャーアクション[/h1]
※シャンテーシリーズを遊ぶのは今作が初です
主に近接攻撃（髪）を使って戦うアクションゲームで
アドベンチャー要素も強いです。（英語をちゃんと読まないと迷います）
メトロイドやロックマンX等にも通じる[u]黄金パターンを独特の形で詰め込まれています。[/u]
文句なしのオススメ評価

[h1]予備知識が無いと分かりにくい[/h1]
攻略には問題ありません。
でも、会話内容を理解する上で
[u]過去作やキャラ設定の知識がないと付いていけない箇所[/u]が多いです。
主人公も含めて個性的で濃いキャラクターばかりなので…。

[h1]難易度は少し高め[/h1]
謎解き的なステージ設計、パターン化できないと回避すら難しいボス
基本ノーヒントの隠し通路and隠しアイテムなどなど。
高難易度ではないですが、途中で詰んだり投げたりする方もいるでしょう。
[u]アクションゲームの基本的なお作法[/u]は知っている前提の作りだと感じました。

author: {'steamid': '76561197989692690', 'num_games_owned': 731, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 565, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 565, 'last_played': 1491780423}
review:
[h1] PROS [/h1]
[list]
    [*]Interesting story
    [*]Good soundtrack
    [*]Well drawn and animated
    [*]Enjoyable gameplay
    [*]Fanservice
[/list]
[h1] CONS [/h1]
[list]
    [*]Sudden difficulty bumps
    [*]Last level is needlessly hard and quirky
    [*]Keyboard controls are weird
    [*]Easy to get lost trying to find where you have to go next which forces you to refer to walkthroughs
    [*]Fanservice
[/list]
[h1] OVERALL [/h1]
Shantae and the Pirate's Curse is a really enjoyable game, nicely animated and drawn, with a vibrant colour palette. The story and its characters are memorable. It offers 10 or so hours of gameplay unless you're a completionist and you want to complete all the achievements. This was the first game I had played of the series and I quite liked it even though I don't particularly enjoy metroidvania games. At full price the game is a little bit too expensive for my taste but I would totally suggest you buy it when it is on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038494992', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 962, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 905, 'last_played': 1631674723}
review: This is a great game, but fair warning: the last level will hit you like the Juggernaut and will disintegrate any hope you have of overcoming it with Phoenix-like brutality. It is perhaps the biggest cockblock I've ever encountered in all my years of gaming. Skipping the level is no better, perhaps worse: a sequence of jumping from platform to platform in the tower, which requires absolutely perfect timing. The entire stretch of the level, whether completing the level as intended or skipping it through the tower platforms, is a crock of shit. It's utterly unnecessary, excessive, and jarring. There are difficulty spikes in the game, like Megaman And Bass, but while that game is consistently difficult this game hits you with this like an atomic bomb. You might just want to skip this one and enjoy the soft-reboot that is Half-Genie Hero.  Otherwise, enjoy it like you would a tv show that was cancelled too early but was going to a predictable conclusion anyway.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010819253', 'num_games_owned': 218, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1091, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 898, 'last_played': 1502388630}
review:
Uno splendido platform 2D, ne troppo semplice, ne troppo complicato.

L'unica cosa che non capisco è il perchè tra le etichette non sia inserita Colonna sonora eccezionale perchè sono state proprio le musiche di questo gioco a convincermi a prenderlo.

Lo consiglio agli amanti del genere!

author: {'steamid': '76561197995346221', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 758, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 694, 'last_played': 1492900675}
review:
The music works so well in this game I have to call it out first. It's fun and upbeat and exotic, and sets the tone, pace, and rhythm of the entire game.

The platforming is great. It flies by quickly, matching the beat of the background music. Not quite as challenging as other platformers out there, but there are plenty of very satisfying moments, especially when discovering upgrades. The final stage does introduce a decent amount of challenge.

Varied and satisfying boss battles. Still not too difficult compared to other games. The Steam achievements surrounding boss battles sound insanely difficult, for anyone seeking more.

Likable characters and fan service abound. The dialog feels fresh, jokes not overdone.

The length of the game is just right. 8-10 hours for experienced gamers. Again, it flew by, and I was left wanting more, yet satisfied with the experience- if that makes sense.

Downsides:

- The beginning of the game (first 30-60 minutes) feels easy and boring. It picks up after that.
- A couple of the collectibles are obscure if you don't clear a room the way the developers intended. This makes backtracking/exploration tedious in a couple areas. The majority of collectibles make sense though.

Overall a fantastic and highly satisfying game. Pick it up!

author: {'steamid': '76561198010121117', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1138, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 727, 'last_played': 1545496714}
review:
One of the better 2-D action platformers you can find.

If you're looking for a Metroidvania or classic Nintendo type of game, then definitely give this one a try.

Quick fun for the completionists out there, for this game isn't a long winding and confusing path of collectables, but it's still got a fair amount of cleverly hidden items that will likely have you check twice here and there.

It's got puzzles, dungeons, action and a great Soundtrack to back it all up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198097512483', 'num_games_owned': 408, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 750, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 750, 'last_played': 1491106579}
review:
Shantae é uma franquia que merece o sucesso!

Um dos melhores jogos indie que já experimentei na Steam. Além de ter gráficos bonitos, personagens cativantes e uma trilha sonora espetacular, o jogo faz referências a clássicos marcantes da indústria dos jogos (Castlevania, Duck Tales, Megaman, Sonic...).

O jogo não é difícil quando se pega o jeito, e vai ficando mais interessante a medida em que vc vai aprendendo novas habilidades com a Shantae. 

Pra quem gosta do gênero Metroidvania, a diversão é garantida!

author: {'steamid': '76561198001071919', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 203, 'playtime_forever': 628, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 628, 'last_played': 1491172172}
review: This is the first and only Shantae game I will be playing.  Everything about it except the music is awful.  I've had it crash 3 times losing around an hour or so of progress each time.  If you like Having Waifu tiddys shoved in your face then grab it by the P***y otherwise steer clear.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054766153', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 1136, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1056, 'last_played': 1491006524}
review:
I got this game in a humble bundle and had seen a couple of videos of the game previously. I was interested in the game before I tried it out and the game exceeded my expectations. On the surface, it's a cutesy anime-inspired looking game with more fan service than I would have liked and with a lot of humor and fourth-wall breaking. It may seem like a game to not take seriously, but the gameplay is Metroidvania-esque with hard platforming, items, puzzles, hidden objects, secrets, difficult but interesting bosses, etc. It holds up with hard platforming games like that on the NES or SNES, but it's also modern. The controls are fluent and very responsive and movement it sastisfying. Attacks are mostly hair-whipping but you can unlock a powerful kick and when you get items like the cannon, the scimitar, and the boots then you can use them as weapons as well and even do so combos. You go to different islands which each have a boss where you get an item after. Each island gets increasingly difficult. Spiderweb Island is kinda annoying because of the zombies that come out of the ground. The ghosts are BS because they will randomly appear within damage distance to you and you won't see them coming, often times knocking you back off of platforms, and they can be hard to line up hits against. Mudbog Island is the most annoying for me because every other steps an enemy suddenly appears when you're close enough to get damge from them. These weird tar globs pop up from the ground, strange gloop monsters poke from the ceiling so when you try to jump over the tar globs, the ceiling gloop guys slap your face. Then the slime ghouls that bounce around are just stupidly irritating. It's not a hard level, just one where you get sick of it quick. Some bosses feel almost impossible until you figure out what you need to do and what item you need to use. The Squid Baron gave me a real run for my patience and I died many times until I figured out how to weaken him and how to dodge his patterns. The dragon boss was weird because I wasn't sure if I was doing anything right or if I was hitting him and suddenly I won, but I'm probably alone on that one.
There are places that seem excessive to me, and perhaps not for the better. In Spider Web Island, you have to carry someone through a forest and you have to dodge enemies and obstacles because you can't attack and one hit kills you. And this part feels like it goes on forever. Everytime you think that was the last section and you relax your muscles, wiping the sweat from your brow, there's more. Also, the final level going through the palace was impossibly hard and incredibly tedious, adding so much more stages than I feel they should have and not enough checkpoints. I would get to a part in a stage where I thought there was a checkpoint, then I make a small mistake and I'm all the way at the beginning, forced to face the last deathly impossible challenge. I actually had to do a jump shortcut to skip the palace in order to save my sanity (this is the video that helped me https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=X2oO17qvy34&t=13s ) Maybe you'll have a lot more patience than me. And the final boss took a longer time than I expected too. Everytime I thought I was close, I was far from it, and then he'd change things up and you'd have to defeat this stage of him. But once that final cutscene started, my heart soared to the heavens and I screamed in passion, "YESSSSS!!!!" It felt good. The rewards were worth the challenges. It looks like a game that will be average, but instead is tough and looks at your outstretched hand and says "I ain't taking your hand you little baby." It kicks your butt, it gives you false security, it then let's you know just how bad you are. It's a good game, and even though it can be a little cryptic at times, it's worth playing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198093299328', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 503, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 503, 'last_played': 1490903031}
review:
I would have never thought that I would like this game. 

Platformers are not my favorite kind of genre, and I got put off by the visual style in the beginning. But this game has actually a very good level design and charming humour. It was challenging at times, but not too much. 

I may actually get the sequel of this at some point.

author: {'steamid': '76561198131483583', 'num_games_owned': 271, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 400, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 353, 'last_played': 1569954384}
review:
The game itself is simply gold, though do not be fooled by it's "Full controller support", this it does not have. this is easy to fix, however,  with a simple program that I don't really remember the name of currently. (wow, didn't believe it would be that hard to write a gorydamn rewiew, geez)
But what the game has is an incredible story, awesome gameplay, nice pixelated graphics and... You know what, fuck it, i'm going off the script here, what the hell are you even doing down here in the comment section? Buy the bloody game already! Its awesome, trust me! (well, don't trust me to write good rewiews, but trust me on this one)
Definetly worth a buy, seriously, you won't regret it. unless you're an idiot that is. (but you're not, are you?)

author: {'steamid': '76561198119626352', 'num_games_owned': 422, 'num_reviews': 108, 'playtime_forever': 627, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 627, 'last_played': 1490808287}
review:
简直可以称为2d动作游戏的一股清流
有流畅的动作，动听的音乐，
搭配不算复杂的操作却充满乐趣和挑战的关卡
虽然要重复跑迷宫但是不会产生太多厌倦的收集要素
放弃了前作的部分系统，优秀程度却丝毫不逊色
还有蜜汁剧情？

缺点也就最后一关难度突然飙起而已（虽然玩惯act的应该对此问题不大




8/10  好了，我要开始运球了！

author: {'steamid': '76561198040595851', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 757, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 757, 'last_played': 1490587144}
review:
This was my first game in the Shantae series and I have to say I was not disappointed. The game does have a lot of backtracking, and the game doesn't truly become diffcult until just after half way, but it is still a well rounded platformer with a lot of creativity. It took me just over 12 hours to beat it, but I don't feel it was missing length.

[spoiler]Also if you're into half naked waifus it has lots of those too.[/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561197992812494', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 678, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 678, 'last_played': 1490576799}
review: The game is great, until the last level inside the palace. Whoever designed this level should never be allowed to have dessert for the rest of their life. I refused to finish the game for this part alone. Still, worth playing... but screw that level and the designer.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961082042', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 214, 'playtime_forever': 623, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 612, 'last_played': 1490450913}
review: Fun gameplay but lots of backtracking, no autosaves, and lots of times where you don't know where to go to use a certain item. Don't recommend the full price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198134475777', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 704, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 585, 'last_played': 1653837569}
review:
IMPRESIONANTE, MARAVILLOSO, DIVERTIDISIMO...!!

Shantae es un juego realmente impresionante, lo pueden degustar tanto los paladares mas retro como los gamers de hoy dia que busquen un juego de plataformas con unos toques mas.

Nos encontramos ante un titulo impresionante que han sabido cuidar y mimar hasta el ultimo detalle con unos sprites muy bien hechos, muy graciosos y muy divertidos que hacen que sea uno de los puntos mas destacables del juego "desde mi punto de vista", se mueven con una fluidez espectacular que acompañados de esos paisajes tan coloridos y agradables a la vista en todo momento hacen que en cierto modo volvamos a nuestra niñez olvidandonos por completo de otros titulos donde tiene mas importancia la calidad grafica, las opciones disponibles o el juego en equipo o coperativo.
La musica es otro de sus puntos fuertes y destacable tambien en todo momento que acompañado de los sonidos y animaciones y la jugabilidad hacen que tengamos diversion asegurada al 100% durante el tiempo que nos dure el juego.
Sobre la durabilidad no puedo opinar ya que aun no le he terminado pero tengo ganas de acabarlo para jugar al proximo shantae que ese si que es el juego estrella de la saga.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970839600', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 642, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 553, 'last_played': 1541467109}
review: Nice platformer, cute and memorable characters, gradually harder difficulty as you progress in the game which gives you a decent challenge through the game, not too easy and not too hard, replayable and still fun as hell.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025158704', 'num_games_owned': 573, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 210, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 55, 'last_played': 1575214226}
review: Idealna gra by odetchnąć na chwilę od wszystkich przesadnie rozbudowanych gier z otwartymi światami, tysiącem znajdziek i efektrami walącymi po oczach. Gra retro, ale lepsza od większości 8- i 16-bitowych platformówek - zachowuje ich zalety jednocześnie pozbywając się frustrujących elementów charakterystycznych dla klasyków gatunku. ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198257591419', 'num_games_owned': 132, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 1141, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1141, 'last_played': 1490087496}
review: 通关撒花~感谢@muse强行安利 这是我在steam上第一个玩完的平台类游戏，直观感受是这游戏很靠背板和运气，游戏性来自于关卡设计的难度挑战性，探索做得非常好，道具感觉都是比较基本的功能性道具；音乐是属于卡关也不会听着烦躁的棒，如果模型更精细+有中文就更好了~

author: {'steamid': '76561198197196354', 'num_games_owned': 737, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 636, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 458, 'last_played': 1491206929}
review:
绝对是好游戏  ，喜欢恶魔城这种游戏以及像素控务必不要错过，原价购入不亏，玩了一半左右感觉比前作好玩。
操作的手感完美  不会出现有些游戏难度源于本身操作和物理引擎很难受这种问题，玩的非常爽快。
BGM满分  非常有感觉。
关卡设计的话……  有些关卡一时想不到怎么过会卡关一下，不过总体来说整体还是很流畅的[spoiler]
第一大关要打肉然后收集肉的香气你敢信？我搞个神灯就为了这个？	[/spoiler]
收集要素（血上限和那个黑色的小恶魔）还是蛮多了  虽然我只玩了头三大关但是似乎差了有四分之一的收集要素需要打了之后的关卡才能拿到。
没有中文，感觉想看剧情但是不想啃英文有点难受。We need Chinese plz.
[spoiler] 乳摇好评	[/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198028535642', 'num_games_owned': 125, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 1648, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 985, 'last_played': 1620839422}
review:
This game is WAYYYYY too much fun.  As a fan of mostly shooters, it was fun to go to another gametype, and [b] oh boi did I choose a great game [/b]. 

So, I guess I need to break it down like this then. 

STORY: I really do like the flow of this story, it starts you off from what I belive is Risky's Revenge. However, the story is so flowing that not only do you not need to play the other games, but you'll feel like you have played the other games even though you didn't. [i] It actually feels like an adventure, go figure[/i] xD 9.5/10

GAMEPLAY: I can't really talk about this game play too much without spoiling a 10 year old game (it's totally not 10 years old lol). Starting out, it feels like a typical platformer with a standard melee, fair stuff. But [i] ohhhhhhhhhhh boi[/i]. When you get dem "upgrades", boi oh boi, that's when this game gets REAL GOOD. JESUS. Not only does it get more fun with "upgrades", it does get challenging as you progress. 10/10

MUSIC: [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TUoYI0cXIUw] Bruh,[/url] it is the best game music I've heard in a while. It can be funky as fuckle when you are in an easy going part, and then [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vGW1aF5cAyg&index=3&list=RDhImbUtLJT04] ominous and spooky [/url] when need be. It is a FANTASTIC soundtrack and I want to kiss Jake Kaufman for making doing so well (... well maybe not kiss, but you get the point; I'm very appreciative of his work).  15/10 I don't give a fuck.

Minor Gripes: Some things are a little cryptic while other times they stright up tell you what to do with an item. Items can be hidden in the weirdest of places (I'm lookin' at you, Scuttle Bat #20. :V) Really, my only complaint.

Overall: If you can get this in a humble bundle or if you get this- JUST GET THIS. PLEASE. IT HAS FULL XBOX CONTROLLER  SUPPORT AND IS JUST A GREAT GAME. PLEASE. 

This game has changed my outlook on life. That's how good it was. I [i]was [/i] suicidal. Now, I'm going to make a life of myself just because I played a game. 
.... that sounded way better in my head- anyways, Please do get this game. It's way too good :O

author: {'steamid': '76561198062464945', 'num_games_owned': 469, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 14, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1489514622}
review:
I didn't give this game much of a chance, but it seems Gamepad is almost essential to play it. It seems like a console game that was poorly migrated to PC, doesn't integrate well in Full Screen and with Keyboard.
Music is very repetitive and annoying as well.
Not sure why it has "Overwhelmingly Positive" reviews, seems just average to me.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972680205', 'num_games_owned': 1276, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 476, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 476, 'last_played': 1489497078}
review: This was my first Shantae game, and I'm now sold on the series. The graphics, gameplay, writing, and especially the music are amazing. One of the best platformers I've ever played. Positive, bright, humorous, and even touching. Shantae is fun from start to finish.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990570457', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 770, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 770, 'last_played': 1489310465}
review: An all around improvement on Risky's Revenge. Graphics, navigating, sound, controls, abilities and much more are improved or added. Good humor and fun gameplay, check it out! 7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198008414556', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 797, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 736, 'last_played': 1489936001}
review: Fun game but what kinda killed it is the backtracking.If you dont like reading guides and spoilers online then there will certainly come a point where you have no idea what to do and you will have to backtrack to all the other islands to find out what item you are missing and then hope to find the right NPC that interacts with that item so you can finally progress. Or you could just let me enjoy the game at a nice pace? I guess not

author: {'steamid': '76561198076789172', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 444, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 444, 'last_played': 1489171217}
review:
I can't wholeheartedly recommend The PIrate's Curse. You get a few laughs here and there, lots of silliness, but nothing that really gets to you. The platforming is decent, but without any emotional context you often feel like you're running around out of sheer boredom.

In short, there are better platformers out there, and there's better writing out there too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198070945092', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 357, 'playtime_forever': 873, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 873, 'last_played': 1559049495}
review:
전작 할때는 분명 굉장히 좋았던 일러인데 이것과 비교하니 얼마나 많은 발전이 있었나 보입니다.
전형적인 플렛포머 게임이고, 전작에는 마법이라는 요소로 재미를 줬다면 이번에는 특수 아이템들로 재미를 줍니다.
복귀 아이템으로 편의성이 높아져 전작보다 맵 이동에 따른 짜증이 덜합니다. 그리고 맵도 굉장히 다양하여
여러가지 재미를 주기도 하구요.

전작을 해보셨던 분이나 처음으로 접하는 분. 플렛포머를 사랑한다면 만족할 수 있는 게임이라고 생각합니다.
이제 하프 지니 히어로만 구해서 하면 될텐데...

author: {'steamid': '76561198158125034', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 190, 'playtime_forever': 788, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 788, 'last_played': 1488775054}
review:
TL;DR: I recommend it if you like sidescrollers, or are new to the genre.

It has a lot of backtracking, and on some (very few) moments the difficulty spiked so randomly that it pissed me off how unbalanced it felt.

But other than that its really good!, good music, pixel art is nice, the artwork is better than on the previous games of the series, and all in all the bosses and dungeons were fun!

author: {'steamid': '76561198050478086', 'num_games_owned': 1672, 'num_reviews': 156, 'playtime_forever': 1049, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1030, 'last_played': 1488116293}
review:
This is my first shantae game and i must say i loved it, the writing is awesome geting many laughters  , the gameplay hooked me since the very first minutes,  im not a fan of platformers myself but this one was actually fun! 

The game is very metroidvania as you progress will unlock new items to move through the level, some of those power ups include gliding with a pirate hat and having your own pirate pistol to use  in order to pick up collectables you couldn't pick before in previous levels  both for upgrading yourself or to progress in the story.

Overall the game is quite easy unless you're doing challenges like 100% speed run or beat the game with only 2 heart containers in which case prepare to break your screen in anger , recommended to play with a gamepad for the best experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046052125', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 900, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 877, 'last_played': 1518412205}
review:
Nice fun platformer, you constantly find uppgrades giving you new abilities making you backtrack to previous levels to reach places you couldnt before. Good layout, cute graphics and relaxing gameplay.

The gameplay is relativly easy, where the challenge comes more from figuring out where to go and what to do next than from the enemies

author: {'steamid': '76561198143594906', 'num_games_owned': 330, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 4165, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 826, 'last_played': 1591242948}
review: I loved it... The soundtrack was great, the gameplay was amazing, the cast and character interactions were consistently funny and interesting. Buy this if you haven't already, you're missing out.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972499798', 'num_games_owned': 504, 'num_reviews': 219, 'playtime_forever': 679, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 679, 'last_played': 1488347590}
review: Humorous with good quality combat and platforming.  It could stand to have a little bit more depth but it plucks all the right strings to be just a good game.  There is good platforming, combat and music.  It's a bit short on items/character upgrades but makes up for it with some meta gaming humor which is always to be admired.  All in all this game is worth spending your money on.

author: {'steamid': '76561198088230290', 'num_games_owned': 228, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 1401, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1394, 'last_played': 1488175526}
review:
Shantae and the Pirate's Curse is absolutely overflowing with personality. Its gorgeous art direction coupled with a killer soundtrack and tight platforming makes for an all around fun game. The characters are well animated, the dialogue is memorable and humorous, and the locales and all goodies found within are expertly designed and situated.

If you are looking for vibrant visuals, kickin' soundtracks, tight platforming, and lots of goodies in between, then I highly recommend getting this game for yourself.

author: {'steamid': '76561198229841752', 'num_games_owned': 130, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 3826, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3167, 'last_played': 1697338304}
review:
Nos encontramos ante la tercera entrega de Shantae cuyo personaje debutó en 2002 en la consola portátil de Nintendo la Game Boy Color y que actualmente está disponible para el Nintendo 3DS (exclusivamente). Una vez más es un juego de plataformas en 2D (side-scrolling) pero que ahora agrega mecánicas de los juegos de Metroid (Metroidvania/Igavania) por lo que es mucho más extenso que Risky's Revenge. A pesar de eso sigue siendo un poco corto y algo fácil porque el juego apenas ofrece reto, ya que los niveles a pesar de estar bien diseñados son pequeños y no hay mucho que explorar. Los acertijos de los laberintos son muy fáciles (por no decir muy obvios) y los jefes de nivel tampoco son la excepción, no obstante, sigue siendo muy divertido y satisfactorio.

Gráficamente me decepciona porque si lo comparamos con la versión de 3DS (original) los sprites y escenarios están demasiado pixelados y no tiene soporte de filtrados como bilinear o trilinear como mínimo y es que algunos gráficos se distorsionan bastante haciendo que la versión de 3DS sea muy superior visualmente.

La música es excelente pues es de Jake Kaufman quien ha trabajado anteriormente en juegos como Shovel Knight, Mighty Switch Force y la serie de Shantae propiamente. El diseño de personajes es muy original y esta vez fue el equipo de Inti Creates (Mega Man Zero y Azure Striker Gunvolt) el que se encargó del arte.

En el apartado técnico no me puedo quejar de nada porque el juego no tiene bugs o al menos yo no tuve dificultades, soporta mando para aquellas personas que no están acostumbradas al teclado (yo jugué con los dos) y no parece tener problemas de rendimiento o compatibilidad.

En conclusión Shantae and the Pirate's Curse es un juego muy entretenido pero que es un poco corto y algo fácil, no obstante, tiene a su favor una historia muy divertida, personajes carismáticos, buena música y en general un buen diseño.

Calificación:

4 de 5

author: {'steamid': '76561198037482292', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 545, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 538, 'last_played': 1486743383}
review:
A solid 2D side scrolling action platformer which contains all the important ingredients for a great experience.
Namely:

1) Quirky and interesting characters
2) Simple yet good controls
3) Lots of secrets & hidden areas
4) Extremely lax clothing rules

While not particularly challenging (unless you're achievement hunting), the host of interesting characters and the silly interactions keep the game light-hearted and fun. Because of this, you'll always be ret-2-go for the next island.

author: {'steamid': '76561198088389026', 'num_games_owned': 738, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 998, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 998, 'last_played': 1487865702}

author: {'steamid': '76561198118663902', 'num_games_owned': 1624, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 997, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 997, 'last_played': 1487860975}
review:
Pasado
Me lo comprare shantae parece bonita!, me gusta coleccionar juegos probarlos, y si me gustan lo suficiente terminarlos.

Presente
Como pude estar tanto tiempo sin conocer esta franquicia, si te gusta metroid, castelvania, kirby, megaman este juego es para ti, aun más si te gusta el anime de aderezan la vista con estupendos diseños de personaje, increíble personalidad e historia que va avanzando no solo a nivel de juego, sino también a nivel general de toda la saga, increíble comedia, increíble jugabilidad, increíble duración al día de hoy al 100 % 19 horas pense que seria un juego de 6 horas!.
Ost buenisimo para que tu oído se de un banquete, diseño de nivel perfecto para que se pueda hacer con calma o en modo speedrun, y además tiene 2 finales que más se puede pedir sin más obra maestra!

author: {'steamid': '76561197976923707', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 788, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 788, 'last_played': 1487788676}
review: Lo he adquirido mediante humble bundle (1$) y la verdad es que me ha sorprendido gratamente, es un indie de plataformas que no se hace nada repetitivo y muy bien pulito en todos los aspectos, la banda sonora es genial también. Muy buen juego

author: {'steamid': '76561198095695887', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1444, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1441, 'last_played': 1488881878}
review:
此游戏不同往常所玩的横板过关游戏没有过于华丽的动作
在这个动作至上的时代这样或许会显得这款游戏是否过于单一
答案是否定的，并不是说一款游戏没有动作就不能有趣
桑塔是由多个独立的动作组合而成，每个动作都是在其他的动作游戏中的常见招式
但是它却能做到比一些动作华丽的同类游戏更加的有趣这必然是下了功夫
他的优点就在于其爽快的操作，不使用华丽的动作就是为了换来爽快的操作
可以在简简单单的动作中得到很大的乐趣
然后又在简单的动作中去收集各种要素简直是不亦乐乎
但是这种爽快感最大的缺点就是耐玩性比较差
第一次玩乐的时候会觉得很有趣
然是第二次或许就不再想玩乐了
不过对于一个如此价位的游戏而言已经是十分值得
再说一句
没有中文很可惜
英语比较差通关的时候有些许麻烦

author: {'steamid': '76561197972091113', 'num_games_owned': 653, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 819, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 819, 'last_played': 1487703663}
review: Tremendously charming and well-realised platform adventure. Beautiful art, infectious music and warm humour bring the world and its characters to life, and tight controls make it a joy to play. Makes some demands on the player towards the end, but by then you'll have the tools and practise to see it through. I'd happily place it alongside the best examples of the genre.
