author: {'steamid': '76561198030792061', 'num_games_owned': 123, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 691, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 668, 'last_played': 1489760967}
review:
Antes que nada, no he jugado los otros Shantae y, en mi opinión, esa es prueba suficiente para demostrar que el juego por sí solo es bueno, dejando de lado la-que-sea la historia que quiera contar.

A primeras el juego no llama la atención, es un plataformas de más pensamos... O cuán insensato fui.

Shantae tiene unas mecánicas muy sólidas adaptadas correctamente a los niveles y según qué partes del nivel, si desbloqueas un nueva mecánica lo más seguro es que puedas usarla otra vez en alguno de los mapas ya visitados, favoreciendo y recompensando la exploración.
Los enemigos, aunque muy diferenciados en diseño (apartado donde pongo un sobresaliente), no se diferencian entre sí, pues la mayoría atacan cerca, con arrojadizas (rectas o en curva) o simplemente caminan para hacer daño.
La banda sonora es muy destacable, perfectamente adaptada al momento y la jugabilidad: Rápida, rítmica y pegadiza.

El diseño ¡oh el diseño! Fabuloso PixelArt llevado a cabo con un cuidado increíble, no solo en los sprites estáticos o fondos del mundo, sino también en las animaciones.

Juego muy recomendado, al menos como obligado durante las rebajas.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038286084', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 35, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35, 'last_played': 1487464451}
review:
Got as part of humble bundle and decided to try it based on positive reviews. I can only assume this game gets better later based on other reviews, but I don't plan on playing it long enough to find out. The first few levels were very boring, your character starts with only a basic melee attack and single jump and that's it, average level design, and extremely boring enemies. Only allowing the player to save at specific points is also annoying.

In windowed mode, the game only allows two very small resolutions (uninstalled the game before I thought to check the exact numbers for this review) which is strange. The game has a fullscreen mode which gives more resolution options, but I had serious performance issues. I can only describe it as excessive screen tearing, which made the game unplayable in fullscreen. Forcing vsync on in nvidia control panel did not make any difference.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006304133', 'num_games_owned': 1958, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 406, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 406, 'last_played': 1487398632}
review:
This game is by far one of the best platformers I've played in recent years. It has a wide variety of settings that utilize the various abilities given to you throughout the game. There's definitely some good replayability in there for finding the "fastest" route.

The only complaint? It was too short! I could've kept playing for many more hours.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061373735', 'num_games_owned': 599, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 5565, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4382, 'last_played': 1593273334}
review:
Hace literalmente 6 días analicé Shantae: Risky's Revenge Director's Cut. Pues en ese tiempo me  he descargado pirata este juego, me lo he pasado, me lo he comprado, y me lo he vuelto a pasar, en ese orden. 

Este juego sinceramente es, más de lo mismo, jugabilidad mejorada y más divertida, mismos y más personajes carismáticos, pero ahora POR FIN NO HAY BANDAS NEGRAS VERTICALES JODER 1080p60 REALES FUCK YEAH. Más diversión, más dungeons, más por explorar, más Shantae, pero además mejor. Historia jodidamente bonita, con traducción notablemente regular pero comprensible. En este tiempo me he enamorado de la saga y de sus personajes y de todo lo que rodea este juego el aspecto gráfico píxel sublime, el soundtrack otra vez de mano de Jake "puto amo te comía los huevos" Kaufman. Manamorao y no puedo esperar pa comprarme en cuanto pueda la última entrega, Shantae: Half-Genie Hero.

EN RESUMEN QUE COMPRES ESTE PUTO JUEGO COÑO

author: {'steamid': '76561197960342473', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 157, 'playtime_forever': 599, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 357, 'last_played': 1487349684}
review:
Fun platformer. Wouldnt call it Metroidvania, its not that complex.

Nice Metal Slug pixel art style, solid gameplay, good soundtrack

If youre concerned about/in want of anime boobs, there are some (on monsters too lol) but its harmless PG cheesecake akin to Parodius. The game doesnt take itself too serious either.

Controller recommended

author: {'steamid': '76561198046268101', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 119, 'playtime_forever': 697, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 697, 'last_played': 1487334778}
review:
キャラクターが可愛いメトロヴァニア系プラットフォーマー。
前作のRisky's revengeと比べてマップが2次元の構成になったので迷いにくくなった。行き先がわからず詰んだらだいたいゾンビ兄妹のところへ行けば間違いない。
回復やバフ系アイテムがやたら豊富なため各種ボスはゴリ押しできる。最大の敵は即死の穴とトゲ。
レベルデザイン上の難易度設計がおかしい。序盤と最終ダンジョンだけ異常にむずい。特にラスダンはつまらなくて高難度で中間ポイントが遠い。
演出はよくできているのでちゃんとしたレベルデザイナーを雇ってほしい。

author: {'steamid': '76561198009156904', 'num_games_owned': 756, 'num_reviews': 278, 'playtime_forever': 483, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 483, 'last_played': 1487308415}
review:
Shantae ภาคนี้ยังคงเกมเพลย์เหมือนภาคที่แล้ว (Risky's Revenge) คือเคลียร์ดันเจี้ยน ตามเก็บไอเท็มพิเศษเพิ่มหัวใจ เก็บตังค์ซื้ออัพเกรด ย้อนกลับไปฉากเก่าๆพร้อมอุปกรณ์ใหม่เพื่อเก็บของที่ขาดไป แต่ที่ต่างคือแทนที่จะใช้การเต้นเปลี่ยนร่าง (ซึ่งที่มันไม่มีเพราะมันต่อเนื้อเรื่องจากภาคที่แล้วที่ Shantae เสียพลังเวทมนตร์ในตัวไป) ภาคนี้มีอุปกรณ์โจรสลัดที่สามารถหยิบมาใช้ได้ด้วยปลายนิ้ว ตัวเกมเพลย์พัฒนาขึ้นมากๆ แผนที่มีประโยชน์ ไอเท็มกดใช้ทันทีได้ และอุปกรณ์โจรสลัดที่ให้มาใหม่ก็มีประโยชน์และใช้สนุกมากๆ เพราะสามารถลัดการเดินทางให้เร็วขึ้นได้ และภาคนี้แฟนเซอร์วิสเยอะกว่าภาคที่แล้วด้วย (อาร์ทเวิร์คมันสวยขึ้นด้วยแหละ)

ข้อเสียเดียวที่ต้องบ่นเลยคือทั้งๆที่ในรูปมันแปะภาพ Shantae ใส่ชุดโจรสลัด แต่ Shantae ไม่ได้ใส่ชุดโจรสลัดเลย Sprite ก็เปลี่ยนเฉพาะตอนใช้อาวุธโจรสลัด และมันมีโหมด Pirate Mode ก็ไม่เปลียนชุดให้ ทั้งๆที่ภาคที่แล้ว Magic Mode มันเปลี่ยนชุดให้ทั้งเกมเลย

สนุกและคุ้มเงินดีสำหรับคนชอบเกมสไตล์ Metroid และอยากเห็นตัวละครหญิงแต่งชุดวับๆแวมๆอ่ะนะ

author: {'steamid': '76561198045976087', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 949, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 716, 'last_played': 1491233123}
review:
First of, I havent even heard of this series till i got this game. After playing through it... It was worth it.

Story is very wall-breaking just to advance the plot... but hey, it all kind of works in its own charming and quirky way.
Graphics is based from its 3ds port, sound is OK. Controls are terrible on default. After configuring to WASD and JKL... its playable reminiscent of those old flash games.

Gameplay is smooth and fun...until the last level. This difficulty curve is insane but doable. If you hate trying to make it through a corridor perfectly over and over again... look up a cheat/exploit to skip it. I did it legit but that was not fun.

Overall... I would give it a 8.5/10. Worth playing even if youve never played the series. Suggestive outfits are just a bonus.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969856521', 'num_games_owned': 638, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 721, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 663, 'last_played': 1562111585}
review:
This game has huge input lag issues in fullscreen on some systems and the resolution options are pathetic.
Sadly there isn't even a true fix for both those problems.
You basically have to play this in windowed mode wich on top of all this crap is locked to some wierd small resolution like 540p or 600p if you have input lag.

The game itself is a very good platformer, you should get it on a console if you have one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198107694284', 'num_games_owned': 170, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 1763, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1617, 'last_played': 1590159667}
review:
跟前作 Shantae: Risky's Revenge 相比進步了很多
劇情上的時間點延續前作，人物雖會提及過去事但不會多提，但在了解前因後果的情況下會更有趣


本作的 Shantae 因為劇情關係無法變身，但還是有她那頭強韌的頭髮XD
也因為與系列作勁敵 Risky Boots 合作，可以使用各種海盜裝備，收集齊全就會變身成海盜！ (最好)
前作原本預設就有的向後滑步不知怎麼改成要從商店購買，但既有靴子，何用滑步呢


本以為有個超強大魔頭劇情應該會比前作嚴肅，沒想到比前作還歡樂爆笑
湖邊玩水、囚禁公主、前頭目的大反擊，講太明白就不有趣了，有興趣的玩家請自行體會
還有選擇島嶼畫面根本不像要拯救世界，反而是像要跟 Risky Boots 約會 (褒意)


前作主角好友戲分過少的問題在本作也有改善，而且搶戲程度不輸Shantae，不再是劇情提醒用NPC
Bolo 是個迷糊鬼，Sky 是心靈與物質上都很支持你的好姐妹，Rottytops 是個愛捉弄人的小惡魔
讓我大感意外的是城鎮裡還有人提到前作的多話廚師，製作組該不會很愛這個角色吧......


前作因劇情關係在相同兩地往返移動的乏味過程，在本作也能感受到製作組試圖改善
譬如在某島上設有快速直達列車，也有能夠直接回到接駁點的道具可以使用，移動起來方便不少
破關後以海盜模式重新體驗，更能感受到地圖是有用心設計過的，好多捷徑可以抄，第一輪玩得好苦XD


另外 Shantae 原地不動的時候會撥頭髮，血量過低時會露出疲態，
使用油燈扭來扭去的樣子特別有魅力，像素圖刻得這樣生動，能感受到美術的愛


真要說缺點，應該是觸碰到尖刺即失敗重來的關卡後期會比較多
尤其是後期爬向天空或爬塔，可能會讓不擅長的玩家好不容易前進一點之後又立刻崩潰


方便入戲用的前作大劇透，觀看前請三思：
[spoiler]1. 市長因情況不得已把小鎮賣給 Ammo Baron，本作一開始就是債主來取貨
2. Rottytops 三兄妹在最後關頭與 Risky Boots 合作，導致 Risky Boots 的計劃得逞
3. Risky Boots 用魔法油燈吸走了 Shantae 的魔力，並用那股魔力來對付 Shantae
4. Shantae 最終破壞了由自己的魔力形成的實體，卻也沒了魔力，變成了普通人[/spoiler] 


最後附上破關後四張圖片的獲得條件：
[spoiler]1. 不限條件純通關
2. 完成度100%，不限時間通關
3. 不限完成度，2小時內通關
4. 完成度100%，並在3小時內通關
（收集到 20個 Dark Magic、32個 Heart Squid，不強制熔成愛心上限、商店裡能強化 Shantae 的物品要全買，若以上都有做到，最終頭目戰前存檔進度會顯示為97%）[/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198050968623', 'num_games_owned': 170, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 921, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 889, 'last_played': 1584605199}
review:
하프지니 히어로를 해보기 전에 어떤 게임인지 알고 싶어서 세일 기간에 질렀지만 꽤나 만족스러운 게임이었습니다. 
게임 자체 난이도보단 숨겨진 길이나 아이템의 위치가 좀 까다로운 정도라 가볍게 즐기기엔 딱 좋은거 같습니다. 
무엇보다 샨테가 예뻐요(제일 중요)

author: {'steamid': '76561198105877801', 'num_games_owned': 727, 'num_reviews': 233, 'playtime_forever': 625, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 625, 'last_played': 1486830538}
review:
This game has a lot of stuff going for it: Cute artstyle, descent platforming, fun gameplay overall. But the overwhelmingly positive score is misleading. 

The game is far from perfect.

The game possessed a number of frustrating bits/design flaws, that really spoiled the engagement.

1) I will start of with the worst: In order to get the true ending (which you definitely should strive for) you need to find all cacklebats (type of secret). Problem is, sometimes they are so well hidden that is seems almost impossible to find them without luck. For example, in one area you have to hit a wall while charging, and the cacklebat drops from the sky. There are no markings on the wall whatsoever and it you can't hear or see the cacklebat. How am I suppose to know that will happen?

2) Enemies appear when they are off screen for 2 seconds. Why? Why can't they appear again once I leave the area? Some enemies work that way, but others don't for some reason.

3) Enemies appearing at the same spot you're at. You're just trying to jump from one branch to the other and a ghost appears right in front of you, giving you no time to react. This isn't a huge problem, but it's just unnecessary design.

4) They don't always introduce new mechanics in the best way (apart from gear). There are some platforms that you can shoot and they will do something. Uhm, since when does this happen? There is nothing indicating that something should happen if you hit them.

5) Backtracking. Remember the small rock in the corner that prevented you from going in that direction? Well now that you have the gear, 2 hours later, you can and must go there. You don't remember because you took a break for a day? Tough luck. Some characters do point you to the island you need to go, but this problem could've been tackled much better.

6) Bog island first 3 screens :P

The positives outweigh the negatives, and some type of frustration is good to have if it makes you get good at the game. But these are mainly design flaws that take away from the experience which makes it a good platformer, but not very very good one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012363945', 'num_games_owned': 2121, 'num_reviews': 409, 'playtime_forever': 1129, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1087, 'last_played': 1486826960}
review:
Even better than it's predecessor Risky's Revenge.  

This game series just keeps getting better for each installment that comes and is very recommended for people who likes their platformers to have interesting characters and story. 

Be advised though, this game has a pretty hard end game so unlike it's predecessor this one is for a bit more mature audiences as the end game is quite hard platforming. Puzzles are also not sometimes any easier than before so guides may be needed to proceed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048002635', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 617, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 405, 'last_played': 1486612738}
review:
[b]Classic Gameplay, Modernized Perfectly[/b]

[b]9/10[/b]

[b]Worth The Price?:[/b]Quality-YES, Quantity-NO. If you already love the series or NEED a castlevania-esque game then pick it up now! Otherwise I would wait for a sale. 

[b]PROS:[/b]
-Simple and rewarding gameplay 
-Interesting cast of characters 
-Charming humor 
-An unhealthy amount of voluptuous tiddies and butts
-Highly detailed pixel art mixed perfectly with HD renders
-Catchy soundtrack
-Lots of upgrades and collectibles

[b]CONS:[/b]
-Controls not optomized for keyboard
-Easy to finish very quickly
-Is it possible to add more tiddies?

I have played the first game in the Shantae series as well as this one, and this one perfects and expands upon everything that one lacked. Everything about this game is smooth, fast paced and fun. The world is very detailed and full of unique, well designed enemies that make you wanna keep exploring further. As I stated above the game is short, but that said, it may well be the perfect size for what it is. Buy for the boobs stay for the adventure!

author: {'steamid': '76561198054891609', 'num_games_owned': 2892, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 913, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 747, 'last_played': 1503973447}
review:
This was my introduction to the Shantae series, and I'm loving it so far.

It's a high quality metroidvania with platforming and tight controls to fit.

Featuring a pixeled art style, with impresive animations.  Many of the characters also have full art pop outs that come up when you talk to them.

I've been playing with a controller, which is supported natively.  I do wish you could change the controller config in the game though.

The writing and story is above average for a game like this.  It's entertaining enough to not be pointless.  It also seems to have callbacks to previous Shantae games for fans of the series.

There's also a fair amount of replayability, if you care about achievements.


Pros
*Great environment to explore
*Fantastic animations
*Enemy diversity
*Native controller support
*Keyboard controls make sense and can be changed


Cons
*Some of the collectables seem too tough to get to, but they're not required to beat the game
*No option to change controller config


9.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198004954586', 'num_games_owned': 6094, 'num_reviews': 124, 'playtime_forever': 1476, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1476, 'last_played': 1486470272}
review:
If you love action platformers you have to pick this up.

It's entertaining, amusing, and sexy. All very important things and I definitely recommend it.

The achievements add a lot of replayability too.

My only complaint is that, once you acquire all the items it feels like there's just too much to keep track of. Floating, triple jumping, downward sword, whip, gun... just so many things.

Though it is still damned entertaining and I can't wait to play the next game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025377501', 'num_games_owned': 435, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 742, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 728, 'last_played': 1487526211}
review:
Shantae and the Pirate's Curse is a medium-length (ten hours or so) action-focussed 2D platformer with discrete levels gated by unlockable abilities. Whether it's strictly Metroidvania is arguable; I see it more as part of a tradition of Genesis, SNES and GBA side-scrolling platformers like Aladdin or Duck Tales. It has bright, colourful pixel animations, with hand drawn art which highly sexualises womens' bodies for dialogue scenes. The soundtrack is Jake Kaufman digital studio work. The main game is easy for platformer players, apart from the last level, but there are lots of extremely difficult achievements.

The gameplay is polished. By time spent, there is as much combat as platforming. There are dozens of enemy types, and traveling to your destination normally means killing three or four of them over and over while moving from left to right. The odd fetch quest and minigame are thrown in too, including one very memorable sequence in which you carry a manipulative undead woman through screens of one-hit-KO hazards. The bosses are huge, and generally involve a simple puzzle, which reveals a small hitbox. Defeating them without being hit (except for the first one) is phenomenally difficult. I found the game unchallenging, but fun. Risky's affects give Shantae several abilities which meaningfully empower the player's movement through physical space, so you start to feel superhuman by the end. The final level is bereft of enemies, and doubles down on tight platforming. I began playing games on the SNES in the early 1990s, and this was my bread and butter. I loved the last bit of this game. I just wish it had gone on a little longer.

The plot is a MacGuffin. Shantae teams up with her old nemesis, the malevolent purple pirate, Risky Boots. Her ability upgrades are not genie powers, but Risky's piratical affects, which have been stolen and hidden around a bizarre archipelago. It has genuinely sweet moments, but it's mostly a network of gags. Games in this genre are frequently weighed down by mountains of stultifying lore, so it's a relief that Shantae gives you the bare minimum and lets you play. Worldbuilding and atmosphere are instead provided by the music, gorgeous art assets, and pleasing animation.

The music is full of bangers. I don't think there are any bad tracks. For a platformer, you mostly want upbeat, high-tempo music to keep you motivated and give you momentum, so the songs are fitting. I have found myself humming them while driving or working.

This game was mostly made by men, and it mostly stars half-naked women with body types which straight men usually find appealing. Men in this game are caricatures, and their extremely diverse bodies are not sexualised (with the possible exception of a cyclops, whose undress is played for laughs, and who receives no sexual attention). A couple of animations (and the entire spritesheet of Risky Boots) aside, the sexualisation exists mostly in the art which accompanies dialogue scenes. I found that I was never entirely comfortable with this part of the game. For what it's worth, the strongest suggestion of sexual interest or romance is between Shantae and another female character, and it is written very innocently.

I also don't feel great about the co-option of Arabic folk religious tradition in the Western trope of the 'genie', although that battle was probably lost shortly before my birth, with the publication of the Arabian Nights in 1706. Thankfully, the trope is not very intrusive here, although Shantae's hometown resembles a pop cultural imagining of Arabia, circa 1200. I'm white, and not best placed to say how harmful this depiction is.

I had fun running around in this world, and I intend to pick up the next instalment.

author: {'steamid': '76561198154984179', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 858, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 858, 'last_played': 1485010203}

author: {'steamid': '76561198146890377', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 694, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 694, 'last_played': 1486333917}
review:
If you grew up playing platformers in the 80s and 90s like me, you will probably think this game is a total cakewalk. The only thing slowing you down from breezing right through it is figuring out where you are supposed to go. The story does not always tell you in a way that makes sense, but you never really have to backtrack too far until they explicity tell you. The only part that becomes minorly hard is literally the last level and boss, and they only seem hard because the rest of the game was such a joke that it catches you off guard. 

Also, if you're like me you hate the genre name 'Metroidvania' because it immediately brings to mind 2 classic games that most cannot live up to. If you put all the maps in this game together, it might be as big as 1/4 of the original Metroid. Why call attention to that? And the original Castlevania is hardly like the 'Metroidvania' genre at all so it's mislabeled right from the start! Why did we stop calling them Adventure Platformers? What genre name is made up of other game titles anyways? 'Roguelike?' Have any of you really ever played Rogue? Not Nethack, not Hack, but actual Rogue? I played it, and I can count on one hand how many others I've met who've actually played Rogue. I'll let that one slide because 'Nethacklike' does not roll off the tongue.

After having said all that, I would still recommend the game if you can find it on sale or if you already like the series. It is fun for as long as it lasts, and it never becomes frustrating. The artwork is also very nice, and there are a few funny jokes in there as well.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977567326', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 10, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1486300675}

author: {'steamid': '76561198241325364', 'num_games_owned': 2837, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 580, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 580, 'last_played': 1485221985}
review:
Debo admitir que cuando obtuve este juego, aunque me llamó la atención, no esperaba gran cosa de él más allá de pasar el rato y echarle no más de una horita; no obstante, grata fue mi sorpresa cuando al empezar la partida no sólo me encontré con un Soundtrack muy bueno y personajes carismáticos, sino además una jugabilidad más que sobresaliente y un nivel de dificultad adecuado, algo que hace rato no veía en un juego de plataformas y lo cual hizo que no descansara hasta finalmente terminarlo (aunque no aún al 100% ni con el ‘final verdadero’).

 

La historia, sin ser una maravilla, atrapa lo suficiente como para que te intereses en avanzar y ver lo que sucede; los enemigos se sienten variados y acordes a cada isla que tienes que atravesar, los jefes finales son interesantes (unos más sencillos que otros), los gráficos pixelados aportan un interesante aire retro y sobre todo, esos hermosos sprites de las muchachas súper bonitas que anhelas por ver en full detalle durante las escenas de diálogos son excepcionalmente geniales.


No sobra decir que a pesar que Shantae and the Pirate's Curse es un videojuego bastante divertido, peca en que es corto pues se puede pasar en 7-9 horas dependiendo de qué tanto explores cada mapa y, en mi opinión, no ofrece muchos incentivos para rejugarlo (aunque ofrece un nuevo modo '+' para iniciar el juego con todas las armas y artilugios desde el principio).



Sin lugar a dudas un excelente juego, muy recomendado para los amantes de las nenas monas y de los juegos de plataformas.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049181223', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 107, 'playtime_forever': 981, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 981, 'last_played': 1486168167}
review:
Ich hab das Spiel als Teil des HumbeBundle bekommen, also eher so als Draufgabe, während ich etwas anderes wollte. Ich bin sonst nicht so der Plattformer-Fan und auch nicht so gut in solchen Spielen. Shantae habe ich aus einer Laune heraus mal angespielt und bin sofort dran hängen geblieben weils mich doch unerwartet gefesselt hat.

[b]Positiv:[/b]
[list]
    [*]Richtiges solides Gameplay mit etwas unterschiedlichen Mechaniken in den verschiedenen Gebieten
    [*]Nicht zu schwierig und nicht sehr strafend, daher auch für Spieler ihne viel Plattformingerfahrung spielbar
    [*]Angenehme Grafik, schöne Animationen
    [*]Bekloppte Charaktere
    [*]Nahezu Fehlerfrei
[/list]

[b]Nicht so positiv:[/b]
[list]
    [*]Zuweilen etwas undurchschaubar, was man als nächtes tun muss. Diese [url=http://www.gamefaqs.com/3ds/689550-shantae-and-the-pirates-curse/faqs/73038]Karte[/url] hilft
    [*]Einige wenige Stellen sind spürbar schwerer als das was sie umgibt
[/list]

[b]Status: Durchgespielt. [/b]Das hat wirklich Spass gemacht.

review:
After losing all her genie powers Shantae I starting to live a normal life but when she gets trapped by her nemesis Risky Boots who explains that all her men and weapons have been stolen she accuses Shantae for taking them but it turns out another villan is turning Risky's men into monsters Shantae and Risky team up to defeat the "Pirate Master"

So without being able to transform into different animals she instead uses Risky's equipment she finds along the way.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982630449', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 347, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1484243845}
review:
메트로베니아 장르의 수작으로 남을 작품입니다.
닌텐도 DSI 휴대기로 나온 게임의 포팅 버전.
이런저런 추가사항과 개선이 되어 지금도 무리없이 즐길 수 있습니다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032988179', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 566, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 566, 'last_played': 1485730713}
review:
I haven't played any other Shantae games, but my impression after playing what I gathered to be "the best one" is that it is pretty good, but really overhyped.

[h1]I'm not going to read any walls of text, give me bullet points[/h1]
[list]
    [*]Solid Platformer
    [*]Silky Smooth Animations
    [*]Fan-Service. I mean, this is why you've even heard of Shantae, right? Unless you've listened to the...
    [*]EXCELLENT Music by Jake Kaufman
    [*]Funny / Endearing(?) Writing
    [*]Callbacks to Previous Games That I Did Not Understand
    [*]The Bad Kind of Backtracking. The Annoying Kind.
    [*]Shovel Knight Is Better
[/list]

I was [b][i]really[/i][/b] skeptical that there was actually a fun game in here though. Without Jake Kaufman's soundtrack, I would've stopped playing long before it had a chance to win me over.

All that said, even though it's "just ok", I keep thinking about my playthrough and whether I should pick up Half-Genie Hero.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999574444', 'num_games_owned': 637, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 492, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 492, 'last_played': 1486000254}

If you like metroidvania games and want a quite short adventure with very straight forward story, this is definitely a game for you. Controls are top notch (at least with steam controller!), story is fun and maps and graphics are nice. All in all, good game and if in discount, get this.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994563317', 'num_games_owned': 547, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 483, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1519453915}
review:
I really don't understand why there are so many good reviews for this game.

The controls feel really sloppy. It's difficult to tell what is part of the background and what is platform. The game feels like an excuse to look at scantily clad, impossibly thin cartoon ladies. I'm glad I picked this up as part of a humble bundle, because this game does not grab me at all. Definitely not worth its asking price of $20.

Furthermore, the game doesn't support high refresh rate monitors. I played this on my 144Hz monitor and it was nearly unplayable. I had to manually change my refresh rate to 60Hz to actually play the game. I started out already irritated by this, but the game itself also isn't good.

author: {'steamid': '76561198099647863', 'num_games_owned': 249, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 394, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 394, 'last_played': 1486510057}

author: {'steamid': '76561198013618695', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1119, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1113, 'last_played': 1496594393}
review:
I thought Shantae Risky's Revenge was a very good game, this one made me want to speed run every game.

A Metroid + Megaman Fusion, a very fun platformer, it has adventure, action, exploring, lovable characters and a very funny story. Shantae and the Pirate's Curse is the sequel to Shantae Risky's Revenge and the third game to the series (first game not avaliable). 4th Game is Shantae Half Genie Hero which is also on steam and the sequel to this one as far as I know.

I enjoyed a lot my first playthrough, it had some exploring to do and was well worth it. I never felt there was too much back tracking just enough only to keep you playing. Some of the collectibles required a lot of try but none were impossible, maybe a couple gave me a headache.

The game + brings a ton of replayability, (No spoilers) since the game let's you start a new game with every ability it turned my 10+ hour first playthourgh in to a 2 ~ 3 hours of speed running which I enjoyed a lot. 

Getting all the achievements were a blast and a challenge, unlike the previous game only like a third are none missable, and the "hard ones" are speed running the game with any or 100% + killing all the bosses without taking damage, it made me play another 3 times to get everything and it never bored me down.

The game has it's difficulty and you will feel your progress throughout the playthrough.

I can't recommend this and last game enough, a no brainer if it's on a 50% sale (I got it this way).

author: {'steamid': '76561198044477209', 'num_games_owned': 1361, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 733, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 677, 'last_played': 1656571892}

author: {'steamid': '76561198025093031', 'num_games_owned': 681, 'num_reviews': 115, 'playtime_forever': 1703, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1703, 'last_played': 1486231731}
review:
If you liked the previous installment of the Shantae series you're gonna love this one. The changes that have been made to the gameplay mechanics are perfectly fitting, since Shantae lost her genie powers at the end of the previous chapter, but they keep intact the fun and the challenge of the previous games. The story is a lot better than Risky's Revenge, I loved seeing Shantae and Risky work together to defeat the Pirate Master and I think that the overall quality of the characterization has improved a lot. I also loved the new art style used for the character design, Risky in particular has been splendidly redesigned.

The only complaint I honestly have about this title is the addition of the "no damage" achievements for the boss battles. Most of them are easy, but some are just insane. I'm a completist, I like to unlock everything in the games I play and frankly I always thought that this kind of challenge is just not fun. The speed runs were already difficult enough, I didn't feel the need for more pointless tasks. That aside, this is a lovely game and I recommend it to everyone.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044539233', 'num_games_owned': 1237, 'num_reviews': 177, 'playtime_forever': 513, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 513, 'last_played': 1485840229}
review:
Better than the second game which was already good.  It's actually very similar to the second game, though definitely more polished.  Some changes include:

Instead of transformations, in this one you get pirate gear which aids in your fighting and platforming.  Unlike the transformations, these can be used more immediately and together with each other.  

Magic is gone and consumable items return, however they are not key to any puzzles this time and attack items can be largely ignored without issue.  Enemies also now drop items which is very nice.

The world is now split into multiple islands which you can instantly sail between using a boat.  The islands display what collectibles are left to discover and you can warp back to the boat with an item, so backtracking is fairly minimal.


Took me 7 hours to 100% first time through, though it can be done in less than three.  A New Game+ mode is available which starts you off with all pirate items in hand.

review: As a person who grew up in the 8 and 16 bit eras, I've got to say this game takes the best parts of platformers of the era and adds a few tricks and an extra layer of gloss. Slick controls, smart and funny dialog, a banging soundtrack, and tons of exploration make this an awesome game. Easily in my top 5 platformers of all time :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197976147822', 'num_games_owned': 1594, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 59, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1640276295}
review:
[h1] Shantae's Greatest Adventure [/h1]

[i] Note: Purchased and played on New 3DS XL [/i]

[b] Shantae and the Pirate's Curse [/b] is Shantae's best adventure.  [b] Half Genie hero (HGH) [/b] is fun, but it can't reach the heights of greatness that [b] Pirate's Curse [/b] did.
This is probably the last really great Shantae game, wrapping up the story of the first three games perfectly.  

[h1] GAMEPLAY [/h1]
-The pirate moves fit perfectly into gameplay in a way that the transformation moves never could (and still don't in HGH).  The move away from the Metroid/Vania style I was weary of at first, but in this case it just makes the game all that more enjoyable.  Where Risky's Revenge saw Shantae traveling back and forth over only a small handful of areas, Pirate's Curse is structured more like a level based game, with mini worlds to explore.  The gameplay and flow is sooo much better for it.  Unfortunately they took this approach way too far in HGH and we were left with a linear level based game ALA DuckTales remastered.  Pirates curse was the perfect mix of both styles.  Pure platforming bliss.
[b] Risky's Boots / 10 [/b]

[h1] VISUALS [/h1]
-Just absolutely beautiful and pitch perfect. Gorgeous hand drawn/painted backdrops with plenty of animated elements immerse you in the locals of Sequen Land and beyond. Bright and eye popping pixel art in the foreground is used for characters.  The sprites are pixle perfect and the animations are fantastic, best in series by far.  We can't forget the beautiful character portraits shown during speech, drawn by the team at Inti Creates this time.  They are teh best they have ever been, and likely ever will be now that HGH has changed the art style so drastically.
[b] Rotty's tank topp / 10 [/b]

[h1] MUSIC [/h1]
-The best it's ever been in the series, still infused with those chip sounds that got lost in HGH.  Remixes of old favorites as well as new additions make the soundtrack really hit the spot. You'll be belly dancing along the entire adventure!
[b] Bolo's Bandana / 10 [/b]

[h1] Story [/h1]
- Just perfect.  If you've played the first two games you won't be disappointed.  It has just the right amount of callbacks to make long time Shantae fans grab hold of it right from the get go.  It really is the most well crafted story of all 4 shantae games.  The characters are used to their full potential and you really get attached to them like you never have before even in Risky's Revenge.  
-I just can't praise the story enough, it's the best part of the whole package. Especially when you consider the fact that Wayforward elected to alienate long time fans with HGH by doing a soft reboot to try and draw in new fans.  It's really nice to see a proper Shantae story to wrap up the original trilogy.  While HGH does still fit into the chronology as the fourth game, it pales in comparison to Pirate's Curse in this regard.
[b] Sky's Cowlick/ 10 [/b]

[h1] TLDR / Overall [/h1]
Pirates Curse is the greatest Shantae game of all time, and it looks to stay that way if the games progress in the direction HGH is taking them.  One last fantastic adventure with Shantae and friends.  If you're even a little bit of a fan of the series, you MUST play this game.
[b] Shantae's belly / 10 [/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198291079726', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 756, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 756, 'last_played': 1485731775}

author: {'steamid': '76561198029349772', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 365, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 271, 'last_played': 1513340580}
review:
Shantae and the Pirate's Curse is one of the best platformers ive played in a long while, even on par with Shovel Knight. The controls are tight and responsive, there are many items that are fun to use and increase the fluidity of motion, such as Riskys Hat which, if you look at the trailers you can see that the item will make you glide through the sky. This is a great feature to add to a platformer because it gives you a sense of speed that is sometimes lost nowadays in modern day platformers.

There are a couple of small problems I have with the game. There is A LOT of fan service. My favorite example which makes me laugh a lot is there is a level where you get captured by people who think you are the queen. They dress your character (Shantae) in prison Leia type clothing. If thats not hilarious blatant fan service right there you have to unlock 3 other gates. Each of them contain a captured FEMALE dressed in the same outfit. Even though they are supposed to be no where near that area. They all have their own poorly written excuses to why they are there but we all know its for the weebs to get their ding dong goin. Other than that I have no issues with the game, it is well rounded and the levels are unique are exciting. Worth the buy

author: {'steamid': '76561198042543370', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 533, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 95, 'last_played': 1516300384}
review:
Whether you like this game or not depends on whether you enjoy the Metroid or Vania part of the Metroidvania equation more. I enjoy games closer to Metroid, where the emphasis is on exploration and upgrading. While Pirate's Curse does incorporate those elements, it places a higher emphasis on the Castlevania aspects, in the form of enemy/projectile dodging and platforming.

I really don't care for the latter, so I found it to be a subpar metroidvania. But if you do enjoy the latter, you will probably enjoy this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999072624', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 306, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 174, 'last_played': 1486319098}
review: Cute AF.  Excellent platformer, really enjoying my time with it so far.  This is my first Shantae game (been meaning to get into the franchise for years) but its checking a lot of boxes of things I enjoy.  Good soundtrack, bright colorful art style, fun character designs, tight controls, the works.  I know this is from a mid-tier veteran developer but this is refreshing seeing how most platformers that come out these days have a lo-fi retro aesthetic.  I understand that this entry is supposed to be notably different from the other Shantae games because she doesnt have transformations and has pirate weapons instead, but I honestly can't comment on the change of direction until I play some more of the games.  Highly recommended, just be ready for some fan service.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005368700', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 900, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 900, 'last_played': 1484905537}
review: Of the first three Shantae games, Pirate's Curse is the best.  While there is less of a focus on backtracking and exploration in this title over Risky's Revenge, Pirate's Curse makes up for it by having much better movement, level design, bosses, story beats, and graphics.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966604206', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 917, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 913, 'last_played': 1485581828}
review: It's a very qualified recommendation. There are several really, really badly designed levels. By which I mean, beating this section will probably take a half-hour or so of continuous jumping without a save point. I don't have that much contiguous time to spend on this type of game, so MOST of it was nice about having regular save points and being easy to set down and come back to the next day. But there are a few sections that are quite the opposite- after looking at a video of just how to reach the top of the pirate master's palace, I doubt I'll bother. Not worth the hassle.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077185468', 'num_games_owned': 913, 'num_reviews': 103, 'playtime_forever': 714, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 714, 'last_played': 1485436981}
review: Grabbed the game from humblebundle to catch up on the Shantae series. As a huge metroidvania fan, I didn't expect too much from this title, but hey... I was surpised how good this game is. First of all, it gave me the comfort of good old SNES game atmosphere. Smart level design, not too much backtracking, catchy soundtrack and most of all, smooth controls. I think this title didn't appeal as much as other titles on the EU market because it contains too much sexism and nudity, which I found ridiculous and unnecessary in a kids game, but besides that I had a blast playing it. For one Dollar, this was one of the best deals I ever made.

author: {'steamid': '76561198110660224', 'num_games_owned': 200, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1715, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 938, 'last_played': 1610847008}
review:
[b]MINOR SPOILERS AHEAD[/b]
[b]Note: I try to speak about the shiet nobody else talks about, and go more in detail from a completionist point of view.[/b]

[h1]Concept[/h1]
Shantae and the Pirate's Curse is the continuation of "Risky's Revenge" where our half genie, all girl and all walking rule 34 bait hero, lost her powers. This time you'll be pairing up with Risky on your quest to defeat a common enemy, this is where the fun starts. Unlike every other Shantae title that revolves around her dances to get around, this one you'll be using [spoiler]Risky's pirate gear,[/spoiler] earned as the story progresses. Each piece of gear has its use and since they act more as moves you'll never go without using one; but more importantly they allow you to speedrun the living hell out of the game which is really fun if you are into that.

[h1]Playthrough[/h1]
The playthrough is about 7-8 hours if you go in blind and take your time to do everything. The story is enjoyable, the dialogue is funny and clever as ever, the levels have awesome art direction and simple yet fun layouts, and the drawn sprites really pop out making it a rather enjoyable playthrough. The game sadly lacks on the boss department, bosses aren't really challenging and I can't say I had fun with them, I just felt neutral.

[h1]Completion[/h1]
The 100% in game is rather easy, since it's a metroidvania type of game you'll do some back and forth but nothing too extreme. The game has two collectibles: Squid Hearts, that are used to improve your health, and the Cacklebats, [spoiler]which are needed to get the true ending of the game.[/spoiler] Thankfully this doesn't feel like a chore and for me it happened naturally, since I always search every quarner of the levels as I play this type of game. I've seen a handful of people crying about the last level and the boss, but it isn't all that challenging (more about him on Achievements). After you finish the game once you'll unlock Pirate Mode, which allows you to play with all the gear from the beginning, and this is where speedrunning makes an appearance...

[h1]Steam Achievements[/h1]
[b]Summary: Speed and Precision[/b]
To obtain all of the game's achievements it's where I believe the biggest portion of fun actually exists, they provide some challenge to a rather easy game so for me it's a welcoming gift. If you don't like speedruns this isn't the completion you should be hunting down. One of the Achievements is to finish the game with any percentage in less than two hours and the other one finish the game 100% in three hours. A lot of people struggle with these, but they are doable if you use a Youtube speedrun as a guide. Personally I achieved the 100% in 1:18 of in game time, but it actually took me about 5 hours. 
The other challenging ones will have you defeating each boss without getting hit, something rather simple to do, only the final boss can be of trouble. Personally I had issues with the final boss due to not being able to dodge his [spoiler]cannonball[/spoiler] attack, but after many failed attempts I took my time to see their pattern and I found a way to easily dodge them. Since that was the only challenge in that fight, it quickly became easy to achieve. The only other two achievements that may provide a headache for some is to clear the [spoiler]"Run Run Rottypops"[/spoiler] portion in [spoiler]Spiderweb Island[/spoiler] without getting hit, that one is just a matter of patience. And the other one is to finish the game with all the Heart Squids but without using them, so basically finish the game with your starter health, if you do this in Pirate Mode it should be "easy". All of the other achievements will come naturally and/or are simple to get but missable like "Fool me once...".

[h1]Steam Badge[/h1]
Having leveled it up to max I can safely say the Steam Badge for this game, it's not worth getting, the emojis you'll get are "meh" (if you get any, all I got where 4 Shantae Smile and 1 Shantae Relax) and the same goes for the Backgrounds. You can go to my profile where I'm using the rarest one, if you like it and want a shot at it then sure have a go at the badge.

[h1]Final Thoughts[/h1]
Shantae and The Pirates Curse was a fun game that I genuinely had fun playing and completing. While I would recommend [b]anyone[/b] to play it, I wouldn't recommend it to Achievement Whores like myself.

This game gets:
8/10 and my Dark Seal of Approval
5/10 Achievement Whore Score (More means easier)

author: {'steamid': '76561198087050551', 'num_games_owned': 1006, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 744, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 623, 'last_played': 1485309626}
review:
I'm a huge fan of Metroidvanias, and Shantae and the Pirate's Curse definitely hits the mark.  It's very reminiscent of Aladdin on the SNES visually, while it plays like Megaman X with a dash of Super Metroid.



The graphics are fun, bright, and gorgeous pixel art that recalls the 16-bit era of gaming which the soundtrack matches perfectly.  Dialogue is witty, story is fun, and the game takes place over many different locales.  The "stage select" is very reminiscent of Megaman which is suiting because the game controls similarly as well.  The changes of scenery are nice and help keep the game fun between zones.  The pacing at which the game gives out new mechanics that allow you to advance is pretty well done for the length of the game as well, and there are a variatey of items that are paired in fun/funny ways with the new abilities.  A great example is that you get the ability to "double jump" from a cannon that you shoot below you.

The boss fights are not too challenging, but make up for it by being fun, patterned bosses, often with multiple phases.  The game has a good 8 hours of play time the first play through if you take your time to explore all the nooks and crannies.  Time can easily extend past that with a game+ mode and speed running.  The game controls very smoothly and in manner that allows you to improve over time.

I only have a few gripes which some may not agree with on account of preference:
-i prefer more exploratory Metroidvanias--this is not that type of game.  while there is a little bit of revisiting old zones, the game is failry straightforward in how it progresses.  i also felt this was a shame because of how many zones there were and how different they were--it would've been nice to spend more time in them.
-the bosses are a tad easy.  i personally don't mind this if the boss fights are engaging (and they are!), but some people might be bothered with this.  the game makes up for this a little bit with multiple achievements being tied to fighting bosses without being hit or in unique ways.
-i felt the characters took up too much room on the screen.  it wasn't terrible, but it could've been a little better as well as the game was built around how much realestate there was available on-screen.  this keeps you from being able to play and react more strategically to your environment.  so while the character sprite wasn't quite Sonic-level of taking up screen space, it wasn't exactly Super Mario World either.
-the dialogue character art is a little too "sexy".  to the point where i could see some parents keeping this game away from their kids.  i get that it's supposed to be anime-ish, but i found it distracting at best and uncomfortable at worst.


Anyway, Shantae and the Pirate's Curse is one of the better offerings in the Metroidvania space, and is well worth the money.  Highly recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198283955086', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 416, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 168, 'last_played': 1485307277}

author: {'steamid': '76561198050742251', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 739, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 736, 'last_played': 1694882598}
review:
There are already plenty reviews pointing out pretty much everthing about this game, so I'm gonna keep this one short.

I honestly don't know how a platforming game with some metroidvania-style elements could get any better. It's been some time since I've had that much fun with a game. I liked it even better than Shantae's newest installment, Shantae: Half-Genie hero, even though that one is also a pretty solid platformer and Pirate's Curse doesn't feature it's fancy HD graphics (would be a very nice optional texture pack though... I wish it were possible. ;D)... I felt it just had a little more depth to it, with it's neat dungeons, light-hearted dialogues, excellent platforming mechanics and hillarious take on humor. It even nails the perfect difficulty, with some challenging parts, but without ever being unfair. 

I could go on and on, but I promisd not to bore you. So, let me just tell you this. If you're looking for a good platformer: BUY THIS ONE. DO IT NOW.

author: {'steamid': '76561198346832883', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 609, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 597, 'last_played': 1544628787}
review:
This is the best Shantae game by far (until I beat Half-Hero Genie I can't judge the last entry) and outplays the original Shatae and Risky's Revenge in every single aspect of the game.

The gameplay is faster and it's brilliant: the lack of transformations (while being VERY sad) gives Shantae new equipment that has unique abilities in the whole series. The music is awesome and the Scuttle Town theme is one of my favourite tracks of all videogames.

The backtracking is also very good and light, making the game non-linear and adds a few hours of exploration. The length of the game is correct, pretty much like others platform games. My first run was 8:30h, but Shantae is very replayable, and I'm sure you'll want to do 3-4 runs at least.

The game has a lot of charm, and the characters and the NPCs (and their dialogues) are lovely and hilarious. This is what makes Shantae great and this is why I absolutely LOVE all the Shantae games.

If you like Metroidvania games and want a refreshing experience, you'll enjoy every second of Shantae and the Pirate's Curse.

author: {'steamid': '76561198132748965', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 346, 'playtime_forever': 1055, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1055, 'last_played': 1485239216}
review:
不知道是不是对Shantae系列要求太高了，这部依然让我感到失望。游戏整体素质比前作Shantae: Risky's Revenge有所提升，但并没有提升太多，某些方面还出现了倒退的迹象。

-首先，地图还是不够大，不够大！尽管乍看游戏画面很丰富，但由于比例尺较大，很快就会发现，一屏场景所呈现出来的内容是很有限的。有了冲刺技能后，跑图成了分分钟的事，更加凸显了这个问题。以后还是不以“类银河战士恶魔城”要求这个系列了，当成普通的平台动作游戏玩可能好一些。

-其次，前作中最吸引我的——女主变身为动物的能力，尽管与战斗系统结合得不够好，在这一部里，干脆就消失了！Shantae成了一个普通人，以人类的武器和道具进去战斗，不得不说是游戏特色的一大损失。不过变身能力似乎在下一部Shantae: Half-Genie Hero中回归了，这是第三次踏进同一条河流的节奏？

-卖肉。这一点见仁见智吧，我反正看不出来给四位女角色安排一场丁字裤秀除了讨好死宅还有什么必要。

+情节和人物刻画水平有很大进步，Shantae与Risky的互动值得玩味。

+音乐和操作手感维持了优秀的水准。

总评：7.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198101362124', 'num_games_owned': 690, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 756, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 756, 'last_played': 1481260293}

author: {'steamid': '76561198076219837', 'num_games_owned': 3116, 'num_reviews': 296, 'playtime_forever': 1001, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 971, 'last_played': 1485219136}
review:
Este juego es un metroivania con mucha personalidad y encanto que es divertido la mayor parte del tiempo pero extremadamente frustrante en algunas, sobre todo el ultimo nivel.

Lo bueno:
+Increible soundtrack, honestamente planeo comprarlo, asi de bueno es.
+Animaciones y artstyle buenas, no voy a decir que son lo mejor que he visto jamas, pero cumplen su funcion y en juegos como estos lo que interesa mas que nada es el gameplay.
+El  gameplay y los controles son cumplidores, nada del otro mundo, pero en general es fluido, los controles responden bien y rara vez una muerte es por culpa de ellos.

Lo malo:
-Cuestionable desiciones en el diseño de ciertos niveles, el mapa de la isla de las almas perdidas y el ultimo nivel en especial, el de las almas perdidas porque tiende a sentirse muy "cheap" el posicionamiento de algunos enemigos "ocultos", usualmente estos juegos tienden a darte una pista de peligro, pero aqui esta pista se confunde con el entorno y es realmente dificil saber si hay peligro o no, rompe por completo la fluidez de la experiencia... Y el ultimo nivel es exponencialmente mas dificl que el resto del juego, es como pasar de jugar el primer nivel de super mario uno de los ultimos niveles de super meat boy en menos de 30 segundos, esa curva de dificualtad aparece de la nada. Comprendo que los ultimos niveles deben ponerte a prueba de ahi la satisfaccion de ganar el juego, pero dios, si es dificil el ultimo nivel, probablemente soy solo yo, pero es algo que talvez a alguien mas le pueda afectar a la hora de jugar, por eso lo menciono.

Sobre todo, Shantae and the Pirate's Curse es un juego decente con sus fallas, lo recomiendo a personas que realmente adoren los metroivanias y no les moleste jugar uno que al inicio parece casual, pero al final termina siendo super meat boy.
Es un 7 de 10 en mi libro, bueno, pero nada extraordinario.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011841547', 'num_games_owned': 1665, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 630, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 630, 'last_played': 1485187280}

author: {'steamid': '76561198132720565', 'num_games_owned': 412, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 999, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 948, 'last_played': 1485002093}
review: Classico platform vecchio stile, Shantae and the Pirate's Curse mi ha tenuto occupato per una decina di ore o poco più e alla fine mi ha lasciato soddisfatto. Livelli vari e colorati, nemici fantasiosi e una spolverata di backtracking (lieve se si vuol soltanto completare la storia, un po' più corposa se si va a caccia di collezionabili) legato all'acquisizione di nuove capacità da parte della protagonista, ne fanno un gioco che può tranquillamente ricoprire il ruolo di passatempo, senza stressare troppo il cervello e strappando anche qualche sorriso (la trama non è che sia 'sto granchè, però alcune battute dei personaggi mi hanno fatto ridere). L'unica pecca, da giocatore anziano, è la scarsa difficoltà del titolo, che soltanto nelle battute finali mi ha fatto sudare un po' e quindi dopo l'eliminazione dell'ultimo boss non mi ha lasciato quel senso di appagamento tipico dei vecchi 2D. Ad aumentare il livello di sfida, per chi volesse cimentarsi, ci sono però determinati Achievement, che ne prolungheranno la longevità ma obbligheranno comunque a rigiocarci da capo. Si tratta in conclusione di un gioco sfizioso che, dai 3€ in giù, non vi farà pentire dei soldi spesi!

author: {'steamid': '76561198060287878', 'num_games_owned': 199, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 820, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 653, 'last_played': 1514083559}
review:
Heckity heck this is a great game. The controls are awesome and never did I feel like I died for anything other than my own fault. The story is engaging and you dont need to know anything about the Shantae story to enjoy this game. Every island, while not all of them are exactly original, all feel geniunely like their own world and that gives this game an astounding level of immersion and depth within the story. 

The story itself is not incredible but its not boring either, and the gameplay and exploration are so fun that this game would still be a perfect 10 without a story. The story is not a focus of the game but rather a framework, and a believable and engaging framework at that.

The art in this game is top notch. All the characters are ridiculously fun to look at and theyre all designed excellently, even the side characters. The pixellated gameplay artwork is clear and very well done, never is there any confusion in what is being displayed and the enemies are never hard to see. The backgrounds and level design are highly effective in creating a sense of atmosphere that instantly communicate what kind of environment you're exploring.

10/10 game, absolutely would reccomend to anyone willing to give an awesome retro-style metroidvania a try.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999337717', 'num_games_owned': 551, 'num_reviews': 151, 'playtime_forever': 431, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 431, 'last_played': 1485049335}
review:
Shantae and the Pirate's Curse is a lighthearted (but not light difficulty'd) romp as the titular half-genie, jumping around various islands, killing monsters, saving the world. Stuff like that. If you've played a Metroidvania game before you've played Shantae and the Pirate's Curse. Does that mean it's a game you should skip though? Oh no. 

While it is a straightforward game, Shantae is a world full of lively creatures to meet and pummel complete with their own animated pixel art and animation. Really it's a joy for the eyes at all times. Which is good as you'll be running back and forth between the various islands again and again, getting whooped along the way. But this isn't a bad thing, the difficulty is a steady increase, enemy monsters drop gems you can use to upgrade your weaponry and grab items for tough fights, and a rocking soundtrack keeps your blood pumping from one end to the other.

While what Shantae does has been done before, it still stands on its own two legs very well because the elements it does use are polished. There are things to find, places to explore, and you'll be engaged from beginning to end. So if you are looking for a game that takes standard Metroidvania concepts and pushes a little further, that's not Shantae. But Shantae is still a good game and thus is worth a full recommendation. Maybe wait for a sale if you're on the edge, but the game goes for relatively cheap anyways.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007029683', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 716, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 1545365566}
review: I have seen a bunch of indies that want to re-create the platformers of the SNES era, and this is one of the first that does it properly IMO. It feels like Disney's Aladdin in the way it looks and a bit on the gameplay. The cute pixel graphics are charming and very easy on the eyes. Very few indie/platformer tittles are able to capture the old school feeling as well as this little game does.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014436674', 'num_games_owned': 303, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 613, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 613, 'last_played': 1485038332}
review: Pretty good. Does everything the previous game did but better. Great music. I got it for a dollar and I think it's probably the best single dollar I've ever spent.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025461832', 'num_games_owned': 730, 'num_reviews': 199, 'playtime_forever': 473, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 473, 'last_played': 1485022511}
review:
La primera mitad del juego es fantástica: plataformeo ligero, personajes super-entrañables con diálogos divertidos, música estupendísima... todo muy disfrutable.

Sin embargo, en la segunda mitad, el juego se vuelve super hardcore, con enemigos que aguantan mucho daño y dan unas bofetadas que flipas, saltos calculados al píxel y una cantidad de backtracking que te va a hacer sacar la guía cada dos por tres, parando el ritmo de juego en seco.

No me importa que un juego sea difícil, pero que pegue un salto tan brusco, y que suba la dificultad más por frustración con la cámara o los controles que por exigir precisión al jugador es algo que me resulta difícil de tolerar. Cuanto más me acerco al final, menos me apetece seguir jugando...

author: {'steamid': '76561198016610531', 'num_games_owned': 731, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 715, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 715, 'last_played': 1485169166}
review:
Overall experience:
Pretty nice music and art, though my favourite thing is probably the characters and the humour. There's quite a decent sense of adventure, and often you have to use intuition to figure out what to do next. Sometimes it's a bit too much to figure out, but using a guide is no problem.
The game might seem very hard at first, but once you get more hearts it's a lot easier! The abilities you get are pretty nice (charge, triple jump w/ bomb dropping, paragliding....).

Initially, the checkpoint system really annoyed me - but later on, it wasn't really a problem. Basically, you talk to some mages who are dotted around to save - so you don't get as much control as, say, in Ori and the Blind Forest (play that game too!)

Pretty recommendable for a couple bucks, if you like this genre of game. Some parts of the game are a bit BS, but they're pretty doable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198166073948', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 621, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 496, 'last_played': 1499108470}
review:
Este juego es una carta de amor para los que les gustaban juegos plataformeros con algo de RPG tipo castlevania o megaman de las viejas consolas(PS1, GBA, NDS), las animaciones son perfectas y muy fluídas, el pixelart es un dulce para los ojos(eye candy) digno de apreciar junto a las imagenes vectorizadas de los personajes, la música ambiente va muy a tono con las áreas y la tématica media árabe del juego, el gameplay es bastante sencillo y posee un poco la díficultad de los viejos plataformeros donde en algunas ocasiones te quedas pegado sin saber donde ir por que no te lo dicen o te dan una vaga pista, debes explorar y averiguar ciertas cosas por ti mismo/a pero que ciertamente se te es recompensado.

Todos los objetos importantes que te ayudan a mejorar tu movilidad para desbloquear nuevas áreas se sienten útiles, ninguno de ellos se sienten como relleno o ínutil. La única habilidad que encontré poco útil fue la tecnica de la patada que a pesar de que pega 10 es muy poco y es lento en comparación a la velocidad con la que puedes tirar el ataque básico.

También si sabes íngles, es preferible que lo jueges en ese idioma, ya que la traducción en español en cierto punto se nota que es mala por los errores evidentes(confusión de generos más que otra cosa y la útilización quizá excesiva de modismos de español de españa más que un español de españa neutral) y te pierdes o no entiendes algunas bromas que hacen los personajes.

Lo recomiendo si te gustan los juegos plataformeros.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013698729', 'num_games_owned': 372, 'num_reviews': 143, 'playtime_forever': 1300, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1299, 'last_played': 1541632969}
review: Shantae and the Pirate's Curse to trzecia odsłona mniej znanej serii z konsol przenośnych Nintendo. Mamy tutaj do czynienia z klasyczną platformówką z tzw. gatunku metroidvania. Gra jest stosunkowo prosta, porównując ją do innych platformówek tego typu. Całe szczęście nie wpływa to na przyjemność płynącą z rozgrywki. Tutaj nie tyle walka jest ważna, co eksplorowanie otwartych poziomów, zbieranie różnych ulepszeń itp. Trudność można sobie podnieść odblokowując wszystkie osiągnięcia Steam, które wymagają od gracza solidnych umiejętność (choć nadal stosunkowo łatwe). Shantae and the Pirate's Curse to gra bardzo ładna. Pixelartowa grafika wygląda dobrze na większych ekranach, a muzyka, która towarzyszy nam w czasie zabawy wpada w ucho. Jednak najważniejsze jest to, że Shantae and the Pirate's Curse wciąga. Jest tutaj ukryty ten czar platformówek 2D, choć gra nie jest powiewem świeżości, czuć wtórność. Jeśli chodzi o wady, to taka największa warta wymienienia to wygląd postaci płci żeńskiej podczas prowadzenia dialogów. Jeśli miałbym dodać tag na Steam do tego produktu, to pierwsze co przyszłoby mi to głowy to... cycki, wszędzie cycki :D No kompletnie nie rozumiem, czemu autorzy mają takie ciśnienie na eksponowanie kobiecych piersi. Totalna przesada. Na początku mocno mnie to irytowało, ale później machnąłem na to ręką. Gra przez to ma oznaczenie PEGI 12 (Violence, Sex) co też chyba średnio pasuje do kolorowej platformówki. Mimo tego gra jest dobra i mogę ją śmiało polecić.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999935168', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1190, 'playtime_forever': 392, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1512367099}
review:
tldr: not quite good enough to make me want to do any back-tracking like I would in other metroidvania games, and a insane amount of unnecessary dialogue padded into every conversation that makes me want to rip my own head off and throw it across the room every time I have to talk to anyone.

The graphics and design are easily a 9/10 but everything else is around a 6/10 at its very best, including the very simple combat and basic gameplay. It feels like a flash game albeit a very good one. The problem is its reliance on its back-tracking metroidvania style. It doesn't work for me in this game. It's not a bad game by any means, it's just that it has such a basic indie flash game feel that I just want to get through it and not have to put any extra time into back-tracking because it isn't fun for me in this game. It just makes it all feel like one big tedious chore. That and the game has a insane, brain numbing amount of mostly pointless dialogue that feels like it rivals even the amount in the Mass Effect games. It feels like I spend more time pressing the button to get through all the dialogue than actually playing the game. I mean they really went overboard padding conversations with a huge amount of pointless extra dialogue that makes all conversations ten times longer than they need to be.

I'm in the extreme minority though so pick it up and considering it has a large amount of 'overwhelmingly positive' reviews you will most likely enjoy it where I didn't.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005463499', 'num_games_owned': 593, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 1076, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1076, 'last_played': 1484603297}
review:
Oh Dear Lord, I loved this!
I've never played any of Shantae's games, and i didn't know what to expect, other than a regular platformer, Installed it for "a try" and got instantly hooked!

Shantae and The Pirate's curse is a metroidvania platformer that charms you with the Beautiful locations - I loved it in pixel art, I can only imagine how great it would look drawn over - filled with... FUN!
The only donwpoint i can think of, is that you get a lot of references on the other games, and on the lore, and you get little to no explanation of it in the gameplay, you have to go google it down. other than that, 
The environments are thoughfully crafted, you have secret areas to look for, funny scripts and crazy bosses, if you love any of the above mentioned, Go for it!

author: {'steamid': '76561197977205782', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 1044, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 794, 'last_played': 1701693998}
review:
I've never played a game in this series before. Based on the preview images, the sexualization of the characters made me suspicious the game was using that to lure in gamers to compensate for poor quality. And, while there is a lot of sexualization (take that for what you will), this ended up being one of the best platformers I've played in years. Definite must play for anyone that enjoys the classic Metroid and Castlevania games. To start off with the sort-of negatives, there really isn't any character development at all for the most part. By the end, I could hardly remember any of the characters names or anything about them. I found the story also pretty forgettable (at least to someone who's new to the series, like me). The end of the game left me feeling indifferent towards the characters and the world because of that. 

That said, this game managed to keep me hooked all the way until the end despite the above. The art design for the characters, enemies, and world is great and takes me back to my Sega Genesis days as a kid. The characters, while pretty two-dimensional, do remain charming when they do speak. But, the real reason to play this game is for the platforming. And the platforming is really, really good with a controller. The controls are tight and responsive and the game introduces new platforming mechanics at a regular interval that keeps the game fresh and encourages the player to revisit previous levels. You start off feeling like the game is pretty slow. But, by the end, you'll (literally) be flying through the levels at crazy speeds. 

The platforming mechanics in this game are just so much fun I never ended up caring about the neglected story or character development or how much of a BS difficulty spike the last level was (seriously, it's like something out of Super Meat Boy). It took about 10 hours for me to complete the game 100%, but it feels like a game I will want to replay later on and I'm really looking forward to playing Half Genie Hero.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979602815', 'num_games_owned': 1613, 'num_reviews': 243, 'playtime_forever': 526, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 525, 'last_played': 1485490704}

author: {'steamid': '76561198117179038', 'num_games_owned': 588, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 2049, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1006, 'last_played': 1517257247}
review:
[h1]My Opinion[/h1]
[i]Shantae and the Pirate's Curse[/i] is an amazing platformer and, in my opinion, the highpoint of the [i]Shantae[/i] series. Dispite missing one of Shantae's main features, her magic, it is replaced with Risky's pirate weapons, which are quite nice and feel natural with Shantae. It was not only fun to play through the first time, but also the second, and so far for the third. The quirky characters, nicely designed dungeons, humorus dialog, and beautiful pixel art all come together for a game that is almost perfect in every way.

[h1]Pros[/h1]
+Fast and fun gameplay that kept me attached to my computer
+Amusing dialog that kept me laughing throughout the story
+Great storyline that keeps true to the original 2 Shantae games but also forges a new path
+2 Endings that create different feeling within the player
+Challanging bosses
+Heart upgrades are hidden in both plain sight and way off to the side where you wouldnt expect them to be
+Rewards for beating the game under certaint times, getting a certain ending, or beating the game with certaint percent completion
+Had amazing character development throughout the story
+Fun to playthrough multiple times
+Great Boss names

[h1]Cons[/h1]
-Terrible Keyboard controlls
-The final Area isn't the most difficult, rather 3 islands before it is
-Rottytops has a few Really Bad puns... like really bad
-Final bosses true form with full heath is easier then a boss close toward the middle, at least in figuring out what to do. Dor killing them the final boss is a tad bit more difficult.

[h1]Final[/h1]
[i]Shantae and the Pirates Curse[/i] is a great game to play. The game has the perfect mixture of evcerything to make it so good and fun to play. There is a reason this is one of my favorite games afterall.

author: {'steamid': '76561197974085922', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 313, 'playtime_forever': 517, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 517, 'last_played': 1484864426}
review:
It's an old school mascot based action platformer, like Sonic, Mario, Kirby, and the like.  It's self aware and quite funny, causing me to laugh out loud at times.  The controls are tight and the art is well done.  

That being said, the game constantly tries to get me to give it a bad review.  There are some absolutely intolerable sections involving one hit kills for no reason, a forced stealth section where you have to start the entire thing over if you're detected, poorly explained unneccesary backtracking, and, oh yeah, if you die the game restarts you at the last save point, even if it was ages ago, there's no autosave or checkpoint system.  It only came out in 2014, it's not like it's from decades ago.  The difficulty curve is nonsense thanks to an extremely generous item system that allows you to fully heal multiple times in combat, as well as double or triple your damage and shield yourself.

However, I'm still going recommend it.  Just know what you're getting into and don't expect the moon.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023109038', 'num_games_owned': 2200, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 872, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 872, 'last_played': 1484796389}

author: {'steamid': '76561198014909296', 'num_games_owned': 607, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 175, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 158, 'last_played': 1525942420}
review:
Controls are twitchy, analogue sticks don't work properly with this game. Character moves fast and has no acceleration/deceleration, which makes fine control excessively difficult. This is a problem as the first level is littered with very small platforms over death-pits. This is not how I would design a platformer.

EDIT: Apparently this game doesn't properly support higher refresh rate monitors. The reason the controls seem so twitchy and difficult for me is because I've been playing the game at over twice the speed it's supposed to be played on my 144hz monitor. I will not be be changing my recommendation in light of this however, as it's still a bug that makes this game nearly unplayable for me.
