author: {'steamid': '76561198067923465', 'num_games_owned': 962, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 258, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 254, 'last_played': 1471183707}
review:
Nice retro quality, music is good and awesome artworks and charac designs...
The story's quite common, but the gameplay is smooth, the metroidvania aspect can sometimes be quite tricky and I still regret the fact that we can't kill monster by jumping on their heads like 99% of 2d platformers.

Anyway, it's still a really good game to play and sadly not well know enough, because considered as the poor sequel of an old childish series. 
But it's not really the case if keep attention to the artowrks and cutscenes... (shut up, rule 34)

I do recommend. Yes I do. 
You can count several hours (9 - 15, maybe more if you're not so good) to beat the game 100%.
Now have fun !

author: {'steamid': '76561198041636869', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 187, 'playtime_forever': 1672, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1672, 'last_played': 1469935883}
review: Shantae and the Pirate's Curse is a Metroidvania 2D platformer where you play as former half-genie, Shantae, who teams up with her former nemesis, Risky Boots, to take down the Pirate Master. I love both Shantae games. They have great writing, fun characters, interesting levels and bosses, and plenty of humor. It is easily worth the $20 pricetag.

author: {'steamid': '76561198177311310', 'num_games_owned': 122, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 3449, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1911, 'last_played': 1516038011}
review: Eu estava procurando um jogo novo e diferente para eu jogar, de preferencia que fosse de plataforma, foi quando eu conheci a saga Shantae, o jogo é perfeito e muito bom recomendo muito a jogar, tem uma história boa, jogabilidade boa, os gráficos são bonitos bem polidos, me viciei muito nesse jogo, vale a pena comprar para quem gosta de clássicos e etc, recomendo muito, e irá lançar o novo Shantae half genie hero! e estou muito asioso. 27/09/2016 /o/ /o/ /o/

author: {'steamid': '76561198301579284', 'num_games_owned': 54, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1789, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1783, 'last_played': 1679146369}
review:
Back when I first started looking into this game, I was surprised to see it on Steam, having assumed it to be 3DS/Wii U exclusive, but given this review and later ports to other systems, it's clear I was grossly mistaken. Having played and beaten Risky's Revenge beforehand, I was more than happy to jump into this new adventure. Did it meet or surpass my expectations? And was its reputation as fan-favourite (note that Half-Genie Hero wasn't out at the time!) well-deserved? In sum, yes, absolutely.

Picking up some time after Risky's Revenge left off, a now-fully human Shantae is suddenly confronted by her arch-nemesis Risky Boots over a Tinkerbat being held in Mimic's laboratory. When the Tinkerbat suddenly transforms into a monstrous Cacklebat, Risky realises that this means that her former mentor, the Pirate Master, is to return, which would result in disastrous consequences for all of Sequin Land. Shantae must now set aside her differences with Risky and team up with her to handle a new common foe, but will she stand a chance without her powers?

Yet another Metroidvania, Shantae and the Pirate's Curse, rather than be set in a fully interconnected world, instead is spread across multiple self-contained locations, each distinct from the last with cool concepts and some cleverly hidden surprises.

First thing worth noting is how well Shantae handles this time 'round. Her movement feels smooth, and the various new tools she gets for navigation and combat blend in so well with her usual tricks. Combat is as satisfying as ever, and Shantae is a joy to handle, especially with her full arsenal by endgame.

Of course, if this is a Metroidvania and Shantae no longer has her magic, how does she gain new movement tools? Enter Risky's equipment. With her pistol for striking targets from afar, her hat as a parachute/glider, her scimitar as a downwards strike, her [i]boots[/i] (get it?) as a charged dash, and her cannon to give yourself up to a [i]quadruple jump[/i], all kinds of new options open up. The pirate gear come out instantly, and flows right into Shantae's offensive and movement options like a glove. It's not a complete replacement for the transformation dances, but I like how it makes sense in terms of story and doesn't forced.

As for story and writing, the writers hit this one out of the park. Dialogue is at its funniest yet, and this game fully establishes Shantae's adorable side, although her brasher side is heavily downplayed this time. The series' penchant for references to other media is still present, heck, we even have a blatant He-Man parody this time! Nothing seems particularly forced, and the story advances at a good pace, with not as much in terms of blatant filler plot arcs.

Speaking of pacing, the game's already wonderful flow, combined with fun movement, meshes quite well with well-designed dungeons packed with fun puzzles and gimmicks, some of the most creative bosses yet, and when there is backtracking, it never seems to be forced and will see you revisit old places at least once each. The main collectable this time, the Dark Magic left over from defeated Cacklebats is required for the best possible ending, but the Cacklebats themselves are well-hidden, and they usually are kept away from locations that'd make you go Guide Dang It.

As for difficulty? This game's by far the easiest yet, with a Game Over being an outright rarity. The only real stumbling blocks are the infamous Run, Run, Rottytops segment, a stealth section during mid-game, and a surprisingly brutal final dungeon, but that aside, it's a relatively comfortable ride that still is fun to play.

From a musical standpoint, Jake Kaufman's done it again with some memorable tracks, new and old. The new songs are incredibly fitting and feel just right with the new sights, and the new takes on old classics are at their finest yet, from Burning Town to Sky's Theme/Water Town. As per usual, the OST is available on Jake's Bandcamp free of charge, but feel free to toss in some money to support his wonderful work.

All in all, this is yet another fun adventure and the series keeps on getting better and better. Biggest gripes I can provide is Run, Run, Rottytops and how knockback is handled, but otherwise a fun ride all the same. For good reason, this is my favourite game in the Shantae series yet.

Verdict: "Worth Your Time!"
Final remarks: Have fun doing Run, Run, Rottytops deathless~

author: {'steamid': '76561198044766531', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 460, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 459, 'last_played': 1469480409}
review: You can clearly tell that this was originally a Nintendo platform only game. The very tutorial gives you a strong sense of what is to come and simply, that is plain fun! It never takes itself too seriously and has some genuinely funny moments. Gameplay is tight and the length was just right, (in my opinion). Very excited for the sequel after playing this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198093139188', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 3884, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 579, 'last_played': 1485883259}

author: {'steamid': '76561198159461400', 'num_games_owned': 219, 'num_reviews': 97, 'playtime_forever': 972, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 829, 'last_played': 1580527269}
review:
Shantae and the Pirates Curse is a 2D platforming game staring the half-genie, Shantae. Here are some pros and cons.

Pros-
-Decent story with some very quirky and enjoyable subplots
-Charming characters with cute anime-like designs
-Fun combat
-Pretty great platforming and dungeon design
-Big and diverse world with various themes from island to island
-The OST absolutely SLAPS

Cons-
-Some puzzles have hard to find solutions, like an invisible hole in the wall to pass through, but hey, that's what the internet's for, right?
-You'll be backtracking through the same worlds with new abilities often, though this issue is rectified in the New Game Plus of this game, Pirate Mode
-Fighting enemies and bosses can be a bit too easy at times

This is a game I would recommend to any fan of platformers, it has a fast pace, cute characters, wonderful music and great pixel art. What's not to like?

author: {'steamid': '76561198138954393', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1502, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1117, 'last_played': 1473854906}
review:
I saw this game on sale and thought I'd pick it up because I saw the E3 trailer for the next installment "1/2 Genie Hero". I was expecting a cute little pixel game with a bit of that classic "Nintendo Difficulty" that I loved to be frustrated by in my childhood. This game was a joy to play through, even when I kept dying to the god damn spikes. A lot of people will tell ya that this game is very short and they'd be right considering that if you don't bother with exploration you blow through this like Huricane Katrina through New Orleans. However, much like an old NES or SNES game you'll wanna take your time and find all the little secrets. This game has a handful of collectables, one type of which adds several more phases to the final boss (who might I add was justified to the hype Risky built up). This game offers challenge that Metroidvania fans will appreciate, a wonderful soundtrack, downright adorable characters, and an impressive art style in both pixel and digital. I have yet to play through the previous games (The first game is impossible to find for less than three-hundred fuggin dollars (USD)) but the second game is available on Steam right now so I might pick it up when it goes on sale. Though, I doubt that the second game is as good as this one. WayForward is an impressive developer, taking up bigger jobs to fund their own series is admirable, and you can tell they put in the love and effort the games deserve. I cannot wait for the next game in the series, while diverging from a pixel animated art style to a full on digital, it still looks impressive. 20$ is asking just a bit too much however, as this game has nothing more to give after completing the game 100% (aside from the achievements for my fellow achievement freaks). Do give this game a try though, WayForward deserves more praise than they get, you won't regret putting time into this game.

Rottytops best girl

author: {'steamid': '76561198202154811', 'num_games_owned': 76, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 120, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1684132718}
review: Shantae is such a fun game series.

author: {'steamid': '76561198198859785', 'num_games_owned': 405, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 23, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1449070407}
review:
Mediocre, mudane, run-of-the-mill, uninspiring sidescroller that's heavily pixelated... I mean, excessively pixelated, far exceeding the healthy dose of my taste for retro aesthetics.

The controls/handling is rather mediocre too... there's no fluidity and character animation is simply lacking. Some enemies came straight out of the NES adaptation of the Aladdin cartoon; in fact when I think of it, the stage design also smells suspiciously of copy-and-paste and reflects the not-giving-a-merde on the part of the designers.

Simply put, how the series has managed to drag its feet and get praised so often is beyond me. So I got my refund.

If you are looking for a Metroidvania game with great aesthetics, responsive controls, wonderful music and overall fantastic production value, there're plenty of alternatives available on Steam, like, say, Ori & the Blind Forest.

Anyway, for this game and any other Shantae iteration? I recommend that you AVOID.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022671473', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 880, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 293, 'last_played': 1470094303}
review:
After only putting in just a couple hours I can say this is a solid game and would recommend to anyone who likes side scrollers. The last and best time I had playing a side scroller was with various Mario games on the SNES before I was even attending Kindergarden. I am thoroughly enjoying the amount of thought the developers put into this game to make it a very enjoyable, well rounded experience, and I have zero complaints. The small things like the voice acting, the art in the cutscenes, the very tender foreshadowing used to introduce and build the game mechanics to the players - wonderful.

I have stayed away from side scrollers / 2D platformers because of how ridiculously boring and repetetive they are, but this game has given me hope, I never thought I'd find a 2D game with such quality in all aspects. Everything so far has been tight knit, I'm not running around endlessly trying to remember 100 different things going on, and nothing is too simplified either.

I'm now a fan and will be purchasing the game before this one as well as Half Genie when it is released.
If you like 2D platformers / sidescrollers, I would check this game out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052778576', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 1021, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 947, 'last_played': 1482433932}

author: {'steamid': '76561197987115229', 'num_games_owned': 1613, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 1006, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1006, 'last_played': 1468868337}
review:
Definitely a buy for any 2D-platformer enthusiast, sale or no sale. Action-packed from start to finish with satisfying upgrades that changes Shantae's moveset to allow for some tricky platforming towards the end of the game.

[b] Improvements	[/b]
Less clunky and more fastpaced compared to Risky's Revenge. Mostly because the special moves are bound to items instead of dance transformations which slowed down the action in RR.

[b] Cons	[/b]
Unfortunately some slight grinding is needed in order to acquire (buy) all item upgrades since not nearly enough gems are dropped while simply playing through dungeons/areas once. But since all upgrades are not required to complete the game it is not a big issue.

author: {'steamid': '76561198293013187', 'num_games_owned': 436, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 1037, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 976, 'last_played': 1468807674}
review:
"Shantae and the Pirate's Curse" is the latest and best game released of the Shantae series (so far). Join Shantae as she teams up with the pirate Risky Boots to stop the spread of an ancient curse. Use various pirate equipment and sail on a pirate ship as you explore several islands in Sequin Land. Battle monsters, upgrade weapons and search labyrinths for rare treasures and items.

Like the previous installment, the game stands out with great music, beautiful art, solid controls, lovable characters and a memorable story that never takes itself too seriously. Note that it has more content than the previous games, including an unlockable "Pirate Mode", multiple endings and enough achievements to challenge even hardcore players. The only significant flaw is the lack of transformation magic (and sexy dances) due to the events of the previous game.

I highly recommend "Shantae and the Pirate's Curse" to anyone who enjoys platformers like Castlevania or Metroid. Definitely look forward to the release of the next Shantae game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198074278263', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1013, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 882, 'last_played': 1469638381}

author: {'steamid': '76561197973057524', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 677, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 677, 'last_played': 1468379569}
review:
Shantae and the Pirate's Curse is a fun and light-hearted adventure with great music, solid controls, beautiful animated sprite art, and funny reimaginings on common metroidvania power-ups and abilities.  I would call most of the game easier than the classics in the genre, but I would not hold that against it.    That said I found a few specific levels to be difficulty spikes and found them frustrating against the challenge level of the rest of the game.

As the third game in the series I do not recommend it as an introduction to the series;  Risky's Revenge is a better starting point.  Pirate's Curse doesn't really try to introduce any of the returning characters to you, which would make the story beats fly over a player new to the series' head, including that our heroine *had* magic abilities that she somehow *lost* before this game begain, and her history with series antagonist, Risky Boots.

Some folks might be turned off by the fan service.  There is a high number of female characters wearing outfits that show off clevage or belly buttons if not both, and there's an entire sequence poking fun at the "slave Leia" outfit.   To me the game came off as self aware about it as opposed to creepy or skeevy, but other folks may feel different.  I did find it refreshing to play a game where not just the heroine is female, but so are most of the significant cast members.  This is something I enjoy about the series overall.

Wayforward overall does good work, and Pirate's Curse is certainly another example of that.  I enjoyed turning to it when I wanted a pick-me-up with fun gameplay, good controls, fun story, and solid music.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006575550', 'num_games_owned': 1631, 'num_reviews': 625, 'playtime_forever': 440, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 440, 'last_played': 1467671000}
review:
When I first saw this I was worried about the Anime like art style but this is a real deal 2d platformer. The game is fairly difficult and has the feel of more classic games. I found the controls to be on point which made the game very enjoyable to play. The humor is a bit silly at times and there are references to the previous game I didn't get. Do make sure to check the shop for upgrades but you do not need any of the skills there. You will be picking up other skills throughout the game that are required to progress. It's not the same skills but I found the ones in the shop to be pointless.

Really good boss design, level design, and music. You're going to have to work on collecting items to get the good ending so it will take longer.  I definitely think this is a positive addition to the genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076838025', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 538, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 538, 'last_played': 1467958366}
review:
Shantae is a fun and whimsical take on the "metroidvania" genre. The game has an excellent soundtrack that really gives the action feel that it is going for. The characters are well written and provide plenty of comedic opportunities. 

The gameplay isn't too difficult for the majority of the game. The last level the gameplay gets dramatically harder, and it’s for the better. It's very satisfying to take all that you have learned through the game and pass the ultimate test. The ending was a little anticlimactic and was obviously setting up the next game, but story is not the reason to purchase this game regardless. For a sale price, this game is worth every penny for I had a blast with it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198002498592', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2280, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2054, 'last_played': 1569727210}

author: {'steamid': '76561198170025969', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 760, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 750, 'last_played': 1533578540}
review: You never know what you want until you have it. I had no idea that I loved 2-D sidescrolling Metroid-Vania adventure games until I played this. Now I REALLY want it! This game had a little bit of everything; it was funny, 4th wall-breaking, cute and charming, as well as having incredibly difficult sections near the end that tests everything you know about the game's moves. The final boss is a joke, try to get through with 0 damage if you want a challenge. And the game has a habit of oversexualizing every female in the game (Excluding one but no spoilers) to a somewhat comedic degree (in a Lollipop Chainsaw kind of way) until I believe it's supposed to be making fun of games that oversexualize their females. And I enjoy that, I am open-minded enough to realize a joke when one is being made, although that fact is a little difficult to explain to my parents when they find out what I've been screaming at all day.

author: {'steamid': '76561198203412952', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 1364, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 915, 'last_played': 1646846724}
review:
Shantae and The Pirate's Curse is the 3rd installement in the shantae series. This time with the help from IntiCreates ( makers of Megaman zero, ZX , 9/10) , wayforward was able to show us what Shantae was really capable of. The first Shantae game well being the first one and being on the gameboy color had some issues , most of them caused by the console itself, it also didn't know what it wanted to be. The second game Risky's Revenge which you can also get on steam while improved upon a lot of things in the first game still had some design choices that made the game feel unfinished (the map , only 3 dungeons one being a gauntlet etc...) . 

With background out of the way lets look at this game.

Pros:
1: The music is amazing. Its energetic and memorable. Same guy who worked on shovel knight also a great game.
2:The controls are tight if you die its your fault and not because of some input delays.
3: The weapons you get are really useful and welcomed addition to the game. In previous games you had to hold buttons certain amount of time to dance and then transform  just to use the power you needed. However this time all you have to do is to just press the correct button and BOOM. It kinda reminds me of Symphony Of the Night in that regard.
4:The bosses are really fun and challanging and the best part is you can beat all of them withouth getting hit. Its actually not that hard. 
5: There are lots of dungeons (and 2 of them are secret bonus) and these are pretty fun. 
6:The writing is hilarious.
Cons:
1: You can't (to my knowledge ) assign the buttons on your controller. You can do it for the keyboard but not the controller.

..........And thats it , I can't really find major problems with this game.

I recommend Shantae and The Pirate's Curse to anyone who enjoys 2d platformer/metroidvania type of games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040549915', 'num_games_owned': 771, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 654, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 650, 'last_played': 1527350552}
review:
With a final playtime of 8 hours and 15 minutes, 100%ing the game after looking up a guide for the handful of collectibles I missed, SatPC is a little on the short side, but the overwhelming majority of those 8 hours are filled with an exceptionally solid platformer with an irresitibly bouncy soundtrack, enjoyable visuals and several absolutely top-tier waifus.

The difficulty is fairly nicely balanced and rises at a reasonable rate, save for when it skyrockets in the final two levels and sends the death count soaring. Regardless, you'll have hopefully had a good enough time with the endearing characters and enjoyable combat that it hopefully won't sour the experience. Definitely worth the sale price, and possibly even the full £15.

Also, Rotty is best girl.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057164345', 'num_games_owned': 2934, 'num_reviews': 187, 'playtime_forever': 663, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 663, 'last_played': 1483984008}
review:
Shantae and the Pirate's Curse takes place after the events of Risky's Revenge, Shantae, who at the end of the previous game lost her genie magic in circumstances which the game takes considerable care to not actually reveal, now has to team up with her former nemesis Risky Boots to prevent the resurrection of the Pirate Master, a tyrannical pirate warrior who seeks to return to the world of the living. In addition, the Pirate Master has started using Dark Magic to turn Risky's Tinkerbats into Cacklebats - horrifying mutated creatures which Shantae must defeat in order to cut off his source of Dark Magic. Honestly, I think the plot here is actually much better than in the previous game. Whereas the plot in Risky's Revenge is at times quite thin, in this game it doesn't feel thin at all - there always seems to be something going on and it's in general much easier to follow.

Gameplay-wise It's a Metroidvania-platformer like its predecessor, but the areas you explore have been expanded quite a bit. Rather than just Scuttle Town and the nearby areas, you have a multitude of different islands to explore, from the tropical Saliva Island to the zombie-infested Spiderweb Island and the icy Frostbite Island, which gives it much more variety with regards to the areas you explore and visit. Compared to the first game, Scuttle Town and the surrounding areas have also been shrunk massively, though in all honesty this is more to the game's overall benefit, since it cuts out a lot of the needless traipsing back and forth that the first game had. The multiple islands also help to mitigate the Metroidvania forgetting-where-you're-up-to problem by giving you much more of a sense of progression as you unlock the islands and defeat the Cacklebats found there. The number of undiscovered Cacklebats and Heart Squids, which you use to increase the size of your life bar, are also shown above each island in the hub screen, making the completion aspect of the game much more accessible too. Because of the way in which it's been redesigned it's also much easier to find your way around Scuttle Town since all the buildings are now clearly labelled, so you no longer have to guess which door contains what.

The base gameplay and graphics are very similar to that of Risky's Revenge, with a few notable differences. In this instalment Shantae is by default able to whip her hair back and forth much faster than before, and as a result from the get-go the action is much less rigid and more snappy and satisfying. The fact that they've also added Castlevania-style knockback is both a blessing and a curse, since it allows the action to flow a bit more, but on occasion can be quite irritating. Unfortunately, due to Shantae having lost her genie powers, her Dancing mechanic is missing, but fortunately this is replaced with a new mechanic in the form of pirate equipment that can be found throughout the levels, for instance a pistol that allows you to hit far-off switches and serves as a weak ranged attack, a hat which lets you glide over long distances, and a scimitar which lets you do a ground-pound attack. These new mechanics complement the Metroidvania gameplay much like the Dances did in the previous game, and arguably even do a better job, since there's much more of them and they allow for a lot more variety in the platforming puzzles than the Dances did. Not only that, but WayForward have also, it seems, managed to add a couple of new spins on the platforming too, with gameplay drastically changing in a couple of sections of the game as you play. One section has you running through the woods, unable to attack, and another is a Wind Waker-eqsue stealth section in which you're stripped of all your items and have to try and sneak out of the area - if you're detected by the guards they will march you back to the start. These serve as interesting, fun little breaks from the Metroidvania gameplay and keep the game interesting in a way that doesn't disturb the flow of the plot in any serious way. 

A drastic change from the previous game is the items system, which has been almost completely overhauled. Most of the Magic from Risky's Revenge is gone and the mana system has been replaced with time-limited, single-use items. You're no longer able to hot-switch between different items in quite the same way as in Risky's Revenge but what you can do is use multiple items at the same time - a feature which the previous game lacked. The overall range of items available is also wider and you no longer need to find Magic Jam to buy anything. There's some offensive items, attack buffs, "Fighter's Moves" - extra maneuvers you can perform in combat, some of which can come in particularly handy, and a massive, very variable and on occasion slightly humourous range of healing items (including the new Auto-Potion which activates as soon as you run out of health - believe me they will save your bacon on many an occasion). I found myself not using quite as many items in this game as in Risky's Revenge, but honestly there's nothing wrong with the new system. It's different, but it doesn't really detract from the experience at all and is just as fun to use as the old system.

A lot of the characters from Risky's Revenge also reappear in Pirate's Curse as do some new characters, major and minor, ranging from a new Baron to a walking He-Man parody, and they're all just as funny and interesting as they were before, perhaps even more so. You get to see a lot more of the other characters than in Risky's Revenge and you'll learn more about them as you progress through the game - and you'll be glad to know that the fantastic writing also makes a return, and in greater and even more humourous amounts. Sometimes it'll have you on the edge of your seat, other times every other line will have you giggling, heck, even SIGNS and some item descriptions contain their fair share of weird and wacky humour! All that and somehow you never really lose track of the plot. Suffice to say, this game's writing is top notch.

A fair amount of the sountrack is made up of remixed tracks from Risky's Revenge but most of them are original, and whereas its predecessor's soundtrack was pretty good, Pirate's Curse ramps that description up to "freaking fantastic". Every single track is even more riveting than in the previous installment, and the soundtrack in general seems to have much more "thump" to it than before. As a result it perfectly complements the action-rich gameplay and awesomely-written characters, and not only that, but whilst it does sound modern and upbeat some of the songs seem to remind slightly of its 16-bit forefathers - if you listen to them in the right way they sound a bit like remixes of songs from the days of the SNES era. I really kind of regret that I can't fit more songs from this game's soundtrack into this video, it really is that much of joy to listen to.

Another thing which this game has which Risky's Revenge doesn't is voice acting for some of Shantae's lines, provided by none other than Cristina Vee, who also played such high-profile roles as Homura Akemi from Madoka Magica and Compa from Hyperdimension Neptunia. Whilst at times her voice acting can be a teeny bit grating it certainly helps to build up Shantae's character a little more by putting more of a voice in her mouth, and Christina Vee's performance is pretty good. That said, it is a bit of a shame that WayForward didn't choose to go big and fully voice-act it, because that would have been downright awesome.

All in all, Shantae and the Pirate's Curse is not just a great sequel to a great game, but also a truly fantastic game in its own right. The music is wonderful, the dialogue is stellar, the gameplay is smooth and enjoyable, the 16-bit graphics once again give it a fair amount of charm, and for what it's worth I can say that, even on its own, this is one of the best platformers I've ever played and certainly one of my all time favourites.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050157026', 'num_games_owned': 412, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 447, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 437, 'last_played': 1495772649}
review: Stylistic, charming, and damn good looking. Shantae and the Pirate’s Curse does almost everything right. Tight controls, smooth, fast paced combat and platforming, fantastic atmosphere in some areas, a lot of really nice music, and it’s got quite the replay value for a 2D platformer. The story could definitely use some work, but it’s not too vital to the overall quality of the game. Its charming retro Arabian fun!

author: {'steamid': '76561198085487096', 'num_games_owned': 1624, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 556, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 556, 'last_played': 1467120486}
review:
Shantae and the Pirate's Curse is a very good game with lots of interesting elements.

[b] Gameplay : [/b] Shantae and the Pirate's Curse is basiclly an action platformer that somehow feel like a fusion betwen megaman and metroid (more megaman than metroid). I'll start with, an odd point : the controls. The first time I have controlled shantae, something was odd, I felt like I couldn't control the caracter properly and I always took hits that I would have normally dodged. I felt this for, like 1 hour then the controls were perfect for me. So that's why I first thought that the controls were bad and I almost gave up, but in the end, it's just that you really need your time to adapt yourself I think (or maybe I was just stup). So the controls aren't bad. After that let's talk about the difficulty and the levels : It's very well done. In the middle of each island, you will obtain a new equipment item which grant you a new movement skill that will help you to move forward, and the level disign is perfectly done to use these item and make each equipments usefull. Also, the game is pretty difficult, some passages will make you die a lot but if you really can't do it, you can use items to help you (Do not always use items or the game will be way too easy, you can almost rush a boss without worring about your hp because you will kill him faster that he will kill you). 

[b] Art : [/b] The whole thing is well executed, the design and the backgrounds are beautiful and they fit very well to the universe of shantae, no bad point here, it's gorgeous. Also, you can obtein CGs in the game and that's cool.

[b] Musics and sounds : [/b] Well, the music are good and they fit very well to the art and the universe of the story but I am pretty sure I wont remember any of those song, it's not bad, but it's forgettable.

[b] Story : [/b] The universe is really cool, and the characters as well, they are funny and they are some comic elements. The story of your journey itself is kinda.... boring, you will clearly not play that game for his story,

[b] Glitch and issues : [/b] I had a pretty small issue but it's worth to mention. The speed of the game depend of your fps, it's nothing serious you will say since it's a retro style game and there is no way to have fps drop on this BUT the issue is somewhere else, there isn't a 60fps cap, so if you have a screen which can show more than 60 fps, your game will speed up ! I have a 144Hz monitor so the game ran at 144 fps and it was like playing with a x2 fast forward option, so if your monitor have more than 60Hz then you will have to cap your fps yourself. Nothing serious, just have to remember to change the fps cap before launching the game.

[b] Summary : [/b]

Pros :
- Good gameplay and well dosed difficulty (the first level is for baby but the last one is very hard)
- Well executed art and level designs
- Can be speedruned
- Support the french language

Cons : 
- The little fps issue I had
- Maybe a little short, it took me 7H and half to beat the game for the first time, there is a new game+ but it's more a speedrun mode because it's the same thing but you will have every gear unlocked from the start.

80/100 It's worth your money and your time, it's very fun yet perfectible on some points

author: {'steamid': '76561198071958059', 'num_games_owned': 377, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 1767, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 280, 'last_played': 1596714760}
review:
+ 既可爱又酷的人物 Both adorable and badass characters

+ 富有异域风情的悦耳配乐 Sweet Arabic style BGM

+ 幽默逗趣的剧情 Funny story

+ 有趣的游戏体验 Appealing gaming experience

+ 高水平的配音 High standard dub

- pc版由于无下屏，使用道具时比掌机版略繁琐 Without another screen, using items is not to be so convenient as the handheld version    

- 无手柄震动 No gamepad vibration set

总分Overall：10/10

掌机版已通，PC版先凑够五分钟写个测评，之后再慢慢玩。
对于WayForward这种老司机来说，再去夸赞《香缇与海贼的诅咒》关卡设计巧妙、美术风格独特等等似乎都显得毫无意义，唯一需要考虑的问题便是要怎么把这游戏推荐给其他人。
这是一款完美的横版游戏。推荐各位购买。

author: {'steamid': '76561198037486505', 'num_games_owned': 404, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 1936, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 595, 'last_played': 1559923592}
review:
9/ 10

갓겜.

산테 시리즈는 원래 재밌었다지만, 이건 모든 시리즈중 독보적인 걸작.
스토리상 샨테 상징인 마법과 밸리댄스 변신을 잃었단 설정인데 어떻게 된건지 액션의 다양함이 마법있던 전작 시리즈 때보다 몇배는 위다.

악역이었던 리스키와 함께 파이러츠 마스터를 쫒는다는 내용에서 그 과정에 얻게 되는 리스키의 해적 아이템을 얻어 쓴다는 진행을 통해 샨테의 액션과 패턴이 파워업하는 형식이다. 특정지형을 이동가능하게 해주는 해적 장비를 얻으며동시에 전투도 다양해지고 강화되는데,

권총 낙하산 시미터 등을 얻으면 단순히 특정지역 이동용이 아니라 놀랄만큼 다양하게 써먹을 수 있고 전투를 흥미롭게 만들어주며 신발 대포를 얻으면 완전 딴겜 수준으로 플레이 가능하다. 특히 신발을 얻을 경우 생기는 초고속 돌진기는 게임스타일에 큰 변화를 줄 뿐 아니라 그 액션 자체의 손맛도 끝내준다.

휴대용게임기의 이식작 답게, 인터페이스나 구성자체는 심플한데 볼륨도 조작감도 게임의 템포나 타격감 등도 모든것이 만족스러우며 골 빈듯이 유쾌하고 무식한 스토리를 매력적인 캐릭터가 완성시켰다. 샨테 시리즈는 원래 조작감이 부드럽고 안락하지만 이 게임은 템포면에서 좀더 스피디한 맛을 넣으며 조작감은 한단계 더 파워업 했다.

맵구성도 쾌적함 자체, 진행을 방해햐지 않는 깔끔한 필드 자체구성과, 신호탄이란 귀환아이템도 있어 이리저리 갔던 길 또가게 만드는 지겨움을 최소화 시켰다.

단점이 없는건 아닌데 적다.
-이식작이라 낮은 그래픽 해상도 
-한글 없는데 언어애드온도 없어 언어장벽으로 인한 몰입감 박탈
-체력회복등 소모품사용이 너무 자유로워 다소 낮은 난이도 설정
-별것없는 보스전

단점은 이정도밖에 보이질 않는다.
그러나 횡스크롤 찾는 사람중엔 하드코어 유저가 많아서 낮은 난이도란 문제는 확실히 사람에 따라선 걸림돌일수도 있겠다.  록맨 원작시리즈 정도의 난이도에 익숙한 올드유저라면 1~1.5점 더 까야 할 듯하다.

스팀에서 구한 다양한 횡스크롤 게임중 가장 재밌게 한 게임 중 하나.
속편이 곧 나온다고 하니 더없이 기대된다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034775930', 'num_games_owned': 2576, 'num_reviews': 266, 'playtime_forever': 573, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 573, 'last_played': 1464252477}
review: Эта игра просто великолепна. Я не играл в предыдущие части, а эту получил в комплекте Humble Monthly Bundle. Современные платформеры мне не особо нравятся, они все одинаковые или просто скучные. Но эта игра вернула меня прямиком в 90ые, когда ты будучи ребенком и держа контролер от сеги или денди получал дикий восторг от платфомеров. Здесь очень приятная и яркая картинка, простой геймплей, который укладывается в пару кнопок - беги, прыгай, убивай врагов, все очень просто. По ходу игры открываются новые способности, можно купить на заработанные очки разнообразные улучшения. Есть даже сюжет, который хоть и прост, но все равно цепляет. На удивление в этой игре очень круто нарисованы персонажи, почти все они девушки и не раз у меня нехило вставала шишка ( рейтинг 12 лет Sex от пеги себя оправдывает). Музыка великолепна, она бодрая и запоминающаяся - найдите трек из игры под названием "The nightmare woods" и вы поймете о чем я. Вообщем если вы соскучились по ярким, добрым и веселым платформерам, которые просты в освоении, то эта игра обязательна к покупке. Сам особо не играю в инди игры, но на прохождение этой потратил почти 10 часов и прошел за раз, а так сильно зацепить не каждый платформер сможет.

To be honest, I don't really know... If I had to guess, it's because it says "EIT GAME" instead of "EXIT GAME" at the save selection menu. So close...

author: {'steamid': '76561198055863752', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 967, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 967, 'last_played': 1466375074}
review:
Ну вот я и добрался до The Pirate's Curse. 
Поервым делом бросается в глаза, что Шантае теперь человек и у нас отобрали нашу магию. В замен дали нам расходники с свойствами скилов. Я подумал, что теперь надо будет расчитывать и запасатся расходником. Не тут то было! Дело в том, что с мобов падает по одному кристалу и не 100%. В итоге местный дроп сделал из меня Скруджа МакДака и покупал я только небходимые предметы, такие как усиление урона.
К вопросу об апгрейдах они довольно слабые. ...и не берите удар ногой. Как он выполняется я так и не понял, а выполняется он на туже кнопку что и выстрел. 
Мобы... Как же меня бесили русалки в Risky's Revenge, но тут они оказались переработаны. Это порадавало. Оооо!!! Как же я заблуждался.
Если все уровни оригинальны и непохожи друг на друга. Уровень Mud Bog Island мало того, что набит бесячими врагами, так ещё и дизайн самого уровнявызывает отвращени. Враги, кстати, просто вылитые симбиоты из Spiderman...
В конце игры разработчи видимо думали, что они делают Angry Video Game Nerd Adventures. Вы не захотите перепроходить его.
Бесячий финальный босс, вы будите каждыраз смотреть заставку перед босом, будите смотреть на его трасформации, будите смотреть на то как он прокастовывает все свои атаки. В это время вы бить его не може.

Воооот.... А так весёлый, отличный платформер, с весёлым сюжетом, с уникальным квестом в каждом уровне (да, даже в Mud Bog Island). 
Непонятно только зачем разработчики напихали всё выше описанное, такую вот ложку дегтя.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012902673', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 380, 'playtime_forever': 546, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 479, 'last_played': 1466375630}
review: Aside from a handful of trial and error sections, Shantae and the Pirate's Curse is a very fun and well put-together Metroidvania-esque platformer, with great pixel art and great music to round out the package.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029848562', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 739, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 739, 'last_played': 1465434363}
review: A fun little platformer that will remind you of its contemporaries while still retaining a unique identity.  Nearly all characters have a charm to them and the story is filled with humerous moments.  Playing the previous games are not necessary to comprehend the story.  The music, illustrations, and pixel art are both very well done.  I'm not sure I would recommend this for young children due to some of the character art, but to paraphrase someone in the forums it's no different than taking your child to the beach.  People who grew up playing things like Mega Man, Metroid, and Duck Tales ought to find a nostalgia fix with appreciable difficulty here.  I recommend playing this with a controller but keyboard and mouse support is here too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016201558', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2153, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2132, 'last_played': 1465773926}
review: Like Risky's Revenge, a very good game. Much of the plot issues were setup in throughout Risk'y Revenge (not jujst at the end), which really stands out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060633576', 'num_games_owned': 200, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 561, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 431, 'last_played': 1465925519}
review: Great platformer with a some cool concepts and story and a nice difficulty curve. Worth the money!

author: {'steamid': '76561198052859487', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 613, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 613, 'last_played': 1465813959}
review:
Shantae and the Pirate's Curse es una autentica maravilla de los metroidvania, un juego con una historia simple pero que propone un cierto humor y una jugabilidad muy sólida. Esta mítica saga desconocida se merece muchísimo más reconocimiento por los grandes títulos que dispone.

En este juego iremos obteniendo habilidades nuevas según avancemos y que nos desbloquearan nuevas zonas que antes no alcanzabamos. Esta característica es una de las principales por las que me encantan estos tipos de juegos, y es que te dejan con el gusanillo de que habrá en aquella zona que no podías ir antes, y ahora que puedes vuelves a esa zona para inspeccionar ¡y suele merecer mucho la pena!

La verdad es que me alegro mucho de haber conocido a tiempo esta saga, y se la recomiendo a cada una de las personas que conozco, porque para mi es uno de los metroidvania más solido y con mayor experiencia en el género, que con su toque desenfadado y divertido lo hace un título altamente recomendable. No dudeis en compradlo merece hasta el último euro de su precio!

author: {'steamid': '76561198069749103', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 755, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 755, 'last_played': 1654528200}
review:
Positives:
+ Great visuals 
+ Fun game play 
+ Suprising funny and charming dialogue and story
+ Rockin tunes 
Negatives:
- Shante only puts on the bandana when you use specific items even though she looks really cute with it on.

strong 7 to a light 8 outta 10

author: {'steamid': '76561198092368969', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 977, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 532, 'last_played': 1657494468}
review:
Stumbled upon the OST on Youtube from the suggestions on a Shovel Knight music video (same composer, aka the almighty Jake Kaufman - great suggestion, youtube!).

Got curious, watched some gameplay.

Bought it and enjoyed every bit since. The platforming is really well made, precise and responsive. I love the "pseudo" retro style, the artworks are gorgeous and the characters are great. Do I need to say how amazing the entire soundtrack is?

11/10 would buy again. Very enjoyable game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066246862', 'num_games_owned': 545, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 528, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 527, 'last_played': 1466262945}
review:
Everything a sequel should be, better graphics, more accessibile and fun gameplay, funny writing, and plot points from previous game actually carry into this one. The music is on another level (composed by Jake Kaufman or simply Virt of Shovel Knight fame). This time the transformations are gone and this is good because the new pirate gear is much faster, easier and fun to use than any of the animal forms from the past.

If you liked Risky's Revenge then this is even better, but for people who aren't sure about Metroidvanias I'd wait for a price drop as it might not be your cup of tea. Also it took me under 9 hours for both ending and depending on the person this can be good or bad.

Overall, fantastic game and I'm definetely looking forward to ½ Genie Hero coming out this September!

author: {'steamid': '76561198192651930', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 5061, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 341, 'last_played': 1687294194}
review: Yet another solid Shantae game. So entertaining to play, and I appreciate the practical uses of the pirate equipment far more than the genie transformations from Risky's Revenge. Not to mention, I think this game is home to Jake Kaufman's finest musical work yet. Give it a shot if you like broad worlds to explore, secrets and treasure to find, and a quirky sense of humor.

author: {'steamid': '76561198088050136', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 117, 'playtime_forever': 1726, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1461, 'last_played': 1541875938}
review:
shantae and the pirate's curse...couldn't believe that i'd love the game and put much effort on it 

it has the megaman's death animation , some sonic-ish soundtracks that you would like :D , some legends of zelda stuff and a Wario's land dash attack  , and much more...
the game is kinda short , i could finish it 100% in 9 hours ; the levels are challenging , the bosses aswell .

the game is a good port from the nintendo consoles tho , has a good performance and is enjoyable on the both controlling platforms : the keyboard and the controller , it has an open world and the items exploration makes you enjoy the game even more!!

the game is really worth it , but i don't recommand paying the full price ( if it was longer by 20 more hours , i would concider paying the full price of it :D )

enough said , i wish i had more words for this review : 

10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198027011568', 'num_games_owned': 439, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 671, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 671, 'last_played': 1465087608}
review:
Loved this silly platformer. 

Story isn't heavy, comic releif isn't too obnoxious.
The sprites all look and animate very well.
Standard level-based adventure title, sometimes so much sop that they break the 4th wall about it.
Very nice, funny and diverse cast of characters with well-scripted interactions.

Took me less than 8 hours to complete the storyline and obtain 50% of the extra collectibles along the way, so not too daunting, but not a lame trip, either.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077861220', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1467, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1119, 'last_played': 1614895862}
review: Shantae and the Pirate's Curse is a fantastic game of which many fans of previous Metroidvania-style releases should enjoy playing, with quirky and interesting characters, funny dialogue, highly detailed animations, 16-bit graphics and character designs and a good number of collectibles to keep you going for a while. Well worth the price and highly recommended to those with a nack for platformers!

author: {'steamid': '76561198057984107', 'num_games_owned': 192, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 898, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 848, 'last_played': 1487313301}
review: Shantae and the Pirate's Curse is a very good adventure platformer, with health collectables, dungeon items (which most of them give you mobility which by the end of the game make you go from place to place very fast) and more collectables that either progrss story or allow you to fight the true final boss. All of the characters have cool personalities but the only downside is that if you haven't played the previous games you might not understand of some things they're talking about. This game also includes new game + so you start with all the dungeon items so you can get all collectables in one run and move very quickly around the map so it won't take nearly as long the second time. So in conclution if you have the money for this game you should definitly pick it up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198140790203', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1722, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 784, 'last_played': 1467060135}
review:
Shantae and the Pirate's Curse is a HUGE stepup from Risky's Revenge.  The game pretty much has all the goodness of the prequel + more and some things done better.   You still have good visuals, level design, animations, music, etc (all the aesthetics are still good). The game actually feels complete with the inclusion of more bosses, more abilities, more dungeons and better character development.  The game is also more challenging (somewhat still easy for the hardcore platformer afficionados tho).

Not sure why they nerfed the backdash tho.  And I found the kick ability kinda useless far into the game.  Looking forward to the next scheduled release game Shantae Half-Genie,

author: {'steamid': '76561198263254745', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1930, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1543, 'last_played': 1527512173}
review:
这是一款很好玩的日式横版过关游戏，是《Shantae》系列的第三作，本作有ACT游戏有的优点，也有自己的特色，是少数的女主人翁游戏，我就得横版过关最重要的就是手感和操作，本作的操作比较简单，特殊技能释放简单，基本2到3个键便能完成技能释放，手感很好，操作完美，动作流畅，差不多是我玩过这类游戏里最好的了。立绘精美，美工相比前作进步相当大，天气光影相当到位。人设塑造的很好。游戏节奏、剧情无缝衔接，不拖泥带水，章节之间有密切关联，还有一定的探索解密要素，随着新装备的获得，之前章节的未知区域也会被一一打开，从而慢慢收集起黑魔法和小章鱼。音乐方面，在小镇上的阿拉伯风格音乐十分带感，摘出来可以单曲循环，随着剧情的发展BGM也随之变化，最后boss战的BGM也我听过的最好的boss战BGM之一，不同章节有不同的风格的音乐，使用不同的攻击音效也不同。女主的配音也是赞的不行，除了基本的对话中的配音，在攻击、使用武器、连招时也有配音，显得更具打击感。
  这是一款被埋没精品，一款佳作，真心推荐，期待下一作！

author: {'steamid': '76561198094626530', 'num_games_owned': 174, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 806, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 805, 'last_played': 1475633479}
review:
I absolutely LOVE this game to death. As a fan of the Shantae series, Pirate's Curse manages to combine what made the previous two good and make still make something new out of it.
The music's varied and extremely catchy, the graphics are charming, the writing manages to make so many characters feel unique, and Shantae herself is a great character to use. Being able to dash around the expansive maps with gliding, extra jumps and incredible speed is such a blast.
If you're a fan of platformers, Metroidvania's or just general gaming fun, then I highly recommend Shantae and the Pirate's Curse. I'm Ret-2-Go to play this game again!

author: {'steamid': '76561198109929912', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 138, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 98, 'last_played': 1485962478}
review:
Oh, Shantae... My waifu...

动作苦手的我，居然3DS版也快通关了，回头写一下感想。
* 作为metroidvania，这个游戏相比恶魔城，还是偏银河战士。每个迷宫都有一个新道具，而且我很欣赏在拿道具的场景同屏立刻可以用新拿的道具练手这一点。
* 存档点恰到好处的放置，所以难度不会很高。
* Boss战基本都是解谜，动作难度不算很高，不过这个游戏的强力道具很宽裕，所以基本没有困难。
* 收集要素一目了然，目标基本都在能看到的范围内，只是要动脑子去拿。即使是像主城最左边那个dark magic，也是有强烈暗示的。
* 福利。我最喜欢的是Rottytops的公主装~ (●ˇ∀ˇ●) Rotty最萌了
* Jake Kaufman的音乐真是神作。就像是在海边吃烧烤，[b]孜然和海盐味[/b]混杂在一起的美妙感觉，舌头简直停不下来。另外不出所料很多曲子都有恶魔城风。

缺点么。。
* 有些任务的交代一两句话就带过，如果漏看了就很麻烦。尤其是到了那个Propeller Town怎么继续那里费了点心思。
* Wii U和Steam版的像素风我倒不反对，不过不是点对点显示有点遗憾。铲子骑士是你的榜样。
* Steam版似乎没有（或者没做好）垂直同步？偶尔能看到画面撕裂，比较遗憾。

我会到处安利别人玩这个游戏的~

author: {'steamid': '76561198102020074', 'num_games_owned': 474, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 945, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 836, 'last_played': 1465684517}
review:
Parece que los de Wayforward sabían en qué falló su anterior juego (que yo resalté en mi anterior análisis) y han explotado las buenas cualidades de Risky's Revenge: los personajes tienen más diálogo y tiempo en escena, los sprites ahora son el doble de bien hechos (no en vano Kinucakes ayudó con la animación) , backtracking mucho menos tedioso, las magias innecesarias eliminadas, mejoras que SÍ tienen multifunción y no solo romper X bloque, sistemas de teletransporte que no apestan, jugabilidad mejorada...este es EL juego de Shantae, el que todos deberían probar. 

Es un gran plataformas, y un gran metroidvania: entornos variopintos y divertidos de jugar, jefes finales llamativos, un final verdadero como dios manda, una trama que desarrolla ligeramente mejor a los personajes, humor lleno de doble sentido para los malpensados y sobre todo una dirección de arte sin igual. Además, viene traducido al español ( con ligeros fallos ) así que tienes literalmente 0 EXCUSAS para no probarlo. 

Mi única queja es que si consigues un par de corazones más y usas objetos, se vuelve muy fácil...pero siempre puedes NO hacerlo y tendrás un desafío decente. 1000% recomendado

author: {'steamid': '76561198120536352', 'num_games_owned': 246, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 498, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 273, 'last_played': 1627230032}
review: my parents are dissapointed in me now

author: {'steamid': '76561198054202691', 'num_games_owned': 1166, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1958, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1848, 'last_played': 1590087429}
review:
Итак, пишу обзор после прохождения игрули на 100%.
Можете не соглашаться, но Pirate's Curse - лучшая игра в серии Shantae. В ней на высшем уровне выполнено почти всё!

Сюжет таков, что на Скаттл Таун опять нападение (привет первой части). Только на этот раз со стороны Ammo Baron'а. Мэр по тупости продал ему город. После этого появляется Риски Бутс без своего снаряжения и команды и обвиняет Шанте в их пропаже. Последняя недоумевает. Риски показывает запертого пирата в мастерской дядюшки Мимика. Из ниоткуда возникает темная магия и превращает пирата в мутанта. После победы над ним, Риски рассказывает про некого обозленного Хозяина Пиратов, на которого раньше работала, а после его поражения от джиннов увела его оружие и команду. Вот так вот Шанте объединяет усилия со своим заклятым врагом и отправляется в новое приключение...

Геймплейно, это по прежнему метроидвания. На этот раз для достижения ранее недоступных областей используется не магия танца (ведь в конце Risky's Revenge Шанте лишилась своей магии), а пиратское снаряжение Риски Бутс - пистолет, шляпа, ятаган, ботинки (Risky's Boots, поняли, да? Смейтесь.) и пушка для выполнения четырёх прыжков вместо одного. Стартуем на этот раз с двумя сердечками, которые можно прокачать до 10 путем сбора не одного какого-то апгрейда, а 4-х на сердечко кальмаров в форме сердечка, которые затем надо расплавить в кузнице Скаттл Тауна. Всего кальмаров в игре 32. Для лечения, кроме зелий, также теперь можно использовать несколько типов еды. Магии может быть и нет, но две формы шипастого шара в игру вернулись в виде расходуемого предмета. Вместо зелья магии появилось монстр-молоко и супер монстр-молоко (временное увеличение урона). Также появилось полезное авто-зелье, которое автоматически восполняет здоровье, если оно опустилось до нуля. Но есть и слабые стороны, например специальные движения:
Back-dash, доступный изначально в Risky's Revenge, теперь надо покупать, но он не используется по большому счету из-за тупо медленного исполнения, в отличие от предшественника (после получения ботинок вообще становится бесполезен). Мув-лист Шантэ пополнился и двумя новыми движениями: восстановление в воздухе после получения удара (единственное хоть сколько эффективное) и пинок, который наносит 10 очков урона, но опять же почти не используется из-за низкой скорости атаки (нет серьезно, полная прокачка ятагана даст столько же). Эффективнее будет избить врага стандартной волоснёй.
Что же насчет мира игры, то теперь кроме Секвина доступно еще четыре не особо больших острова (без учета последнего): Saliva Island, Spiderweb Island, Tan Line Island, Mud Bog Island и Frostbite Island. На каждом из островов обитает пачка кальмаров, Cacklebats'ов (мутировавших пиратов Риски) и босс со своим логовом. Путешествовать на острова мы сможем с помощью корабля Риски, найдя перед этим карту острова. Тут мы подошли к еще двум вещам: пиратская сигналка, которая вне помещений мгновенно вернет к кораблю и темная магия, выпадающая с Cacklebats'ов. Всего в игре 20 таких порождений тьмы и, соответственно, единиц темной магии. Для прохождения игры вся темная магия необязательна, но для полной концовки игры она необходима. Всего, кстати, две концовки. Про геймплей вроде всё сказал.

Про музыку, написанную всё также Джейком Кауфманом, нечего сказать, кроме как шедевр. Отлично слушается даже отдельно от игры, хотя лучше всё-таки наслаждаться музыкой именно в игре.

К графике я вообще никогда не придираюсь. Нормальная графика, с учётом платформы-первоисточника - Nintendo 3DS.

Итог: Shantae and the Pirate's Curse - это великолепная игра, одна из лучших в жанре и лучшая в серии на данный момент. Ведь как можно не любить множество отдельных веселых и серьезных моментов, которыми она насыщена и которые сопровождаются отличнейшей музыкой (отдельно хочу выделить A Troublesome Trek, которая является ремиксом ночной темы 2 из оригинальной Shantae).

author: {'steamid': '76561197995713938', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 754, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 689, 'last_played': 1491588407}

author: {'steamid': '76561198118772942', 'num_games_owned': 271, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 660, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 598, 'last_played': 1463135072}
review:
像素横版过关，如果你喜欢这类型的游戏，这款游戏可谓是必须入手了。而且可以和前阵子非常热门的rabiribi作比较，像素的精细化上海盗更胜一筹，游戏难度比草兔简单，如果说兔子更符合你的日系口味，那么海盗女主能激发你心中的那块久违的欧美系风格激情（各种换装炒鸡萌），如果英语水平不是很差，一定要静下心看对白，女主各种萌翻。
        boss战也挺过瘾的，海盗的缺点是有些关卡没有进行下去的提示，流畅度还不够，几个地方卡关的我还翻出去看了几次攻略视频。。。
       另外给新人个小提示，没必要一开始去买商店里的技能。基本用不着，好好强化武器。
       音乐方面也非常出彩，但仍略不及rabiribi，海盗沙漠那关的BGM非常有M2U的风格，吓我一跳。
（9.4/10）

author: {'steamid': '76561198048480941', 'num_games_owned': 2676, 'num_reviews': 118, 'playtime_forever': 1355, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1355, 'last_played': 1462957655}
review: Обалденная игра чем-то напоминает duck tales на nintendo только лучше. Shantae красиво нарисована тут проработано всё до мелочей начиная от разной походки в разных костюмах и заканчивая звуками, когда эта очаровательная малышка лопает какой-нибудь деликатес. Прекрасно анимированы и озвучены персонажи, немного пикселизированная графика не портит, а придаёт милый шарм, легкая музыка, множество крестов и прямолинейная часть прохождения нежели в Shantae: Risky's Revenge - Director's Cut, та была запутанная, а здесь вопросов куда идти и что делать не возникает. В конце сложность возрастает и там уже уровень игр spelynky и super meat boy. Сбор всех сердечек и темной магии, а также множество секретов дополняют это непростое, продолжительное и увлекательное приключение.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967692485', 'num_games_owned': 765, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 1101, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1101, 'last_played': 1462325559}
review:
Ahoy! WayForward's trademark heroine is back with a new adventure that will see her join forces with her sworn enemy Risky Boots, and swap her (half-)genie moves with a brand spanking new pirate arsenal.

Much like its [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/277890/]predecessor in the series[/url], [i]Shantae and the Pirate's Curse[/i] is a casual adventure platformer with a charming cartoonish design. As per usual, the new abilities you unlock as the story progresses go hand in hand with increasingly challenging foes and level design. Although some backtracking will at times break the linearity, the game follows a stable pattern of unlocking new areas one after another, each of which will feature some sort of maze-like dungeon where you'll earn a new skill and fight a boss.

Although the difficulty increases with each new area, it remains relatively easy on the whole, meaning you'll probably clear this ten-hour adventure without much frustration (only the final dungeon has a few brutal screens). If you've done a good job of amassing health upgrades, the boss fights are pretty straightforward and a wise use of the healing/shielding/offensive items will help keep you alive. None of them are hugely challenging, although the achievements for defeating them without taking damage are another story.

With the gameplay relying on rather classic action platformer mechanics and only posing a moderate challenge, its true highlights lie elsewhere. The cartoonish design is just delightful, most notably in the dialogue scenes where the character art is all kinds of cute. The writing is tons of fun, with heaps of absurd comedy, mild innuendo and occasionally breaking the fourth wall, all the same ingredients that had already made the previous episode so refreshing. Last but not least, Jake Kaufman's soundtrack is absolutely lovely, with a bunch of energetic, catchy tunes that will stay with you long after you've quit the game.

tldr Recommended as f

review: Beautiful, snappy action platformer. Excellent artwork, entertaining dialogues (which can be skipped, as they can become tedious). Runs like butter on my 10-year-old machine. Bouncy, fun soundtrack. Not easy, but not too hard, either (I suck at platformers!). Lots of hidden stuff to explore. I'm having great fun playing this, highly recommended if you're into the Metroidvania-style game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002982240', 'num_games_owned': 861, 'num_reviews': 135, 'playtime_forever': 603, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 568, 'last_played': 1463659983}
review:
感觉还没怎么玩呢,就八个小时过去了.

游戏本身是非常出色的.关卡的设计人物的手感好听的bgm,各种fc老游戏的即时感.玩起来就停不下来,当然一些无伤成就还是放弃掉算了.别跟自己过不去,嗯.人物精美的立绘则更是锦上添花,给人一种"明明可以靠卖球赚钱,但是我偏要体现出游戏性"的感觉.

如果你喜欢2d横版过关游戏,非常值得尝试一下本作.当然我想看到我评测的你早已经入手了吧.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025800636', 'num_games_owned': 327, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1580, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1399, 'last_played': 1463977877}
review: Un juego muy recomendado, sobre todo para los fans de los juegos como Metroid y Catlevania, bastante acción que te mantendrá entretenido al jugar. El juego no se toma enserio, y se nota en los dialogos de los personajes, se centra en el gameplay. El juego a ganado una popularidad modesta, pero que a crecido por mérito propio. Quizas lo mas llamativo del juego es su aspecto estilo anime con chicas de anime sexy, pero al final te quedas con el juego por lo divertido que es. Tiene su grado de dificultad pero que dominarás rápidamente y querras jugarlo mas de una vez. Una compra de la cual no me arrepiento y estaré en espera de mas entregas de esta franquicia que espero tenga mas entregas.

review:
Metroidvania simpaticote y bastante sencillote (supongo que esto es relativo, pero quitando la ultima pantalla, no he experimentado ningún sitio especialmente dificil), que tira de humor blanco, unas protagonistas sexy-cute y estética de dibujos animados.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972433746', 'num_games_owned': 2131, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 1278, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1278, 'last_played': 1461782117}
review:
https://youtu.be/1GikBNbcVYs

[h1][b]Geschichte[/b][/h1]
Dieses Spiel schließt an die Geschichten der vorherigen Teile der Nintendoreihe an. Hier wurden wir unserer magischen Fähigkeiten beklaut und versuchen diese wieder zu erlangen und die auch die Stadt vor dem Bösen zu bewahren. Durch das Spiel lernen wir viele Charaktere, Freunde und Feinde kennen.

[h1][b]Grafik[/b][/h1]
Für dieses Spiel ist die Grafik perfekt finde ich. Schön animierte Effekte und detailierte Umgebung sowie schöne Illustrationen bzw. Bilder der Charaktere. Es  errinnert mich an einige Spiele vom Nintendo DS. 

[h1][b]Gameplay[/b][/h1]
Mit einem Controller lässt sich dieses Spiel sehr schön spielen. Im späteren Verlauf bedarf es etwas an feingefühl die Fähigkeiten die man erlangt hat zu kombinieren aber man kommt schnell rein und wird schnell in den Bann gezogen.
Ich kam für meine Verhältnisse gut mit der Steuerung klar.

[h1][b]Sound[/b][/h1]
Die Musik ist auch hier sehr schön in  Szene gesetzt und passt sich immer den Situationen bzw der Karte/Umgebung an. Teilweise wurden hier auch Stimmen verwendet für die Charaktere was diese noch authentischer macht. An einigen Stellen merkte ich das Effekte-Geräusche fehlten, aber sonst wurde alles gut vertont.

[h1][b]Wiederspielwert[/b][/h1]
Durch die Erfolge und die verschiedenen Enden  und sogar den 2. Modus, spielt man dieses Spiel  gerne ein 2. oder sogar 3. mal.

[h1][b]Herausforderung[/b][/h1]
Manche Stellen im Spiel sind schon sehr Nervenrauben und schwer, da man mit einem kleinen Fehler oft den Kartenabschnitt neu  machen muss. Bei den Endbossen muss man manchmal auch die Mechaniken erstmal herausfinden aber kommt auch gut voran. Es ist also nicht zu schwer.

[h1][b]Fazit[/b][/h1]
Wer ein gutes Action Jumb&Run sucht, welches nicht nur eine schöne Geschichte bietet sondern auch Humor und Herausforderung, dem kann ich dieses  Spiel nur empfehlen. Mir hat es viel Spaß gemacht, dieses Spiel durchzuspielen.

En vez de ser un unico mapa dividido en zonas como en la anterior aventura, ahora son varias islas con un mapa mucho mas extenso donde hay que usar las habilidades que vas obteniendo a lo largo del juego.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017477181', 'num_games_owned': 3879, 'num_reviews': 150, 'playtime_forever': 1784, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1676, 'last_played': 1461104077}
review:
Un Jeu de plateforme comme je les aimes. à la difficulté dosé augmentant juste comme il faut, aux possibilités apportés par l'équipement collecté, aux passages secrets, poussant à vouloir tout compléter.... Tout ce qui fait un bon Metroidvania.

A cela s'ajoute une direction artistique et un level design de qualité, mais surtout de l'humour, allant de la bonne grosse blague aux petits clins d'oeils. 

L'histoire est rarement la qualité première des Jeu de plateforme. Ce n'est pas vraiment mieux ici, reprenant de bonne grosses ficelles et classique du genre, ce qui n'empêche en rien d'apprécier le contenu.

Une petite merveille sur PC pour qui aime les bons jeux de plateforme.
