review: A really good MegamanX-style platformer. If you like Risky's revenge, you can't miss this one. Stage design is awesome. Only 2 drawbacks of this game are not so good in-game graphic and the last boss which not let me use any move I had practiced from previous stages.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004565666', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 296, 'playtime_forever': 616, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 616, 'last_played': 1450496825}
review:
This is a solidly "pretty good" metroidvania platformer. The platforming and combat are both good, the bosses are well-designed, and the difficulty ramps up very nicely. The beginning is very easy but by the end there's some fiendishly difficult platforming sections. 

Also there are secrets everywhere to find and a cute plot full of cute characters. If you're into those things.

The only flaws I'd list are that you're given so many healing and buff items that you should never ever die unless you're intentionally stingy, there's a good chunk of backtracking required for just the main plot, and the final boss without tracking down all 20 Dark Magic items is pretty anticlimactic.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055630763', 'num_games_owned': 120, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 842, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 797, 'last_played': 1459398629}

author: {'steamid': '76561198049402635', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 1805, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1805, 'last_played': 1479410444}
review:
[h1]Oh boy, this sure was a lot of fun.[/h1]
100% collectibles in 7 1/2 hours. 7 1/2 hours [strike]i'd replay for the extra achievements[/strike] GOT THE ACHIEVEMENTS BOISS

First of all, this game is a metroidvania. If you don't know what that means, google.
At this point by seeing the review is extensive, you'd want me to tell you how good it is.
It's fantastic 9.5/10 i'd order more but games take time. Will buy 1/2 Genie Hero @ release if sale. And since they're growing thanks to steam i do expect sales from them. That's something really good btw. Great job guys, can't wait to see what's next.

[b]What's this game got of special?[/b]
*Comedy & Unexpected shit
*Great improvement in an amazing saga.
*Well built personalities, lore connection and storyline.
*Collectibles! Noice.
*Replayability
*Jake Kaufman made the music => It's more like the best OST ever (Once again, thank you for Mighty Switch Force OST, keep making more i'll be sure to pay for the games.)
*Puzzles and stuff like that, backtracking for collectibles, and other tricky things.
*TONS OF FANSERVICE EVEN IF IT'S NOT CONSIDERED FANSERVICE. FOR REALS, WHY DO THEY KEEP MAKING THAT KIND OF JOKES AND PUTTING ULTRA HD DIALOG PICS THAT SHOW LOTS OF SKIN? NOT LIKE IM COMPLAINING THO ( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°)
*Cheaper than your classic triple A garbage
-Not enough thighs (Shoutouts @ Mighty Switch Force) 

something like 1million/1 on pros/cons isn't something you pass up.

Get this game IF:
*You have money obviously
*You are more than 15 years old and know what retro style has to offer.
*Like difficulty scaling but also like to say "FUCK IT ILL JUST DRINK INSTANT MAX HP POTION" (yeh, there's that. Difficulty isn't hindered much tho)
*Get this game altogether, you just should. It really is a fun metroidvania

So far, the newest game in the series is [u]a bit[/u] botched and not 100% finished so if you really are looking for the best one at the moment, get this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082952274', 'num_games_owned': 900, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 823, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 823, 'last_played': 1449903352}
review:
old school风的横版卷轴跳台游戏（女主超骚），剧情十分有趣（女主超骚），难度比较平易近人（女主超骚），人物动作流畅且画面风格良好（女主超骚）。有着类恶魔城的地图系统以及多种能力升级（女主超骚），可以作为闲暇时的娱乐（女主超骚），唯一的不足是部分解谜有些不讲道理而又缺乏提示（女主……够了！闭嘴！），属于那种虽然是做给小孩子玩的但实际却是一群大友（变态）在玩的游戏。比如这种->（啊啊女主真的超骚啊啊啊！）

-------------------------------
非完美通关啦，明明打算收集全DARK MAGIC看完美结局的结果还是忍不住先去打了boss。说真的这游戏里的boss难度都不是非常大……最终boss更是上完buff直接无脑戳死，虽然不是真·boss就是了。不过游戏里的迷宫都十分有(sang)趣(bing)，尤其是最后的palace，打完那几个迷宫我爽得我简直要升天啦，而且中间还没有存档点。

总体来说是个风格清新，妙趣横生的横版过关游戏，像我这样不去收集东西通关都用了十个多小时可以看出游戏内容还是蛮丰富的。推荐萌豚、横版游戏爱好者、像素游戏爱好者入手，当然如果你是像我这种三样全占的人
SHUT UP AND TAKE MY MONEY!

author: {'steamid': '76561198076464310', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 1101, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1101, 'last_played': 1449408071}
review:
シャンティシリーズの第3作目。

ストーリーは前作のRisky's Revenge終了後のお話であり、そこでの登場キャラは全員続投しているためできるのなら前作をプレイしてからのほうが楽しめるだろう。
もちろんストーリ的にはそれぞれ独立したお話なので、いきなり今作からプレイしても特に問題はない。
前作のことがよくわからなければ、とりあえずシャンティ（主人公）がリスキーブーツ（紫肌の人）と敵対しこれを退けたが、その影響で魔法の力を失った、ということだけわかっていればOK。
よって前作は使えた魔法や変身は今作では使えない。
そのかわりにストーリーが進むと入手できる特殊なアイテムによりシャンティの行動や攻撃方法が増えていくのが特徴。

プレイ感覚としては、前作に比べて操作性が格段に向上している。
特にジャンプ周りの動きはかなりよくなっており、ピョンピョンと軽快な動作で跳び回れる。
またストーリが進むと出来るようになる特殊動作も、前作はベリーダンスを踊って変身する必要があったが今作はボタン一つで即時に実行可能。
結果的にアクションゲームとして非常にスピーディなプレイが可能となっている。

難易度は難しすぎず、易しすぎずのちょうどいい塩梅に感じた。
マップデザイン的には敵との戦闘よりもむしろ、トゲトゲやら落とし穴が強敵。
とはいえ穴に落ちたりトゲに刺さったりしても即死ではなく、ライフが減ったうえで部屋の入口に戻されるだけなのでそこまでストレスではない。
またボス戦は、倒すのに特定の手順を踏まなければならないタイプで倒し方がわかるまではちょこっとだけ苦戦するかもしれない。
ただ前作同様、今回も回復アイテムを大量に持ち込んでのゴリ押しが可能なため、倒せなくて困るってことはまずないだろう。
ゲーム作成者もそれはわかっているのか、全ボスにノーダメージ撃破実績が存在する。
余裕があれば狙ってみよう。

欠点としては、次にどこに行くのかがわかりにくいことが挙げられる。
新しいマップのダンジョンに入るためには、過去のマップのアイテムを回収しに戻ったり、町でイベントを起こす必要があるのだが、これがちょっとわかりづらい。
この点だけは改善してほしかった。
それとゲームプレイには直接関係ないが、現時点で日本語がないことが少し残念。
一応すべてのセリフを飛ばしてもクリアは可能だが、ストーリーやキャラの掛け合いもこのゲームの大きな魅力の一つなので、それらを飛ばすのはもったいない。
幸い全セリフを訳してくださるサイトが存在するので、そこを見ながらやるといいかもしれない。

総評としては、非常に出来の良い2Dアクションゲームだと思います。
ゲームの出来はもちろんの事、より日本人好みになった立絵や、素晴らしい音楽など細かい所まで満足なゲームでした。
かなり強くオススメできる一本です。

author: {'steamid': '76561198071125787', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 772, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 602, 'last_played': 1453008256}
review:
おもしろかったよ。コントローラーがあったほうがいいね。
xboxパッドを使ったよ。
主人公の動作がかわいくて豊富なのが◎
しゃがみ歩きのへコヘコと、はしごを降りるときがかわいくて意味なく繰り返してしまった。
ゾンビの娘を家に届けるモーションは最高だね。
軽い感じで数も少ないけどBGMも良かったよ。スタッフロールのアレンジはクリアしたぞー感がある。
ゲームの難易度は簡単で子供向け。昔の家庭用アクションゲーム感覚。
初見殺しなステージも多いけど、ライフ製で回復アイテムが豊富なので何回も挑戦できる。
失敗して、やり直しの開始位置も丁度いいからイライラもなく、純粋に難所を攻略する気になったよ。
海外の2D絵もかわいくなったなぁ・・と感じさせるゲームでした。

author: {'steamid': '76561198178338014', 'num_games_owned': 166, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 743, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 532, 'last_played': 1449346727}
review:
Justo acabo de terminar el juego y puedo decir con total seguridad que es uno de los juegos de plataformas mas entretenidos que he jugado en mi vida.
Una historia sencilla pero atrayente,una jugabilidad casi perfecta y una personaje muy entrañable son solo unos pocos de los factores por los que recomendaria este juego.
Hace poco me entere de que una secuela esta en desarrollo,y cuando la saquen no dudare ni un segundo en comprarla.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040084487', 'num_games_owned': 415, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 1175, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1172, 'last_played': 1625976979}
review:
*ahem* Dear Wayforward,
We need more Shantae....that is all....


                 Sincerely,

A very satisfied action/platformer gamer who thoroughly enjoyed the GBC original release, this, and Risky's Revenge: Director's Cut.

Now that that's outta the way, on to the review.

On the surface, it's just an average everyday platforming puzzle solving game, however, the style and story are very well done and the variety of available sub-weapons and special moves adds to the fun.  I wish we'd seen the return of the belly-dancing transformations, but given this is a direct sequel to Risky's Revenge, I can see why they opted to leave the half-genie stuff out, seeing as she lost all her powers in Risky's Revenge.

Graphics: 4.5 - The colors are vibrant and the backgrounds vary from island to island.  Still, it's a bit dated, but for this type of game, it's not a bad thing at all.  This game is set to stand the test of time as it just looks good and easy on the eyes.  Be prepared for MORE BUTT WIGGLES!

Sound: 4.5 - the voice-over work was interesting, but I wish they'd run with it a bit more.  It would have been a bit more engrossing having at least the dialogs between main characters/villains with voice-overs.  Still, Shantae's voice is cute and lovable.  The music does the job well setting up the scenarios and scenes everywhere.  

Controls: 5 - I'm using a 360 controller that's working flawlessly while I play.  The occasional ducking is a problem, but that's the CONTROLLER, not the game itself.  I fault Microsoft for that one because the d-pad, while great, is sometimes too sensitive and I find myself ducking and crawling when I meant to run forward.

Replay: 4.5 - Even if this game is short, I still find myself always going back to platformers and playing them again.  This is why Super Mario Bros. series has always stood the test of time.  I always find myself going back and playing those games and I'm sure to find myself coming back to Shantae and playing it over again.  Still, I wish there were a few extra things to do during a 2nd playthrough.  Even Risky's Revenge: Director's Cut had the alternate costume playthrough, but still, I will most likely find myself coming back to play this again even after I've completed it 100%.

For followers of Shantae, definitely worth it.  Those new to the series may find it a little lacking, but the gameplay is solid and flawless in controls.  Anyone looking for a quick platforming fix will find plenty to like in this and the earlier entries of the series.  Steam and the world needs more platformers as solid as Shantae is and hope that there's future entries in this series.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045970843', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 232, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 212, 'last_played': 1452115090}
review: I feel compelled to leave a review because WOW, I'm blown away by how much fun I'm having. If you are wanting for Metroidvania style games, look no further. I played a lot of those when I was a little SNES tyke. At first, the game starts out rather easy and boring. But as you go further, the story and characters really unfurl their wings as the gameplay gets more difficult, challenging, and it starts to show just how much love and care was put into this game. The lo-fi graphics look amazing and are smooth as butter. The characters are all easily identifiable and rememberable. They're also all usually adorable and likeable, too, Shantae especially. She's always bouncing around with a big smile on her face, but she lets out a believable warcry that makes me love whipping dudes with her hair, when I first thought I'd hate it because it'd get repetitive. Nope, love doing it, all the time. Love jumping too... Because she's just so... Bouncy... Sorry, lost my train of thought there... Yeah, she's hot, sue me. Doesn't help that she bounces along to the song in Scuttle Town. Did I mention the soundtrack is great too? Anyway, just buy the game, already. It's an amazing platformer. It's just frickin' beautiful.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041923138', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 713, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 713, 'last_played': 1448901176}
review:
Taking inspiration from games such as Disney's Aladdin and Metroid, this game was a really fun experience. Excellent graphics and animations, music, gameplay and in particular the controls which are really smooth and precise. Not a single time did I feel that the controls were the source of my mistakes. The game has hillarious moments, causing laughs at unpredictable moments.

9/10, the only thing keeping it from a 10 is a slightly short length and a fairly simple and predictable story.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968089020', 'num_games_owned': 779, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 1631, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1548, 'last_played': 1494216266}
review:
Shantaeシリーズの3作目です
ストーリーや登場人物はほぼ前作からの続きです
興味があれば前作から始めるのが良さげかも

Steam版に日本語はありませんが前作を和訳してくれた方が今作も和訳してくれています　本当にありがたい
http://scrap-cliff.sakuraweb.com/other/shantae_to_JP_top2.html

日本語版は3DSでパッケージ・DL販売しています（立体視で色々出るとこが出ててすごいらしい）

今作では立ち絵やタイトル画面等の絵を日本の方が描いてくれています
前作の絵もかわいかったけどもっとかわいくなった　すごいかわいい

ゼルダの伝説やメトロイド等に影響されているらしく、前作同様ゲーム性に似通った部分が多いです
ドット絵も可愛い探索系アクションゲームです
程良い難易度ですがイライラ棒的なチャプターも少しあるのでその部分は好き嫌いが分かれるかもしれない　ぼくはそのへんちょっと苦手だなーって思いました
それでも前作と比べると2周目以降のプレイで色々な場所をショートカット出来たり勢いのあるプレイが出来るのでとても爽快感あります
とても楽しく全実績解除ができました
4時間以内に100％クリアなど、実績一覧に表示されていない隠し実績があります

author: {'steamid': '76561198002616062', 'num_games_owned': 426, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 614, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 614, 'last_played': 1448812412}
review:
プレイ時間目安：一周目100%クリア　8時間

良いところ
・キャラが際立ってメチャシコ
・ダンジョンやアクションは良く出来ている
・パイレーツパーツが全部集まると爽快感あるアクションゲームになる
・ドットの動きが良く出来ている

悪いところ
・各ステージに次のステージで手に入るパイレーツパーツがないと取れないアイテムが多々ある。
・新しいステージのダンジョン開放条件が一度クリアしたステージに戻って条件をクリアしないと、開放されないという面倒くささ。
・アイテムアップグレードがあるが、パイレーツパーツが強すぎてあって無いようなものになっている。

悪いところは2周目からある「パイレーツモード」でほぼ解決するが、2周目前提のアクションゲームはどうなのと思いたいところ。
くれぐれも「shantae hentai」で検索しないように。

author: {'steamid': '76561198124300256', 'num_games_owned': 111, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2639, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1962, 'last_played': 1662853919}
review:
Ну что, прошел я эту замечательную игру, и могу сказать что это идеальная метроидвания. Идеальный баланс сложности, очень удобное управление ( играл на геймпаде ), ачивки дают неплохой челенж, хороший сюжет ( лучше играть с первой части на GBC т.к. это все же трилогия и сюжет в них общий ), в плане графики и музыки к ней не придраться т.к. они создают невероятную атмосферу, ну и самое главное это умопомрачительный геймплей. Вобщем лично для меня эта игра совершенна во всем, советую всем, особенно любителям платформеров, не пожалеете.


Более детальный видеообзор можна посмотреть здесь: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DYw674Ci-NY

author: {'steamid': '76561197970739339', 'num_games_owned': 676, 'num_reviews': 564, 'playtime_forever': 771, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 700, 'last_played': 1447295379}
review: Shantae and the Pirate’s Curse is the third and most refined entry of the series thus far, forming what is now called the “sprite trilogy”. In this installment, Shantae teams up with longtime series antagonist Risky Boots on a quest to tame an ancient curse that threatens all of Sequin Land. Bereft of her genie magic, Shantae must instead make use of powerful pirate items: Risky’s pistol, hat, boots, scimitar and cannon, to traverse the world. The overworld and warp points of the earlier games are replaced with a free-roaming stage select, where Risky’s ship takes you to each of the levels, and she can be talked to at almost any time to leave your current island and travel elsewhere, up to the very end of the game. Easily twice the length of Risky’s Revenge, Pirate’s Curse retains most of the advances made in that game and also brings back a number of elements not seen since the original GBC game, most notably, the bathhouse in Scuttle Town that lets your recover health for free. Also, reloading a save will refill Shantae’s health. Pike balls are once again consumables as in the original, and the storm puffs and fireballs are gone, but Risky’s Pistol provides unlimited ranged attacks and can be upgraded, like Shantae’s hair, for more damage. Shantae can use the hat to glide, the scimitar to pogo-jump enemies a la Shovel Knight, the boots to do a Super Metroid-style boost run, and the cannon to do up to three additional jumps, altogether making Shantae her most maneuverable self yet. The same great sprites seen in Risky’s Revenge are augmented with new character art, new music, and a variety of new environments and enemies that revisit those seen in Shantae 1. Other new editions include consumable items that boost Shantae’s attack damage, food items that drop off enemies and restore various amounts of health, and “pirate flares” that allow you to return to Risky at any time, so long as you are outdoors. Overall, Pirate’s Curse is considerably more challenging then Risky’s Revenge but not to the point of frustration- falling into a death pit or touching the spikes merely removes a single hit point and returns you to the entrance of the current room, and you can have a total of forty, and carry enough health items to render an actual game over a near-impossibility- thanks to the addition of auto-potions that trigger automatically upon losing all your health. It is not however, anywhere near as cheap as the first game, and for that I am thankful. If you liked the previous Shantae titles, Metrodivanias or platformers of any kind, Shantae and the Pirate’s Curse is a treat for your eyes, ears and fingers that should not be missed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025913007', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 132, 'playtime_forever': 267, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 267, 'last_played': 1446423103}
review: Shantae and the Pirate's Curse is a great game.  If you like light-hearted platformers, Shantae is probably for you.  The game looks like it's fairly short for the full asking price, so you might want to wait until it is on sale to pick it up.  My only real complaint about the game itself is that some of the stuff you have to do before entering dungeons is tedious.  I don't think the game stacks up favorably against Freedom Planet or Shovel Knight, so if you are new to the genre and want to try out a platformer, try those first.  But if you are a fan and have played both, Shantae is a great buy on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198089250151', 'num_games_owned': 666, 'num_reviews': 108, 'playtime_forever': 722, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 388, 'last_played': 1454183080}
review:
等了几个月有幸遇上打折，终于能玩到续作了，对前作有疑问的童鞋也可以去看看刚刚写的评测

首先说说这作不小的变化，可能是上一作出的比较早，而且也想要靠近原本GBC的那种风格，所以PIXEL的那种感觉会重一点，这一作在基本保持原有游戏画面的基础上，UI界面以及原画设计都变了不少，不过莫名其妙的有点靠近了日呆风格（大误）再加上一些很···不寻常的要素，不禁让我怀疑是不是wayfoward新混进了不少11区死宅（划掉）

能够看得出在保持动作流畅的基础之上，难度比起上一作要多了不少，解密嘛似乎还是普普通通不至于让解谜苦手的抓狂怪物从分布，行动等等都可以看得出来是特意给玩家制造困难，我们可以来统计一下在第二个岛上抱着Rottytops跑路的那一段大家一共挂了多少次[doge]（“我练功发自真心！（摔）”）···不过我想···大概也是为了呼应前一作结尾Shantae失去精灵力的剧情，本身的能力确实是大打折扣（注意这作有明显的击飞受身）

音乐在原本主体的基础上，渐渐去掉了MIDI味道，变得更加“动感”起来，也让游戏的节奏加快了不少；至于一些小细节还是如同以往一样，可爱的美式幽默、冷笑话和小俏皮话，（巨龙流口水那个简直哈哈哈哈哈哈哈，心疼两个妹子）E文苦手的孩纸们快学英语吧（扶额）——值得说的就是之前提到的，莫名其妙多了一点日呆风（误）人物立绘暂且不说，我们的女主和一些人物间的对话也让人感觉有的时候会玩画风突变···和Riskyboots全程闪光有木有！Shantae有的时候会突然耍笨卖萌有木有！和几个女性角色之间各种芬芳的气息有木有！（似乎以前看到的同人图大多是把bolo，那个头带背心小男孩当做女主的CP不过，从这两作看根本没这回事嘛···谁知道初代究竟发生了些什么···）而且那个航海画面是什么鬼！Risky你这么看着我我会把持不住的好不好（，作为一个快要学会法术的大法师，我收到了极为强烈的震撼（够）

——好吧，我才玩到沙漠那个岛屿所以暂时还不知道之后会有什么福利（馆长脸），仍然是给犹豫不决的童鞋们安利，不要再等了，快趁着打折入手，绝对不会让你失望的——另外似乎wayfoward要把这个系列继续做下去？同样是今年早些时候一个相关的苹果游戏watchquest早已上市有肾果手表的童鞋们不知是否有玩过，另外紧接着续作的消息已经放出，我已经按耐不住了，先给我来三张（希望这个系列能够做的越来越好

author: {'steamid': '76561198134939359', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 415, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 415, 'last_played': 1444257500}
review:
Sinceramente, uno de los mejores plataformas que he jugado. Súper divertido de principio a fin.

Bastante mejor que el anterior, no solo por la variedad de los escenarios, o más bien las mazmorras, que en el anterior todas se parecían, sino por los objetos que vas recogiendo a medida que avanzas en la historia. Como unas botas para hacer un ataque de carga y así superar ciertas zonas inestables o una pistola que te permite accionar dispositivos desde lejos.

No hay transformaciones como en su predecesor, ya que en esta parte Shantae no posee magia. Sin embargo, en mi opinión, no es algo que importe, pues los objetos que te van dando son muy divertidos y cómodos de usar.

El control es una delicia, responde perfectamente y eso se agradece muchísimo, la sensación que tienes al mover a Shantae es brutal, y aunque parezca una tontería, no lo es.

La banda sonora también es muy buena, acompaña perfectamente al ambiente y no cansa, y hay algunos temas que telita.

La única pega que le veo es que es muy corto, unas 6 horas me ha llevado completarlo al 100%, aunque aún me quedan 2 logros, pero son de speedruns, y odio los speedruns xD. Pero al que le guste pues más horas le dará. Al completar el juego desbloqueas el modo pirata que hace que empieces el juego con todos los objetos, para así facilitar el speedrun.

En definitiva, uno de los mejores plataformas que se han hecho, en mi opinión. Si eres fan del género, es compra obligada.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988656223', 'num_games_owned': 352, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 1623, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1623, 'last_played': 1446307756}

最后给女主角如此用心的[spoiler]娇喘[/spoiler]配音点个赞！

author: {'steamid': '76561197978683845', 'num_games_owned': 401, 'num_reviews': 111, 'playtime_forever': 928, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 761, 'last_played': 1660247481}
review:
Best Shantae game of the series at time of this posting, it feels a bit simplified in the exploration department, but what it trades for is worth it. Far more sensable level design and better flow with the new 'powers' while making the story feel more complete though just as silly. The game is funny, with a lot of funny dialogue and things to do. 
All the pirate weapons blend together to make a more natural action-platformer with some light backtracking. Some really funny moments, great artwork (best so far) and some fantastic music. 

Some levels have some crazy tricks to sort out but nothing too hard if you've played any platformer game I'd wager. 

The other Shantae games suffered a bit from difficulty spikes or overcomplication of the powers & Navigation which this game overcomes and creates a really fun game to go through. 
There's some reused assets from previous games but it comes buffed up and better than before. 

Got 100% in the game, really enjoyed my time through it and I see myself doing it all again.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996886109', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 1130, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1130, 'last_played': 1441805680}
review:
I find it difficult to rate this game.  Eventually I decided on a positive rating since I am glad I played it.  Besides, I know how this works.  If you disagree with the majority, your review will be downvoted into oblivion and never be seen, even if you have good reasons for your negative rating.

While I have nothing but praise for [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/277890/]Shantae: Risky's Revenge[/url], Shantae and the Pirate's Curse is a mostly good game, marred by occasional bad level design and severe balance problems.

Shantae and the Pirate's Curse has fun abilities, great artwork and music, good humor, and sex appeal, just like the previous games in the series.  It is longer than Shantae: Risky's Revenge.

The only technical complaint I have is that it would have been nice to have the window scalable in windowed mode.  The developers have my thanks for adding key remapping.

As for general complaints about the level design and difficulty, there are many cheap hits.  Zombies often spring from the earth directly under you.  Ghosts often materialize on top of you.  These are an almost constant problem on Spiderweb Island.  The problem with Ghosts also happens on various other levels that include them.  When Scuttle Town becomes corrupted by dark magic, the Pumpkin Fields becomes black, except for the sky, making it almost impossible to see enemies or their projectiles, since they blend in perfectly with background elements like foliage.

There are several unique, and bad (uniquely bad), level designs.

On Spiderweb Island there is an area where you have to carry another character.  This prevents you from attacking or ducking, and causes you to die in one hit.  Some timing in this area is unreasonably tight.  The worst offender is the room where you are in tunnels with too little headroom to jump until you reach an area near the end with a platform overhead, and a kissing robot at the other end that is running toward you.  There is only a few pixels of space between you and the robot when you successfully make the jump, which will likely take many, many attempts.  This area is agonizingly long, like most of the problem levels.  When I play a Shantae game, I want to play a Metroidvania, [i]not a racing game[/i].

On Tan Line Island there is an area where you have to stealthily escape a palace.  This prevents you from attacking or using any special abilities, and causes you to restart the entire area if you are spotted once.  You are expected to make use of new mechanics, like blending into the shadows, without any explanation, and given the severity of the punishment for any mistake, experimentation is extremely unpleasant.  This area is agonizingly long, again, like most of the problem levels.  While I [i]like[/i] stealth games (a lot, I am very fond of [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/211600/]Thief[/url], [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/205100/]Dishonored[/url], and [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/214560/]Mark of the Ninja[/url]), this is like playing a [i]bad[/i] stealth game.  The player has almost no means avoiding enemies other than moving out of their sight.  No distractions, no clever movement options, no disguises…  Making a mistake sets you back far too much.  When I play a Shantae game, I want to play a Metroidvania, [i]not a stealth game[/i].

By far the worst area in the game is the Pirate Master's Palace.  The area is lifeless except for a few Bats and Save Guy.  It is mostly full of instant-kill spikes.  Like the other bad areas, it looks like it was lifted from other games.  In this case, [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/70300/]VVVVVV[/url] and [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flappy_Bird]Flappy Bird[/url].  Like other bad areas, it is agonizingly long.  I died around 30 times in the first room before finding a way to bypass the first 3 rooms on Youtube.  After that, I was able to complete this area, but the process left me so infuriated and exhausted that I am unlikely to ever play through the game again.  This area officially “ruined the game for me”.  When I play a Shantae game, I want to play a Metroidvania, [i]not Super Meat Boy or Flappy Bird[/i].

The final boss is almost as badly balanced as the level he lives in.  Until I encountered him, I had avoided sacrificing any Heart Squid children to make Heart Holders.  I wanted to finish the game that way.  Unfortunately, each hit he lands is enough to instantly kill Shantae without any Heart Holder upgrades, and attacks like his bouncing cannon balls and flying pistols seem to be impossible to avoid even with a Bubble Shield.  9 Auto-Potions was not enough to see me through the battle.  Despite being squeamish about it, and it costing me the achievement, I melted all the Heart Squid children I found into Heart Holders so I could finish the game and write this review.

WayForward, if you are reading this, and I hope you are, please keep releasing more of this series, but make future releases fun, not frustrating.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034498865', 'num_games_owned': 621, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 1092, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1092, 'last_played': 1443902397}
review:
Shantae and the pirates curse continues from the events of risky's revenge.Shantae now no longer a half genie has strange dreams about a grave of a terrible evil but is soon woken by explosions as Scuttle town is under attack she meets up with Sky and Bolo and begins to defend the town from the Ammo Baron forces a brief exchange of words between them she battles him and destorys his tank.The palace gaurds arrive and give Shantae a summons to the palace.She returns home and is confronted by her nemisis Risky boots blames her for her missing weapons and tinkerbats Shantae shocked by this is sent her her uncle lab to find a tinkerbat in a glass case moments later a strange purple mist apears and transforms the tinkerbat into a crackle bat which need to be defeated and the dark magic absorbed this is a important feature as it will impact the ending of the game as all 20 dark magic crackle bats need to be defeated to get the true ending to the game.Heartsquids can also be collect these can be taken to a blacksmith and forged 4 squids into a extra health bar.Since she lost her magic shantae needs important items to destory blocks,jump higher,glide and to operate switches.All these items are risky's for exampleRisky;s,pistol,cannon,hat,sword.You will travel with risky to various islands from a dessert island a hell island,ice island to clear dens of evil which the Pirate master gains his power from. Each den is gaurded by a end level boss ranging from a giant plant,spider,dragon,Squid baron makes a return once done you will have you're final showdown with the Pirate master which you will fight in 3 stages but getting to him is tough as the last level is insane.

Gameplay is a typical side scrolling 2d platformer with beautiful backrounds.

Soundtracks.The ingame music is amazing every level has great music from scuttle town and the surrounding island its a treat for gamers.

Pros.Great story
      .Charecter development
      .Great powerup items
      .Great music
      .Graphics
      .Smooth gameplay

Cons. I really cant think of anything i didnt enjoy about this game serious its amazing.

Conclusion.This is a amzing game and i would say is a must have form anyone who loves platformers.I recomend playing and finishing Risky's revenge first before playing this since this game is a direct sequel to that game so the story will be abit confussing if you didnt play and finish that game so play that first.Rating9/10

For fans of Shantae games and fun platformers.

Trading cards are avalible.

http://steamcommunity.com/id/DemonicRaven77/recommended/277890/Here is my Risky's revenge reveiw.

review: Extremely fun game if you enjoy a well-done Metroidvania game. Great story, fun gameplay with some puzzles to get to the boss room of a dungeon, with a nice side of comedy. One of my first steam games to 100% all the achievements, and was totally worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015327809', 'num_games_owned': 1111, 'num_reviews': 352, 'playtime_forever': 564, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 564, 'last_played': 1441477546}
review: Shantae 3 is an overall improvement over 2 though it has flaws like having no warp zones so you have to pretty go all the way back through levels unless you pay for an item that gets you back. Also I really don't get why indie Metroidvanias insist on being twitch platformers because the final dungeon is such a pain in the ass. Indie devs need to stop that shit, it’s one of the reasons why I don't think any of them rival the genre namesakes still. Regardless Shantae 3 is definitely worth playing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039482295', 'num_games_owned': 256, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1342, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 624, 'last_played': 1560577960}
review: An absolute joy to play. Tight controls. Excellent platforming. Challenging but never frustrating. Memorable and likable characters. Simple yet enjoyable story with quite a few laughs. Wonderfully detailed sprite animation. Outstanding soundtrack. Everything about this game just feels so good and spot on. One of the best Metroidvania's I've played and damn near close to perfect. You can tell WayFoward loved making this game, and they just made a new fan. I forsee myself replaying this gem many times over.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037003719', 'num_games_owned': 4057, 'num_reviews': 385, 'playtime_forever': 424, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 256, 'last_played': 1442381862}
review:
《Shantae and the Pirate's Curse》是一款2D平台動作冒險遊戲，強調逐步探索進而解鎖能力的Metroidvania風格玩法（名稱取自銀河戰士和惡魔城的特色玩法）和個性鮮明逗趣可愛的人物設定，馬上就成為當年任天堂3DS平台眾所矚目的話題強作之一，筆者發現近期以復古風格為主題的動作冒險遊戲再次被市場所重視，這也證明了在次世代畫質大比拚的遊戲業界中，還是有部分玩家跟筆者一樣，寧願去選擇2D復古風的作品遊玩。遊戲中總共支援六大島嶼供玩家進行探索，遊戲時數初見一周目大概會花上七到十小時，我們會在遊戲中扮演將紫色秀髮當作武器使用的半精靈女英雄桑塔，與大反派女海盜蕾斯基破天荒攜手合作，保衛自己的家鄉並且阻止海盜王的邪惡詛咒禍害人間。


為什麼我會一口咬定《Shantae and the Pirate's Curse》是款表現出色的遊戲呢？答案是有始有終的故事劇情、印象深刻的人物設定、拿捏得宜的遊戲難度。先讓我們從故事劇情說起，遊戲中的故事劇情相當簡單易懂，英雄拯救世界一直都是廣為玩家接受的老梗劇情，故事主角桑塔的任務就是拯救世界，沒有其他撲朔迷離讓人看得霧煞煞的深奧劇情，也不會最後留下讓人腦洞大開的開放式結局讓玩家腦補。再來談談人物設定方面，就算是從沒接觸過系列作的玩家應該也會被人物立繪所吸引吧？一身小麥膚色的桑塔除了是名半精靈英雄之外，更是一名舞技熟練的舞孃，女海盜蕾斯基也是焦點人物之一，玲瓏有緻的身材加上大姊頭個性馬上獲得廣大M男關注，只能說兩位女主角的形象確實成為不少玩家購買本作的主因。


接下來談到遊戲難度，《Shantae and the Pirate's Curse》是一款難度中等的遊戲，只要玩家操縱桑塔進行遊戲，隨著故事的進展就能明顯感受到桑塔不斷提升自己的戰鬥能力，同時玩家更能取得女海盜蕾斯基的武器裝備，利用它們破解謎團並突破難關。每一座島嶼都會有強大的關卡頭目鎮守，如同多數的平台動作冒險遊戲，關卡頭目往往會有固定的行為模式，只要抓準時機閃躲就能無傷擊敗頭目，玩家也能花費打怪得到的寶石貨幣購買升級道具，讓桑塔的傷害與速度提高，總而言之本作難度不高，非常適合全年齡對象遊玩。

author: {'steamid': '76561198029172386', 'num_games_owned': 544, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 1351, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1351, 'last_played': 1433085598}

author: {'steamid': '76561198111662179', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2105, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1014, 'last_played': 1618961530}
review:
The story:
A Long Time Ago, before the first Shantae, someone called Pirate Master died and left a curse for Risky Boots, after Risky's defeat in Risky's Revenge, Shantae's Light Genie Magic became Dark Magic, and the Tinkerbats became Cacklebats. On a side story, Ammo Baron has bought Scuttle Town from the Mayor, who bought chocolate... Again. Now, Shantae has to team up with Risky Boots to defeat the Pirate Master, collect the Dark Magic from the Cacklebats and rescue Scuttle Town from Ammo Baron.

Pros:
- Shantae's adventure is now bigger, better and harder
- Awesome OST
- The characters are well developed
- Lots of collectibles
- Two different endings: The Good One, and the Bad One. I prefer to call them as Best Ending and Worst Ending respectively as there is almost nothing bad in the 2nd ending
- There's one Nostalgia stage with music from Shantae from the Game Boy Color
- Each boss has a different subtitle
- 4 different In-Game Wallpapers

Cons:
- That Last Dungeon is harder than anything else
- Dagron is harder than the Last Boss

[h1] FINAL SCORE: 10/10 [/h1]
Long Story Short:
Shantae's adventure is bigger, better and much more interesting but you still need to play the other games to understand most of it. So buy this game and buy Risky's Revenge

My "Shantae: Risky's Revenge - Director's Cut" Review: 
http://steamcommunity.com/id/JLuizMorenoB/recommended/277890

Remember to buy "Shantae: Risky's Revenge - Director's Cut" if you haven't yet:
http://store.steampowered.com/app/277890/?l=portuguese

Also, both "Shantae and the Pirate's Curse" and "Shantae: Risky's Revenge - Director's Cut" have Achievements, Steam Trading Cards and Wallpapers

author: {'steamid': '76561198088164676', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1686, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1463, 'last_played': 1624651140}
review:
Superb game. Great gameplay, consisting of platforming, combat, and speedrunning, all coming together to create an incredibly fun experience. The story is compelling, being not too heavy, nor too light, while throwing in comedic moments and themes along with the more serious aspects. Voice work is minimal, but this works to the game's advantage, and what little there is is quite good. Sound quality itself is top-notch, and nothing more needs to be said about the soundtrack than to go download it on Bandcamp right now (it's free!). Art and animation are high quality, and I think a dramatic improvement over previous installments of the series. Replayability is high, and first-time players will find themselves with plenty to do even after completing the game, such as acheivements, wallpapers, and speedruns. Incidentally, this is the first Steam game in which I completed all acheivements.

Overall, 9.5/10 game, highly recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054537443', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 854, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 350, 'last_played': 1669346406}
review:
Got this game for 20 bucks and i gotta say this is the first Shantae series I've ever played and i loved it.
Anyways on with the review.
It's about a half genie named Shantae who lost her powers she wakes up one morning to find that the village is under attack by Ammo Baron's minions.
The villiagers ask Shantae to help the town so you go to Ammo Baron and fight him. As soon as you beat him you get a court summons to the royal palace and you go home to take a bath only to find that a pirate name Risky Boots who at first thought was an enemy but turns out to be an ally to help you get rid of the curse that the pirate master placed on her and her crew.
So you go to island to island to help defeat each boss to get rid of the curse and to one day fight the pirate master.

author: {'steamid': '76561198086686429', 'num_games_owned': 274, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1475, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1244, 'last_played': 1472064715}

author: {'steamid': '76561197974653316', 'num_games_owned': 532, 'num_reviews': 108, 'playtime_forever': 1296, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1296, 'last_played': 1439587781}
review:
Good
+Jake Kaufman's music
+Good platforming
+Faster gameplay since abilities can be used at will (no time lost transforming)
+Level design
+Fan service
+Writing
+Map layouts are easier to digest than the multilayer maze of Risky's Revenge
+Backtracking takes less time
+Pirate mode
+Boss battles
+Easter Eggs
+Inti Creates' character portraits

Bad
-Multiple instant death sections (that go on for too long)
-Run Run Rottytops!
-All of Mud Bog Island
-Key hunting and backtracking
-Certain character portrait's are poorly drawn (Sky's parents for example)
-Backdashing and power kick are useless

Overall it's a pretty great game. You'll get the best value if you're a completionist.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002585943', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1214, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1205, 'last_played': 1439065982}
review:
As i saw both games on steam, i knew that my choice of buying them
was the best choice i ever made. Long story short with the history of me and
Shantae, the gameboy game was a great part of my childhood, and i wouldnt be here reviewing the games
without it.

In anycase, seeing both the new games on steam, i bought them on an instant,
as i knew that the games where made by the same guys, so i knew it be a
great experience, just like with the gameboy color game.

I will seperate each review for both pages, so beyond this sentance, the review will be different.

Here is my review of Pirate's Curse. Similar to Risky's Revenge, it has the same sprites and graphical style,
but the view is zoomed out, giving you a wider range of the area you play in.
The is seperated into islands, and each offers a unique feel, music and challanges, thus giving a more
variation.

Unlike the previous 2 games, Risky's Revenge and the Shantae on the Gameboy Color, this game doesnt offer
any transformations, but isntead, gives you artifacts that gives you new abilities, while the belly dance was
replaced with an oil lamp that allows you to absorb dark magic or other gas like materials, wich will come
essential.

The musics are amazing, and some of the songs are pretty darn cute, and it certainly requires alot for a music
track to sound cute.

The sound effects are more 16-bit like, giving a more retro feel.

The game itself is somewhat more cryptic at times for first time players, so for those that does not like exploring
or problem solving, they will be getting a little lost at times.

The Expression of the characters are cute, and really shows the
personality of each character during dialogs, and Shantae is amazingly cute in this version.

Again, Kodus to the developers of giving my childhood game new life, and a great experience
that i will forever remember.


So for my thoughts about recommending the game to people? Well it all depends on the person.
If you like retro like games, or simply was a fan of the old Shantae game, this is for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038307084', 'num_games_owned': 271, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 999, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 999, 'last_played': 1457132163}
review: One of my favorite games from one of my favorite series. I love the Shantae series and this is possibly it's best one. A great platforming game and entertaining with the characters within. Shantae was Ret-2-Go in the first 2 games but this one will definitely suck you in. I'd suggest trying Risky's Revenge, but if you dont feel it suits you, jump into this one. Simplest way to play is via a gamepad. I hope you all will love the Half-Genie Hero as much as I do.

author: {'steamid': '76561198123412640', 'num_games_owned': 511, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 1285, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 783, 'last_played': 1700770110}
review:
Shantae and the Pirate's Curse is a 2D metroidvania platformer adventure. You play as Shantae, the half genie guardian of Scuttle Town. Recently you have lost your magical powers, but you don't let that stop you from saving the town once trouble comes through. Most of the trouble is caused by evil magic being sent out by the imprisoned spirit of the Master Pirate. It's your job to team up with your former rival Risky Boots in order to stop his minions, collect the magic, and prevent his spirit's escape. 

The gameplay is fairly simple. You can run around, jump, duck, crawl, and whip your hair to attack. Along the way you will receive new items and upgrades to give yourself more abilities and more power. You use these abilities to access new areas in order to find secrets and progress. There are a few light puzzles and fetch quests sprinkled in, but the main play will consist of traversing overworlds and conquering dungeons. You can also increase your health and carry items to heal you on the go or to give you some other battle assistance. You'll need to skilled in combat, platforming, and adventuring to complete this game.

The music is overall pretty great, being polished and interesting to listen to. The art is a mixture of two styles. The playable game consists of colorful pixel art that is well animates, while the dialogue bits have hand drawn cartoonish representations of the characters. The sound effects are also an interesting mix of higher quality voice and sound sample along with retro style video gamey effects. The controls are tight and understandable. Plus, the dialogue is cute and can actually be funny at time. It's an interesting mixture.

For those who played Shantae: Risky's Revenge before this as I did, you'll be glad to know that nearly everything has been improved upon in this game. You get lots of new abilities rather than just recollecting the same ones from the previous game. The story is even more interesting with the same quality of dialogue. The hand drawn art is different, but it seems to have a bit more detail. This game has more length, with more places to explore, things to do, things to find, people to talk to, and just generally more everything, which means even more quality playtime. The difficulty is also higher for those looking for a greater challenge, which is welcome since this is a sequel, but not too hard for newcomers that would like to try it as well. The map system has been improved to read more like a standard metroidvania style map and show you where you have and have not been. If you liked exploring, platforming challenges, puzzle challenges, combat challenges, and just the overall gameplay of the previous game, you'll love this one even more.

There are a few issues with the game though. One that may have just been for me was that sometimes there was a flickering glitchy effect on some backgrounds. This usually only happened in the company logo right away and on the world selection screen, but it also did happen consistently in one temple where I kind of needed to know where the walls and floors were. It was only for that one room in the one temple, but it kept happening after a few reloads so it may be a real problem for others as well. Also, I didn't think the cartoonish characters hand drawn in dialogue scenes meshed well with the pixel style of the game. Mayb it's just me, but I would rather just keeping it all one way. That's minor. The difficulty could be a problem. It's harder than the previous game, which is good for people who played that first and it's not TOO hard for those who want to jump right in, but to some casual gamers it could be a bit too tough to get through. While I like that the map system has been reworked and the sailing aspect works will with giving Risky more purpose, it's a shame that instead of one big interconnected world it's now multiple smaller worlds you have to select separately.

Overall, Shantae and the Pirate's Curse is awesome. If you like metroidvania games, it's a great one. If you played the previous game (which I also reviewed on here) and liked it, this is definitely worth looking into. It's a fun, metroidvania adventure platformer with a pretty style. I like how fun, challenging, and yet forgiving the game is to make it a lot of fun to keep playing. Another one of the best games I've played on Steam. Is it worth the 20 dollar asking price? Well, personally I would say that, if you're really interested and liked the other Shantae games, then of course. Otherwise maybe wait for a sale. I got it for 15 and it was worth not being able to wait anymore. If nothing else, getting it at 10 bucks or less at some point is going to be a real steal, especially for all the content here. Shantae and the Pirate's Curse gets a 9 out of 10 for being a great blend of genres, gameplay, personality, and style. Also... I know I'm a pervert but... I mean, come on, Shantae is a babe ;)
https://youtu.be/c-UEX8pQABc

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198131544900', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 2098, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1914, 'last_played': 1511502121}
review: Taking place after the events of Shantae's 2nd adventure, Shantae: Risky's Revenge, our little hero is now human! However she's been getting strange visions about a possible threat that might attack Sequin Land, she wakes up when Ammo Barron starts taking over Scuttle Town, disgregaurding the fact that we don't need him anymore! Shantae gets in trouble with the law for standing up against the Baron, and Risky sets a trap for her and tells her about a new threat in Sequin Land! Now Shantae has to team up with her arch nemisis, and hoping to get her powers back while finding out more about her parents and her past, as well as Risky's past as well! This game is chock full of hiliarious moments and dialouge, an amazing soundtrack, great gameplay and epic boss fights! This adventure of this unlikely duo is one of the Half Genie's err... ex Half Genie's best! With more challenging puzzles! Colorful characters new and old! And pop culture refrences abundle! It's an enjoyable game for all types of gamers! For being her 3rd entry of the Shantae series! It's definatley one of her best! Also... #Shantaeforsmash!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561197998193633', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 623, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 623, 'last_played': 1436133510}
review: Fun platformer with interesting bosses. Can be expected to be completed in around 10 hours. Compared to the previous game (risky's revenge) the main gimmick of this game is the use of Risky's pirate items rather than doing genie transformations. Most of these can also be used as offensive moves in addition to clearing obstacles. I got this on sale for 15 dollars, and I would say for the price it felt like a really genuine true to itself platforming experience. Funny dialogue, and of course great art style and level design. Lookinf forward to the next chapter!

author: {'steamid': '76561198001875982', 'num_games_owned': 2820, 'num_reviews': 91, 'playtime_forever': 851, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 851, 'last_played': 1436082802}
review:
Wow.

If you're played Risky's Revenge or read my review of the previous Shantae game, it's a pretty rough entry into the platforming genre. Pirate's Curse is, in turn, a vast improvement.

Though it retains the same sprites that were used on the DSi, the resolution is much sharper, with crisp, attractive backgrounds and new animations thrown in. This also makes the HD graphics used for conversations and menus a lot less jarring, but they still look a bit odd at first. Though enemy sprites are reused from Risky's Revenge, it also adds a lot more of theIt also has a lot more enemies, and new huge, screen-filling bosses help make hitting the end of a level a lot more exciting than before.

Shantae feels faster, jumps farther, giving a better feel to the controls, and her speed and leaping ability grow dramatically as you go through the game. Unlike the "lock and key" transformations of Risky's Revenge, which often don't see much use outside of opening up a new zone, you'll find yourself using most of the equipment which replaces the transformations in regular gameplay. The extra movement options also make traversing zones a lot easier. This time, the zones are connected through a central hub, and you readily can get items that return you to the hub. The exploration is much improved, though it still struggles a bit (being able to warp directly to dungeons, for example, would have saved a lot of tiresome trekking). The levels are now quite varied, often with different gimmicks other than just graphical stylings.

It's also a [i]lot[/i] funnier, and... might I say fairly fetishy by comparison, expecially during the early parts of the game. If that kind of thing bugs you, it will bug you. While it's not [i]quite[/i] Totally Spies, some pretty odd fetishes feel like they're checked. I just find it amusing, but others might find the humiliating nature of some of the situations more problematic. Still, the dialogue is far more clever than earlier iterations, and generally got me to at least crack a smile at some of the back-and-forths.

Even those "stop 'n go" enemies I hated from the previous game are improved. For example, Riskys' Revenge had mermaid enemies that would try to bore you to death through periods of invulnerability, but now their windows of invulnerability are now far briefer. In addition, often Shantae can dispatch enemies much faster... or, later in the game, just heedlessly charge through them or float over them. Magic has been replaced with limited-use items, though in some areas they drop often enough you may as well use them all the time. Overall, it's a clunky system compared to refreshing magic, but it's not a real black mark.

Ultimately, Pirate's Curse is a lot of fun. Where Risky's Revenge relied mostly on charm and nostalgia for appeal, Pirate's Curse has a lot more substance. It often has different sequences where it offers variations on the core gameplay to keep things from being too monotonous, and the new equipment keeps shifting how you play the game. Thumbs down on a final level that suddenly kicks up the difficulty drastically and frustratingly, but at least is capped by a very satisfying end boss.  Though it's not a breakthrough or a massive innovation in the genre, it's a very solid platformer that feels and plays great, and gives me a lot of hope for the upcoming HD sequel.

author: {'steamid': '76561198098071576', 'num_games_owned': 1470, 'num_reviews': 240, 'playtime_forever': 1764, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1763, 'last_played': 1654196487}

author: {'steamid': '76561198222305688', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1503, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1500, 'last_played': 1499166223}
review:
Shantae and the Pirate's Curse has been the most enjoyable game I've played in a long time, sucking me in for hours of game play and exploring the colourful world that it has. 

The series of Shantae was new to me, and I bought it out of sheer curiousity and haven't looked back. The characters are loveable, the dialogue is comedic and the story is simple and easy to follow. The gameplay is addicting and easy to dive into, whether you play on a keyboard or with a controller.

I'd recommend it to anyone, it's just an easy, enjoyable game. There's no competitive aspect, no intimidation. It's fun to play for hours on end.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994904389', 'num_games_owned': 483, 'num_reviews': 142, 'playtime_forever': 1338, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1338, 'last_played': 1436650672}
review:
This is what I call an improvement!

If you check my profile, you can see that I played and reviewed an earlier installment of the series: Risky's Revenge. While it was lacking in some aspects it was cool enough that after the convincing gameplays I decided to jump back to the series. This is definitely more fun and polished game and I can easily say it is worth your interest with only few hiccups along the way. If the game is solid, then I'm more than happy to nitpick some issues for further ironing out for the next Wayfoward's game. Criticism makes excellence!

Game is notably faster than the Risky's Revenge. The previous game was pretty sluggish at times, but the improved controls, Shantae's speed and jumps in pair with good level design, help dictate a reasonable pace that makes you flow through the game with no noticeable frustrating moments. Graphics are in my favorite 16/32-bit Mega Man X4-rish style, that didn't really change after Revenge (with recycled sprites), but it still looks pretty nice, especially with the new locations. Bosses are definite plus. While not very challenging, they provide fun encounters. There are a lot of new faces as regular enemies which are good to see. Platforming? No complains there.

Music deserves an separate paragraph. Jake Kaufman did probably his best score yet. In my opinion it's far better than Shovel Knight's and provides tons of catchy memorable tunes that really "sells" the game. I would say that without this soundtrack, many locations wouldn't be as fun and atmospheric as they are now, since many of them are pretty generic. Mud Bog Island with Village of Lost Souls hidden within it is an great example of climatic location boosted by an amazing music. This stuff rocks.

The story. Characters are likeable and unique, scenes are full of humor and plot overall isn't particularly offensive, but...

Logic? Out of commission. Setups? Wasted potential. Lore? Barely touched.

It looks like the devs had a plenty ideas for funny situations and hijinks between characters. There are lots of mini character arcs that bring this thing together, but logic behind why scene A resulted in events in scene B is completely bizarre. It fits the convention and style, but for me it is something of a missed opportunity. Keep in mind that this is a nitpick and Shantae doesn't need a great story to be an awesome game, but I would say that this is an aspect for further improvement.

Upgrades. They are all powerful and really fun to use... unless we are talking about the Sword upgrade that is only useful for unlocking vertical shafts and nothing more. It gives no advanced mobility and is pretty weak against enemies. No sense in using instead of standard hair whip. Pistol and additional melee attacks also become obsolete really fast, but other upgrades are extremely fun to use and tinker with.

As for a completely minor sidenote, which doesn't hurt the game that much, but I would like to point it out... There is also a strange dissonance in level progression vs. classic Metroidvania mechanics. Shantae controls would really shine in level-to-level progression system (intro level shows this), but this series was very exploration heavy from the start. Game tries to bring the best of both worlds, but levels are not-seamlessly connected and they are overall pretty small, so there isn't as much exploration as in standard Metroidvania and there are not enough set-pieces as for classic platformer. You can really feel it, as the game has less adventurish feel and yet doesn't deliver as much level-specific excitement as Freedom Planet or Shovel Knight. Luckily, this is subjective and not very noticeable. It doesn't affect the enjoyment as much, probably thanks to the overall solid experience crafted by the devs.

The only proper negative that I can think of is the price. Content-wise, it offers a similar about of fun and features as afromentioned Shovel Knight and Freedom Planet, yet it's price tag is 5 dollars higher. 15 bucks is a perfect price for fun and enjoyment you will get from Pirate's Curse. It's solid platform game that is definitely worth your interest since it holds up a great quality on par with other genre representatives. If you are a platforming fan, then you are making yourself a disservice if you won’t put it on your wishlist!

author: {'steamid': '76561198147515065', 'num_games_owned': 101, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1831, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 714, 'last_played': 1691536956}
review:
Well, I have a lot of good things to say about this one. For starters, I didn't play any other Shantae games other than this. But judging by the trailers for the other games, I can easily assume this is the best. This game came out last year on 3DS and Wii U, and just a few months ago was ported to the PC. Here's my review.

The game plays like your average platformer. You control Shantae, who uses her hair to whip enemies, although later she gets upgrades like a gun, etc. The controls feel very smooth and responsive. You travel through six locations where you have to accomplish certain things and then go to the dungeon of the world. This heavily reminds me of Zelda, especially considering there are chests, keys, items, puzzles, etc. There are also a lot of secret items throughout the game. You can get jellies, which you can turn into health, and there are also bats I think that give you dark magic (you'll find out the use as you play). Also, you can use money earned from defeating enemies to buy one-time items (spike balls, shields, potions, etc.) or permanent upgrades (faster whip, more powerful, etc.). One thing I don't like is that some items are hidden in places that you either don't see (so either you have to get to them by complete accident or by trial and error), or that look like you can get them but you really can't. For example, there is a section in the sand that has tiny platforms that break upon touching them. I got very frustrated trying to get it, only to give up and learning that you can get it, but only after getting an upgrade. If it was more obvious that I couldn't get it, then I wouldn't have to be frustrated.

Presentation-wise, this game has great graphics. They are in a 16-bit SNES style, although on top of that, there are full artworks of the characters in-dialogs. For some reason, WayForward decided to use a default font for the dialogs, which looks quite ugly and annoying if you ask me. The soundtrack? Don't even ask. It's f*cking amazing. The composer also made the soundtrack for Shovel Knight, Duck Tales Remastered, Contra 4, etc. There isn't full voice acting, only occasional words by certain characters are pronounced, ususally sound good, but can get annoying at times.

Well, this game isn't super long either. You can beat it in three hours easily. Do I recommend it? Definitely. It is a little expensive compared to other indies (20$), but I still think it's worth it. Buy it, you'll like it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198098396870', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 770, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 415, 'last_played': 1451360676}
review:
Shantae and The Pirates Curse is definately one of the best if not the best 2D platformer i've played in a while... This game feels open, sure there is some backtracking here and there but even the backtracking is fun in my opinion because while u backtrack u grind for $ which u could use for awesome upgrades in the shop

speaking of upgrades the upgrades are fun to use and are very useful. you get some of the upgrades from the story itself like a hat that lets u float or a pistol, or even a sword, while other upgrades are availible in the shop like cream for shantaes hair letting her use her hair-whip faster or shampoo which will allow it to do more damage. there are lots of other upgrades as well

the bosses are also incredibly fun and funny. i love that they brought back the squid barron from riskys revenge, the best part about it was that he kind of breaks the 4th wall by complaining that he was put in the game as a "filler boss to round out the package". im not going to spoil anything but lets just say the whole thing was funny

overall shantae and the pirates curse is a FANTASTIC game which i highly recommend to absolutely every1. as a platformer it is fun, controls better than any other platformer i've ever played, and has many cool unique spins on the genre. in addition to that the funny bosses, the memerable charactors, and the good story make this A MUST BUY in my opinion. while the game is somewhat short at 7-10 hours in the 1st run it does have a lot of replay value

my only complaints are that the default controls are a little weird (you can remap the buttons but i usually dont like remapping the buttons), you cant remap anything to the mouse (which stinks cus i have a 6 button gaming mouse and it would have made the controls 10x easier for me), and lastly there are some moments where shantae talks but only says 1 or 2 words out of the whole text so it would have been nice if they could have got the person who does the voice of shantae to record more of the text, i mean seriously either do all of it or none of it dont just record 1 word and ur done

Lastly even though i highly recommend this game i cant recommend it for $20. The game is fantastic but $20 is a little much for a 10 hour platformer. i got the game during the steam summer sale for $15 but i recommend waiting until the price drops under $10 before getting it. 

i give this game my Rkraiem100 score of...

9.8/10!!!

PROS:
- Fantastic level design
- Memorable charactors
- Interesting story
- Fun gameplay
- Unique items
- Great bosses
- Funny references and jokes
- Perfect difficulty curve for beginners and advanced players
- Not too much backtracking
- Great replay value

CONS:
- Cant remap buttons to mouse
- Game is 7-10 hours long

author: {'steamid': '76561198014766672', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 398, 'playtime_forever': 332, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 332, 'last_played': 1435092087}
review:
[h1]This game was reviewed using a code sent by the developer.[/h1]

Shantae and the Pirate's Curse is a platformer game which was initially released on the Nintendo 3DS and WiiU. It's the third in the Shantea series. I haven't played any of the previous one so I was a little behind on the story here.  The game was released initially in 2014 and was ported to Steam in April of 2015. The 3DS release of this game was actually nominated for the best platformer and was also in the Top 10 games in the Nintendo 2014 survey of fans favorites 

You play as Shantae, who is a half-genie. You goal in the game is to save everyone from "The Pirate Master", with the help of her what appears to be long standing nemesis, named Risky Boots. 

Throughout the game you will find various different "pirate equipment" such as pistols and cannons, these items are all used at various points in order to progress through the story. You can also upgrade all of your equipment too to make them more effective. This game is said to be the biggest in the series in terms of how many locations are included for you to explore. We also see a familiar mini-map screen you will have seen in Metroidvania style games before. The actual gameplay is very Metroidvania too, lots of jumping puzzles, thought based puzzles, enemies, collecting jewels and gems to find and chests with equipment and keys in to find. 

The game uses a 2D graphics engine, which I can imagine looks pretty good on the 3DS, however it does look like a bit of an emulated game on the PC. The dialog scenes look nice, but the actual in game graphics are very pixelated, granted some people enjoy that style so that may right be up your street. 

I must warn you, this game is not easy at all. You will die, and die, and die plenty of times. It may even have you rage quitting at points that it is so frustrating, but you can't help but load it up again in order to move on. The difficulty curve is very up and down, sometimes you can be going through one level and think its actually quite easy, then all of a sudden you are failing countless times on a specific area in the zone. Being hard is not a bad thing at all; it's actually something I really look for in a game. I did have to revert to Youtube videos for hints on how to get past some levels though.

A full playthrough of Shantea and the Pirate's Curse took me almost six hours. Sadly I don't think there is much replay-ability to be had here; once you playthrough it the once - there is really no other reason to playthrough it again. 

This is actually a well put together port to the PC. The developers have gone to the effort of adding full controller support along with a graphically helpful control screen to go along with it. I would highly recommend you play this game with a controller aswell; playing on a keyboard would be a disaster. 

I would recommend Shantea and the Pirate's Curse; but not at full price. I think the six hours it took me to complete along with the zero amount of replay-ability means you should really be picking this up on sale. However I did enjoy playing it, it is in no way a bad game. I am looking forward to trying out the other games in this series now!

If you found this review helpful, please consider giving it a thumbs up. You can also find more reviews over at http://www.completingthebackloggroup.com/

http://store.steampowered.com/app/345820

author: {'steamid': '76561198036180220', 'num_games_owned': 572, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 707, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 707, 'last_played': 1435072219}
review:
TL;DR  I would rather replay this game for a speedrun wallpaper either than paying over 1000 rubles for bad ported "AAA" games

This is a great example of Metroidvania games from 2000s and probably 90s. It has everything what it needs.

+ As far as you go in game, you achieve  more various actions, which are useful in world investigation and also in battle.
+ Explore the world to find hidden items and enemies. 
+ Talk to NPCs for getting hints, some of are needed to carry on the story. 
+ Story is not so original, but it doesn't disturbs the gameplay at all [spoiler] mostly	[/spoiler]
+ Animation is very smooth and well made.
+ Soundtrack is suitable and is good enough to listen on IPod. [spoiler] Jake Caufman, you are amazing! 	[/spoiler]
+ Shantae's voice is great and delightful for ears 

"Wait, i supposed to play a game, where everyone is half naked (including the arci-nemesis)? play as a hero, which is a belly dancer (and also a half-genie), who attacks enemies with own hair? play in a friendly shiny world? shoot enemies and dash through whole army with a blade? Eat food to regain health and not even grow fat?"

[spoiler]+ "Yes, please"	[/spoiler]

? Sometimes you might be confused where you need to go, but... it is Metroidvania game, so you may be smart enough to complete the game without using any guides. Otherwises... well, you know [url=https://www.google.com] what to do[/url]
? Pixel-art Retro game. I think i said enough.
? Dropping-Items-System will suprise you. For Example, skeletons drop milk. Shantae drink it. She is angry now... HELLO, METROIDVANIA! 

- Usually game is easy, but sometimes (and unexpectedly) it is hard as hell. 
[spoiler] Mud Bog island is trully a nightmare, complete with sad music. Eeriness O_O	[/spoiler]

I recommend this game to every platform lover. In addition, this one is actualy better than its prequels in Shantae series.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078582120', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 597, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 498, 'last_played': 1442543969}
review: Easily the best in the Shantae series. Similar to other games of this genre, many items necessary to progress in this game are very carefully hidden, and give you the feeling you truly accomplished something; but it's not to the tier of Dark Souls, as the game gives you subtle hints along the way. The boss fights seem to have a greater satisfaction to them, despite having less character than they did in Risky's Revenge. The characters are appealing, the art looks fantastic, and the soundtrack is one of my favorites to date. While I suggest picking up Risky's Revenge first, it would probably be in your best interest to just nab both of them at once.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061953629', 'num_games_owned': 443, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 499, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 300, 'last_played': 1527193052}
review:
well this is a REALLY good game before this and Risky's revenge i have only played the origanal on the Emulator  its a very well polished 2D platform Adventure game with a decent story and characters and the art style in Shantae's 3rd adventure reminds me alot of Rayman in a way 

the controles respond Nicely with no lag but it would be nice if the configuring of the controls was possible i really don't like using my throtle shoulder buttons on my Game pad but thats just me nick picking 

the difficulty is nothing to massive so if your decent at platforming you should have no difficulty getting through this game 

and the Soundtrack is a real treat to hear as you go through each of  the levels 

so in the end this Feline-tiger Girl gives this game a 9.5 / 10  only time i had difficuilty was when i was trying to minimize the game it just would not respond so Steam support is a little wonky but if you can get over that Shantae and the Pirate's curse is a Must Have for anyone that likes a Decent platforming adventure

review:
（本游戏有轻微福利向，你懂得）
终于打通了一周目，浑身舒爽。
这款游戏让我想起了GBA的恶魔城和塞尔达，它结合了两者的成长和解谜元素，同时融入了自己的画风和特色。
操作感流畅，BGM和场景设计的都很棒，冰川地图的音乐赞爆了。
另外，剧情和对话的设计上都在透露着“石化异性恋！”的观念......

review:
Shantae and the Pirate's Curse is Shantae...But without her magic and incredible dancing. Well she still sorta dances but not as her past self have been doing. Anyhow this version of Shantae is weak in a sense. How weak? Well gee...Why not play Shantae:Risky Revenge to find out or maybe buy this game.

Platforming fun and pretty straight forward to where you want to go and what not. I would say give this game a go. The more deeper you get into it the more you love the mechanics of the game at its core.

It may not be Shantae with her Tranforming Magic abilities. This game in its own way is its own type of magical. Give it a buy and if the first 2 hours don't entice you well then....Maybe Shantae would be not the game for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071042705', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 603, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 480, 'last_played': 1434220385}
review:
After achieving 100% in Shantae, and spending 8 hours on the entirity of the game, I can say it was one of the best metroidvania's I've played.

There are plenty of powerups, and there are lots of secrets to discover.

Also, the only complaint I really have about Shantae is how inconsistent the difficulty is. For the most part, the game is easy, then once you get to a certain island, IT GOES INSANE, then you leave and it's easy, then at the end it suddenly goes insane again. 

I'd rate it 85/100. It's a solid game, and one that I am happy to have in my Library.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041484815', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 89, 'playtime_forever': 748, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 748, 'last_played': 1433195640}
review:
WOW 
What can I say about this game. Shantae and the Pirate's Curse is one of the best platformers I have ever played. This game belong to games like SuperMeatBoy. 
The game’s art style music and solid gameplay makes all great game that you cannot leave for one day. I was playing lots of Payday2 and Project Reality lately but I cannot help to know I haven’t beat this game yet so I go back and try again and again until I beat the level. 
Speaking of level the designs are amazing. They are always big with large amount of secrets to be discovered. It also has an element of Metroidvania which makes you go back to other levels to explore side quest and secrets. 
Also final thought am in love with Shantae she is just adorable belly dancing genie <3.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041146385', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2092, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1633, 'last_played': 1505601304}

author: {'steamid': '76561198023403505', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 612, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 612, 'last_played': 1430576854}
review:
I love Shantae Games. Another 100% completion from me. 

If your familiar With Shantae, Visually Not much has changed in this game. It will all be familiar to you, However if this is your first Shantae game, I would put a word of warning on the pixel graphics on a monitor as oppose to the usual 3ds or wii U screen. I found during my play through that while I still love this game, There was a noticeable amount of screen tearing going on. Not exactly jarring but definitely noticeable.

How does it run? Well considering that it pretty much is just a straight port to PC, It runs pretty well. No experiences with crashes or Bugs during my play through. And pretty smooth as well. 

A major up vote from me again as usual is the soundtrack. A lot of us were worried that they would recycle some of the old tracks like they have done with the visuals But I was amazed and taken back by the Games OST. Its a real treat and I would definitely recommend getting it if you can. Big praises to way forward again here.

I wont go into the story as its hard to tell it without spoiling it. Lets just say.... You are a Belly Dancing Half Genie that's the hero of scuttle town.... And Pirate stuff. Everyone loves pirate stuff. 

I would say if your a big fan of Shantae, Its a definite must have where as if you are curious about Shantae and the series in general, check it out and see what you have been missing. Half Genie hero is in the making and you may want to see why it was hugely successful in its kickstarter Campaign.

I <3 Shantae.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031975140', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1632, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1320, 'last_played': 1591759889}
review:
Ich habe die Shantae Reihe leider erst vor kurzem entdeckt und war wirklich überrascht, wieviel Liebe in diese Spiele gesteckt wurde. 

Der dritte Teil der Reihe, "Shantae and the Pirate's Curse" hat es mir besonders angetan: 

Wie schon beim zweiten Teil wusste "WayForward" wie man ein geschicktes Jumpn ´Run / Metroidvania Spiel entwerfen muss. Geschicklichkeitspassagen wechseln sich gut mit Kämpfen und Rätseln ab, wobei diese nicht zu schwer oder zu leicht ausfallen.

Sehr abwechslungsreiche Landschaften und Gegner, sehr schöner Dungeonaufbau und die richtige Kurve an Schwierigkeit wobei gerade der letzte Dungeon es meiner Ansicht nach in sich hat, fast auf einem Donkey Kong Country Returns Niveau (also Bock schwer ;) )

Dazu eine sehr schön ausgearbeitete Geschichte, Charaktere und Dialoge, witzige Momente und hier und da ein kleines EasterEgg. Was die Geschichte angeht muss man die Vorgänger nicht gespielt haben. Manche Sachen kann man sich 1 zu 1 zusammenreimen. Aber manche Schmunzler kann man nur verstehen, wenn man zumindest "Riskys Revenge" gespielt hat (empfehle ich übrigens auch ^^)

Die Bosskämpfe machen wirklich Laune, und jeder Boss verlangt eine andere Taktik und Vorgehensweise. 

Der Umfang ist größer als bei "Risky's Revenge" ungefähr das Doppelte. Mein erster Try (inklusive der Suche nach allen Items) lag bei ca. 10 Stunden Spielzeit. Nicht gigantisch, aber auch nicht gerade kurz für den Preis und Genre. Spielt man das Spiel zum ersten Mal durch erhält man die Möglichkeit eines altenativen Modus, der vor Allem für Speed Runs optimal ist. Auch laden manche Erfolge dazu ein, das Spiel mehrmals zu spielen.

Nahezu alle Fähigkeiten sind gut ausgearbeitet und keine ist wirklich nutzlos.

Das Spiel macht definitiv Lust auf mehr und ich freue mich schon richtig auf "Shantae: 1/2 Genie Hero"


Ein paar Kleinigkeiten habe ich allerdings auch auszusetzen:


- Für ein "Metroidvania" kehrt man, meiner Ansicht nach, nicht oft genug an alte Orte zurück. Im Prinzip kann man alle Geheimnisse der vorigen Insel mit dem Item der Insel danach aufdecken. Auch habe ich durch meinen Forscherdrang durch "Zufall" alle benötigten "Key-Items" gefunden bevor ich sie wirklich gebraucht habe. Brauchte also nie groß überlegen, wo ich denn jetzt Item X herbekomme.

- Das Spiel ist (wobei mich das persönlich nicht wirklich stört) leider nur auf Englisch. Ein großer Reiz des Spiels machen die Dialoge aus, wer also nicht des Englischen mächtig ist (kommt zu meiner Überraschung heutzutage leider oft genug vor) der wird so manchen Witz nicht verstehen.

Fazit: Super und liebevolles Spiel, an dem Anfänger wie Fortgeschrittene in dem Genre ihren Spaß haben können. 
Zudem mit nur sehr wenigen Macken, die im Grunde genommen nur persönlicher Natur sind.

Shantae hat sich mit diesem Spiel endgültig ihren Platz bei meinen Lieblingsvideospielcharakteren verdient.

Edit: Seit heute, dem 02.06.2015 lässt sich auch die Tastaturbelegung anpassen. Diesen Kritikpunkt habe ich gestrichen.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982632398', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 470, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 470, 'last_played': 1432044352}
review: Just finished the game and all I can say that it's extremely awesome. The style is great, with cute female characters here and there and sprites looking very good. The gameplay's very addicting and well balanced. You explore the levels, find equipment that gives Shantae new abilities, fight really cool bosses and run through neatly designed platforming sections. The difficulty curve actually lets you learn how to use acquired abilities properly and brings the tough challenges when you're actually ready (not that it'll make you clear the from the first try but all of the sections seem fair and your fail is only yours). All that, plus fun characters and dialogues, spectacular music and some neat easter eggs make this game the best in the series and a great find for all of the platformer enthusiasts out there. Hope that Half-Genie Hero will be even better!
